text: Bottle. Rich citrus, peach and mango aroma. Pours golden in colour with a frothy white head. Sharp bitter lemon flavour with some hints of peach/apricot. Medium to full bodied with a slick texture and moderate carbonation. Long bitter citrus finish with some warming alcohol.
Clear gold appearance, with the nice citrus & herb taste and smell. Good (very) ipa
Pours hazy orange with a white head. Aroma of citrus, pine and apricot. Taste is medium bitter and medium sweet.
330ml bottle. Pours a semi dark gold with white head. Passion fruit on the nose with subtle sweetness. Medium body with a strong initial bitterness which fades into a sweet malt palate.

Bottle from a gas station near Reno, Nevada. Aroma is juicy hops, intense tropical fruits, grapefruit, soft biscuity malt, citrus, orange, some pine resin. Flavour is light to moderate sweet with a firm bitter finish. Body is medium. Amazingly balanced hoppy fruits basket, one of the finest if not the finest well-rounded example of the style I¬íve enjoyed.
LCI. Uit de fles geschonken. Prachtige IPA: bitter, hoppig, fruitig, sterke, volle smaak. En een lange bittere fruitige nasmaak. Topper!
Big rich taste but very moreish. Very fruity and tasty with a strong hoppy aftertaste. Definitely a 6 pack beer and not a one off

35.5cl bottle from Systembolaget. It poured an orange golden colour with a medium big white head. Aroma is malty with notes of caramel and toffee and topping off with some tropical fruity notes. Flavour is bitter and complex. Lots of malts, bread and caramel, pine, grapefruit and faint hints of alcohol. Medium long aftertaste.

Pours a nice gold with white head. Has a nice aroma, primarily citrus with a hint of spruce. The taste is great with low bitterness yet fruity. I really enjoyed this, it leaves me wondering what the other varieties of Sculpin taste like.

Aus der Flasche auf der Berliner Biermeile 2013 getrunken. F√ºr mich eher ein Bier f√ºr die Nase. Denn die tollen Mango-, Graphfruitnoten k√∂nnen am Gaumen nicht bestehen und dort ist dann leider nur Bitterkeit.

355ml can. Pours an amber gold with a solid white head. Aroma: Citrus, apricot, biscuity malt, nectarines. Not overly aromatic, but a pleasant aroma. Taste: Apricot, mango, citrus flavours dominate. Mild peach and biscuity malt flavours. Pleasant flavour balance. Mild sweetness followed by lingering bitterness. Very nice beer. Quite easy drinkin considering how strong the beer is.

Aroma is not very good. Nice apricot taste but the aftertaste is not good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This beer has such a strange relationship with my palate. It tastes disgusting at first but its so refreshing and I keep drinking it,the after taste it the only bad part but if you keep drinking it,then its delicious. The only unpleasant part about it is the one second after taste, I eventually got used to it but I still know that I dont like it. Everything else about it is great and I understand that the after taste is part of the overall beer and it wouldnt work without it. This is one of my favorite beers and most definitely my favorite IPA. IPAs are cool right now,so everyone is making crappy IPAs to fit in, but this is an IPA done right and I feel that it has been crafted with passion.

Bottle 355 ml / Bier-Bienne (CH). Golden beer, slightly veiled with a white head, low persistent. Fruity aromas of citrus, orange, lemon, apricot, mango. The taste is notably fruity, bitter-sweet with pineapple, apricot, citrus and carame. The mouth is light, mossy with a pleasant bitter but it¬ís the fruity side which prevails. Very nice, a rare IPA to suit the meal.

650ml bottle @ home(thanks Evan). Pours a hazy golden amber colour with a decent white head. Nose is quite piney though there is some slight subtleties of fruits hinting in the background. Flavour is predominantly pine needles mixed with orange rinds leaving quite the bitter taste lingering on the palate. Ok for the style, but I¬ím preferring these new ¬íEast Coast¬í style IPAs that have run rampant =)
Klares Orange mit durchschnittlicher Schaumkrone. Malzig, sehr fruchtig, Mango, Orangen, Zitrusfr√ºchte, sehr s√ºffig, bitter.

W nosie ≈õrednio intensywne, grapefruit, mango, ≈ºywica, ciasteczkowo≈õƒá. Barwa ciemnoz≈Çota, lekka mgie≈Çka, piana gƒôsta, ≈õredniej wysoko≈õci. W smaku wytrawne, dominuje grapefruit i ≈ºywica, lekkie mango w tle, praktycznie bez kontry s≈Çodowej. Goryczka wysoka, grapefruitowa. Ach gdyby dorwaƒá to piwo ≈õwie≈ºo po rozlewie, by≈Çoby idealne WC IPA, a tak to dobry plus. Butelkowane 01.12.2016

Many thanks for this beer to CH-303. Szalu ie ma jak na te wysoka ocene. Piana srednia szybko opada, ale oblepia szklo. Barwa pomaranczowa lekko mglista. Aromat silny chmielny troche tropikalne bardzo dojrzale owoce. W smaku owocowo i zywicznie. Na przodzie owoce mango, morela, brzoskwinia i mirabelka, troche tez Physalis. A wszystko zasypane swierzym chyba Amarillo. Bardzo gorzkie piwo. Poczatkowo owocowe potem przeradza sie w extremalna gorycz lubie to. Ale byla tez pewna wodnistosc bo ta chmielnosc na dluzszy czas nie pozostawala.

On tap @ Beer Temple. Clear golden color. Big white head. Aroma¬ís: resinous, malty sweet. Retronasal there¬ís sweetness too, with light resinous and floral hops. Flavor is mild, sweetish, light bitter. Medium bodied. Finishes mildly bitter. Another IPA clearly past it¬ís prime, or it travelled too far. Hope to rerate with a fresh one at some point.

Bottle from systembolaget √ñstersund. Grapefruit aroma, super bitter but with quite a light finish. Old hops. Strong. It¬ís a superb IPA but it¬ís just not really my favourite type of beer with the old hop taste. It grew on me.

Wow, it seems like ever since Ballast Point lost their way with all of those fruit beers, their standard bearer took a dive. This used to be at the top of my list. Now, either everything else has gotten much better or they have forgotten their roots. This beer has a nece nose, hint of pine, but the flavor is nearly all a generic hop. Yes, it is bitter, which I like but all the love is gone. Go back to your peach pineapple fruity etc and leave the real beer brewing to those who now are doing real beers. For shame.

Nic szczeg√≥lnego. Nie mogƒô znale≈∫ƒá daty rozlewu, ale tradycyjnie jako to z IPA by USA (po d≈Çugim czasie dystrybucji) bywa podejrzewam utlenienie. Do≈õƒá puste, wodniste z wyra≈∫nƒÖ zio≈Çowo - grejpfrutowƒÖ i ciut zalegajƒÖcƒÖ goryczkƒÖ. Mo≈ºna sobie darowaƒá

≈Åadna pomara≈Ñczowa barwa, prawie ≈ºe klarowna. Utworzy≈Ça siƒô te≈º spora czapa drobnej piany przy nalewaniu, dosyƒá trwa≈Çej, utrzymuje siƒô do ko≈Ñca picia. W smaku nie ma fajerwerk√≥w, ale te≈º nie jest ≈∫le, czuƒá g≈Ç√≥wnie karmelowo s≈Çodowe nuty z lekkƒÖ zio≈ÇowƒÖ kontrƒÖ od chmielu. Gorycz bardzo fajna, zostaje przez chwile, nie zalega, w ustach odczucie wysycenia ju≈º raczej niskie.
Spodziewa≈Çem siƒô och√≥w i ach√≥w a to takie dobre normalne piwo. Bardziej session ipa. Owocowo-zio≈Çowe z nutkƒÖ ≈ºywicy.

Amber colour, medium white head. Aroma of tropical fruits, citrus, malt, pine, hops. Sweet lightly dry taste, medium bitterness in finish and aftertaste. Medium body and soft carbonation. Very nice IPA.
W aromacie g≈Ç√≥wnie s≈Çodkie owoce, niezbyt intensywne. W smaku lekka podbudowa s≈Çodowa, skontrowana solidna grejpfrutowa goryczka. Poprawna, solidna IPA.
Drinking this beer at tivoli in SD. I don't know why the reviews are so hot for this ipa, it seems just mediocre to me.
pours golden orange, vibrant grapefruit aroma, big fizz and fantastic balance of the grapefruit, hops and pine that a West Coast IPA does so well...when done well...and this is done well...

Pours gold with an orange hue. Leaves a full, creamy white head. Aroma is maracuja, mango, citrus. Perhaps light vomit notes if one is to be unkind about it. Overall though, a good start. Taste is bitter with strong fruity undertones. A bitterness that subsumes itself with increasing acridity moving into the finish. An overdose of pine so to speak. Body is to the light side of medium, and the brew has a smooth, creamy feel in the mouth. Maybe I¬ím just not into IPAs with such a strong hops profile. Verdict: good, but far from great.
My compliments to the producers. You really made a true US West Coast IPA that really pleased my taste buds, every single one of them. "My preciouzzz ...."
Bottle from system bolaget. Pours nice amber color with little to none head. Quite bland taste but great bitterness. Didn¬ít get this one...
@ Budapest, Hungary - Tasting Session #7 üëåüèªüëåüèªüëå Beeroda.hu - Beer Tasting Sessions @ Budapest, Hungary üç∫üç∫üç∫

Can. Grapefruit hop citrus aroma with notes of tropical fruit, apricot, peach, lemon and a bit of pine resiny hop bitterness. Pours orange-amber colored with a large tan head that has excellent retention and some lacing. Starts with bright tropical fruit, apricot and peach flavors with a little bit of lemony citrus. Finishes dry, but fairly smooth with grapefruit hop citrus and acidity and a bit of piney hop bitterness. Excellent IPA.

Even after many years, this is still one of the best west coast IPAs. It has a delectable floral aroma with citrus tornado and the appearance is a bright frisky orange not unlike that furrocious feline Garfield. The taste is a fruity hop bop on the nose with heavy notes of mango, lemon, and a sweet round crunchy bitter backbone. There¬ís a lot to chew on here and this was one of the first I had that justified the inflated 14-15 a sixer price point. Good for blissing out to some new age synthesizer jams while you wait for your better half to change into something.
Bardzo dobre piwo, piƒôknie wyglƒÖdajƒÖce i pachnƒÖce. Ale przegra≈Ço z muddle ipa....

Pours golden, clear, nice white head, good lacing. good hoppy aroma. Citrus, grapefruit, resin, spruce, some mango, pineapple. Crisp, bitter, dry, no malty sweetness. light body, lively, long bitter finish. Very refreshing IPA.
Lacks some character in the aroma. But the bitterness is awesome. Strong, present but brief. Great IPA.
Aroma: Masculine, hops. Appearance: Clea, light-brown. Taste/Palate: More like an Imperial IPA, hops, bitterness, some distant tropical fruits. Overall: A masculine IPA.
poprawna, ca≈Çkiem przyjazna podniebieniu ipa, pijalna, ale Polacy robiƒÖ lepsze i znacznie ta≈Ñsze piwa w tej kategorii. nie warto przep≈Çacaƒá.

Pour: Golden orange amber. Head is a creamy white with beautiful lacing. It looks like your grandmother¬ís doily.

Bouquet: Clementine citrus, raw sugar, piney, and floral hops.

The Sip: Toasted malt notes start off and fade into the hops. These herbal and floral hops spring up through the malt notes and burst citrus onto the scene. There is a nice hop bitterness which cleanses the palate of the malt makes Sculpin very well balance. Sculpin reminds me of apricot jam, orange-marmalade, light creamy malts. Toasted bread. Deep resin.

Mouth-Feel: Small, sharp carbonation. Medium body. Tart pucker on finish.

Overall: Exceptional. An intensely complex IPA. Flavor notes are deeply layered, and very well balanced. You could drink this with almost anything and it would steal the show, I would suggest light foods to pair with this, lightly fried fish, grilled chicken, or sauteed shrimp.

I have been anticipating a serving of Sculpin for some time. Restrained anticipation. Bought in a six pack, first one out. I drained the bottle in a tall beer glass. It gives a swell medium gold liquid and a charged white head that laces quite well. Lifted for a scent it is a moderate citrus and grass nose with a hint of sweetness. The taste is moderately hoppy, lemon, and pineapple. Pleasantly bitter at the end, it lingers on the tongue. Perhaps the best rounded IPA I have had.

Bottle. Shared at Beertemple, Amsterdam. Thanks! Pours golden amber with almost no head. Fresh fruity aroma, lots of citrus, peach, light sweet malts. Taste is over moderate bitter, resiny bitter aftertaste. Very nice.

Rami Rami is drinking a Sculpin IPA by Ballast Point Brewing & Spirits at Saska Kƒôpa

Takie normalne, niezbyt intensywne, disc zbalansowane, juz utlenione
Zapach zio≈Çowo-≈ºywiczny. W smaku te≈º zio≈Çowo-≈ºywicznie. Goryczka bardzo fajne zaznaczona, a zupe≈Çnie niezalegajƒÖca. Fajne.
Fresh pineapple fruit with mango and guava tastes like a rainforest in your mouth.

Review based on the BJCP2015 guidelines (style 21A). Bottle 35.5 cl - Batch SC1447 (BBF unknown). AROMA: medium hop aroma with some oxidation notes already taking place. notes of mango, slight peach and faint dried grass. medium-low almost neutral malt background with a slight oxidation note (caramelized). APPEARANCE: deep gold/orange-ish color and clear. medium white head with good retention. TASTE: medium-low hop notes (resin/pine), followed by a slight caramelized medium-low malt background. medium-high bitterness with a dry and bitter finish that endures. PALATE: medium-light body with medium carbonation. OVERALL: an american IPA showing oxidation notes and that should be nice fresher. The US breweries should pay more attention to the shipping conditions because the Europeans also want to drink your great beer. ;)
0,355l bottle. Pours orange with small white head. Piney with a bit of citrus. Quite average bitterness for an IPA. Bit disappointed to be honest.

10/20 very disappointed. It's ok but a bit middle of the road, not much freshness, zero bitterness, not much depth of flavour. It's drinkable, not unpleasant but was expecting more for a 100 club beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

355ml bottle bought at HK Brewcraft in Central.
Looks: Clear golden orange colour; One-quarter finger head with soapy white foam which fades in 15 seconds; Very good sticky lacing with active carbonation.

Aroma: Very fragrant Ale malt, with apricots, strong mangoes, peaches, candied fruits, grapefruit pulps, floral nectar, sugar, pine, resins, spices, biscuits, lemon peel and grass. Very subtle! 

Taste: Close to medium sweet Ale malt, with grapefruits, light candied fruits, floral, fructose, pine, fair resins, strong herbs, spices, dry biscuits, lime, strong bitter hops and strong fresh grass.

Body: Mid to full body; Thick, creamy and oozy palate.

Mouth Feel: Full Ale maltyness in a thick background, rich and very smooth. Strong but subtle hops with moderate grapefruits and touches of candied fruits, very grassy herbs, pine and light ooze. Flowery with fair fructose sweetness. Biscuity with lime to round. Very balanced and nice!

Hoppiness: Apricots, mangoes, peaches, candied fruits, grapefruits, floral nectar, pine, resins, spices, lemon peel and grass in nose. Citrus, light candied fruits, floral, pine, ooze, strong herbs, spices, lime, and fresh grass in taste; Bitterness is quite strong for a lasting, mid to high astringent bitter sweet malty finish.

After taste: Fairly dry. Citrusy, herbal and nice strong bitter to mouth.

Comments:This one is strongly hopped for sure, but what is so good about it is the subtely in both aroma and taste - the yellow and citrus fruityness is juicy, with with well-noted pine and resins but never over the top. Very herbal grassy but the bitterness is mild and, breezy and refreshing. Its sweetness is fruity not sugary. I can go on, but you get the picture: this is a very well-balanced west coast IPA. A masterpiece!
Bottle. Pours orange with a white head. Aroma has notes of pineapple and grapefruit. Taste has notes of grapefruit with a bitter finish.

Can, Blacktown, Australia. Pours golden with an offwhite head, lacings. Aroma of malt, light caramel, fruity hops, tropical fruit, peach mango, little spicy hops, light citrus. Flavor is sweet, light bitter, malt, fruity hops, peach, mango, citrus. Medium body, average carbonation, light bitter finish. Good, but i like to try it fresh. 100317

Piana ≈õrednio oczkowa, niezbyt trwa≈Ça. Barwa z≈Çota, opalizujƒÖca. Aromat ≈õrednio intensywny, trochƒô dojrza≈Çych cytrus√≥w, trochƒô mango, liczi i iglak√≥w. W smaku p√≥≈Çwytrawne, intensywnie cytrusowe, owocowe, z nutkƒÖ naftowo iglakowƒÖ i geranium w posmaku. Goryczka spora, d≈Çuga, ≈ºywiczna. Wysycenie ≈õrednie.

Po prostu bardzo dobre West Coast IPA, aczkolwiek na miejsce w czo≈Çowej dwudziestce stylu degustowana butelka raczej nie zas≈Çuguje.

UPDATED: MAR 21, 2017 Bottle. Pours clear orange with white, rocky head, good lacing. Aroma of citrus, orange, grapefruit, pine needles and caramel. Taste is light sweet and medium+ bitter - citrus, pine, some resin and herbs, light hints of caramel. Medium body and carbonation, oily texture, long bitter finish. Good IPA, but not very fresh and not outstanding.

0.355 l bottle from ¬íBierhalle Deconinck¬í, bottled in November 2016. Clear, golden amber with a large, frothy, almost stable, white head. Sweetish, fruity and slightly resiny aroma of pineapple, mango, passion fruit and some pine. Sweetish, slightly bitter, very fruity and slightly resiny taste of pineapple, lemon peel, mango, passion fruit and pine, followed by a medium long, rather dry-bitter, resiny and slightly herbal-grassy finish. Medium to full body, slightly creamy and a bit effervescent mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Very tasty, but not as great as expected.

Pours clear golden with decent white head which lasts well. Aromas of pine hops, citrus and a touch of light malt. Good carbonation and mouth feel. Taste is lemon and lime with a grassy hop kick. Slight honey touch before the semi-dry bitter finish kicks in. Very good IPA.
Good beer, grapefruit dominate on the palette, moderate bittetness, mild malt character.

Bottle. Teku. Golden, clear with moderate, semi-thick, white, frothy head. Good head retention and moderate lacing. Moderately hoppy profile - resinous, piney and citrus (grapefruit). Light to moderate tropical fruits in the background. Moderately to highly bitter - quite stable and constant thru the degustation. Medium body, oily texture, average to lively carbonation, finish is bitter, piney and semi-dry. In overall well hopped IPA with strong piney, resinous and grapefruit accents. Moderately drinkable. Good, but not outstanding, neither very good.

Hop hop hop ... Hop hop. Cloudy yellow with thin white, crisp head that sticks around. Aroma of lots of hops, both the fruity and piney kind. Mild sweetness. Lots of pine in the taste, more so than the tropical fruit which is also there. Some malt lingers with the bitterness too.
on tap pours amber with a off white head. Aroma of citrus and pine. Taste is grapefruit, peaches and hops
Sometimes you find one you have missed! Pours clear golden with a white head. Aroma of pine, citrus, mango and tropical fruit. Bittersweet finish.
355ml bottle. Clear dark golden with nice off-white head. Pine, grassy and caramel. Good.

(Bottle) Clear orange body with big off-white/orange head of fine bubbles which reduce to rocky peaks. Aroma of orange, tropical fruit, some grass, pine and earth. Flavor is full of resiny hop bitterness, mildly sweet caramel; grass, pine. Medium body, oily.
12 oz bottle pours amber with a off white head. Aroma of citrus, pine, caramel and mango¬ís. Taste is grapefruit, peaches and caramel.

355ml can from Uncle Dan. Amber with a mild haze on the pour and a small and lasting white head atop. Vibrant and punchy tropical fruit aromas: mango, peach, lychee, pineapple, passionfruit et al. Mid-weight, gently carbonated with a subtle oily texture and long, intense pine and grapefruit bitterness to finish. The malts are present but in the background playing a supporting role to the aromatics and freshness of the hops.

Quite clear amber, medium soapy head and some spotted lacing. Fantastic to the nose with peach, mango, citrus. Very crisp attack, with all the hoppy character in the aroma that kicks in. No much of malts here, but it tastes bloody good! Light body and soft carbonation, very smooth. Awesome IPA.

355 ml bottle.
This is very good. The aroma is packed with spruce, floral, earthy and citrus notes. The taste is a lot of the same, very earthy and floral flavours with a hint of citrus at the back that really elevates the beer. The malt sweetness is far in the back, it doesn¬ít feel that balanced but the flavours are top notch. The mouthfeel is heavy, just a slight oily feel to it. The taste stays on your palate for a long time.
Solid IPA! Won¬ít blow your doors off, but goes down very smooth. Better then a lot of other high scoring IPA¬ís!

Bright yellow pour with a persistent creamy head. Aroma is grapefruit, pine, grass booze. Bright citrus and tropical fruit flavours, lightly woody, earthy bitterness is kept under control. Mouthfeel is suitably refreshing. While it¬ís not my absolute favourite, it¬ís clearly a quality IPA.

UPDATED: JAN 27, 2017 Pours deep clear yellow. Thin head. Solid flavour and medium body full of fruity flavour, hop bitterness and biscuity malt balance. Long hop palate leading to floral bitterness aftertaste. Mango and apricot very present throughout. Fruitily bold, refreshing and quite nice.

Bottle pour. Clear dark golden with a large soapy off white head. Aroma is caramel, pine, and grass. Full creamy body. Sweet with a bitter finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
From tap. Bronze, clear nice creamy foam. Creamy caramel, and fruit in the aroma. Toffee, fruit, hint of citrus with intense caramell hoppyness in the growing aftertaste.

Bottle. Pours medium honey color. Big frothy off white head. Juicy hop aroma. Juicy tropical citrus flavor. Nicely balanced. Very good IPA. Have been seeing this more in my area, but at $14 for a six pack its price point is well above local IPA¬ís of similar quality.

UPDATED: FEB 28, 2017 Can, brought back from the US by Lalitha and drunk on an IPA night. Poured a clear bright amber with a nice thick white foam. It¬ís a solid, decently balanced IPA, some nice sweetish malt and lots of citrusy hops and a nice pine finish. Not overly dry or sharply bitter. Very pleasant.
Bottle from systembolaget. Pours a light amber colour beer with a medium head. Fruity and hoppy with caramel and notes of pine. Dry finish.

Bouteille achet√©e chez Drink Of The World - De couleur ambr√©e claire avec une belle mousse blanche qui dure et colle au verre - Au nez des ar√¥mes puissant de houblon fruit√© mangue, passion, grapefruit, kumkwat, une tonne de r√©sine, le corp malt√© tient parfaitement ca place, biscuit caramel, une fin sur l¬íon fusion de th√©, c¬íest plaisant - En bouche on continue avec les houblons fruit√© b directement beaucoup de r√©sine b puis du grapefruit de l¬íorange et de la mangue, puis le malt caramel et une touche de biscuits, tr√®s proche du nez - Corp l√©ger/moyen, amertume moyenne/forte, carbonation correcte, lisse et l√©g√®rement s√®che, final longue am√®re herbac√© - Solide IPA typiquement dans le style US
Six pack from Hot Rods in Mount Vernon. Tons of tropical fruit notes. Solid IPA.

I have had this in bottle in Australia many times but having it at the brewery, fresh, on tap is an experience not to be missed. A perfect balance of toasted and bisquity malts to hold the massive hop flavour and aroma. Let it warm and sample it again and it¬ís a different beer to be enjoyed. I don¬ít readily give such high score but...WOW! I¬ím coming back to San Diego.

Sculpin? Felt like a pin was stuck in my skull, or not. So I have that going for me. This, while being a naughty little brew still falls well short of the glory and mayhem that Val Blatz can (and will) bring into your home. Would I drink this again? Probably. But, I should not get any bonus points for such an observation, as I am an idiot¬Ö..or so my wife says. But her judgement is faulty as she was dumb enough to marry me.
A well balanced IPA, if you¬íre looking for something more adventurous then sample the Habanero Sculpin!, Cheers.

Golden-orange color with a sizable head of creamy white foam. The aroma is complex with Valencia orange, apricot, some skunk, a little herbal rosemary, light caramel malt, and a touch of pine. The palate is treated to more prominent notes of caramel and citrus with an easy-going dry pine finish.
Looks beer. Packs a punch. Trippy fruits. Pine. Flower. Straightforward great. Some malty base as well. Passion.
Orange with light haze and fresh nose of hops and grapefruit. Light bitterness in the taste and some rich fruits. Palate rather longlasting and might bitter.

Data zabutelkowania: 16.06.2016
AROMAT: Intensywny. Karmelowo-zio≈Çowy (cukierki ≈õlazowe) - typowe dla piw, kt√≥re przeby≈Çy d≈ÇugƒÖ drogƒô z Ameryki do Europy. W tle nuty ciasteczkowe oraz cytrusowe.
SMAK: Z poczƒÖtku karmelowo-zio≈Çowe, z czasem dochodzi kontra cytrusowa. Posmak cytrusowy. Goryczka wysoka, zalegajƒÖca. 
WYGLƒÑD: Barwa z≈Çota, opalizujƒÖce. Piana drobna, ≈õredniej wysoko≈õci. 
OG√ìLNIE: To musia≈Ço byƒá piwo wybitne...gdy by≈Ço ≈õwie≈ºe. Niestety transport w wƒÖtpliwych warunkach zrobi≈Ç swoje.
Draft. Aroma: Citrus with a hint of floral. App: Reddish gold, thin white head. Taste: Very citrusy but balanced. Not super deep though. Long finish. Very good overall.
Tap at Ravintola Kirjakauppa. Hazy orange color, small white head. Aroma is bready and grapefruity. Medium-bodied. Grapefruity and a bit grainy flavor. Maybe not the freshiest keg.

CAN 12 OZ courtesy of solidfunk. Almost clear amber, off-white head. Big grapefruit nose, lots of citrus peel, but no harsher pine or resins. Similar flavour - the sweetness is more like a ripe pink grapefruit than malts proper, clean pungent but not overly aggressive citrus peel bitterness. Some more sweet citrus fruitiness in the after taste. Very good.

Bottle from Beergium.com - could not find the "bottled on" date :/
Aroma: very delicate, not to say week, fruity aroma and some underlying caramel 

Looks: clear gold with medium white head with good retention

Taste: mid dry, caramel with some hoppy bitterness. Bitter rather short and malty finish.

Feel: mid carbonated, mid full body

Overall: Ok as an everyday beer but nothing special about it. By all the hype about it I was expecting way more. I guess the bottle could have been old :/ will have to try it fresh sometime...

Yes--I know people don¬ít like that Ballast Point was acquired by Constellation and yes, my palate has evolved in the years since this beauty was first released, having tasted countless other IPA¬ís.

To hell with that---Sculpin is still THE great San Diego IPA and became so by hitting that illusive sweet spot of not being too strong and bitter to turn off the non hop heads and enough citrus and fruitiness to appeal to women and novices.

If you were to try one San Diego IPA as your benchmark for my home town¬ís best known style--it would be Sculpin, bar none
aroma has both notes malt and piney hops. dark gold and clear in color with decent head. Taste is hoppy but not overwhelming, of piney and resinous notes

Aroma is quite sweet but not overly so and citrus. yellow clear colour with white head. taste is heavy bitterness, with medium sweetness. finish is long bitter, medium body, average carbonation. Very balanced and enjoyable beer.

Bottl fruity citrus bomb of e: Clear Deep yellow/Red colour, with a nice head. Aroma is dominated og flowers citrus, lots of fruits. werry nice. Flavor had a dry bitter, Medium boddy! long dry bitter fruity citrus finsch! Wery nice

1 finger white head that dissipates quickly. 
Clear, amber coloured beer. 
Aroma is mango, orange and grapefruit. Hint of kiwi aswell. 
Explosion of bitterness almost right away. Soapy, grassy and grapefruity bitterness with a quite boozy aftertaste. 
Not much fruit in the actual taste which I prefer but still works. Always thought this one was overrated when I started drinking craftbeer but it¬ís a well made IPA for the IBU maniacs out there.
Quite thin but still a bit sticky and it¬ís really ¬íbig¬í for a 7% ABV beer. Feels like a DIPA. 
Good stuff!

355ml can from Dan Murphys (BB 8/17). Quite light coloured for an IPA with a clear bright golden body and an ample sized fluffy lasting white head with nice lace rings. I get peach, mango, grapefruit and subtle pine needles on the nose. Plenty of juicy fruity hops on the tongue with a long lingering dry hop bitterness. Sweetish cereal malt base is there at the beginning. Overall more stonefruity than resinous, unlike other classical US West Coast IPAs I could mention.

Can. Hazy, orange, frothy, white foam, light sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, oily feel, & bitter finish.

Great appearance with a thick, frothy head that collapses into a nice collar. Aroma is citrusy hops. Aroma is fresh. Some fruity notes. Average carbonation. Long bitter finish. Sticky mouthfeel. High on the hoppy side which is a plus. Sculpin is up there on the list of the best IPA to me. Great beer.

7.0% ABV. One of the best IPAs I've had. Stronger than most, but doesn't have bitter, overpowering finish.

330ml bottle. Aroma is sweet orange, pine and caramel. Flavour very much the same with a lovely restrained bitter finish. Beautiful full body. Very nice.
Draft at BW3s. Citrus aroma, mainly orange. Medium hops. A brew to hook you on IPAs due to solid mouthfeel and expanded availability. Grapefruit Sculpin not quite up to this original.
A darn Good IPA. A mix of citrus flavor and IPA bitterness. Not over powering like some IPAs.
Bottle 355ml. Golden with a medium-density white head. Bready and nutty aroma with toffee notes. Taste is a bit boozy, but not overwhelmingly so. Punchy hop notes going into a bitter finish.

Bottle; pours slightly hazy gold with an off white head; tropical fruit aroma with some caramel, cereal, and floral notes; taste is light bitter with tropical fruits, caramel, and malt; finish is dry and bitter some floral notes and pine hints; very good
Pleasant color of amber with peach and apricot aroma. Taste is a bit bitter but thats what the IPAs for. Great beer.
Bottle into a glass. Pours a hazy orange. Aroma of citrus, apricot and peach.

12 ounce bottle into tulip glass, bottled on 8/22/2016. Pours slightly hazy medium orange/amber color with a 2 finger dense and rocky off white head with fantastic retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lasts. Dense soapy lacing clings around the glass. Fantastic appearance. Aromas of big grapefruit, tangerine, apricot, peach, pineapple, mango, lemon zest, orange peel, citrus rind, pine, light caramel, toasted biscuit, herbal, and floral/grassy earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of bright citrus/tropical/pine hops and moderate bready malt notes; with great strength. Taste of big grapefruit, tangerine, apricot, peach, pineapple, mango, lemon zest, orange peel, citrus rind, pine, light caramel, toasted biscuit, herbal, and floral/grassy earthiness. Good amount of pine/citrus rind/grassy bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of grapefruit, tangerine, apricot, peach, pineapple, mango, lemon/orange rind, pine, toasted biscuit, and herbal/floral/grassy earthiness on the finish for a while. Incredible complexity, robustness, and balance of bright citrus/tropical/pine hops and moderate bready malt flavors; with a great malt/bitterness balance, and minimal lingering hop astringency after the finish. Moderate dryness from bitterness, increasing through the glass. Medium carbonation and body; with a very smooth, sticky/resinous, and lightly creamy/grainy balanced mouthfeel that is nice. Minimal warming alcohol for 7%. Overall this is an incredible IPA. All around fantastic complexity, robustness, and balance of bright citrus/tropical/pine hops and moderate bready malt flavors; very smooth and easy to drink despite very resinous bitterness. A highly enjoyable offering.

Bottle. Pours clear, orange in colour with medium sized head. Aroma with hint of pine and citrus, nice malty caramel touch. In taste citrusy, bitter, dry with hint of malty biscuits. Medium body, moderate carbonation, dry, smooth with very bitter finish. Average aroma (si? to age), but still tasted fantastic. Very refreshing and easy drinkable.

I enjoyed Sculpin from a 12oz bottle poured into a shaker pint glass. The beer pours a dark, golden, orange that looks as refreshing as it tastes. There was about a finger and a half of paper white head with good lacing on the glass. 

The aroma is very strong and is dominated by citrus, floral, and fresh characteristics. I picked up lots of orange and grapefruit. 

This is a medium-heavy bodied beer that feels hearty and sweet with a nice amount of carbonation and buttery smooth finish. It is a great level of bitterness compared to lots of other IPA¬ís. I¬íll probably pick up another sixer of Sculpin as long as I can not look at the price.

Picked up single 12-oz bottle from Heritage Liquors in Maplewood, MN. Pours a semi-clear golden orange colored brew with an average sized off-white head that slowly dissipates. Aroma of light grapefruit, tangerine, a hint of mango and caramel malt. Taste is medium bodied with flavors of a solid tropical fruit-style IPA. Finish is semi-dry at first with a lingering bitterness that really takes its time. Tongue shock recovery time, about 3 minutes.

Pour: Golden orange amber. Head is a creamy white with nice lacing.

Bouquet: Clementine citrus, raw sugar, piney, and floral hops.

The Sip: Toasted malt notes start off and fade into the hops. These herbal and floral hops spring up through the malt notes and burst citrus onto the scene. There is a nice hop bitterness which cleanses the palate of the malt makes Sculpin very well balance. Sculpin reminds me of apricot jam, orange-marmalade, light creamy malts. Toasted bread. Deep resin.

Mouth-Feel: Small, sharp carbonation. Medium body. Tart pucker on finish.

Overall: Exceptional. An excellent intensely enjoyable IPA. Complex flavor notes, and very well balanced. You could drink this with almost anything and it would steal the show, I would suggest just drinking this alone so nothing spoils your palate. Everyone needs to try this beer.

Bomber. Pours amber with a resilient white head. Aroma is grapefruit, lemon, lime and caramel. Flavor is grapefruit, lemon, lime and caramel. Finish is bitter with the same flavors. Medium body, average carbonation.

Great bottle. Pours with a lovely golden colour. White, medium lasting head.
Nose: A very hoppy nose with lots of pine tree and citrus.
Taste: Almost soft, fruity arrival with quite rich carbonation. Immediately followed by a grapefruity, long lasting bitterness. Fruity, fresh and bitter. In the exit the malt appears, with notes of nice caramel mixing into the hoppy bitterness. A very good IPA but rather on the bitter side for my taste.

UPDATED: JUL 16, 2016 Beautiful clear amber with a small white head that dissipates quickly. Smells strongly of fresh pine. Pleasant steady bitter taste without the highs and lows I get from some. Bottle 35.5cl. Poured into a teku glass. Clear deep golden, good two finger frothy white to off-white head, good retention and lacing; strong hop aroma, pale malts, grapefruit, apricot, pine, grass; mild taste medium sweet and bitter, malty, fruity, hoppy, grassy; lingering dry bitter aftertaste, spicy and fruity notes; medium body, oily texture, soft carbonation; excellent elegant and well-balanced ipa.

A very tasty beverage. Clear golden amber/orange with wispy light creamy head. Grapefruit/citrus notes through and through. Don¬ít really get the hoppiness until the end. Super smooth, not heavy handed or overpowering. Fine brew.

One of the best "standard" IPAs out there. The clear amber color makes it really nice to look at. The aromas is well balanced between ctirus hops, malt and fruit. The finish is long without becoming bitter.

When pouring the beer, you get an amber beer with white foam.
The foam has small means bubbles and is perfectly right.
The foam stick around for a while and leave little trace in the glass.
Hop aroma will direct, a little malt notes.
Behind this, we find the fruity tones of grapefruit.
A little tropical and mixed herbs, and a little caramel.
The first thing you taste the hops and subsequent bitterness.
Both hops and bitterness are dominant but behind that is a lovely taste of the grapefruit.
Some mixed tropical flavors of orange and a little lemon.
Some spices, herbs and a touch of toasted coming towards the end.
The hops and bitterness are dominant and sits in all the time and a moderately while afterwards.
I think both hops and bitterness takes over a bit much and that the other flavors will not forward enough.

Delicious and smooth IPA. Tons of nice citrus and tons of tropical fruit. Like a toned down enjoy by with less dankness. Very enjoyable and world class IPA.

Aroma fake orange, 
Appearance orange, clear, white foam, 
Taste light sweetness, lightly bitter, medium bitterness, 
Palate medium body, 
Overall to me there is a unnatural orange flavor that is not doing it for me. I am a fan of the grapefruit and pineapple but not this one. I would not suggest this beer to a friend.

Bottle at home, from Systembolaget. Clear amber with a white head, nice lacings. Aroma medium malty (caramel) and hoppy (piney, citrusy, orange, tropical fruit). Flavor medium sweet, medium+ bitter, fruity, long lasting, metallic. Medium+ body.

12 ounce bottle. Pours a hazy gold with a thin white head. Taste is of citrus, grapefruit, hops and some grains. Similar aroma. Has a decent body w0ith a slight fruity and bitter finish. A very enjoyable and highly drinkable beer.

Sculpin, another great IPA. Unique taste. Strong bitter hop flavor. Ballast Point has a winner.

Pours an amber color with an off-white head. Aroma is of floral and citrus hops with caramel malts. Flavors isn¬ít as hoppy as the other versions of this brew. I had high hopes for this since the other Sculpin beers were so delicious.

UPDATED: MAR 30, 2016 12 FL. OZ can thaks to my brother. Appearance: Clear orange with a full sized off-white head with excellent retention. Aroma is malts, Mandarin and grapefruit

Great IPA. Alltough a bit off a of a one trick pony, but perfect execution.

Kobberfarvet amerikansk IPA med 3 cm stor offwhite skumkrone. Denne svinder til kant samt overflade. Klar/filtreret og rolig. 
Humlearoma domineret af grapefrugt og harpiks. Senere fremkommer noter af appelsin.

12 oz bottle poured at souplantation in San Diego. Smells like citrus, drank from the bottle so unsure of appearance. Great taste; citrusy hops. Very refreshing. Great beer.

Bottle courtesy of blankboy - thanks, Paul! Clear and bright golden with a small white head. Classic American IPA aroma and flavour, with notes of grapefruit, peach, apricot, pineapple and sweetened lemon. Clean and crisp mouthfeel, lingering bitterness in the finish. Fantastic!

First.....let me add my voice to the chorus of fans who were disappointed to learn that they sold out to the big boys. This is a beautiful IPA but I doubt that it will remain so under the inevitable demands to ramp up production. Apricot, peach/mango up front with a subtle citrusy and balanced finish which makes it very approachable for several in row.
K√òLF 111215. Golden colour with an off-white head. Aroma is citrus, fruit, grapefruit, caramel. Flavour is orange, malt, hop, pine, citrus, grapefruit, fruit, caramel, peaches. Nice beer.

My investigation into American IPAs continues with this classic. Sure, yes, it¬ís obvious to anyone who can read, there¬ís a lot of overrating going on here. But still, what a beauty of an ipa. A workshop in taste, balance & drinkability. Offers a sucker punch of citrus hops, medium bitterness & crisp finish. Groovy hop juice for the wicked.

perfect ipa ever
should be basic of beer tasting
strong fruity aroma close to grapefrute
solid finish

Good nose, caramel followed by citrus and stone fruit, I get pine forest. The taste is nicely bitter followed closely by delicate malt. Very well balanced and rounded out. Gets better as it warms up. Great beer!

Bottle. Deep go[den pour with a thin off-white head. Citrus hops,malt and a bit of pine in the taste and aroma. Really nice IPA, but, to me, it doesn¬ít stand out in a beer scene where there are a lot of really good IPAs.
This is a downright delicious IPA. Perfect level of hoppiness and alcoholic strength, for me at least, so as not to overpower its delicate qualities.

Just a great beer. Pours a classic IPA with generous but not too much head. Nose is sweetness - mango, maybe - and citrus. Mouthfeel is huge; a blast of resiny hops, and more sweet citrus. Clean, biting finish that makes you want more.
Brun klar farge med hvitt skum. Lukter godt av humle, ananas, sitron.Meget god bitter smak og avslutning. God:-)

Draft. Pours orange-Amber with white head and lacing. Grapefruit and resiny hop aroma. Piney hood with grapefruit notes with malt in the resiny, mouthcoating finish.

Aroma: citrus, grapefruit, mango, gooseberries, mango.
Appearance: clear golden color and thin white head.
Taste: medium citrus bitterness, nice intensive citrus notes, gooseberries, quite dry, thin malty backbone.
Palate: medium body and medium carbonation, bitter finish.
Overall: Great IPA, really drinkable and intensive.
Pineapple, apricot, citrus and pine aroma. Taste is very spicy, tropical fruits, big hop bitterness and some grapefruit. Really refreshing and addictive. A first class West coast IPA.
A very refreshing scent of pineapple would make you feel good. The right amount of mouthfeel. Well balanced between sweetness and bitterness.
On draft at lost lake. delicious IPA. Really dig this. Perfect amount of kick to it, but also smooth. Hoppy but it's a light hoppiness that's sparkly.

Much has been said about this beer and I¬íll make it short. 

It¬ís an amazing IPA with very citrusy-hop foward aroma that is also very complicated. It has a clear golden body color, with very nice head retention that is an inch thick. The aroma is again very citrus. Pineapple dominant at first and then peach and apricot notes follow. The taste is very complex. It¬ís resiny, floral and piny while maintaining its hoppy character. Moutfeel is very crispy. For me, it¬ís on the harsher end but it¬ís still nice.

One of the best IPAs I¬íve ever had!

It has a near perfect mouthfeel for me and that¬ís helped by a fairly light job of carbonation. Dang, I better slow down here, not because of the abv but because it¬ís so damn tasty and I don¬ít want to be looking at an empty bottle and glass! Yum!
Full fruity aroma / Light orange color / Fresh, tropical fruity taste / Medium bitter / Nice finishing / a formula of IPA.
How could I resist this? This beer is just awesome. Perfectly balanced between bitterness and sweetness. I love this dominated fruity smell. Best beer I had today.

Perfection in a glass. Beautifully balanced hop bitterness with sweet fruit flavors.

Aroma is dominated by hops, grapefruit and spruce. Just a bit of bready malt.

Light copper or amber color with a fairly substantial white to off-white head. Clear.

Taste is quite dry and quite bitter.

Palate is interesting, fairly light body, really crisp and dry. Carbonation average. Finish is grapefruit and carbonation.

Overall I like the crispness and dry bitterness. Definitely a hop bomb though, not much malt balance.
This is an awesome and balanced IPA. Good aroma of pine, hops, citrus. The flavor is mild with a nice and hoppy undertone. Alcohol is masked.

UPDATED: MAY 17, 2016 A hop bomb bouquet of fresh citrus with lots more on the palate. Grapefruit and orange dominate, along with, mango, grapefruit, a bit of peach and some piney goodness. Deliciously bitter.

33cl bottle
clear orange~amber color
strong citrusy aroma of grapefruits, but also notes of tropical fruits and stone fruits.

Color dorada, espuma de baja retencion. En aroma se sienten los lupulos en forma bien intensa, citricos. Cuerpo medio, con notas citricas y frutales, amargor bien equilibrado.

One of those legacy beers you always hope you¬íll stumble across - and it finally happened. Let¬ís see how it matches up to the world¬ís IPAs. Nose of pine needles and mild orange. Flavour of sharp pine and orange rind. Decent stuff. Lasting head.
Violence! It¬ís like electricity in a glass. It¬ís all sharp edges, but still pretty easy to drink. Very very hoppy. That¬ís really all I have to say. It¬ís pretty good though.

Poured bottle into Teku. Wish the bottle was more fresh. Lacks the hop aroma. Appearance is slightly hazy pale. Flavor is very very well balanced. You would have guessed this was a 5.5% beer. Overall a solid IPA.
Bottle 33 cl. Golden, cloudy with a medium offwhite head. Hoppy nose, and some light caramel sense. Light/med bitterness with a ok fruit end.

Good IPA this. Nice aroma, with classic american IPA notes. Light to medium body. Medium carbonation. Copper color. Hint of raisiny and toffee taste, probably from crystal malts, which is not my favorite. A good, classic american IPA.

Extra point for being so difficult to get. Or I should take the points away .... Anyway : the beer has a huge aroma of well balanced bouquet of fruits. The usual stuff but better. It smells really like you wanted it as your perfume. The taste is more interesting. It has a good bite of pomelo but with a kick of fresh zest. Almost like it wasn¬ít a beer which is ...not sure if good but difficult not to admire the craft. Good stuff and I was happy to taste it finally.

Pours a hazy gold with a thin white head. Aroma is lots of fruity hops, with citrus, grapefruit, and tropical hops dominant, and some mango as well. Flavor is full of juicy hops: fruit, citrus, and tropical fruits. Has a light bitterness, with a crisp mouthfeel. This is an excellent IPA.
Fantastic ipa! Great balance of tropical fruits, peach, mango, passionfruit and guava intertwined with a hefty malt bull but balanced excellent with the hops and no astringent finish.
Flaske. Uklar oransje farge, lavt karbonert med en tynn skumtopp som forsvinner. Smaker sitrus, grapefrukt, tropisk samt h√∏stl√∏v. Meget god
Aroma of malt and hops. Taste is sweet malt with hops making it citrus, grapefruit and tropical, Overall a very decent ipa.

Bottle from The Euston Tap, London. Pours a clear pale amber colour with a medium white head. Aroma of grapefruit, orange, apricot, slight peach, pine, some caramel, a little toasted malts and subtle grassy hops. Taste of grapefruit, apricot, orange, slight peach, some caramel, a little toasted malts and subtle grassy hops. Medium bodied, moderate carbonation and an oily texture. A bittersweet, toasted malt, citrus hop bitterness in the finish. Such a well made IPA, Maltier than most and could do with a bit more hoppiness but still a good example of a west coast IPA.

On Tap. Served a clear copper color with a nice head. Aroma of pine and primarily light fruit. Taste of pine and fresh fruits. Sharp bitterness that lingers into the finish. Moderate body, with a crisp, clean feel. Its a quality beer but I¬ím not really into West Coast IPAs.
Excellent nose, malts feel right at home with the hops. Bitterness is totally on point with a fantastic flavor. Brilliantly clear. Wonderful beer.

My favorite IPA yet. I stock this regularly, and love all the related Sculpins too (Grapefriut, Pineapple). So strange to get that perfect simultaneous sharpness, sweetness, and smooth all together at the same time. Maybe be the perfect beer.

Bottle. 7.0%. Best before 08.07.16. Pours a hazy orange with a lasting, yellowish head. Decent lacing. Grape fruit and pine hop aroma, a bit fat, and with a slightly dusty/dry overtone, bordering cardboard. Light cheesy/old hops note as it warms. Sweetish, bitter and fat flavour. Pine hops, and a wee bit juicy. Rather bitter finish with an alcohol burn, lingering, along with a light green apple note. Soft palate. Overall good, though not as good as I had expected/hoped for, and less complex ¬ñ but a fresher example might prove better. 04.02.16.

Great CA IPA on the nose, and one of the go to classics. Lots of citrus and pine. Taste imparts a little bit more tropical flavor which makes sense why the adjuncts of this have been grapefruit and pineapple. Whichever way you want to lean away from the base you can and both are excellent as well.
Draft at Pinthouse Pizza. Amber/golden color with white head. Aroma and flavors of pine, citrus, grapefruit, and peach. It¬ís quite fruity. Has a bitter, piney finish.

Aroma: fruity, very faint hops; Appearance: straw colored, clear with thin head and some lacing; Taste: acceptable but not much personality; not particularly bitter; not complex; Palate: finish a bit better - long, dry, more bitter; Overall: okay. Would drink if available but not seek out.

Bottle at Piccadilly, Bod√∏. Has a slightly hazy orange color with a creamy off-white head. Fruity aroma of peaches, pine, orange peel, grapefruit and dry hay. More grapefruit in the flavor along with peaches, grassy hops, pine and citrus. Has a slick mouth feel, medium body and a balanced bitterness. A fruity and nice IPA.

Pours orange amber with thin head. Light lacing. Aroma of citrus and resinous hops balanced with apricot and malt. Flavor starts off a little sweet with flavors of peaches,lemon and oranges and progresses in to a long dry finish. Body is a bit thin but does not take much away from experience. Oily texture. Moderate carbonation. Really tasty but would do well with a bit more weight.

335 ml. bottle from Systembolaget, poured in to a Tulip. Hazy, amber-golden colour with a creamy off-white head. Fruity aroma with grapefruit, grasses, sweet, tropical fruits and caramel malts. A toasted note. Taste is bitter. Medium body with a creamy texture and a soft carbonation. Finishes dry and bitter with citrus fruits and toasted notes. In essence a typical westcoast IPA.

Can. Just yum. Smells awesome, tastes awesome. Wonderful pithy bitterness, subtle honey sweetness, tidy balance. Feels properly put together and delivers on all the tasting note promises. Those 7 abv¬ís go unnoticed. I¬ím off to enjoy the rest of it.

Lot¬ís of licorice in the aroma. Fresh. Thick, oily mouth-feel. Distinctive bitterness that remains in the mouth for a very long time. Reminds me a lot of Ballast Point Fathom, I probably wouldn¬ít be able to tell the difference between the two in a blind test. Good stuff nonetheless.
Nice ipa, kinda cheapened by the massive buyout. That doesn¬ít take away from the fact that this is a great beer. Juicy and delicious. Will get again.

Wow! Probably the bitterest IPA I've had to date, but boy is it good. Great aroma, cloudy for an IPA but very sexy looking. Really great IPA.

Pours awesome white dense head, golden and sparkling. Tropical and resinous aroma packed with hops. Light bodied and extremely refreshing, coats your tongue with oily hops. Long complex bittereness, this is delicious!
Pours clear yellow with white head. Fruity aroma of peach mango and lemon. Tasted fruity hops citrus crisp clean malt lightly fizzy and dry clean finish excellent IPA

Pours a clear, amber and gold with a strong white/off-whit head, full lacing. Aroma is strongly fruity, grapefruit being the distinct note. Flavor is heavy bitter with a surprising sweetness (moderate). Mouthfeel is oily but relatively light, with a pleasantly bitter finish. Overall, the most enjoyable and well crafted IPA I have yet tasted.
355ml bottle. Big white head, quite golden color. Aroma is roses, hops, flowers, peach ice tea, hint of wood and brandy. Bitter flowery taste. A likeable perfume.

Bottle thanks to Rian (Thirstybird). Slightly hazy gold with a white head, leaving plenty of lacing. Pungent aroma of sweet fruits, pine and dough. Carbonation is smooth and natural. Flavour is beautifully complex with sweet juicy malts, bitter citrus fruits, a little peach and a lovely resinous, slightly oily swallow. I have to visit San Diego at some point!

The beer that showed me the world of craft beers. Really well balanced and the citrus hop aroma is the best. Every time I try this beer, this beer always impress me. I had many great IPAs, but this one is definitely the best.

UPDATED: JAN 15, 2016 At home. Can shared by Maakun. Tangerine and weed, bit soapy, vegetable/spring onion, very fruity. Fierce but friendly bitter, sweet grainy backbone. Full bodied, texture is fat with a fine grain. Carbo is medium. Very refreshing, very nice!

Can shared thanks to Secret Santa bytemesis. Clear golden with fluffy white head. Mango, dank hops with lots of marijuana, orange peel, grass, light lime and lemon in the finish. There¬ís also some light biscuit malts but the hops are really taking the stage here. Light sweet and medium bitter with a light tart touch just before the finish. Medium bodied. Just like an IPA should be.

Finally got my hands on a nice variety of fresh Ballast Point brews, and this one was "just" a good IPA, nothing crazy like hype would have you believe. I found the grapefruit version of Sculpin better.

Bomber. Pours a clear gold color with a long lasting white head. Aroma is citrus hops and pine. Taste is fairly bitter and resinous. Sweet caramel malt, grapefruit, and pine. Medium bodied with a dry, lingering, bitter finish.
user_location: Menasha Red Light District, Wisconsin, USA

text: Bottle shared with EMJ and NH at OSB 13.01.16. Clear golden. Persistent off-white head and lacing. Aroma and taste of American hops, fresh pine shoots, grapefruit and lime, balanced with pale malt and a slight alcohol sting. Also some marmalade. Pine and grapefruit bitterness lingering on.

Pours cloudy golden amber, with fluffy head. The aroma is grapefruit, citrus, pine, bread, somw earthy. The flavor is pine, followed by citrus, grapefruit, some caramel, bread. Nice end bitterness that lingers for a bit, balanced beer. Overall fantastic beer, that is very easy to drink

Hazy, amber-golden colored, small white head. Aroma is of caramel malt background, some orange hard candy, strong pine and citrus hoppy and resiny aroma. Taste is medium sweet caramel malt, strong pine aroma, citrus and fruity, medium+ bitterness, dry finish, lasting aftertaste. Medium bodied, soft+ carbonation, resiny. Excellent, can only imagine how good it is when freshest!

From 0,33l can, Pours light cloudy to clear liquid, big frothy white head, fell down after a while, Aroma: grapefruit, apricot, frash hopy, lemon grass, lemon peel, Taste: medium sweet, heavy bitter, light to medium sour, fruity, grapefruit, lemon grass, apricot, caramel, resin, Palate: light to medium body, soft carbonation, slick to creamy mouthfeel, long bitter grapefruit aftertaste, Overall: perfect IPA, lighter body, srong bitterness, refreshing, easy drinkable, nice hopy profile, enjoyed.

355 ml bottle. Clear golden body with a nice white head. Aroma is nice and citric fruity, some grapefruit and mild caramel malt. Flavor is a solid balanced IPA with good citric fruit and other fruits mixed with caramel malt and pleasant bitterness. Fine balanced body as well with a pleasant aftertaste. A solid and balanced IPA.

Flaske fra Vinmonopolet Kvadd√•, hjemme en fredagskveld: gylden, med ok skum. Flott kalibrert bitterhet i ettersmaken. Superfrisk ipa i beste amerikanske tradisjon. No poisonous stings here, just pure bliss.

Yet another perfectly balanced IPA with plenty it hops aroma. Actually refreshing and I could probably have more than one.

355 ml bottle. Unclear golden orange color with off white head. Malty and hoppy aroma, caramel, citrusy fruity, grapefruit, pine. Sweet and heavy bitter taste like aroma. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

Rating #1506 - 16.03.2015 - On tap at Local Pacific Beach. Pours a rich golden, small white head, minimal lacing. Aroma is peachy-mango, lemon rind On the palate, similar tropical flavours, mild resin, mild pastry dough malt. Medium bodied and extraordinarily balanced. Glad sculpin is hitting a wider distribution network. Pours a see through golden orange with a lacing thin white head. Aromas of huge citrus, lemon, apricot, slight grass. Similar flavors with almost a bubblegum finish. Hoppy with a dry finish. Excellent ipa.

Bottle. Slightly cloudy golden yellow with a thin white head. Aroma is strong citrus and pine. Light-medium body and moderate carbonation. Taste is resinous and citrus with fruity undertones. Long-lasting bitter aftertaste. Solid IPA but a little too bitter for my taste.
Mooie oranje kleur met een goede kraag. Ruikt fruitig, citrus, hop, orange. Mooie fruitige geur. Smaakt fruitig, citrus, hop, orange. Goede bittere smaak. Fruitige afdronk.
Ziet er super uit. Ruikt heerlijk hoppig en smaakt fris, citrus, erg bitter. Toppertje!
Oranje ondoorzichtig bier met een goede witte schuim kraag. Ruikt fruitig, tropisch fruit, citrus, grapefruit. Smaakt citrus, grapefruit, beetje kauwgombal achtig, goed bitter.

UPDATED: JAN 13, 2017 Rerate. Bottle. Pours a crystal clear orange gold, off white head, nice lacing. Rich sweet biscuit malt aroma, much more than I remember, a fair heap of pine resin. Flavour follows, nice additions of citrus, really balanced taste, delicious malts. Strong pine bitterness follows a medium effervescent body which balances wonderfully and makes it feel assertive yet highly drinkable. Despite the style progressing, this is still an IPA you feel you could have 3 or 4 of. A fave for nearly a decade.
Floral aroma with notes of lychee and grapefruit. Clear amber colour. Bitter front with notes of citrus and malt. Medium body with lively carbonation. A very tasty brew.

Pours a light copper with not much of a head, but a thin lacing that lasts quite q while. Initial smell was of orange, but after it sat a bit got whiffs of citrus, grapefruit and light hop smell. Taste is citrus upfront, pretty strong sweet malt backbone, grapefruit and pine resin taste and feel at the end. 

Pretty solid IPA. Will be getting again. One of the best ones I have found in stores in Utah.
12 oz bottle. Pours a slightly orange golden with a white head. Potent fresh juicy grapefruit hop aroma, orange, herbal. Flavor is also juicy citrus grapefruit and pine hoppiness. Quite good stuff.
Bottle, Ann Arbor, MI via Plum Market. Hazy gold. Stone fruit aroma with citrus and earthy resin. Sharp citrus flavour, pine resin some alcohol on the finish.

(Bottle). The smell is somewhat metallic with aromas of lightly overripe tropical fruits. Taste is rich with a lot of flavor of tropical fruits like mango, peach and passion fruit. The aftertaste is dry and bitter with hints of grapefruit. Regarding the flavors this ought to be a good IPA, But I think the taste is too unbalanced and hard.

Bottle. Hazy golden body with a frothy white head. Aroma of grapefruit, toasted grain, floral hops, dough, dry grain. The flavor is moderately sweet and lightly to moderately bitter. It finishes lightly sweet and moderately to heavily bitter. Medium body, velvety texture, lively carbonation. Light astringency in the finish. Taste of citrus, light resin, toasted grain. Maybe its reputation led to higher expectations than I should have had, but I was not wowed. Lots of ipas out there like this.

Bottle, far too long after bottling date. But as it is what it is, it¬íll get a go anyway. Pours golden, with a creamy head. Flavour is hoppy tropical notes with apricots, mango and citrusy orange peel, as well as a nice caramelly malty back with bread and toffee. Lingering sweet hoppy finish. Solid IPA, which no doubt is even better a couple of months fresher.

Distinct hoppy flavour on a background of slightly sweet malts, notes of grapefruit, pine needles and resin. Bitter finish, very bitter aftertaste.

12 oz bottles with botched date code from six pack of BP Kansas welcome back - roll out served at 45¬∞ into Orrefors Difference Pils and Spiegelau IPA
Acidic nose with lots of fruity flavors of grapefruit and banana. Taste is sweet and hoppy. Very well balanced west coast IPA.

on tap @ Party Town / Florence KY --- Bright clear medium amber, fluffy 2" white head, streaks of lace. Aroma of strong citrus. Taste is caramel that bursts on a lightly carbonated swallow into strong citrus hops. A bit of malt lingers in the background through a long finish. A pretty solid IPA - balanced and complex.
Great IPA. Hoppy with a hint of a fruity balance. Crisp finish that leaves you wanting more.

Clear, orange colour with big, stable head. Nice lacing too. After opening the bottle, it feels big punch of citrus (grapefruit!), exotic fruits (mango, maybe even passion fruit), some floral note and malty base on background. Taste is light to medium sweet, medium to heavy bitter, light dry. Finish is very long, biiter, but not harsh or tart. Soft carbonation. Medium to full body. Great example of West Coast style IPA, nice grapefruit aroma, clear light brown color, half finger of white head, grapefruit flavor nice bitterness clean finish, light body, nicely balanced delicious beer.

27-NOV-2015, bottle @home, from Systembolaget Emporia.
Hazy golden with a beautifull lasting, lacing, white head.
Really hoppy IPA with grape fruit and pine, exotic fruit. Not a lot of malt - mostly pure hoppy niceness.
Really bitter, medium body and carbonation. Looong bitter aftertaste. Really one of the best IPA¬ís.
Fine IPA...but not unique. Many MI brews as good or better. Hop blend leans bitter rather than fruity. Clear golden color.

Tap pour at The Depot before EL VY at First Ave. Commonshawn and samadouche present. Pint glass. Golden orange with hints of copper. Almost pristine appearance. Consistent quarter finger head. Aroma is citrus in the form of grapefruit and orange. Some definite hoppiness. Taste is crisp citrusy and smooth. Beautiful, full mouthfeel with an oily, resiny characteristic that is welcomed. Bitterness chimes in midway through the sip leading into its finish. It¬ís a good go to option despite the fact they completely sold out. Sad...Ballast Point...sad.
Klart mahogni med lavt hvitt skum. Frisk duft av sitrus og noe gran. Sitrus skall og karamell i smaken. Skuffende tynn munnf√∏lelse med en t√∏rr avslutning.

Bottle from Vinmonopolet. Aroma is grapefruit, hoppy, orange peel, orange. Deep golden, clear, small white head. Medium sweetness, high bitterness, taste is grapefruit peel, orange peel, grapefruit, orange, lemon, grassy, hints of pine, small malty backbone. Medium body, medium carbonation, long dry and bitter finish. Heavy on the bitter side, but pretty good..

7%ABV. ¬†IPA.

Poured out of the ¬†bottle a rich slighlty cloudy amber. ¬†14¬∫SRM.

Nose has beautiful flavors of fresh yellow grapefruit peel. ¬†This is not just the zest, but the entire peel with ¬†the tartness of the zest with the more organic sweetness of the white rind. ¬†There are some nice sweet deep roasted malt aromas coming off this thing as well. ¬†Finally, there are some nice pine and fresh grassy aroma notes as well. ¬†There is a molasses sweetness to the nose as well. ¬†Very Very Very pleasing!

Mouthfeel is soapy, sudsy and very very well represented by roasty malty flavors, with graham cracker fullness, caramel sweetness and a roasted hazelnut nuttiness. ¬†There is even a brief pecan butteriness if you¬íre not distracted by the hops

The hops are resinous, piney and pronounced. ¬†You get the same taste experience chawing on a fresh yellow grapefruit peel. Just so so so beautiful.

Food Pairing: ¬†wagyu kushiyaki. ¬†Grain-fed with a marbling 8 at least.

Goes on Favorites List! ¬†All time Favorites List!!

Keg, DogHouse, Merchant City, Glasgow. Pours dark gold almost amber nice white head. Nose is grapefruit, pine, resin, toffee citrus fruits in general but also slightly too sweet. Taste is grapefruit and pineapple and then you get a slightly too sweet after taste.
Bottle bought in Lotte supermarket in Songdo, Incheon Korea. This IPA is the quintessential IPA, if you ever see it, do not forego, it is that good. Biased I am yes, but it is art in brewed form.

Clear amber body with an off-white, long-lived head that ends up as a fully lasting layer of bubbles. Strong aroma of slightly overripe sweet tropical fruits and caramel, with peppery hints in the back. It¬ís not exactly fresh from the brewery, still it¬ís tremendously hoppy! Very strong flavour of tropical fruits, orange, resin and caramel. The long-lasting finish is pretty heavy bitter. Incredibly smooth mouthfeel, medium body, moderate carbonation. A superb IPA! 
[35.5 cl bottle, enjoyed 5 months after bottling, from Vinmonopolet Online]

650 mL bottle. Clear gold pour, tall white head, good lacing. Big citrus aroma, mild cereal malt notes. Taste is very well balanced, lots of citrus, mainly orange and a long lasting bitter finish. Great IPA.
A classic. Hoppy, piney, resinous. Strong, fruity, delicious. Awesome ipa.
Bottle from Vinmonopolet. Nice and clear pour. Not a intens IPA smell, but very fruity. God tropical smell and taste. God balance between the sweetnes and bitternes.

Bottle from Vinmonopolet, Kvadrat. Pours clear deep golden with a big creamy white head. Aroma of oranges and tropical fruits, some marmelade malts as well. Taste is moderate sweet, with a good crisp tropical fruity hop addition. Dry clean mouthfeel, very good and well balanced IPA.
Pours slightly cloudy golden, aroma is instant hoppy. Aroma of pine and grass. Taste is hoppy, but nice. Lots of pine.
Clear golden with white head. Citrus, dank green hops, earth and grapefruit. Sweet, hop resin, crisp and dry finish. overall: Crisp
Brewdog Manchester. Half pint from keg. Excellent ipa, nose as it should be full of fresh citrus fruits, the bitterness so nicely balance! It cannot get any better. Enjoy!

Delightful fruity/citrus aroma, with bit of cereal behind. Taste is very west coast ipa, lots of grapefruit, other fruit. Quite dry, but a little sweetness in there to start, before fading to bitter, bitter, bitter. Finish is somewhat muted.

Bottle. Thanks Matt! Rich full and complex beer. Moderate body but easy drinking. Strong bitterness, strong caramel biscuity burnt sugar malty background, strong resiny piney orange citrusy flavours. Classic and very good.

Clear, deep amber in color. Rather minimal off-white head. Rich, powerful aroma. Notes of resin, citrus, herbs, toast, and caramel. Taste is earthy, with underlying hints of fruit and a bit of citrus tartness. Medium body, slightly oily texture, lively carbonation and a hoppy, bitter finish. An excellent beer.

On the I find grapeskin, marmelade (granny candy?) and tropical fruit. These aromas hint of a well balanced beer. On the palate there is a fantastic thick mouthfeel and that beautiful balance between bitterness, alcohol and malty sweetness. A beautiful IPA! My favourite actually!

Appearance: clear pale amber, two fingers of rocky ivory head, good retention and moderate lacing. (4/5) Aroma: pale malt, citrus and fruity hops. (8/10) Taste: moderate sweet, moderately strong bitter. (9/10) Medium body, moderate carbonation, lingering bitter finish. (4/5)

A really good example of the A/IPA style: nicely balanced hop bitterness supported by a clean malt. Lots of citrusy tones from the hops, with a clean bitter finish. Really good, but for me not quite as good as the grapefruit version. (17/20)

Bottle. Large fizzy white head that mostly lasted. Fair display of lacing. Cloudy amber/golden color. Aroma of peach, passionfruit, fruit, caramel, grain, corn, malt. Over the palate came think malty notes with good counter hoppy notes. Full bodied with a think texture. Well balanced sweet and bitter flavor. Lingering sweet and thick malty finish with some counter bitterness.

Flaska fr√•n SB. Klar orange med fingertjockt vitt skum. Tydlig doft av citrus och exotisk frukt. Ganska tunn kropp, n√•got torr. Inleds med citrustoner f√∂r att √∂verg√• i kraftig, n√•got s√∂tt och fyllig beska som blir kvar h√§ngandes en bra stund. Bra dos av tallbarr, malts√∂tma och k√•da. En IPA som varit hypad ett tag nu. Druckit den n√•gra g√•nger, men tycker den √§r olika varje g√•ng. Inte helt f√∂rst√•tt hypen (√§nnu).

Appearance is hazy amber, with a thick creamy beige head, which clings to the glass. Aroma- orange, pineapple, creamy malt, tropical fruit juice, pine, hop resin. Yum. Taste- massive hop bitterness, orange peel, pineapple, juicy tropical fruit, pine, grapefruit, hop resins. Huge bitter fruit, but also there¬ís biscuity malt underpinning the whole thing. Mouthfeel is oily and clingy, hugely long bitter finish. Superb IPA.
Can. Pours copper with a thick head. Big grapefruit aroma. Citrus flavor up front but balanced well with malt throughout.

Systembolaget. Best before 2016-06-16. Amber color with a minimal head. Pine, cytrus dominates the aroma. Well balanced though a bit sweet. Though this is a great IPA I doubt this is the top notch example of a bottle as the hops feels a bit tired.

Look; off white short lived head, deep golden body, clear, near amber. Aroma; tropic fruits, hops, citric peels. Taste; bitter peaches, citric peels, hops, juicy roasted malts - leading to a juicy roasted malty finish in the peels of tropic fruits. On palate good n juicy with soft carbonation. Overall; solid tropical IPA.
