Mmmmmmm been wanting this for a while, can¬ít wait. Taste yummy and perfect. Big blast of citrus, nice and malty, lemon lime, orange, finishes with bitter caramel. Shit dam fuck is this drinkable, so slamable. Finishes so clean. Bitter lingers. Simple high quality shit.
Bottle - Mild taste on the palate, sorta refined. Not a strong bit from the hops, rather subtle bitterness in fact. Very fruity flavors from the hops.
12oz Flasche. Sehr kr√§ftiges und komplexes Aroma. Grapefruit, Harz, verbrannter Zucker. Wuchtiger trockener Geschmack.
Dunkelgelbe Farbe sehr sch√∂ner fester Schaum, Geruch fruchtig citrus hopfig, Geschmack cremig fruchtig Grapefruit und leichte Vanille, sch√∂ne bitternote
First thing that comes out is the grapefruit, this one is very drinkable smooth nice finish no bitter after taste, with plenty of hoppy flavors,

355ml Can from Brewdog online shop (¬£3.50):
This one was an excellent offering from Ballast Point, exactly what I was expecting with plenty of hop bitterness and beautiful tropical fruits. There was a nice kick to the beer with some great pine and citrus flavours making the beer a classic and easily one of the best of the style that I¬íve tried, there¬ís only a couple others that I would rate higher.

Going public and near. They will do well this beer kicks butt. Citrus and stone fruit aroma in the best way. Flavor of nice light malts and super fresh clean hops and great clean bitterness. One on best IPAS in the best place for IPAs San Diego.

35ml. Can. 
Pours clear yellow with white head. 
Aroma pine, resin, caramel, grapefruit, mango. 
Taste caramel sweets, piney greapfruit bitter. 
Mouthfeel dry, full. 
Great IPA.
Beautiful crystal clean deep golden sparkle. Bitter petrolly with a faint hint of grapefruit. Reminiscent of champagne in a way. Good acidic support. Very clean and pure. Beautiful.

Well as much as I did not want to rate this so high, I had to it is fricking awesome.....but not cuz it is huge hops like a Pliny but because it is so fresh and balanced. The hops are fresh piney and fruity and peppery. It is slightly bitter but really hoppy without killing you palate. So thirst quenching and so hoppy a great combo. A+++++

Can at home. Pours clear golden with a medium white head that disappears quickly. A pretty weak aroma but theres hints of lemon and mango coming through. Taste is citrus, caramel and some apricot. Tasting quite a bit of the malt but I¬íd prefer slightly more bitterness towards the end. Taken me a while to get round to trying one of these and I was expecting big things. A solid IPA that is very drinkable but I think my expectations were slightly high.

Aroma: bread, grapefruit, mango. Appearance: golden, clear liquid, rocky head, white lasting foam. Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness. Palate: medium body, oily/creamy feel, flat, bitter aftertaste.
Bottle. Nice head eith good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are rich flowers, fruits, pine, citrus and hops. Nice semi bitter finish. Could have been more fresh.

Golden/light amber colour with a creamy head. Aroma of hops and fruits. Some pine, grass and citrus together with a hint of mango. Taste of hops, toffee, orange and a hint of mango. Characteristic hop bitterness but still with a fresh mouth feel.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

Bb 5.1.16 Clear golden liquid with frothy white head. Aroma of caramel, honey. Taste of goatweed, medium sweet, medium bitterness, light sour. Medium body, oily feel, light carbonisation, long bitter finish

Aroma has a lot of grapefruit. Pours burnt orange with a small head that leaves some lacing. Taste has heavy bitterness, medium sweetness and nice malty backbone. Taste has mostly grapefruit but also a hint of mango. Medium to full bodied with a perfect carbonation. Long bitter finish.

12 fl oz can from Brewdog online store. Deep orange golden colour, foamy white head and aroma of mango, orange citrus, hop resins. Taste is malt caramel with tropical fruity, peach notes and grapefruit, resiny spice, earthy bitterness. Oily mouthfeel, medium bodied, soft carbonation, dry tangy bitter finish. Aggressively hoppy, very drinkable.

Bottle in the Junkyard, Nottingham. Pours hazy golden with a nice frothy white head. Nice grapefruit aroma. The taste is lots of fruity grapefruit with light spice over caramel. Long lingering bitter finish. Lovely and smooth. Excellent.

A beautiful burnt orange colour with a thick and foamy, bright white head. Peach and lemon on the nose, a nice balance between hoppy and sweet. A very well rounded beer, a slight pine hop presence with some mango sweetness. Subtle light malts and an earthy centre round out this delicious brew. Well carbonated and dense on the palate, a sweet thickness that stays long after the beer has been consumed.

Pours clear golden with creamy white head. Intense citric aroma, grapefruit and lime. Some mango aswell. Taste is medium bitter, very fruity. Lively carbonation, light-medium body. Lives up to its name.

Pours a beautiful light golden amber with an off white head that is fairly president with lacings. The nose is citrus (lemon & orange) and hoppy with subtle mango notes. The flavor of light malt and citrus bite sits on a medium-light body with a strong bitterness leaving the mouth hop dryness. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Gylden brun klar med fingerh√∏yt offwhite skum. Deilig lukt av sydhavsfrukter, ananas, kanel, lime og lett karamell. Fruktig start, kraftig bitter n√•r du slipper inn luft. Fyldig. God blanding av s√∏dme og bitterhet. Middels lang avsluttning.
√ñverlag en myckey bra IPA, inget som stack ut idag. V√§lbalanserad och god. Dracks i labbet p√• fredags aw.

Pours with little foam, beautiful color, great aroma, reminiscent of peaches but with a bitter taste. The alcohol does not appear at first, very bitter.
Great beer, found randomly, always passed at the aisle, but somehow, today it begged me to take it home. 
Will buy again.
A decent IPA, with some good tropical aroma, but I just felt the body was a touch thin in relation to the scent up front
Tap at Tap House Grill. Orange with minimal head and medium lacing. Crackers, dried mango and day old cut grass. Dry with a long grassy bitter finish. Medium body with a fizzy feel.
Best beer in all the land!!! Do not accept any substitutes. Then the Grapefruit and Habanero just reaffirms.
35,5cl bottle. Grapefruit/lemon, tropical fruits (mango, peach), caramel. Moderate bitterness and sweetness. Long bitter finish.

I like this beer better than most, but less than a lot. There are better options.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Light with a big head. Fruity bouquet and sweet as from tropical fruit, emphasized with heaps of hops. A bit too strong carbonation, would gain on softer approach considering its fruity frame.
Bottle from greenslopes cellars Brisbane, In my opinion Sculpin is above their big eye ipa, very smooth and easy on the palate

At first I thought it was too sweet. But with further exploration I found an amazingly well balanced flavor palate! This is truly an outstanding beer. Apricot does come out in quite a pronounced and playful play dance with the pine and general hops deliciousness. Pretty clean but has a bit of a lingering citrus bitter finish in the back of the tongue. Really a great experience.

Bottle to glass. Clear amber, medium small head, fair lacing. Nose is toffee, pineapple, grapefruit. Taste is mild sweetness, grapefruit, pine, bitter, great balance, medium carbonation, medium mouthfeel. Really solid IPA. Their Bigeye is worth trying as well.

Can into a pint glass from The Drinkery, Londonderry NH. Aroma is strong pine, herbs, fruit, spruce, while still being able to glean a maltiness, and some basement toward the bottom of the glass. Appearance is mild hazy orangish yellow with mild sparkle but nice foamy white two-finger width head, mild lacing. Taste is dominant mild-to-moderate bitter but with some sweet fruitiness throughout for balance including into long-lasting finish. Palate is refreshing light-to-medium body with thin, slightly creamy texture and average carbonation. Overall, above average appearance and palate but won¬ít knock your socks off. Very interesting aroma with some of that complexity translating over to the taste but a little over to the bitter side for me.

Local grocery now has a growler station. Glad this beer is one of their initial offerings. Foamy head with nice lacing. Nose was pine and fruit. Perfect bitterness; robust on the palate, with grapefruit and pine prevailing. Nice hop notes; stood up staunchly to a very spicy Indian meal. Great stuff.

UPDATED: OCT 28, 2015 Really nice aroma of peach, melon and abricot. Yummie! Deep clear yellow color with white head. The taste has a fantastic peach and abricot flavor to it along with great bitterness. Sublime fruity IPA.

660ml bottle at home. Hazy golden colour, foamy white head. Classic American hop profile with citrus fruits, light mango/tropical fruits and resinous bitterness, on top of a light malty base. Lingering finish. Good body, medium carbonation, oily mouthfeel.

A beautiful beer. Fresh hoppy taste and classic IPA aroma. 7% but doesn't feel that heavy. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Very excited to try this one after hearing all of the hype. Was expecting a hop bomb so a little disappointed as this was very malty and balanced. Biscuit and pine blended together nicely, and had a nice, almost harsh boozy aftertaste. I¬ím a bit of a hop head so a little too balanced for me but an excellent example of its type.
Bottle into IPA glass. Pours a light coppery colour with white head. Aroma is grapefruit and mango. Taste is tropical fruit with a grapefruit like bitterness. Fantastic IPA.

UPDATED: OCT 20, 2015 Pours nice copper golden with a nice small white head! Aroma; Citrus, grapefruit, pine, caramel with a pinch of malt. Flavours; malt bitterness, citrus, pine and some grapefruit.. This is a very nice beer

Rating #3000. 12oz brown bottle. Coppery golden colour. Tighly beaded white head. Ok lacing. Aroma - light malt - biscuit and a trace of caramel, some light citrus and grapefruit but a lovely burst of spicy pine and resins. Taste has light dry malts with piney hops and spice. Medium bitterness, the aftertaste has resiny hops. Super drinkable. Overall this is a highly enjoyable IPA, one that¬ís been on my hitlist for a long time, it¬ís not cheap and I probably won¬ít fork over the dough for another sixer, but it¬ís absolutely worth it at this moment.
One of my favorite IPAs ever. Bright IPA with plenty of summery, citrus¬íy hops. Balanced malt body that holds up to all the hops.

Appearance: Orange golden, clear. Some off-white head. Looks nice.
Aroma: Hops, slight metal. Fruits, exotic.
Taste: Lots of nice fruits, good bitterness. Nice, lingering bitter aftertaste. Cool.
Bought: Total Wine (Sterling), 355 ml, $2.99
Info: 16/9-2015
Pretty good IPA. Pretty strong at 7% but still has a good flavor that is not intimidating.

UPDATED: JAN 5, 2016 Nitro version on tap showing neon yellow with half a finger of clean white foam. 

The nose shows clean sweet grapefruit. 

The palate is obviously extremely smooth, full bodied, a lot of pithy grapefruit bitterness, with the fruit showing more in the background and a light bitterness on the finish.
Can. Golden color. Nice aroma of citrus, pine and peach. Taste of fresh pine, bitter citrus, passion fruit and caramel. Classic quality ipa.

There is no surprises here, its a really good ipa, ticks all the boxes. Probably one of the best ipas ive tried considering if you take price into consideration. Congrats to ballast point for extremely good workmanship.
Another great IPA. What can you really say about the best IPAs they all taste so similar. Nothing special other than being really good.
Very good beer, hopped perfectly. It¬ís what you¬íd expect from an IPA. If you like hoppy beers, this one¬ís for you!

Bottle.
Amber clear, white head.
Aroma fruit, honey Apple.
Taste sweet, resin, and some bitterness. 
Fizzy and nice.
This is a very bright, solid IPA. Strong citrus notes with a semi dry finish. Theta a reason it¬ís among the best.

Probada en Rattle & Hum. Midtown Manhattan, New York. Septiembre, 2015. IPA exquisita.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Wow! Very nice exotic fruit aroma combined with a nice pineapple flavour. Looks very nice in the glass also.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Flaska. En absolut helt fantastisk IPA. Fullsmockad med tropiska frukter (och en del karamell, malt och tallbarr) i s√•v√§l doft som smak, med en s√• perfekt v√§l avv√§gd beska/s√∂tma att jag rimligen har sv√•rt att se att det kan bli b√§ttre. Jag √∂dslar inga fler ord p√• detta lilla m√§sterverk, jag har fullt upp med att njuta av det.

Bottle from SB 150904.
Clear golden amber withe creamy lasting and lacing white head. 
Powerful citrus and tropical fruit in the nose, not so much resins. Very nice and pleasant bitterness with long aftertaste. Truly nice, but there is a bit to much alcohol breaking through that decreases the taste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma is clove, pinecone, honey, lemon grass and sweet lightly roasted malts. Taste is sweet deep roasted malts balanced very well. Finishes surprisingly smooth. Appearance is a clear gold with a thin pearl head that retains fairly well.

UPDATED: JUL 29, 2016 Bronzed body with aromas of tropical fruits--pineapple, and guava, wafting of the glass. The body has some resiny touches, but again, the fruity hops are at the forefront. Re-rated 7-23-16 - much better this time around, having it on tap might have made the different. Nice resiny hoppy bitter body with some intriguing fruit notes, and excellent complexity.

Beautiful golden amber colour.
Nice hopy piney smell
Strong hop flavour
Real strong aftertaste, nice bitterness

12oz tulip glass on tap at Beer Revolution in Edmonton pours a light copper color with a finger and a half of white head that leaves some decent lacing on the glass. Aroma is grapefruit with some tropical fruits and hints of caramel. Taste is a grapefruit hop bitterness with a tropical fruit and light caramel malty sweetness. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, a very well balanced IPA that is tasty and easy to drink. Not a huge hop bomb, but a pleasant IPA that is sure to satisfy most IPA lovers out there.

Such a unique, instantly recognizable aroma. Very fruity, citrusy, and fresh, with just the right amount of hop bitterness and well-balanced malt. Very drinkable for it¬ís ABV and is one of my favorite IPAs.

The aroma is hops, citrus. Pours a clear copper/orange with off white head, mostly diminishing with excellent lacing. The taste is bitter, biting to the back of the tongue. The body is medium/light, the texture creamy, the carbonation lively and the finish bitter and long. Very Good!!

A typical IPA, not overly fruity aroma, looks like an IPA, tastes like a VERY well balanced IPA a lot of malty fullness, nice bitterness and not trace of over powering fruity hops
Long mature aftertaste with a nice bitterness..
A truly great ipa

Bottle. Hazy copper with a medium sized good lacing diminishing white head. Nose has pine, candied citrus, honey, hay, grain. Flavour follows the same lines; pine, grapefruit, candied citrus, grain, light white bread, apricot, peach, light alcohol. Medium body, oily texture, fine carbonation, medium sweet and bitter. Fine mouthfeel, good balance.
Bottle. Amber colour with white head. Fruity, grape and peach aroma. Sweet, fruity, grape, peach, citric taste, bitter. Medium to full body.

Strong citrus and floral aromas galore! Pours a slightly hazy amber-orange colour with a finger of off-white head. Mildly sweet with some lingering bitterness, but not over-powering. This brew truly is a delight.

Pours a hazy orange/red colour, aroma is delicious with tons of grapefruit, citrus, mango, lychee, passionfruit etc. Real fruity and nice! Flavor has tons of fruit; citrus, mango, peach! The finish has quite the hefty bitterness kick to it, but balances this beer out nicely. Delicious!
Bottle from Cork 57. Body is hazy golden with medium head. Nose is lots of hops and some grapefruit. Taste is very, very hoppy and oh so good. Really nice balance. Kicks in the finish!

I had this at Global Brew. Pours gold with a white head. Taste citrus, pine, caramel. Thought this was good. I would drink this again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Dark golden amber pour with a medium off white head. Aroma of citrus, peach, and earthy hops with a nice malty undertone. Medium body with a sharp hoppy finish.

bottle from brewdog bar, sheffield. Clear light amber with nice glossy white head. Aroma is nice, fruity, apricot and peach, lemon and grapefruit. taste is nice crisp and bitter, not too dry. Quite prickly and a medium body. Good stuff.

A 22 fl oz bomber with a bottled code date of 15063 which means 4th March 2015, and poured into a Spiegelau IPA glass. The beer poured a very nice clear golden orange colour with a two and a half finger white head that dissipates slowly leaving a thin foamy layer and thick lacing. Nice strong aromas with tropical mango and peach strongest followed by apricot, citrus orange and some pine. Taste starts with citrus grapefruit and some light bready malts, followed by tropical fruits mainly mango, apricot and pineapple, hints of pine and finishes with bitter grapefruit once more. Medium bodied with medium carbonation and very refreshing Overall, a stunning beer. Loved it. One of the best IPA¬ís out there in my opinion. A definite must buy for me. And now I just need to try an even fresher version.
Aroma s√º√ülich, mit Pfirsich, wei√üer Traube und einem Hauch Handseife. Geschmack dann aber im Gegensatz zu vielen IPAs dann aber nicht seifig, sehr fruchtig, ausgewogene Bittere.

Farbe goldig, tr√ºb. Geruch fruchtig, mit Mango. Dazu Kr√§uterhopfen. Im Geschmack leicht rests√º√ü. Zum Ende bitter, aber nicht zu bitter. Leicht mehlige Textur, aber das liegt an der Hopfenmenge. Sehr gut.
Fantastic aroma of citrus and a hint of malts, similar taste but a bit more mild, top notch ipa

This IPA poured a slightly cloudy golden yellow colour with a huge, cream coloured head. Scents include citrus fruit hops, glue and a little hay. First swig was quite bitter, but a nice fruity bitter. Flavours of citrus juice and hops. Finish was quite bitter with citrus flavours lingering.

UPDATED: AUG 17, 2015 35,5cl bottle from Arve_Christian - thanks a lot! Pours clear deep golden with a white head. Strong, hoppy aroma, first pine, then more fruity notes, citrus, hints of tropical fruits, some caramel and herbs too. Medium sweet with hoppy flavours dominated by grapefruit and pine and a rather strong bitterness in the finish. Guess it¬ís not too fresh, quite tasty it is, but hardly exceptional.

12 oz bottle. Clear amber, dense head, sticky lace. Fruity hop aroma, mango, peach, apricot, grapefruit, light caramel.Flavor is caramel, citrus, pine, stone fruit. Nice balance.

8/14 Draft at Bull McCabes. Not as much nose as I expected. However great complex mouth of hops. Nice balance without venturing into DIPA territory.

Pours clear golden with small white head. Quite bitter and lots of hops. From systembolaget malung.
How : bottle Appearance : clear golden, small to medium white head. Aroma : peach, apricot, lime, grass , some honey notes. Palate : medium body, average carbonation.
cloudy amber color; great citrusy hop aroma; a fantastic, very well-balanced West Coast IPA; light malt background with lots of citrusy hops up front and center; one of my very favorite IPAs
Pretty good IPA that is pretty easily attainable in Ohio. I think this ranks up there with a lot of the top of the line IPAs.

Alaranjada/dourada, boa forma√ß√£o de espuma (branca) e boa reten√ß√£o. Aroma bastante floral, frutas tropicais amarelas, maracuj√°, abacaxi, no ponto exato, sem exageros. Paladar de amargor m√©dio, baixo dul√ßor, floral aparece com mais persist√™ncia do que no aroma, refrescante. Corpo leve e carbonata√ß√£o m√©dia. Aftertaste novamente lembra frutas amarelas, amargor m√©dio de boa dura√ß√£o, levemente seca ao final. Aroma is overwhelmingly citrus. Taste has citrus, some more elusive fruitiness - is this apricot? Appearance and Pala late are good.

Pours a nice copper color. Grapefruit and citrus rind flavored that linger on the tongue. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours dark yellow with medium head, leaving a nice lacing on glass. Aroma: white tropical fruit, mango, peach, some pine tree. Nice intense and complex aroma. Taste: citrus fruit mixed with very pleasant bitterness, exposing the hoppy crisp thanks to a relatively low body. Nice, balanced palate. ABV well hidden. Complex but at the same time very drinkable. That¬ís what an IPA should be.
from bottle that poured golden brown & very aromatic full of inviting hops taste is a fine blend with loads of grapefruit hoppy flavours & lingering bitterness

12 fl. oz. bottle from Club de Cervezas. Pours a clear, sparkling orange color with a medium sized white frothy head that diminishes slowly and leaves a good creamy film. Intense and powerful hoppy aroma, a real hop perfume. Notes of grapefruit, ice-cream bean, lemongrass, cedar, green apples, rose apple, pine cones and even basil. Really great, purely hoppy. Taste is very bitter, intense and bold without being a hop-juice. Herbal bitterness leaves some space for soft to mild fruit tartness to be perceivable. An all hop brew, with barely any malty hints. I can say, in a hop-head mood, I love it and see little ground to improve it, but it¬ís not the pinnacle of complexity. Medium body and carbonation. Very very drinkable and admirably brewed. I would have this anytime I need a hop fix. Aftertaste is massively hoppy. More bitter and slightly less tart than the Grapefruit Sculpin. My new IPA type-specimen.

Bouteille 355ml. Couleur orang√©e p√¢le l√©g√®rement voil√©e, mousse blanche laissant un anneau sur les parois du verre. Ar√¥me de houblon r√©sineux, pamplemousse, malt, ananas en conserve. Go√ªt de malt, houblon r√©sineux, amertume √©lev√©e, pin, agrumes m√ªres. Carbonatation moyenne-√©lev√©e, corps moyen.

Really nice and juicy ipa. Aroma of pine, sweet grape, orange, tangerine, peach and some floral notes. Tastewise it is bitter and refreshing with notes of pine, grape, unripe mango and some sweeter fruit. Long aftertaste.

Draught. Pours a hazy dark orange with a moderately lasting off white head. Aroma of grapefruit, mango, passion fruit, orange. Taste is of more exotic fruit, orange. Really fruity and refreshing. Oily mouthfeel, medium to high carbonation. Great ipa.
Aroma de ervas com toque c√≠trico e de l√∫pulo. Cerveja √¢mbar com espuma abundante e persistente. Bom corpo com toque herbal e retrogosto amargo pronunciado e persistente
Citrus aroma as well aa dried fruit notes. Mildly bitter with much of a citrus rind taste.

Pour from can at a tasting. Pours copper orange with a potent eggshell beige head. Intense tangerine peel aroma, mellow, and with some grapefruit soft bitterness. Creamy body, on the bitter side, Taste is nice citrus and graegruit bitterness. Very nice!

During my random down time beeresearch I noticed that the last IPA rating I did (La Cumbre), allowed it to leapfrog in the ratings over this locally available beer, that much to my surprise i haven¬ít rated. To be honest, I¬ím not sure if I¬íve even ever had it before. I always have jumped at the opportunity to get the grapefruit and habenero, but this one always slipped through the cracks I guess. Who watches the sequels, but never bothers with the original? Apparently I do. The originals are always better right? I haven¬ít seen The Godfather in a while. Or was that the one exception? Oh yeah, the beer. 12 oz can purchased entirely for the comparison, and to give it the chance to earn it¬ís spot back. I have no doubts, because these guys don¬ít really miss with their beer often. Pours a fizzy golden color with a huge sea foam head. Aroma has a huge splash of grapefruit and citrus, from a distance. Kinda filled the area, which was very nice. Very nice grapefruit, and orange fruit fronted flavor with an excellent hop character throughout. Long cool, lemon citrus like finish. Fantastic IPA to say the least. Another that deserves the hype that surrounds it. It almost seems to me like the sculpin has as much grapefruit as the grapefruit version does. Would love to compare side by side. Overall, an awesome IPA, that definitely stands out.
UPDATED: AUG 1, 2015 Nearly clear. Tasted side by side with grapefruit sculpin. Much more drinkable. Well balanced.

Pours a very clear, coppery-amber color, with a decent, stable head.

Smells of biscuity malts, with a hoppiness featuring a grassy dankness as well as an orange ripeness. While the hops are beautifully well pronounced on the nose, they blend well into the malts with a note of lemon zest standing out from that mixture. 

Drinks outstandingly soft, with a well integrated aqueous note, perfectly covered by pungent hops, creating a fantastic refreshment.

Begins with bready malts, together with a short appearing coppery note, integrated into the overall taste by sun-bathed, sweet oranges. They introduce an exuberant fruit note to the palate, covered by dry, bitter lemon, pushed by a slightly metallic carbonation. Finishes with luscious lemon rind, leafes, a sparkly burn and a dried orange.

Convinces by a world-class balance between sweeter malts and distinct hops, which blend marvelously well together. The hops provide an awesome flavor profile, around which the flavors are successfully build, exhibiting a great depth
you really don¬ít get much better than this with IPAs. Fresh, sweet, hoppy. It¬ís my goto IPA out west.

Oranges & pineapple aroma. Excellently balanced between slightly sweet malts & bitterness. Creamy mouthfeel with a fruit salad of flavours. Believe the hype!

Rated by BrewTom

Bottle. Pours slightly hazy golden with small white head. Aroma is hoppy and fruity, grassy, citrus, earthy, honey, slight soap. Taste is slightly sweet and medium bitter, citrus, pine, grass, fruity, peaches. Medium body. Bitter finish.

Pours a clear orange with a modest white head, which just looks really inviting. Deliciously hoppy aroma of apricot, lemon zest and pine with something resembling melon. Medium body, oily feel, avg/soft carbonation. Taste of grapefruit and hop resin. Bitter and dry finish that envelops the entire mouth for quite some time.

22 bomber to cervoise. Pours clear bright orange, white soapy head. Aroma of pine, citrus and slight trop fruit. Taste of same with sweet caramel malts. Finish is semi-dry and the bitter is well-balanced.
Light golden ipa with very good citrus, malty aroma. Smells better than it tastes, not a 100 for me at all. Medium bitterness that builds after and tastes eh after.

Hazy orange brew with small fast fading head. Aroma is very citrusy and the taste is as well. Has so much of a grapefruit twang to it that I had to double check the label to make sure this was the regular IPA and not the grapefruit one. Only down side to this brew is the price. I have been looking at it on the shelves for some time but just couldn¬ít see buying a 6 pack for nearly the cost of a 12 pack of other good IPA¬ís. Luckily found some Ballast Point brews on the sampler shelves this weekend at $2.69 a bottle. This one is good but still not worth the hefty price.

Visual: Pours cloudy apricot orange with a large long-lasting very-foamy head with sticky lacing and good retention, scattered steady singular streams.

Nose: faint orange-mango, mild fishiness (coincidentally?!) (lvl-4)-pungency

Attack: whipped cream smooth silky mouthfeel, fluffy bite, lemon oils

Mid-palate: fruit-forward, (lvl-5)-sweetness, (MAIN) mango-apricot, toffee malts

Finish: clean transition, soft & gentle bitter hopped finish.

Summary: Complete balance and supreme clean flavours. Absolutely fantastic and I¬ím not that much of a hophead. Pretty outworldly, much like the 90-minute IIPA I had from Dogfish Head at VCBW (Vancouver Craft Beer Week)
A smell of fruits, a hint of alkohol with a nice bitterness. A really solid brew.

UPDATED: MAR 7, 2016 On tap in Chicago-- Pours clear golden with thin white head. Nose is skunk and mint. Aromas are clearly weed, grass, citrus. Oily texture, average carbonation. Long bitter finish. Very great stuff!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle (22oz $7): I get mostly pine and not much citrus taste from this, Then there is a slow build to a fair amount of bitterness that lingers and almost turns to metallic tasting. Good, but not going to be a regular.
Great California IPA perfectly balanced hops! One of the best I have had! And the grapefruit is better!
Flaska fr√•n SB. Orange f√§rg med vitt skum. Doftar grapefrukt, granbarr och citrus. Smakar mango, grapefrukt, granbarr och aprikos. Torr avslutning med en alldeles lagom beska.
Bottle to tulip. No detailed notes on this one - good, bright, citrus-y IPA with a bitter finish.

Can, slightly cloudy golden amber, decent creamy white head. Aroma pale malt and juicy citrus. Flavor is creamy orange and salty spruce, with citrus rind bitter finish. Yet another classic west coast IPA profile, but the palate on this is nice and rich, carbonation just short of bright.

One I¬íve been waiting to try for some time. News of a fresh batch hitting Perth and off I go! At just on cool and into a snifter it goes. Hazy, deep orange with a radiance that is embellished by the first sun we¬íve seen here in weeks. Head is a soapy mess of white that daubs a thick lace. Nose is on the drier side initially just ceding pine and resin but then from out the blue comes soft and rounded, ripe tropical fruits like guava and mango, honeydew and cantaloupe. There is a touch of banana in there too to make it seemingly sticky. On the palate it is delicate, quaint, and almost mysterious. Softly spoken but there is ample going on. Supple fruit like the nose placed at intricate intervals on the palate so that it pops just enough to keep you guessing. There is a touch of honey upfront, clean, amongst some biscuity malt. No interest in offering up the alcohol it drinks like a 4.0 per center. Creamy in mouthfeel with a resinous, fruity aftertaste that lasts. Bitterness matches the fruit and balances the malt. As it warms there is a fruity sweetness that lasts and contrasts the resin and pine of the nose. This is just simple session stuff. So softly spoken and intriguing, but forgetting that it is just a damn good ale. Surprising!!! (12fl.Oz, code SC726, The Liquor Shed, Jandakot)
A short but prounced head. Sweet pine nose. Herbal sweet pine with a tangerine kick and a lingering grapefruit finish.

Wen haben wir denn da am Haken, einen vierhornigen Stichling, sehr selten in unseren Gefilden. Schaut aber wirklich toll aus und riecht mal so garnicht nach Fisch. Scheint also frisch zu sein. Na dann nehmen wir doch mal einen Happen.
Sehr sehr angenehm, rund, nicht so bissig wie andere Artgenossen, h√§ngt mit seinen Gr√§ten lange im Hals und geht ganz sachte matt, leicht bitter runter. Runde Ding, der Stichling. Da werd ich die Angel gleich nochmal aus.

Pours orange white head. Citrusy aroma and flavor. Hoppy. Very good IPA. Typical SoCal IPA. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Tony Roma¬ís in Anaheim. Pours a clear golden with a creamy, small off-white head that laces. Sweet tropical fruit aroma of peach, mango, grapefruit and pine. Sweet flavour of grapefruit, malt, tropical fruit and pine with a dry, bitter, hoppy finish. Medium body with an oily texture and soft carbonation. Excellent. Best IPA I have tried.
Smell of hops and spruce. Amber colour, white head. Aroma of spruce, herbs, a faint of herbs. Bitter, half-flat carbon.

Just over three months old bottle, which is unfortunately the best we could ever hope for over here. Pours a deep gold with slight chill hazing and off-white head. Interesting bouquet with hot rubber, a bit like a vigorously used eraser, a dank quality like a moist dugout, some pine needles and tropical fruits, mostly mango. The palate is medium bodied with good freshness, pleasant, off-dry and round flavour with a very long bitterness which stays at a pleasant level throughout. Very nice.

Sculpin its a smell trip! From moment one you can tell but its flavour that is going to be a great beer. Its very hoppy, but its exotic hoppynness turns into a Maracuya trip! Medium bodied beer, very bitter, not for non bitter people, but the bitterness is mixed with the Maracuya moment that this Sculpin gives you.

Nice creation from Ballast.
My favourite beer stateside, just fantastic. Too Strong, like most US IPAs, but lovely nonetheless.

Pours clear Amber with a good white head. A strong mango and resin aroma. Full-bodied with a powerful, deep bitter finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Golden orange, hazy, slightly off-white head. Big citrus aroma, orange, grapefruit, pine. Matching flavour. Tasty.

Draft at the Tap House in Pangyo, South Korea. A little sticky and white head lasting quite long. Rich aromas of apricots and grassy grapefruits. Lovely palate and tastes amusing in whole mouth with a medium light body. Complex malt tastes between those two fruits. Suitable carbonation and bitterness run, finish with rich and propulsive hop-flavour. Really outstanding.
Cloudy, orange. Strong, citrus hops. A little pine and a little fruity. Well balanced and flavorful. Light, higher carbonation but not much after taste.

Tropical fruit and a hint of citrus aroma. Chewy toffee and a piney resinous bitterness. Ok, just not as fantastic as I recall. It could be the age of the beer..because it¬ís tasting like a shitload of other imported ipas... in that toffee, chewy taste.
Aroma lembrando manga. Gosto lembrando manga/maracuj√° com doce bem pronunciado e resguardando o amargor do estilo

Bottle, 7%. Slightly hazy orange with medium off-white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, hops, grapefruit, pine, peach and zest. Flavour is malt, fruit, citrus, grapefruit, zest, pine, little sweet, peach and bitter.

Clear, deep golden, off white pillowy head, good lacings. Aromas of orange zest bit pineapple, spruce and lychee develop. Light tangy, soft and light slick with a medium body. Balanced malt bed with resinous hoppy bitterness taking over, well balanced. Lasting bit drying out finish.

UPDATED: JUL 1, 2015 Had this on tap a few times, and once from a bomber bottle. Hazy golden-orange color with big head. Aroma is grapefruit, a bit more sweet, tropical fruits as well. Quite complex and delicate. A sting of tropical fruits you might say: apricots, mango, passion fruit. Taste is pure grapefruit, tropical, bitter, refreshing, not too sweet. Body is rather light, but great complexity. Overall dry. A perfect West Coast IPA!

Can, Brewdog Leicester. Golden with a fluffy foam. Aromas are mellow oranges with pink grapefruit and yeast. Woody low pine with nutty cereal and sudsy notes. Flavours are sweet oranges with lemon and bready yeast. Plenty of herbal, leafy pine with bittersweet pink grapefruit and a peppery, pithy dry finish. Very well balanced and addictive.

Can courtesy of Blutt59. Thanks a lot, Bob. Light hazy golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel and moderate hoppy - peach and grapefruit. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and rather bitter finish. 180615

Cloudy pour. Very hoppy nose. Super frothy head dies quickly but a light layer floats ontop. Some lacing. Alcohol is not detected. Above average for this style. Aftertaste is bitter and long lasting. Bottle at the Square wine Company, Madison, Wisconsin.

PunkAGM2015 rate catchup from notes. 6/6/15. Hazy gold. Oily with soft carbonation. Big grapefruit (not so different from the Sculpin Grapefruit in many ways) and tropical notes. Fruity deliciousness. Outstanding IPA,

Subtle aroma of apricot, peach and stonefruit. Cloudy golden beer with thin white head. Light carbonation, oily mouthfeel. Zingy in the mouth. Aftertaste is grapefruit and lemon. There¬ís malt lurking in the background. This is a great beer, complex and subtle. Beautifully balanced, easy drinking (7%!). Really, really good.

Near perfect IPA. Pours golden with a big creme head. Aroma is overwhelmingly apricot. Sweet peach, apricot and hops. Bitter hoppiness hits you quick. Slight alcohol burn with nice lasting bitter dryness.

Keg at BrewDog, Edinburgh. Hazy orange body with a medium white head. Low carbonation. Aroma of grapefruit, orange, cannabis and sweet malts. Flavour of orange, honey and fresh, ¬ígreen¬í hops. Medium body with an oily texture. Soft fizz. Well rounded, very swiggable for ABV.

On draft at Marriott Marquis Washington bar, DC. Appearance is a hazy bright orange with small white head. Aroma is peach, grapefruit, yeast. Taste is grapefruit and pine early, sweet fruits after that. Palate is medium. Overall, pretty powerhouse IPA, but not surprising considering its 100/100 rating.

Clear and vibrant golden with a decent popped filmy head. Rich grapefruit and tangerine good time nose. Soft rather than overbearing sweetness. Soft clinical bitterness. Chewy orangey but not really gripping me. Carbonation is solid and certainly a step cleaner and super drinkable over the clasp of a bottle I¬íve had. Finishes very clean, very simple and creamy pineapple linger. My palate couldn¬ít be more primed and I couldn¬ít be more unimpressed. Keg, Brewdog, Edinburgh.
Pleasant aroma of floral hops and faint citrus. Taste is mostly hoppy balanced by some fruity citrus flavors. It is a delightful IPA

12oz can 6/9/15 (Jewel Mix A Six)-38¬∞ in Shaker-Pours a clear orangish amber with a small white head. Aroma of hops, citrus, and more hops. Taste of the same with some malt. This medium bodied brew is well balanced and is quite tasty. Nice brew.

Clear brassy pour. Massive rocky white head with tons of chunky lacing. Apricot and resin in the nose with just a wisp of pale malt. Medium mouthfeel. Just enough carbonation to carry the nose, but not so much it gets fizzy. Peach, apricot, honeydew rind, and whole lemon in the middle, followed by a touch of honey, bready malt, and lingering pine. Delicious.
Keg at Brewdog AGM. Pours clear amber, nose is pine, citrus, toffee, taste is dry, crisp, fruity, sweet finish.
Keg at Brewdog AGM 2015 MTB event. Pours clear golden with a thick white head. Aromas of citrus, pine, resinous hops. Taste is bitter. Oily texture, bitter finish.
Amber/Yellow in color, with good carbonation and lacing. Smells and tastes of sweet fruit and resin with a hint of hops (leaves a fruity aftertaste) which i enjoy.
[2015-05-20, Leskinen] Kullankeltainen, kirkas. Tihe√§ vaahto, joka h√§ipyy hitaasti. Sitruksinen humalointi, reilusti katkeroa. Maku on yrttisen katkera ja sitruksinen.

Pours a hazy gold with a thick white head. Trying to let the beer warm up to get an aroma, which doesn¬ít seem very strong. What there is of a smell seems to be mostly floral. Taste of biscuit and pine. Pretty good beer but I am wondering if I got an older bottle due to other ratings. I will have to try this beer again.

Can. Mother Kelly¬ís, Bethnal Green. Clear, dark gold. Film of white head. Orange hop. Pine needle. Ripe strawberry. Light spice. Smells great. Taste is piny, resinous bitter. Sticky lippage. Palate is a bit clinical, and overly fizzy. Finishes spicy bitter. Nice one, barring the seemingly forced over carbonation.

Bottle. Nose is bright summery; peach, mango, lychee, sweet floral note. Taste is citrus, grapefruit, tropical fruit, spruce, onion, very light resin the bitterness comes from the emerging grapefruit rind. A little to fizzy for me. 

It¬ís a class leading American IPA.

Pullo @ Systembolaget. Kaatuu lasiin oranssinkultaisena ja hivenen sameana, noin sormen paksuisella vaahdolla. Tuoksu on IPAa parhaimmillaan: hyvin vahvana havua, pihkaa ja sitrusta, hivenen heikommin makeaa vohvelisuutta ja makeampaa hedelm√§√§kin. Maussa pihkaisuus jatkuu, mutta nyt rinnalle tulee puumaisuutta, hedelm√§√§ ei ole. Keksiyytt√§kin l√∂ytyy hieman, t√§ll√§ kertaa se ei ole vohvelimaisuuden kaltaista vaan viljaisempaa. Suutuntumassa katkero puree viel√§ jonkin verran ja muuten tuntuma on √§√§rimm√§isen kuiva, kuten kuuluukin. Hieno ja monipuolinen tuoksu maun ollessa suoraviivaisempi. Hedelm√§√§ olisi saanut olla omaan makuuni enemm√§n.

Cor de ouro envelhecido, brilhante e transl√∫cida; espuma com leve tonalidade marfim de baixas forma√ß√£o e persist√™ncia e lacing razo√°vel.
Aroma com base de caramelo e intenso c√≠trico de manga.
Sabor inicial com leve dul√ßor de manga e uma base consistente de caramelo torrado com final amargo intenso; retrogosto adstringente e leve doce de manga. Corpo m√©dio e baixa carbonata√ß√£o.
Can from Mother Kelly¬ís. A juicy banger in the parlance of our times. Decent bitterness for a West Coast, not too malty essentially.. Nice tropical notes. Good fare indeed.

12 oz bottle. Nice aroma of hops and a little citrus. Clear dark golden color with white head and good lacing. Good malty backbone, with hops front and center. Nice citrusy flavor, a bit of mango. Full bodied. Overall, a very nice IPA that I could drink a lot of!

L:
-pours a clear amber with a big foamy off white head
-great head retension
-high carbonation visible
S:
-huge grapefruit,orange,pine resin,peaches and lemon
T:
-grapefruit,orange zest,resin-y,onions with a slight nutty finish
F:
-medium carbonation,light-medium body
O:
I expected more fruitiness and the onion note was off-putting.
Still a pretty good IPA

Cloudy golden color, frothy off-white head. Fairly sweet, fruity aroma. Grapefruity hop flavor, herbal notes. Full body, medium carbonation. Oh well.
Had this on tap. Really solid IPA. Dry and piney. Decent bitterness. Not much malt, which I like. I could a lot of this brew. As far as IPA goes this one fits the bill for me.

Draught at Farmer Market, LA. Pours clear orange golden with a white head. Aroma is citrus, tropical fruits, pined√∏d grassy. Flavour is verbal and dry. Medium bodied, slick texture, average carbonation. Finish is resinous and dry.

Tasted from a 12oz can. It poured a clear amber hue that was quite effervescent, with a frothy head that left streaky lacing. A pleasing hoped orange nose with kicking hops on the taste buds. Thanks to the dude who recommended this to me while pondering my beer purchase.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A beautiful copper colouer beer with a thin off-white head that long lastes. Mod. intensive aroma with notes of caramel, pine, apricot. Very good balanced crispy-malty sweetnes with a mod. hoppy bitterness. Lively carbonation, creamy texture. Very good one!

Aroma elegante e pulito, di aghi di pino, frutta tropicale, un pelo di pompelmo ed un filo di caramello. Ambrata carica con schiuma compatta e persistente. In bocca base lieve di pane dolce, frutta esotica, dolce, pompelmo, ed un bel finale agli aghi di pino. Carbonatazione media, quasi liscia, bel retrogusto sempre agli aghi di pino e pompelmo. Invoglia alla bevuta, corpo lieve. Ottima.

A great IPA! From a freshly tapped keg, pours a lighter orange color with a nice frothy head. Tropical fruit aroma, not much malt backbone. Smooth, fruity, not harsh on the palate, grapefruit, mango, no piney hoppiness. Refreshing and not too bitter for an IPA, distinctive. Again, not much malt but is quite enjoyable as it is. I will drink this again!
Bottle from Elmanana. Many thanks! Orange amber colour, creamy foam. Sweet nose of exotic fruits and citrus. Lively carbonation. Bitter hoppy finish. Good IPA.

Bottle from Systembolaget passagen
caramel, citrus, grass, roasty, alcohol, golden, clear, white foam, medium sweetness, very bitter, medium body, oily feel, average carbonation, bitter, long finish, 
A tiny bit heavy
Great nose and a good initial taste with an acceptable body but quite a poor finish and aftertaste was lacking.
Bottle bought at bier-deluxe.com. Aroma of citrus, hops, some mango. Taste is awesome bitter, very refreshing. Nice!
Pours an orange/gold color with an off white head. Aroma is tropical fruit. Flavor is tropical fruit with some hop bite.

bottle at home courtesy of Saeglopur. bottled on 05.01.2015. orange, clear color. small white head. smells fruity, pines, grass, mango, citric. full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. taste of pines, grass, some sweetness, citric, grapefruit, oranges, light herbal. citric / herbal bitter finish. citric notes and some pines on the aftertaste. quite nice, not as refreshing as other ipas though, probably because the carbonation is quite soft, or its not soo fresh anymore.

pours a semi murky gold with a decent bubbly off white head. Aroma is floral and fruity. Some orange citrus, also some mango or other tropical fruit. Taste is complex. Some orange and other fruits. Some moderate hop bitter kicks in, but there¬ís some faint sweetness there too. Long full finish with pleasant nasal linger. Solid.

355ml bottle. Clear, orangey, deep golden colour with average to huge, thick, frothy to creamy, long lasting, fairly lacing, white head. Super clean, citrusy hoppy aroma, notes of grapefruit, orange, tangerine, lemon, pineapple. Crisp, bitter and citrusy hoppy aroma, more jelly bear-like than caramel malty background, notes of grapefruit, pineapple, orange, tangerine; some pine and sweaty resin in the deposit containing last sip (yeah!). A bit more "dirty" than the Grapefruit version, but still too clean for me (cf. Kernel as counterexample). Still a very good one, of course.

Cloudy amber with small beige head. Tremendous and huge aroma - sweetened grapefruit, strong malt, mango, passionfruit, paw paw/papaya. The taste is also huge, non-subtle, but awesome, with the same flavours that the smell assaults with. Light in body and ridiculously drinkable. In no way understated but an artful hop punch in the face.

12oz tap pour in The Goat Hill Tavern, Costa Mesa (Orange County) on 11th May 2015. Orange body, white topping. How do you like your hops? If the answer is by the hand full: this is a beer for you. No subtly here, just a very hoppy IPA with plenty of bitterness. I had the Sculpin Grapefruit next, no real citrus feel to this, the original version compared to the Grapefruit option.

Can, from Vermont trip shopping. Clear medium yellow, small bubbly white head. Mango, apricot, citrus aroma - really good and clean. Clean, very flavourful taste - just the right amount of malt, on the light side, and a boatload of well added hops - lots more of that tropical fruit bursting at the seams taste, but with nothing harsh about it. Light and crisp. Pretty much a perfect IPA.

Bottle from SB. Very good IPA, actually one of the first craft beers I bought, now finally in the ordinary stock of SB. Very good indeed, but the competition has become stronger so Sculpin may no longer be the best IPA available, but still one of the best.
My favorite IPA. Great year round. Love the fruit taste. Wish they priced it better.

UPDATED: AUG 3, 2016 12 oz. bottle into a chalice.
Bottled on the 100th day 2015 so 03/15.
A: hard pour yields a lovely pale orange with attractive tan head. Great clarity. Good retention. 
S: Grapefruit, pine needles and slight peach. A bit of malt sweetness.
T: More grapefruit than pine in taste but otherwise follows the nose. Fairly juicy and overall pretty tasty. Not very boozy tasting.
M: Light for its strength and well carbonated to make a refreshing drink. 
O: A good tasty IPA but way overpriced. Stronger than I prefer as well but IPAs are strong. Ripped off my local HT with a 10 dollar mix-6.

MY FREND BRAT THIS BEER TO OUR WEEKLY POKERED MEETINGS AT ARBYS AND WE ALL GOT PRETTEY TWISTERED OFF THIS STUFF. LET ME TELL YOU ,IT REMINDS ME OF PLINY (MY TOP BEER FOR INDIA STYLED IPAS¬í) EXCEPT THAT IT IS NOT PLINY. IT LOOK LIKE PLINY, FLAYVERS LIKE A PLINY, FEELS LIKE PLINY IN MOST BODY PARTS, HAS HOP OF GOOD RATINGS LIKE A PLINY, BUT IM 75% SURE ITS¬í STILL NOT PLINY. NOT POSITIVE THROUGH. I GOT GRAPEFRUIT AND TROPIKALS MOSTLEY WITH SOME BEER FLAYVERS UNDERNEATH. [IM BECOMING VERY GOODS FOR TASTING WITH TASTING WORDS.} THE FISH IS PRETTY COOL COLOURS AND WAS WON OF THE BEST PARTS FOR THIS PLINY WANTTO-BE. IN CONCLUSHUN, DRINK THIS IF YOUR TWO POOR TO AFFORED PLINY HAHA!
Bottle. Good hoppy aroma. Dark gold color and good head retention. Really nice hoppy flavor and full heavy mouth feel. This is a delicious beer with nice lingering aftertaste.

bottle at home, poured a clear orange to light amber colour with a white head. very nice fruity aroma, grapefruit, citrus, mango, tropical fruits, some sweet malts, nice and full oily mouthfeel, crisp, creamy, nice bitterness in the end. could use some more malt kick to it! but this is very very juicy and refreshing!
Orange colour, white head. Aroma of hops, grapefruit. Taste is medium bitter. Medium body, slick texture, soft to average carbonation. Pretty nice.

On tap, Finley's Pub, Denver. Pour is a nice Amber/orange, thin white head. Nose is big hop, big citrus, resin, floral. Taste is bitter, medium bodied. Finished very dry on your palate, but still a full bodied taste. Nice IPA.

Draft, bottle, can. Sweet caramel citrus aroma. Flavor has a lemon/orange taste, sweet bitter mouth feel. Deadly smooth.
Great IPA, one of the best ever. Perfect mix of hops, malt and character! Just try it out if you get the chance!

The first thing I noticed as I opened the can was a delightful aroma of citrus, grapefruit,and piney hops. The taste starts with bitter hops and citrus, followed by a spicey cracker taste, which then ends with a bitter grapefruit. Another thing to note is the effervescent tingle that follows behind the flavor of each sip. All these experiences in each tasting compel you to want to have another sip immediately.

This beer pours a clear golden color with a medium off white head that left some good amount of lacing around the glass. The aroma is amazing! I pick up citrus, sweet grapefruit, and pine. The taste is quite similar to the aroma. you pick up the hop bitterness right up front but it is not overwhelming and finishes with a sweet grapefruit and citrus taste on the back-end. The mouthfeel is on the light to medium side. The drinkability is quite high but you have to be careful with the abv. I wasn¬ít sure if I would be let down by this beer but I certainly wasn¬ít. It is truly a world class beer.

Flaska Bishops √∂rebro. Orange klar v√§tska. Kraftfull humledoft med citrus, barr och f√§rskt gr√§s. Fin maltb√§dd i smaken toppas med fyllig humle med touch av grape, tallbarr, h√∂ och lite druva. Rej√§l och fin munk√§nsla med krispig beska i avslutningen

Growler from GAT Beer. Pours clear golden color with a 2-finger white head. Aroma of piney hops with a nice backbone of caramel malt. Body is medium and a touch oily. Lightly astringent finish. Comparatively mild flavor, with pine and grapefruit hop notes. Caramel malt underneath.
Poured from bottle hazy copper orange. Aromas of fresh citrus floral hops and malt. Taste is crisp and refreshing with notes of sweet peach mango and a nice balanced hop finish. A great beer.

Can; served at about 42¬∞F. Fruity and piney aroma notes. Thin head and lace on glass. Mouth feel is thinner than I would prefer but not so much so that it is watery. Palate finish very fruity and hoppy. I love all the sweet candied tastes mixed in with that pacific coast hoppy bitterness that finishes out this beer. Feels a little warm even at 7%, which should help keep you out of jail. Or not, I don't judge.

Color light through copper Orange is slightly cloudy and has a short cream of a finger thick and creamy white and medium bubbles. Loops are evident along the cup rim and small bubbles form the body of this beer.
The aroma brings much grapefruit, orange peel, a little resin, pine, honey flowers, full cookie, passion fruit, quince, and some citrus tones are found in the background.
The fruity flavor of course with mango, peach, lemon, pineapple, grapefruit, a caramelized light, dryness pine and why not light passion fruit nuances. Very faintly bitter hops are dancing in our tongue and palate. Smooth and creamy with a slightly bitter ending. Great requested.
Its aftertaste is very fruity and malty, but does not bring a remarkable sweet. Giving a beautiful complexity, power and great drinhability.
The body is light, creamy carbonation, bringing a bit of viscosity, but it is still fluid me.
Great IPA Beer!
Slight grapefruit notes. A very good IPA. Pretty much a hop bomb, but drinkable.
Supremely well balanced ipa, fruity aromas, good mouthfeel , fantastic hop finish. One of the best.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Pours slightly golden hazy with a white layer of foam that settles to fine but prominent layer through out the session. The aroma is all citrus, fruits, pines, anything but malt or yeast. The taste is medium-full, waves of citrus, fruit and pine. Somewhat sweet. Very soft and lovely texture. For an american IPA it is very tasty, but as with most of these beers I miss the maltiness.

Pours clear copper with a big puffy beige head, very good lacing, excellent retention. Aromas of grapefruit, tropical fruit, floral notes, bread, grass. Medium body, creamy. Lightly sweet, a hint of citrus, full bitter finish, but not over-the-top. Nice fruity-hop IPA.
Bottle. Medium long-lasting ivory head. Misty golden. Fruity, citric, malty, amber, pine, grass, straw, extra dry, delicious. Excellent, very tasty IPA.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
Citrusy and slightly campfire smell...but in can so may not be accurate..taste is similar...mango apricot etc subtle but good when you notice it..
Draft. Golden yellow color. Moderate lace. Aroma of peach and apricots. Hoppy flavor.

Appearance: clear light orange, with a finger of near white creamy head.  Aroma: smelled pretty good--grapefruit, orange pith, resin, pine, floral honey, light graham cracker, apricots (marmalade?). Taste:  okaaaay--grapefruit, mango, pineapple, maybe some passion fruit, with light caramel, then a wave of apricot and pine.  Finish: 	lingering bitterness, palate seems almost watery. Notes: Clearly mine will be an apostate opinion, but this to me just didn¬ít live up to the hype. Especially when compared to similar items like Hopslam or Two Hearted, or even Dogfish 120, it just didn¬ít compare. Plan to try again, based on reputation. Bottle from Total Wine & More, Fairfax, Virginia (Pickett Center).

Near clear straw colour pour. Small lasting light beige head. Sadly it is clear right away that this is an old bottle.. I can see that this was great once but it has become a malty Sculpin I¬ím afraid... I get some fruity hops on the nose but a pretty malty base on the palate. Potentially a much higher rating but have to settle for 3.8 now. I¬íll be back. I hope.
Grapefruit hoppy aroma come from this clear pale yellow brew. Sweet grapefruit taste with an underlying bitterness which combines well with the light body and crispness of this ipa

Bottle to tall glass. Appearance: light golden color. Medium white head. 
Aroma is pine hops, citrus, grass, .
Taste is also pine, hops, citrus,grass. Touch of ash. Very smooth and well balanced.
Feel is light, medium carbonation.
A nice beer. Thought I had rated this a few months ago on my last 6-pack, but I saw I did not when rating the grapefruit version.

0.355l bottle thanks to cristobal37. Clear golden body, white head. The aroma is smooth and fruity. It has lots of mango and pineapple in it with some caramel, grass and pine. Taste of pine, grass, grapefruit, bread and peach. Awesome IPA!

Gold in color with tiny bubbles rising to the surface. Off white head that froths around the top and settles to a slight layer of bigger bubbles. Lacing is evident along the edges of glass as it slides down. Smell is of pine and some citrus is found in the background. Tastes of pine, grass, citrus and maybe some bitter hops are dancing on the tongue. Smooth on the palate and slightly creamy with the bitterness finishing it off. Overall, a fantastic IPA to indulge upon!
12oz bottle from systembolaget. This is right up my alley. One of my absolute favourites. Orange, pine, hoppy. Not as good as the grapefruit version, but still a great IPA.
Amber color with a modest white head. Aroma is grapefruit / citrus. Taste is clean with a hint of apricot in the finish. An excellent big hop IPA!

This beer has a huge citrus, pine aroma. Strong hop flavor, but smooth and balanced. Had from a can while watching the NCAA basketball championship. Taste is excellent, can¬ít really find fault with this beer. Highest rating

So yeah, I bought another CA beer. And yeah, I¬ím supposed to be in the middle of some sort of CA beer boycott. But when you see a top 5 IPA on tap, and the keg is purported to be fresh, you forget your convictions for a moment. At least I did. Aroma: Grapefruit and mango with a very light caramel malt backbone; the pungent quality of the aroma hops here really is nearly unparalleled in my experience. Appearance: Copper body with a thick, still tan head. Flavor: Grapefruit takes over, but does leave some light caramel; the hop profile doesn¬ít strike me as overly dynamic, and not as impressive as the nose. The finish is moderately bitter and dries out somewhat. Palate: Medium body, slick texture, soft carbonation, bitter finish. Overall: Easy to see why this is highly regarded, but didn¬ít "wow" me all around.
Sample on tap at Eureka. Pours a deep gold, with whitish head. Strong aroma of floral and grass. Tastes of hops and grass. A very distinctive IPA. Thumbs up.
Smell with orange, hop, peach, color in light yellow, orange, good amount white crown, Taste good but mild fire ipa, right texture, but I concur perfect 100 is overstatement

Bottle shared at Anchorage Apr ¬í15 Tasting: Poured coppery orange with an off white head. Aroma was strong citrus and tropical hops. Taste was soft hops not as strong as the nose led me to believe, balanced finish.

Strong hoppy aroma and foretaste followed by a very malty taste that negates the hoppy bitterness. Some grassiness in the malt. Had a 6 pack and drank several before the review to try to understand the very high ratings but maybe just not my style of IPA. I am a hophead but am fine with well balanced IPAs too but I appreciate the initial hop bitterness but am not very crazy about the particular malt taste that follows in this beer. Certainly not a bad beer by any standard but for my taste not deserving the extremely high rankings.
Pours a hazy straw with a thick head from a tap. An excellent representative of what an IPA is or at least should be in the flooded market that exists today. Good beer.

(12 Oz. Btl) - Pours a nice wedding gown white frothy head. Strong aroma of pine resin. Body is a dark apricot color. Flavors of sour orange and apricot. Bitterness lingers on the palate. Nicely done. But, it¬ís definately a sipping beer!

355 ml bottle from Bierdeluxe.de, Germany. Copper color, clear, with a thin white head. Aromas of flowers, caramel and lemon. Taste is mildly bitter with orange, citrus, lemon, caramel and some pine and grapefruit. Light body with less than medium carbonation.

Bomber to the dome. Pours very hazy Orange with a medium to small white pillowy head. Orange is orange zest and fruity. Tate is orange marmalade and jarmy. Very quenching with a light peppery finish with slight warning in the ears. Lots of b√∏√∏¬öt in this one. Or fusels. Hips are pleasant and well done.

Best in class - there is no need to really say anything more than that - add it to the favorites list!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

355ml bottle. Copper colored, clear, nice small bubbles in the glass, medium, high white head. The aroma of grass, cookies and honey. Fresh hoppy taste, fairly light body, smooth in the mouth, sweet notes of orange marmalade and bitter grapefruit peel. A rather dry and bitter finish, meduim long aftertaste. Nice one this!

Glorious. Pours a glowing orange gold with a thick frothy head of hop based froth. The nose is pure citrus and pine resin with a ton of lemon zest and pineapple. Fruity and sweet with light grapefruit bitterness and caramel malts. Good balance overall with a beauty hop profile that screams fresh.
12 oz. bottle poured into a pint glass. Orange in color, not much in the way of head. Aroma of citrus and pine. Smooth to drink, bitter at first ending with a taste of pine and citrus.

Poured from a bomber, Copper body with a non-lingering head. Smells of citrus and pine. First notes are sweet to a nice hop bite. Another classic from Ballast Point. 

The feeling of this beer is heavy IPA due to the malt. Some doubles are easier to "session". Yet again this is not a beer to session, but to enjoy.

Bottle from my brother in-law. Pours a copper colour, white fluffy head, lots of lacing. Nose is citrus and sweet caramel malt. Tastes sweet initially that quickly gives way to bitterness, lots of citrus, but mainly piney hops. Quite good, most certainly sessionable.
March Madness 2015 - Light and fruity; I would not have thought of this as an IPA. Not crazy hoppy and bitter like most IPAs though.
March madness 2015. This is one of the IPA archetypes to me. Very nice citrus aroma. Hops and malt are in relative balance although the hops flavor is very strong. It does not have a bitter finish.

A good balance of citrus and bitter. High ABV so watch out. This beer helped make San Diego awesome.

Bottle @Tommy Knocker, Helsinki. Deep frosty golden color with small long lasting white head. Nose has vig, creamy malts and hops. Excellent hops and superbly balanced body. Long tasty finish. One of all time favorites.

Pours a beautiful gold color and has some lacing, but minimal head retention. This beer smells floral and hoppy. It does not disappoint in the least. An amazing beer, and one that is absolutely legendary for a reason. Excellent!
Big and robust. Clean finish. Great balance. The way I envision an IPA to be. Highly recommend!!!

Bottle from Costco, San Diego. Zesty lemon, pine, and grapefruit aroma in front of light caramel. Clear copper under a lasting, white sheet. Flavour is resinous grapefruit peel, pine, lemon peel, and spicy melanoidin with apricot accents and an assertive bitterness that balances a medium body, sweet, light caramel. Moderate carbonation, smooth.

12 FL OZ ($19 assortment 12pack) I picked up this pack as it had 3 different types of their beer and on their own can be expensive. This is a very good IPA, has lots of character but none of the palate coating nastiness of many other IPAs. has a good amount going on which may not be so apparent to the newbie but is much appreciated for the beer lover. chug it or sip it; either way its a great beer. Totally lives up to the hype and will be buying again.
UPDATED: AUG 24, 2015 Bottle at home, hazy amber with a off white small head. Taste is, hops fruits, biscut notes of pine, malts. Decent
Love this beer. It is a perfect fresh tasting citrus ipa. The body is nice and lite with just enough bitterness. Then it smacks you with great hops aroma and flavor. Love love love
UPDATED: JUN 11, 2015 Rerate, keg at Brewdog Edinburgh. Pours clear amber. Nose is tropical fruits, grapefruit. Taste is grapefruit, tropical fruits, tangerine. Quite grapefruity.
Like big eye just a tad better, but still a perfect SDIPA...hops aroma is like an XXIPA and nose continues through out flavor. Nice grass pine crisp finish excellent.

Sample @ M√ñWF. Hazy golden with one finger white head. Aroma of grass, pine, citrus and orange with some grains in the background. Taste of bitter lemon and grapefruit peels with grainy malts also noticeable. Nice prickly mouthfeel with long lasting bitterness.

Can to ipa glass. Really nice golden pour with a decent white head. Lots of citrus and pine in the aroma and taste. Taste is backed by a nice malt profile. A bit of a bitter backend. Really solid ipa.

Hopped in five stages yielding hints of apricot, peach, mango and lemon flavors.
Orange, hell. In der Nase Grapefruit, tropische Fr√ºchte. Am gaumen herb, fruchtig, crisp, sch√∂n.

Poured from bottle, pale slightly hazy amber with high head. Aroma with notes of fruit, citrus, pine and some bread. Taste is mild bitterness backed up by a very well balanced malt body and leading to a subtle but long bitter finish. The geatness of this beer is in the balance, nothing really sticks out bit the way it comes together is just heavenly...
A small taste (bottle) @ Gallows Bird. Pours hazy amber with a low head. Aroma is malts with plenty of fruits. Flavor is malts, loads of fruits and hops. Awesome.
Can pour at home, lemon golden pour, nice sweet cities aroma and taste, little bite on the end. I see why this has won some models.

Pours hazy yellow with off white head and lacing. 
Nice smack from hops up front, crisp and refreshing. 
Lingering bitterness on the finish. 
Not really getting the fruits as described by the brewer but still a pleasant beer. 
$2:99/12 oz bottle at Total Wine and More Boca Raton
Aromas of pine, spruce, citrus. Clear gold with white head that lingers. flavors of grapefruit, citrus, spruce, resin. Hop forward beer with bitter dry finish that begs for more beer.

Bottle @ SB 7 march 2015. Fine light beer with a thick white and nice foam. Nice real IPA aroma with a lots of hops. Taste is really good, perfect bitterness and light body. I really nice piece of beer and great for its style.

Pours a clear, deep gold color with rich, foamy, off-white head. Aroma is full of citrus and hops, but not overwhelming. Sweeter than expected. Hints of honey and tropical fruit before the bitter finish comes in. Finish is nicely bitter and deceptively long. The finish is my favorite thing about this beer. Overall just a hair too sweet for my taste, but that finish is great. Glad I¬ím not instantly in love with it for $15 per six pack.
Clear yellow with creamy white foam. Fruity citrus aroma is great. Hoppy citrus flavor with a bitter grapefruit finish. Excellent.

Single bottle purchased at the Grog, and consumed at the bar. $6.00 for the 12 oz. bottle (had also asked for pint glass). This really blew me away 3¬Ω-4 years ago, but now I see it more as a passable grapefruit hop-forward IPA from San Diego. Let¬ís get this show on the road!

 To pint, it pours a deep, rusty amber orange with which a sudsy white head 1 finger in length stood. Classic SoCal IPA look. 

Aromas of wet Spring grass, grapefruit zest,artichokes, damp newspaper, and krill oil. 

Tastes the same with the addition of mulched hay, seawater/minerals, sweated peas, Pacific Northwest hops, The best thing about this beer, would probably be the mouthfeel.

[Can] Pours a orange/amber color. A decent film of foam sticks to the glass and leaves a nice patchwork of lacing. Very fresh and fragrant nose of tropical fruits, pine and juicy peaches. Notes of bitter citrus rinds, apricot, pine sap, spruce and a mild caramel malt backing in the taste. Nice body. Dry and bitter finish lasts quite a while. A solid brew!

Aroma of tropical fruits, apricot, mild grapefruit, taste is grapefruit, citrus, maybe mango, hop bitterness, very smooth on the palate, short to medium after taste, alcohol is well balanced. Very Good!

(On tap @ Mikkeller Bar Stockholm, Feb 25 2015) Pours clear orange with a small fine white head fading to a ring with lace. Aroma really lead by mango, with some grapefruit and orange juice, touch of citrus rind, strawberry, I think some apricot and tropical fruit mixed up in there, a fresh fruity hop leaf/weed character. Smell is sweet and faintly bitter. Palate has slightly unripe mango, apricot, orange and grapefruit peel, something not quite pine (kumquat?). A bit of tropical/berry sweetness and pale malt in the middle. On the finish, moderate-high citrus pith bitterness, astringent, a hint of grain the only real flaw for me. Medium boded with moderately high carb. A nice, bright and fresh feeling IPA that¬ís lighter on the malt body. Delicious and really really drinkable. A really nice palette of fruit on the palate too, not one-note by any means. Top flight.

Found at a seedy corner store a couple of blocks from DLand. This beats working today. Strung Out addiction goes on and on. I have to pee like mad but the bowl is farther than I can hit at max arc. Great pour with a long lasting off white creamy cap that looks like bubbly sourdough. Pine nose, peaches, apricots, sweet caramel, sweet lemon, caramel, pepper. Le bouche: same with more pine, balanced pepper nip, bit o¬í mango. Not totally dry but close. Big bitterness is not so big or obvious to make a nasty taste bud punch. Nothing here takes over anything else. Great drinking preferably at a perpetual rate until the sun explodes.

Couleur dor√©e translucide avec un beau col blanc. Aromes d¬íagrumes et de peche, peu de r√©sines, assez douce pour une IPA. Manque de complexit√© et de ¬í¬ípunch¬í¬í . Respectable tout de meme mais pour ma part ce n¬íest pas dans mon top IPA.

BOTTLE. See through straw in colour with light white head. Citrus hop flavours on the nose. Sweet hops, citrus flavours ,lemon most prominent with a lightly hopped finish.... Spicy/pepper after taste.
Sourced RW
Pours golden, slightly hazy and sparkling, nice frothy head. Aroma of lychee, citrus, spruce, biscuit. Taste: pomelo, biscuit, earthy, grapfruit, grass.

One of my favorite IPAs, unique for its effervescence and crispness, plenty of hoppiness but without a heavy aftertaste, and an amazing appearance w nice foamy head. Great beer to drink and to admire in between quaffs.
650ml bottle from Slowbeer. Pours amber with a big head. Big nose, floral and hoppy. Typical DIPA taste, strong and sweet and bitter. A good one.

I¬íve had in 22 and 12oz bottles as well as 12oz cans. Pours a nice orange/golden, has a small white head. Aroma is of juicy aromatic hops, apricot and lemon. Has a light body, good carbonation and very easy drinking for 7%. Has up forward hop taste and then the fruity, juicy hops kick in. Nicely underlying roasted malt flavor as well this is a must for fans of the style.

From the 650 ml. bottle. Slightly hazy orange pour leading up to a lingering off-white foamy head. Lacing. The aroma is strong with floral, citrus, and grapefruit hops behind that toasted biscuit sensation. The body is medium, kind of smooth, yet biting. The taste boasts a generous hop presence behind a yeasty and toasted bread-like flavor. Lingers quite some time at the end. Why go nuts looking for Heady Topper when you can find Sculpin more easily and get basically the same enjoyment.
On-tap, this pours a golden amber color with a slight head. Has a very citrusy hop aroma. The flavor is big, bold but yet very well-balanced. Finishes with a nice bitter finish. A world class IPA!
Pours gold, smells of sweet citrus and earth. Taste is more bitter than sweet, with a dry finish. Overall a good one to try!

33 cl in teku, travelled overseas from SD to Italy in my brother¬ís lugagge, thanks Bob.
Pours a medium/ 2 fingers white and dense head; bit unclear bright orange to rusty/amber colour. Dude this ale smells Ultimate : huge mango, sweet orange, tropical, strawberries, piny, nose refreshing, dank. Taste has again a very nice mango/orange colour fruit taste, caramel, earthy, very resiny; sweetness it¬ís low to moderate but it¬ís very present especially with the fruity notes, medium + and very refined bitterness, quite strong but never annoying. Light to medium body, perfect amount of carbonation which is on moderate level, silky texture. The flavours, notes and hops are strong and "stinging", but actually very well put together and ejoyable, the fruitiness is well balanced with the hops. Excellent overall balance, this brew is an establishment in its category, smooth bitterness.. I forogt about what, for me,  was the best part: the aroma was just MIND BLOWING ; )

UPDATED: JUL 19, 2015 12oz can with 11/5/15 code date. 
Appearance: Golden and slightly hazy, with a thick white foam cap. 
Aroma: Intense mix of melon, grapefruit, pineapple, grass, and resin. 
Taste: Light bready malt that quickly turns to sharp bitterness and dank, resinous, earthy hop flavors. Grapefruit and grassiness is there, but very low. 
Mouthfeel: Light to medium body with a medium-high carbonation
Finish: Seems to balance well on the finish, with only a slight lingering bitterness. It does leave a sticky resin on the tongue. 
Overall: Well done west coast IPA that has a great aroma, with a dominant hop bitterness that doesn¬ít overpower thru the finish. Fairly light malt base that let¬ís the hops shine but still remains balanced.

Slightly hazy, light golden-yellow. Smell is rich tropical fruit, mango, peach, apricot, fresh tangerine. Taste is fresh orange peels, hints of tangerine fruit, sweet, some earth tones, bitter vegetable hop flavor. Light body, long bitter finish.
Sem d√∫vida uma das melhores IPAs que j√° bebi. Excelente sabor com um frutado bem presente que equilibra muito bom com seu amargor. Uma bela cerveja!

19.02.2015. On tap at Rattle ¬íN¬í Hum, New York. Orange colour with white head. Very fresh beer with nice aromas og juniperus and green spruce shoots. Very nice! Strong body with both hops and nakt. And there is aldo some alcohol to back that up. aftertaste is fresh like a summe breeze. Good beer!!
Beautiful copper colored IPA with great head. The hops are robust but like most West Coast Beers, the finish is clean and has a nice citrus end note. Great drinking beer with friends.
Great IPA loved it I think I drank it to cold but after I let it get to temperature it was even better.

On tap - nice golden copper color and good head retention. Aroma - nice balance of citrus and some sweet malt. Taste - very nice hop profile, mostly citrus and some pineapple. Palate - easy drinking beer. Goes down very smooth with no aftertaste. Overall - great tasting IPA. First beer from BP and very satisfied!

I was excited to find this one. Had to head up north about 3 hours; they don't sell ballast point where I live. Great clean aroma of earthy pine/citrus hops and a good amount of malt. Surprisingly fizzy, light golden color with a small, active white head. Tastes outstanding. Hoppy enough for true ipa fans but drinkable enough for novices to the style. Citrus hops mesh wonderfully with a malt backbone that components the hops without overwhelming them with sweetness. Overall very well crafted and well balanced IPA. A must have for all fans of the style.

UPDATED: OCT 20, 2016 2016 re-rate: Big grapefruit nose, candy sugar, pine. Mostly light on the palate but as it warms more pine/caramel. Easy drinking but quite a bitter finish compared to the NE IPAs. Solid west coast but in 2016 a little old-fashioned for sure. On tap. Copperish orage color with a modest head. Fruit bouquet of aromas present: grapefruit jumps out as well as pineapple, melon and mango. Nice bitterness on the palate and the grapefruit stands up really well. Also a little bit of resin/pine hop flavor undertones as well. Fairly well-balanced but the hops definitely shine through. World-class IPA for sure.
On tap at Lord Hobo, Boston. Pours orange with lasting off-white head. Fruit hoppy aroma with hints of pine. Citrus, fruit and hops in flavor, well balanced. Lasting bitter finish.
Une bonne IPA, une base savoureuse, un fort accent d¬íamarillo. Bonne bi√®re mais notation exag√©r√©.
Solid West Coast Single IPA here. Not much to be said about a beer with 2050 ratings except it¬ís damn good!
Bottle pours an orange amber with a thick white head and nice lacing. Aromas of grapefruit, citrus, and melon. Flavor is very well balanced citrus hop bitter with a clean slightly peppery finish.
Aroma is strong citrus grapefruit. Golden color with foamy white head. Taste is citrus hops bitterness.full mouthfeel with good carbonation.
