Aroma is earthy with some pine, citrus and tropical fruits. Taste is malty with long bitter and a bit sweet aftertaste. Flavors of malt, grape, pine, nuts. Very nice aftertaste.

Pours gold color
Smells light lemony on the nose
Not so hoppy
Very smooth 

Definitely one of my favorite IPA

22oz bomber: This one pours a fairly clear, slightly orangish color. There was a pretty good sized head on it that left some lacing. Nice nose to this one. Pine, earthiness and a hint of grapefruit are the main aromas. Maybe some faint caramel malts and other fruits mixed in. The taste is good. An excellent combination of the different hops. Nice amount of bitterness to it. No residual sweetness from the malts. A very nice IPA.

Ggeatest beer on the planet, An oldie and still the envy and benchmark every other IPA shoots for. Nice bouquet of grapefruit, melons and pineapple. Somewhat low low bitterness buy current standards. If I was AB-Inbev I would buy Ballast point ASAP.
Pours an orange with one finger head and mild/moderate lacing. Very forward hop aroma with pine, resin, grapefruit. Toasted malt backbone. Medium to full bodied. Long bitter finish. Great beer.

Tasted from 650ml bottle. Tending towards the tropical fruit end of the spectrum. Nothing immediately jumps out because this beer is incredibly balanced. Great length on the palate, This beer is really hard to pick individual flavours because it is so intertwined. The sum of the parts is greater than the whole.

Pretty darn good. Very earthy dank and bitter. Good amount of pine. Not really citrus tasting. So darn fresh and tasty. Big down side, too darn expensive. The price is reflected in the Overall category. I usually wouldn¬ít let something like that reflect my rating, but $16 a six pack is too much money. Easily could be a 4.5 out of 5 if the price were closed to $10 a six pack.
Bottle 12 oz...one of my top three...greatest hop aroma of mango grapefruit and pine. Favor is as crisp and clean as you can with fantastic hop flavor and dry clean crystal clear greatness.
330ml bottle at Proof at Newark airport. A darker golden colour. Pours without much head.

Poured from a 12oz bottle.
This is a very well balanced IPA. 
Citrus with not a lot of aftertaste.

From 12 oz. Bottle. Small head lots of carbonation from bottom. Aroma of pine apricot. Pretty dry and a bitter aftertaste. A bit too bitter for my taste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Sampled on draught at a bar in Las Vegas. Light orange/yellow colour with a white head. Aromas of fruit, and a flavour of apricots, oranges and lemons. There is also a very dry, almost astringent taste of grapefruity hops. A nicely bitter, well-made IPA in the American style.

Now THAT IS a good IPA! Beer in the glass is magnificent: orange/golden colour, lot of carbonation coming from the bottom of the glass, nice thick white head on the top of the beer. Head disappeared quite rapidly though. Aromas of pine, citrus and mango. The mouthfeel is warm, and the mouth gets filled with this incredible hoppy flavour as the beer gets down the throat. The after taste lasts for hours and is really evolutive. Splendid!

UPDATED: AUG 22, 2016 From a 650ml bottle on 27/1/2015. Pours a slightly cloudy golden with a big fine white head. Have been waiting to try this for ages, as their Big Eye IPA is both a regular and a big fave of mine. The aroma is exquisite, with lots of caramel malt and fruity, piney hops. In the mouth, there¬ís a big caramel malt backbone with some toffee, masses of tropical, stone fruit and citrus fruit (mango, peach, apricot, mandarin, grapefruit), marmalade, and big dry resiny hops. The palate is a little syrupy with average carbonation. This is a truly wonderful IPA which is difficult to fault. To me, it¬ís only subtly different to Big Eye - a little sweeter, smoother and ever so slightly less aggressive. Perhaps a touch more enjoyable, but only just. Rating 4.5

Re-rate on 22/8/2016 (355ml bottle). Certainly a top flight IPA, but on revisiting after drinking lots of Big Eye, I¬íve  concluded that I actually prefer the latter. I¬ím missing the malt I first described above with this. Still damned good, but just not as super special as my first try.
33cl bottle from saveur-biere.com. Gold to orange color. Thin white head. Taste is high bitter, light sweet. Aroma is piney, orange, hop, wood, light malt, spicy. Nice!
On draft. Copper color with one finger head. Citrus aroma. Very citrus taste, a little earthy. Exactly what I like in an IPA.
One of the first beers I tried after arriving in California, on tap at the black cat in Silverlake. A pleasure.

Pours a handsome golden color with a slight orange hue. Limited head.
Beautiful citrus smells. Floral scents and fresh grass also come through. Crisp hop flavors include grapefruit and pine. Extremely drinkable, very refreshing. Me gusto mucho.

Orange klar im Glas, leichter wei√üe schaum, grassig fruchtig hopfig in der Nase, unglaublich ausgewogen, angenehme bittere bei sehr guten K√∂rper (nicht zu leicht, nicht zu schwer), lang anhaltende Bittere, sehr sch√∂ne IPA
Can see why this is rated so highly. Big but small, flavoursome but easy drinking, very good

Quite possibly the best IPA I've ever tasted (haven't tried Pliny or Heady Topper though). Nevertheless it's just a damn fine IPA. Very smooth, not bitter, yet has all the citrusy, piney, hoppy flavor that you love from an IPA. Great mouthfeel. Aroma is citrus. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

650ml bottle from cellarbrations super store in hami hill. Pours golden with a thick white head leaving some nice lacing. Aroma is subtle with hints of lemon citrus, apricot and perhaps a touch of mango. Body is quite light with a medium to low carbonation. Taste is lovely with lots of citrus characters with a subtle dry bitter finish. Such an approachable IPA. Smooth and crisp and just Awesome !

The smell was superb, one of the finest I¬íve felt. Very fruity (9/10). The appearance is a flat yellow. Nothing special (3/5). The taste is very light, maybe too light for me (7/10). Palate leaves a hoppy & fruity ending (4/5). Overally an excellent beer, but for being honest, I expected more. I¬íve tried better from Ballast Point (16/20)

Poured from a 12 oz bottle into a tumbler on 11.03.14.

A: Orange. Maybe honey malt. It smells sweet, but it¬ís not a very strong smelling IPA.

A: 1/2 finger head with a moderate pour. Hazy pale orange body.

T: Orange, tropical fruit, and honey malt dominate. Pine, lemon, and biscuity malt are subtle. 

P: Crisp with bubbles on the back end.

O: This is in the San Diego style, obviously, but it¬ís a well-balanced IPA. It has a subtle piney bite on the back end. Overall, it¬ís not very strong, but it might make a good entry IPA. Stone IPA is similar but seems to have a stronger kick to it as it¬ís more hop forward.
Pour from a 12oz can. Very nice citrus forward IPA. Orange, grapefruit, citrus bitterness in the finish. Tasty.

UPDATED: DEC 4, 2015 Bottle shared with koleminer20. Aroma is dank, sweet tropical fruit, some malt, delicious. Appearance is gold-orange, opaque, white head. Taste is bitter, lemon tea flavor, bitter hops, piny, balanced. Mouthfeel is crisp, fantastic light body and great carbonation. Overall, this is very good but it¬ís definitely too basic in taste to be really great. The grapefruit version adds just the right stuff to make that beer upper echelon.

22 oz bomber. The pour is a darker orange-ish gold with a thin white head and some great lace as it falls to a soapy film. The aroma is just great. There is a lot of tropical fruits and a malty hop presence. The pineapple and tangerine really pop through, but it's not overly done. The maltiness is a little surprising here. The flavor is much more malt forward than I was expecting. The fruits and hoppiness are really relaxed, letting the malts control it. There is a light bitterness on the back end. The mouth feel is really good. The carbonation is a little light, so it does fall off of the palate pretty quick. The aftertaste is really malty and dank, not really bright and hoppy as I would like to see. Not bad by any means, but it could be better, for sure 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Drank ice cold from a bottle. Great hoppy citrus aroma. Fruity light flavour with a generous dose of hops. Really nice and refreshing.

First I noticed the awesome head this beer gets on the pour. Then the awesome fruity/citrusy aroma. And the clarity of this beer blew me away as it was crystal clear. First taste I noticed the tangerine/orange hints then on the swallow moved to the grapefruit pine bite finish LOVE this beer. Great American IPA and first beer for me from this Brewery.
UPDATED: FEB 27, 2015 Cerveza arom√°tica con un toque agradable de amagor al final de beberla, una de mis IPAs preferida.
Fruity aroma with tangerine, grapefruit, lemon, and some pine resin. Bitter flavor with lemon, orange, and a little bready malt. Bittersweet finish. A fine, well-balanced IPA.

Not your average IPA with loads of mango, apricots and peaches on the nose. Taste is not as sweet as aroma, instead subduing the fruits and the pines creating a mild yet distinctly bitter beverage. Different.
UPDATED: OCT 4, 2016 From BandC. OK so this was really good at what it was. Quite hoppy but balanced and knew when to easy off so that it wasn¬ít a hop lozenge. Serving: Can

UPDATED: JAN 18, 2015 The aroma is grapefruit, orange, orange peel, a bit of lawn, some resin, and a malty background of bread and caramel. The mouthfeel is medium, with a smooth body of medium viscosity and soft carbonation that wakes up when you press it against your palate. The taste is medium bitter, with some fruity and malty sweetness rounding it out. Swallow, and orange zest lingers under your palate. There is also an aftertaste of malt loaf and resiny hops. Very, very pleasant, but not as bright and fruity as I thought it would be. I probably need a fresher bottle.

It¬ís hard to imagine a more prototypical west coast IPA than this one. Chock full of citrus and stinky sock nose, and caramel-bread malt nose. Flavor spicy with resinous and citrus hops, malts still come through with a light breadiness, semi-sweet at the finish. Utterly drinkable, it magically disappeared from the glass. Pure gold color, modest head.
One of my favorite IPAs. Bursting with fresh hop aroma. Crisp, clear and a wonderful finish.

Bottle. Pours slightly hazy light amber with a nice amount head. Aromas of grapefruit, pine, mango, and pineapple all pop out of the glass immediately. Excellent on the nose. On the palate, the beer tastes of grapefruit zest and mango. Although it is slightly sweet on the first palate, it is quickly mediated by bitter hop characteristics. Dangerously sessionable for a 7.0%. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I don¬ít drink much IPA because I usually find it too bitter and hoppy but I really like Sculpin. I have been going to Home Brew Mart since the late 90¬ís and have overall been impressed with their beers. This one has the characteristic grapefruit hop flavor but is much more balanced than most IPA¬ís I have had. It is also refreshing and easy to drink. Has complex fruity, floral, and resin aromas, with a good balance of sweet and bitter in the flavor. This is one of the best San Diego style IPA¬ís out there in my opinion.

UPDATED: AUG 28, 2015 Deep golden pour with frothy head, I¬íve read a lot of mention that the hops deteriorate quickly in this one, so I¬íll need to revisit. Initial impression was nonplussed. Hops had a slightly skunky aroma amonst citruses which followed into the flavor. Maybe just not my style (west coast) as there are more strongly hopped IPAs out there that I love.
Pretty much perfect, pine resin grass mango aroma, flavor matches that. Copper color perfect palate! Excellent!
√ìtima cerveja!!! Uma das melhores IPAs que j√° provei!!!.......................... via Beer Buddy for iPhone

one of my fav IPA¬ís so much tropical fruit!! apricot, mango, maybe even some pineapple. pours a nice orange with decent white foam. flavor a lovely balance of caremel malt and amazing tropical flavored hops! well done !!!

An orange colour, a head is almost medium and blond. The nose is sweet and tropical. Peaches, caramell, and some citrusfruits and pine needles. Taste has peaches, strong caramel, medium bitterness that is piney. The end is long with pine needles. Medium bodied, medium carbonation. Strongly caramelly IPA, but the bitterness is also strong enough that the balance is completed. Straightforward.

[Bottle] Pours amber with a nice lingering off-white head. Aroma bursts out of the glass with lots of pineapple and some apricot. Taste is pretty good, but not quite as good as the aroma. Pretty balanced with decent tropical fruitiness and quite a bit of malt towards the end. Good mouthfeel, smooth, dry, fairly long finish. Overall, a very nice IPA.

Can with Cam.
Hard to fault. As far as IPA's go, a great benchmark to measure others against. Nice burst of citrus without overloading the palate. Being in Australia I recommend trying to get your hand on the can if you're able cod as you all know, fresh is best.

Bottle courtesy of Bartram who had it couriered to Prague by his ma. Cheers. Pours Golden with a bunch of bubbles and a White head. Aroma is jammed with character. Floral and citrus with some peachy malty promise. Flavour again is bursting with hops. The citrus gives way to more tropical notes. Pineapple, mango, guava. Assertive bitterness to finish with. In some ways it reminds me of the Goose Island IPA. Delicious.
Aroma is hop and grass. Bronze appearance with medium carbonation. Taste is excellent. Nice caramel sweetness on the front with excellent hop on the end.

Maybe my expectations were too high here, but while I enjoyed the citrus punch and subtle pine notes, the beer lacked the kind of flavor depth I¬íve found in truly great ipas. Sculpin may draw comparisons to two-hearted and jai-alai et al. but it¬ís nowhere near as good. I like Ballast Point¬ís Big Eye much better.

Pours golden and slightly hazy, decent head. Taste is mostly hoppy, with a good bitter and some slight sweetness. A small alcohol taste as well. Has mild carbonation. I always enjoy this beer when I have it.
I¬íve had in bottles and cans.

Definitely a more citrusy IPA. Lacks the richness of a malt balance, but delivers delightfully bitter hops and excellent mouthfeel. The crisp hops are faint up front, but slowly permeate every corner of the pallet. A little too much alcohol for me, but nicely done. overall

Pours a hazy golden yellow with a short-lived white head the coats most of the glass it is poured in. Aroma is tropical fruit. Taste is a similar peach/mango/tropical fruit combination with a slight bitterness on the finish. Thick mouthfeel. Lovely beer.
First craft IPA I tried about a year ago. Will always be one of the go-to¬ís even if the recipe has changed. Amazing IPA

Bottle poured a lightly hazed golden hue w/ a medium white head and great lacing. Bold tropical aromas. Initial flavor is light sweet w/ a bold bitter finish of long duration. Tastes are mango, pink grapefruit, tangerine, and light malt. Full bodied, creamy mouthfeel and lively carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Found this at a small bar and had no expectations... But wow a really nice IPA with a delicious hoppy flavor. Reminds me a bit of a Lagunitis.
Aroma of citrus hops with grassy floral notes. Very bitter taste balanced by citrus hop flavor. Had bomber with Amanda in garage from beverage world.

Clear amber with a bone white head. Weak nose with notes of mandarin. A two-phased mouth that starts with grassy hops and finishes with citrus. Light body with notably little caramel that¬ís the scour of most IPAs.

Medium, fresh aroma with sweet fruits, grapefruit and some caramel. Light orange with a it hazy liquid. Minimal white head. Medium/strong taste with fruits (not as sweet as the aroma suggested), peach, citrus, some pine. Also malts and quite a bit of hops. Very balanced with wide taste spectrum and medium, hoppy and malty aftertaste. Medium/light body with medium carbonation. A top-notch, schoolbook-like IPA. Could have a bit stronger taste and more individual character.

Poured from bottle. Honey-like gold color with good head retention. Aroma is gentle pine wrapped in sweet tangerine; great balance of earth notes, and sour/sweet fruit. Taste is round, sweet citrus, even apple-y upfront, winds down to an enjoyably hoppy dryness near the end, honeyish malt lingers around to balance it. A bit pricey, but delivers 100% on all fronts.

Shinny clear golden color with golden orange hues and a medium creamy white head. Aroma is watermelon with some passionfruit ad slight piney notes, really nice. Flavor is balanced hoppyness, watermelon and pine with a touch of crisp maltiness. Medium palate. Really solid IPA, hoppy, flavorful and packing a punch.

couleur or, superbe nez tr√®s expressif sur le houblon bien frais, avec des notes de pamplemousse, de mangue, d¬íananas, de p√™che, de r√©sine de pin et un petit c√¥t√© floral. La bouche est peut-√™tre √† peine en-dessous, un peu moins exotique et plus citronn√©e, avec beaucoup de pamplemousse, grosse ampleur, tr√®s s√®che, aucune note de caramel ici, mais que du fruit, de l¬íacidit√© et beaucoup d¬íamertume. Finale longue, s√®che, tr√®s am√®re, citronn√©e.

Bottle thx heather and frank A: peaches, citrusy, grapefruit app: light hazy white head and good lacing t/p: med body with moderate long bitter finish. Moderate carbonation.o: good. I am under the impression that I would have given a higher score if the bottle was fresher.

Bottle from trade with StefanSD, many thanks for this one. Pours clear orange color, white head. Aroma is very hoppy, citrusy, grapefruit, orange. Taste is bitter, medium sweet, hoppy, grapefruit, orange zest. Very good IPA.
sharp, crisp, summer-like aroma. Lots of hops, citrus, some spices. Taste is similar with hints of lemon and orange, mixed with a little grassy herb. very delicious.
Pours a clear amber with a dense head which lingers......aroma of banana, lemon.....taste is citrusy and grassy with a nice malt sweetness tailing off into pleasant bitterness.

Minimal tr√ºbes goldenes Bier mit einer ordentlichen wei√üen Schaumkrone. Geruch sehr hopfig, fruchtig, bitter, exotische Fr√ºchte, Aprikose. Geschmack sehr fruchtig malzig, kr√§ftig gehopft, mild bitter, Aprikosen, sehr harmonisch und gelungen, gut!

Pours amber with a large, lasting head.
Nose shows sweet clean malt, resinous hops, piny notes and a little citrus. Enticing.
Great balanced flavours, again there¬ís a mix of sweet clean malt and piny, resinous hops. Some spicy notes as well. Superbly balanced, very drinkable.

12oz can. Lively pour. Peachy zesty aroma. Frothy off white head. Golden brite and bubbly. Highlight is the smooth creamy mouthfeel that contrasts with some tangy, tonsil-itching bitterness. Fruity lightness of flavor belies 7% abv. Superb.

Cobrizo limpio y espuma blanca. Aromas de uva, mango, pomelo y pino. Cuerpo medio y meloso con sabores afrutados de melocot√≥n, c√≠tricos de pomelo y final de amargor intenso y redondo que recuerda a la resina y el pino. Muy rica.

Fresh 12oz bottle. Aroma is so fruity, with rounded harmonious notes of dried mango, pineapple concentrate, fresh berries and a sweet, understated malt presence that doesn¬ít allow the beer to meander too far into one-dimensional juicy fruit territory. The "sting" comes from an initial wave of piney hops combined with generous carbonation. Interesting hop profile in that juicy, fruit forward aromatics juxtapose nicely with slightly harsh, dry piney hops. This IPA definitely has it all; finishes a little dry for my palate and would like the fruit forward hops to be featured more in the flavor but all in all a great beer.

Poured from bottle into a Spieglau IPA glass. Clear light orange amber with persistent off-white foam and lace. Malty, honey, faint caramel, with a rich Munich-like sweetness to support the intense grapefruity American hops, equally strong flowery essence unusual in these flagship West Coast IPA. Great strength, no unpleasant alcoholic heat. Medium body, well-rounded mouthfeel, long-lasting hops-forward aftertaste. Really good stuff. I¬íll have to get this again next time I¬ím in California or Illinois.
The IPA character only hits the front of one¬ís mouth and does travel back. It medium body with good scent. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Hazy Orange, Huge Frothy Head That Lasts And Leaves Lots Of Soapy Lacing. Floral Hop Aroma. Malty, Resin, Pine Hop. Medium Body. Smooth And Easy To Drink. Hides ABV Real Well. Nice. Enjoyed It. Recommended.
Burk p√• bishop. Brunr√∂d med mycket vitt skum. Kryddig humledoft. L√§tt metallisk smak med lite fruktighet som f√∂rsvinner fort.

I keep telling myself that I shouldn't make beer the focus of my life, but then I drink this Sculpin, and of course I have to continue. Beautiful, aromatic, rich, and flavorful (live the hops). I think I'm weak, and will continue to live beer.
Oh my friggin god..Im an athiest and I still just found the nectar of the gods..holy crap...this is really really good stuff..
Very nice west coast style IPA. Clear and straw colored. Apricot and pine hop flavor with bite. Light toast. Reliably top tier but pricey.
This is the finest IPA I have had to date. It is everything an IPA should be and more. It costs a little more, but it is worth it.

On tap at St. John¬ís in Sunnyvale. Golden orangey color with a generous amount of head. Lots of hops and citrus; couldn¬ít really pin down what the flavors were (it was a few rounds in) but an exemplary IPA overall.
Doesn¬ít even register when it hits the front of your tongue but blasts the back of your tongue and throat. Buttery, hoppy finish. Pretty good.

Foggy orange beer with a medium head. Aroma is huge fruity hops, orange, peach, sweet malts. A bit dipa-like really. Taste is fresh fruits, piney hops, caramel malts with a really bitter finish. This is one strong ipa with hints of double ipa. A bit too bitter to my taste actually :)

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Amazing ipa. Orange rind. Mild pineapple, mango, tropical notes. Citrus, grapefruit hops. Hops dominate malt. Nice body. Great beer. Instant classic!

Clear, brilliant light orange amber with a big frothy white head. Pine and all sorts of aromatic citrus perfectly balanced by the malt. Resiny and sort of spicy woody. Crisp, light medium body with a firm but very pleasant smooth bitterness. Superb drinkability. Exquisitely crafted.

This is a great beer if you like something between an IPA or double IPA style. It is fresh, crisp and fully hopped. This beer is less malty than some of my favorites. Funny thing is that it did not taste terribly strong either, but at 7% it is definitely an IPA but perhaps shy of some double IPAs. I have no criticism. The high attenuation of this brew lends itself to higher alcohol than an IPA, but less sweet and malty product than many IPA or doubles. It seems to cleanse my palate rather than saturate and overwhelm it with sticky sweet nectar. It is very good. I don¬ít think it deserves a 100 rating, but beauty is in the taste buds of the beholder. I¬íve recently rated the Odell Myrcenary Double (9%) and Green Flash W Coast IPA (7%), which I¬íve recently loved. This double is definitely not as sweet or sticky as another favorite, Great Divide¬ís Titan IPA (7%). Several Mid American IPAs I¬íve tried in Kansas and Nebraska lately have had off flavors that I believe may have resulted from wimpy to nasty tasting hopping. I keep finding myself returning to Rocky Mountain and West Coast ales that satisfy. This is a top IPA in my book, but one possessing a lower residual gravity and malty character. And the high quality hopping delivered exactly what I was looking for.

Bottled. No clear date on this. Pours a nice clear golden color with a nice frothy head. Aroma is big bold citrus, grapefruit, orange. Flavor is orange, some grapefruit, and a sweet malty biscuitiness. Well-balanced. Nice pleasant and very slightly slick mouthfeel. I feel this would be better rated if on tap.

UPDATED: DEC 19, 2014 Tropical fruit punch with a dried but not fresh overpowering rosemary dry finish. Lightly toasted malt compliments then allows a slightly bitter, not entirely clean finish. Feed me more. One of the best beers I¬íve ever had

Poured copper color with an off-white head. Good lacing. Nose of citrus and tropical fruit. Medium body. Smooth mouth feel. Flavor is tropical fruit, some citrus, and nice bitterness. Finish is resinous. Good stuff.

Pours a honey-orange color, one finger off-white head. Moderate carbonation running up the glass. Aromas of big citrus (grapefruit/orange) with subtle notes of pine, sweet malt and tropical fruitiness. Taste has a great balance of the bitter citrus notes and a light bodied sweetness then moving to some more sweet notes of papaya, kiwi....before harmonizing with a clean, moderate bitterness in the finish. Very well rounded beer.

Loads of flavor in this big grumpy fish of a beer. Get it fresh if you can

---Rated via Beer Buddy

A beer that pours a clear orange color with a white thin head, aroma to tropical fruits and citrus, m√©dium body with some taste to caramel malts, grapefruits and citrus, some astringency and carbonatation, at the end leaves a little bitter well balanced. a very tasty beer

Top notch IPA, might be the best regular IPA i have ever had. Pours clear light copper toned. Aroma is unique, SO much tropical notes and citrus it¬¥s really insane, all this while still being able to pick up the malts in the back end. Taste is just as expected, rich tones of tropical frutis with hints of pinyness on the end. Just perfect amount of bitterness too. Had this one earlier this summer from the same batch as now, it might have lost some of it¬¥s hop aromas but still leaves me wanting more. Insanely good IPA.
Bottle from SB.

UPDATED: JAN 19, 2015 Bottle from Beverage Warehouse of Vermont (Winooski). Aroma: citrus, peaches and mango¬ís, grapefruits, pines, resin. App: mid hazy-mid clear orange with small white head. Taste and palate: medium-heavy bitter, light body,average carbonation, bitter finish. Overall: Awesome aroma, aroma has everything I¬ím looking for. Taste is pretty good too. If you can get it in can, then don¬ít think twice and take it. I preferred this beer in can over the bottle version.
12oz. Bottle at a friends party. Just....really really good. Very well made IPA. Will definitely come back for this one.
pours yellow/orange with a nice white head, can¬ít remember exactly all the taste details but I do remember that it was good

Color is golden, decent head supported by good lacing. Aroma is citrusy with tropical fruits (a hint of starfruit) - great aromas. Grapefruit and starfruit on the palate, with some caramel malts and leathery flavours reeling it back; a very hop driven beer though. Body is light/medium with moderate to high carbonation. Very punchy, long finish. I enjoyed the hell out of this brew and might just grab a 6 pack just to see how sessionable it is.

Ballast Point Sculpin has a thin, white head, a clear, slightly bubbly, orange-gold appearance, and fairly heavy lacing left behind. The aroma is of strong piney hop resin, grapefruit, and generalized citrus. Taste is of all that, with sweet, white bread, and strong, but certainly not harsh bitterness. Mouthfeel is medium, and there is a bit of an unfortunate chalky aspect. The finish is dry and easy drinking. RJT
Crisp grapefruit aroma. Amber body with a hint of gold. Bubbly head that lingers nicely about an inch thick. Bitter at first sip but not blasted away. Has a sweet malt background. Mild fruit finish.

Bottle at Dolphin Hotel, Orlando, 9th November 14. Poured almost clear, the aroma is bitter hops, citrus, grapefruit. Taste is smooth, good balance, bitter, not overly sweet, good IPA, didn¬ít blow me away through
Bottle poured into pint glass. Great looking, light, slowly dissapating head with strong citrus aroma. Tasted great, a for sure staple in my rotation and a recommendation for any IPA fan.
Extraordinary nose with pine, mango, citrus. A blast of bitter and hops and then ..... nothing. Swallow and it¬ís just a bland bitterness. A good beer but not among the classics.

Someone wrote that this one could be a bit more bitter. On the contrary the reason why this is so tasty is that all of the subtle flavors are so well balanced and the bitterness is held in check. This outstanding IPA is my favorite.

Poured from a bomber with no noticeable date on it.

Aroma - tropical, sweet, almost peppery

Appearance - crystal clear light golden color

Taste - Very nice....very smooth with a great bite at the back of the tongue which I like.

Palate - Great lingering taste. 

Overall - I can see why this beer gets such high ratings, it is a top notch beer. Can¬ít believe I waited so long to have it.

UPDATED: DEC 10, 2014 12 once bottle. Nice orange body, orange and other citrus on the nose. Pretty clean, bright and refreshing. Finally got a fresh bottle. Not my favorite IPA but good stuff. Make sure you have a fresh bottle!
22 oz bottle. Aroma: citrusy and resinous. Taste/Palate: starts creamy and sweet, and finishes crisp and bitter. Perfect malt/hop balance. Perfect beer.

Poured from a 22. Color is a light, peachy type color. First sip is very sweet, almost fruity. This beer definitely has the "tropical fruit" hops. Lots of hints of papaya and warm San Diego sunsets! Very well balanced. Great beer!

achete a nyc lors d un voyage je trouve que c est excelente ipa on ressent tout suite le houblon au ton agrume comme le citron et la mangue c est tres gouteux et qu est que je trouve a cette biere c est la finale tout en finesse ^pour une ipa de se type ametume se dissipe c est tres estival c est sur que j en par ici (quebec ) ca serais une que j acheterais c est sur C EST UNE GRANDE BIERE
IPAs aren¬ít really my thing. This one¬ís good. It has a nice bitterness that¬ís a nicely balanced between astringency and citrusy/floral. And at 7% ABV it¬ís not too malty.

There is almost no need to describe the taste cause you all know how it goes - pine notes, grape fruit, orange peels, and so on. The bitterness kicks in like a fish hook in your chin, and a grumpy fisherman reels you in, with that sturdy, weather-beaten look on his face and your¬íe hooked.
From a bottle. Pours a hazy orange. Aromas of pine and grapefruit. Medium body. Pine and grapefruit flavors with a nice bitter aftertaste. Very balanced and drinkable. One of my favorites.
Amazing aroma of pine citrus and mango. Complex hop flavors intertwine over a lighter malt profile that managed to provide perfect balance. I prefer this on tap as opposed to the bottle.

UPDATED: FEB 25, 2015 Cloudy body, strong, hoppy aromas. A great IPA, with citrusy orange, mango and nectarine flavors above soft floral notes, balanced with a blast of crisp, piney hops. A creamy and balanced west coast offering that is not over hopped but packs an impressive punch to that end. (Defeated Stone IPA in a blind tasting).

UPDATED: JUN 5, 2017 Pours clear golden with decent head. Aroma of pine, grapefruit, citrus, some sulphur. Medium bodied. Fairly bitter.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

bottle, from the shelves at the bizarre and amazingly stocked thirsty beershop in singapore. thirsty doesn¬ít offer glasses to pour their bottles into so i can only guess that this was some variety of amber, anyways the label was pretty; potent aroma from the neck of the bottle - loads of grapefruit and pine forest floor with hints of toffee apple; great big whack of bitterness, zesty citric tang with plenty of crushed biscuit sweetness. extremely moreish

Bottle. Clear copper gold with a thick, foamy, off-white head that lasts and laces. Aromas of pine resin, biscuit, grapefruit, light mango and peach. Flavor is pine, biscuit, grapefruit, mango, and light orange zest. Medium bodied, smooth with a dry finish. Lingering tropical fruit and pine.

Mooie koperkleur. Mooie dikke schuimkraag. Ruikt naar citroen/sinasappel/grapefruit. Bittere citrussmaak die lang blijft hangen. Heerlijk bier dat me nieuwsgierig maakt naar andere bieren van deze brouwerij.

courtesy of fiulijn - hazy reddish-orange beer with a poor head retention; solid aroma of oranges and grapefruit; full-bodied, juicy and very tasty; a solid bitterness and quite dry; long and very fruity hoppy finish (tangerines and oranges)- clean and straightforward

12 oz bottle into tulip. Minneapolis. 

Appearance: Orange/copper in color. Generous white head with good retention. Impressive lacing. Pretty close to ideal. 

Aroma: Lots of citrus on the nose. Orange, grapefruit. Peach. Some floral notes also. Really nice. 

Taste: Pretty dry upfront with mild bitterness in the finish. 

Palate: Medium/light body. Soft mouthfeel. Longer finish. 

Overall: This beer has a lot going for it. The aroma is fantastic. The hops profile is pretty much ideal for me. Appearance was very nice as well. The body was a little lighter than I prefer, but I know this was by design. Overall a very nice beer.

Bottle.

Head is initially large, frothy, white, mostly lasting.
Body is dark yellow.

Aroma is lightly malty (toasted grain), lightly hoppy (herbs, lemon), lightly yeasty (dough).

Flavor is moderately to heavily sweet, lightly to moderately acidic, lightly to moderately bitter.
Finish is lightly sweet, lightly to moderately acidic, moderately to heavily bitter.

Medium to full body, velvety texture, lively carbonation, lightly to moderately astringent.

Rated this side-by-side with the Big Eye IPA, which is also 7.0% and in the same style. The differences are significant, however...this has almost no aroma, which is strange for an American IPA, but it¬ís much better balanced in the mouth. Big Eye is an abrasive, astringent, crude west-coast resin bomb, whereas this is more British-styled, like a really high-ABV Bitter. It would be well enough if this was 4.0%, since it would be usable as a mindless session beer...but with all this booze and the lack of an enticing nose, it¬ís not really suited for either sipping or quaffing. So, pretty much the same score as Big Eye but for different reasons.
Nice complex taste with a few different levels. A fruit taste in the beginning with a finish of bitter at the end. Not to mention a nice kick.
Gold orange pour. Aroma of mango, tangerines, dank garlic herbal. Tastes grape, pine, big resin, honey, barley, orange, tangerine, peach. Long bitter finish of apricots and minerals.

Maybe my palate is numb due to so many high alcohol IPAs but I did not feel this beer had the sting that it describes. Lacking the sting does not take away from the balanced smooth drinking IPA that the beer is. I didn¬ít find there to be any dominating or overwhelming flavors but I did find that the first sip was just as good as the last. As I move away from the double and triple IPAs, this beer will definitely be added to my rotation.

Poured from a can into a snifter. Pours a cloudy orange/amber with a small white head. Aroma consists of pine, resin, peach, mango, and tangerine. Taste is much the same with a nice and balanced malt backbone that does not take away from the hop flavors. It has a very nice dry bitterness on the end. Medium bodied brew with moderate carbonation and a sticky mouth feel. Amazing.
Poured a pretty clear light orange with good lacing. Very balanced in the mouth with decent malt to hold back the hops.

I never thought I¬íd ever see this in my own hands but due to a local friend who went out of town and brought this back I have to thank him a ton.
This was poured into a nonic pint. 
The appearance was a hazy burnt orange to slightly bronzed brown color. There¬ís a nice looking big white foamy two finger head that dissipated to a rocky level for a sustainable moment but eventually dissipated to a fine lacing sticking and sliding at the same time. 
The smell had a nice sticky sweet grapefruit, light lemon and pine running over some light caramel malt. 
The taste was sweet and bitter with a fairly decent sweet piney to lemon bitterness over my taste buds. 
On the palate, this one sat about a medium on the body with a fairly decent sessionability about it. I would say this was fairly sessionable. The carbonation was good for the style and for me. There¬ís a nice bitterness running over my tongue in a proper AIPA sort of way. 
Overall, wow, this was a great AIPA that I could bang again. It came across in every good AIPA sort of way and has a good sessionability about it that could definitely go with it¬ís respected food.
355 ml bottle. Clear amber with white head. Smell is hoppy pine and floral. Taste is a light malt and heavy hoppy with grapefruit, pine and flowers. Dry with high bitterness and medium carbonation.

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2014 330ml bottle served in a pokal glass.
A: Pours a slightly hazy light orange color forming a thin bubbled and creamy light yellow head. Great retention and lots of soapy and lingering lacings formed and left in the glass
S: Delicious mix of sweet pale grains and piny hops. Notes of grapefruits, oranges and orange zest. Strong notez of flowery hops
T: Light sweet upfront. Strong notes of pale malts, grapefruit, oranges, orange zest. Intense and persistent hops bitterness. Strong citrus and piny hops character. Earthy end
M: Medium body. Light molasses. Good carbonation. Bitter piny end
O: Excellent drinkability. Perfect American IPA
[ BA Review @ 8/5/2014 ]

Bottle shared at a tasting at our place. Thanks Excellent Little Brother for the delivery! Clear amber. Crisp hoppy aroma, a little pine and dry onion. Bitter, crisp and a little green taste, medium-bodied, very soft carbonation, bitter and slightly oniony finish.
Fantastic aroma and taste of citrus! pours with a really nice golden color. Brewed in Cali..enjoyed in Ga.

12 oz bottle. Pours clear light copper orange with a big frothy white head that retains well and laces the glass some.

The aroma is sweet fruity piney hops. It¬ís a bit subdued.

The flavor is sweet bready malts and a little fruit with big piney peppery hops and a dank finish. The mouthfeel is medium to full bodied with smooth carbonation.

Overall, a very nice IPA. It reminds me of Odell¬ís IPA but is a bit pricier.

Citrusy and fruity aroma. A very crisp clean malt profile. Followed by a wonderful hop bitterness that doesn't punch you in the face. A wonderful west coast style ipa. This was one of the first ipa's that defined the style and it's still one of the best!

Hipster, so three days ago. This brew is fraking everywhere. I see this on tap more than bud. Don¬ít tobey me it is a great brew wonderful hop aroma grata dry tadte. Slightly metallic great clarity for the joneses, however step up from this gateway Bronson and do a fruit lambic!!!!
Moderate body with some nice citrus and pine hop flavor. Not in your face but still quite flavorful.

The same strong hoppy aroma as with other good IPA, but with a much milder and smoother taste. 7% strength doesn't make it taste alcohol, but just adds to all the other flavors. Definitely a good choice ale!

Clear brilliant golden under a thin sticky white head. Lovely floral and grassy nose with some earthy resin and a hoppy earthy caramalt backbone. Nice bitter forward flavor with some citric rind, floral resin, earthy freshness and a caramelly pale malt body. Really balanced with a fresh bitterness up front that calms down quick.
Amber color, off-white head. Peach nose, grapefruit, resin, caramel. Passion fruit taste, resin, grapefruit, heavy bitterness. Full to medium body, soft carbonation.

Poured from a 12 oz can dated August 19, 2014. 
Aroma is very hop forward with some light cracker malt background notes. Moderate resinous hop notes with some pine resin. Quite a bit of grapefruit and orange rind. Some light tropical and stone fruit notes. 
Pours a slightly cloudy, golden orange with a moderately sized, somewhat thick, off white head with average retention. Moderately high lacing and medium small legs. 
Flavor is slightly sweet with some cracker and bread malt notes. Moderately high bitterness with quite a bit of grapefruit pith and orange rind. Some moderate pine resin and light tropical and stone fruit. Light alcohol notes. 
Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. 
Overall, a pretty nice IPA with a lot of classic West Coast hop character. Could use a bit more stone and tropical fruit notes, but its easy drinking.

Color is orange hued with frothy white head. Smells of tropical fruits, lupilin and a bit of sweetness. Palate is medium to light with a complexity and layering to the flavor profile. Beautifully done, one well worth seeking out!

6-pack from Applejack. Golden orange and clear appearance with medium-sized, lingering white head. Citrus, tropical fruits, floral notes and light earthy tones. Crisp, fresh, hoppy and easy to drink. Top notch IPA.
One of my favorite IPA's out there. This has the aroma you enjoy just before taking that first sip giving you that overall tasting experience. Bitterness is just right for an IPA.

UPDATED: NOV 18, 2016 "right at the start i didn¬ít know what all the fuss was about. but the beer opened up. very. nicely. pours lighter than most, almost like a pale. in the end, the aroma and feel especially reminded me of Alesmith IPA (arguably my favorite) with the subtle but present peach/mango tropical fruit flavor going on alongside the bitter hops being the difference. very nice. hopefully one i¬íll get to revisit. 2013- seems to me this is one of the best fresh. Top 3...but doesn¬ít seem to have much of a shelf life, even for an iPa, in bottles or kegs. 8/12 awesome on tap! "
2015/2016 seems to be slipping a bit.

Something wrong with this 12 bottle and the other I had. Good aroma but wierd off metallic character. Way too overpowering iron metal made almost a drain pour.
Middle of the road IPA for me. Poured from a 22oz bottle, fairly light color for IPA...Not much on aroma and is kinda too dry for the bitterness it looks leaves at the end
Summer Beer Dabbler 2014. I don¬ít know how I missed this beer for so long. Good, sweet malt. Bitter hops with flowers, citrus, and some pine. Thick palate for the style.
Can from √ñlrepublikken. Golden. Below average amount of white, foamy head. Quite bitter. Medium body and carbonation. Grapefruit, lemon, pine flavours. Very good.
UPDATED: DEC 9, 2014 A hazy orange beer with a small off-white head. The aroma is bready malt, tropical fruit, and floral. The flavor is grapefruit, citrus peel, and earthy.

UPDATED: OCT 12, 2014 Transfer from BA review on 8-17-13-

 Poured from the bottle into a pint glass

 Appearance- The beer pours an orange-amber color with a one finger foamy white head. The head fades over a moderate level of time leaving a very persistent foam on the top of the brew as well as some foamy lace on the sides of the glass.

 Smell ¬ñ The aroma is rather sweet with lots of tropical fruits of mango, pineapple, and tangerine, accompanied by some caramel sweetness as well. With these aromas is a lighter hop aroma of grapefruit and a little bit of pine.

 Taste ¬ñ The taste begins with a lighter sweet flavor of tangerine and tropical fruits mixed with a cracker and biscuit flavor. The biscuit and cracker create a base for the brew, lasting throughout the entire taste. The tangerine and tropical sweetness fades however, leaving a much drier taste at the end. Initially the taste is smoother with only a little hop bitterness of a more grassy and grapefruit nature. As the taste moves on, and the sweetness fades, the hop gets more bitter as other hop flavors of a pine nature joining in. The grassy and pine flavors take on the bulk of the hop flavor as they increase to the end, leaving a rather bitter and dry flavor on the tongue.

 Mouthfeel ¬ñ The body of the beer is on the average side in its thickness and creaminess with a carbonation level that is rather average. The mouthfeel is rather nice for the crisper and drier flavors of the brew all while keeping the hop flavors well supported.

 Overall ¬ñStarts out sweeter and finishes a bit drier and more bitter. A rather tasty IPA.
33 cl olearys √ñrebro. Fantastiskt god ipa som intogs p√• klass√•tertr√§ffen p√• olearys i √ñrebro.

Great all around IPA. Glowing orange colored. Citrus, apricot, some pine, and some honey in the aroma. Great balance between sweet malts, juicy citrus and mango, and light hopping bitterness. Easy drinking. Fine stuff indeed.

Fantastic beer. Better than expected. Well balanced maltiness with bitterness. I will try and clone this beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Great IPA!!! Citrus piney hoppiness!!! With a smooth sweet flavor that is just outstanding!
One of my favorite IPAs. Very fragrant with fruity hops and really well balanced with a nice bitterness to the finish. Price point is only major downfall of this beer. Have only had this one in cans.
My goodness this is good stuff, Nice and hoppy, love it. Truly a refreshinging ipa

Poured from 2 bombers into a pint glass. This is the first time I rated beer in the opposite, usually I go to places and buy beer, drink it, and then rate it. This time I found a highly rated beer, sought it out, and then drank it. It¬ís funny how expectations change things because after reading the reviews of this beer I guess I must have been expecting a genie to fly out of the bottle and grant me three wishes. Well since this did not happen I will tell you what those wishes would have been. 1.) I wish this beer was $12 a six pack instead of $9 a bomber. b.) I wish this beer was a bit stronger maybe closer to 8% for the price. 3.) I wish I could taste any of the fruit listed on the side of the bottle that was mirrored in many of the reviews. I have had $100 a bottle cognac and can appreciate the reasons why it was 3 times the price, this is not the same, there are better IPA for cheaper. It¬ís good not legendary.
This IPA does live up to the hype. Medium bodied with a nice mouthfeel. Hoppy with notes of grapefruit and a good bitter finish.

Bottle at Brewdog Stockholm, april 18th 2014. Hazy orange body with a nice white head. Finally getting to try this hyped beer, and it delivers. Citrusy pine aroma with a late apricot and peach kick, taste is floral with grapefruit and apricot, subtle balance of caramel, hay, strong bitter finish, with a dry clean lemon and apricot aftertaste. Very nice!

355 ml. can sampled @ Pure Apricot Tasting. Thanks! Another one I¬ím glad to finally try. Orange, little white head. Herbal, lemon, lime, grape & resin hops in the nose. Bitter grapefruit taste, lemon, lime, lemon drops, fruity, peel, grapefruit, light tropical,¬Ö. Nicely hoppy. Solid body, pretty nice beer.

UPDATED: SEP 26, 2015 I really enjoyed this one...just a great balance of subtle sweet smoothness with the citrusy bite; top notch IPA for me; too bad it¬ís 15.99 for a six pack. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Amazing flavor and aroma, dominated by citrus but with a lot of depth. A little fruit sweetness that balances the bitterness nicely. Not quite a DIPA, but a strong IPA - this level of ABV & IBU¬ís really allows you to savor each flavor without anything being too overwhelming.

UPDATED: JUL 15, 2016 Typical West Coast IPA with stable, coarse, off-white head and deep orange blonde colour, clear. Strong and resinous hops in the nose, tonic water, grapefruit peel, spices, bitter honey, orange zest, thyme, gin, white pepper, apple peel. Fresh citrussy onset with elegant and appetizing fruitiness, some apricot, minerals, slick and clean mouthfeel, with a very powerful, spicy, grapefruity, leafy hop bitterness drying the mouth and making for a very long and dry, complex finish without becoming too agressive. Balanced, lean and memorable.

From 355 ml in a tulip glass. Pour is clear orange with a frothy thick white head. Lots of floral and herbal hops in the nose. Tropical fruits dominate with passion fruit, lemon and grapefruit notes. Light bread notes. Taste is lots of fruit flavours with a medium but long lasting bitterness. Hints of bubblegum and very light malt sweetness. Pretty light body for an IPA! Well balanced! Great representation of an West Coast IPA, but not my favourite.

UPDATED: JAN 24, 2016 Amongst the nicest IPA I?ve had. fantastic, huge hop flavours, everything balanced. fresh bottle in the USA. (later had on tap again - fresh and wonderful). // citrus hops with a hint of tropical fruit.

Ballast Point Sculpin is listed by many as a great beer. I am often times leery of mass approval of anything, with that in mind I gave this IPA a try. it was poured into a pint glass and did have a very pleasing light color for an IPA. The aroma was strong but not overpowering and when I took the first sip, I realized many voters are just towing the party line. I like IPAs but I get the since many of these brews are made the "drier" the better and to me that takes away from savoring the flavor. I would drink it again but I don¬ít consider this a fantastic brew. I prefer Ballast Point¬ís Wahoo White which I consider to be an excellent brew. But for the craft beer aficionado this beer would be well worth a sample beer or two to see if it is your cup of tea (so to speak)
UPDATED: SEP 14, 2014 The aroma is tangy with lots of fruit, like grapefruit and banana. The taste is sweet and strong with hops. Very well balanced West coast IPA.

Poured from tap into Chimay glass a nice amber with white head and lace. Aroma was grapefruit and a bit floral. Taste to me was a better balance between the hops and malt. It was grapefruit not doubt but not a bomb. Med body. Really liked this one, a winner for sure.
poured from a bottle. Typical grapefruit ipa, small head, clear orange color, hoppy finish
71 day old 12oz bottle to snifter. Crystal clear copper. White head. I wonder how fresh it needs to be to live up to the hype. Still good.

From a bottle. Pours orange with a thin white head, floral hop aroma, huge palate of hops with grapefruit punch that lingers. No hint of the alcohol, a great beer that is an excellent example of an American IPA.

Darn good ipa. worth every cent too, though they sure do add up on this one. nose is citrusy for sure. tastes just as so in addition to some lighter fruits. this brew doesnt molest you with a ton of ibu¬ís although very much prevalent in the hops department. goes down ultra smooth but crisp with not too much linger. gives a very profuse mouth feel that is very enjoyable. looks like we gotta winner folks!
Bomber from Andy--thanks! A citrusy west coast ipa with a good dose of orange flavor, pine. I found it a little thin and kind of sharp, but generally quite drinkable.

Found a bottle at the Carrefour in Sorocaba, Brazil of all places. The smell was pretty intoxicating. A deep tropical mix of mango, papaya, passion fruit. The pour was golden orange with a slight haze. Heavy bitterness up front like a danky pine then opens up with hints of apricot, peach and the previous tropical mix. Very balanced throughout and good as lacing from the fresh malt.

Medium amber body with powerful head. Nose has lots of citrus, but more varied than usual - notes of other tropical fruits like mango, maybe pineapple. Also some hints of the malt backbone. Taste is equally complex. Along with the tropical fruits there are hints of pine. Mouthfeel is generous with a tiny bit of cloy yet a dry finish. This beer opens up as it warms towards the bottom of the glass. It¬ís worth waiting to judge it until you¬íve finished the glass - it lives up to the hype.

.3l bottle @ Haltiatar 
Pours clear yellow with low head. Aroma is citrus fruits, pine, exotic fruits, some herbs, apricot. Flavor is pine, exotic fruits, hops, resin and grape. Well balanced, soft mouthfeel. Swell.

Bomber poured. Light gold with a beige head. Nice hop variety with malt undertones.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle to English pint glass. Pours slightly hazy light amber. Two finger head, nice lacing. Aroma of mango, apricot, lemon zest. Taste is very hoppy bitter with nice light sweetness for balance. Medium-full body, lightly carbonated, slightly sticky mouth feel. Finishes with a complex symphony of spruce, apricot, melon, earthy herbs. This is a very fine west coast IPA. It¬ís worthy of it¬ís 100 rating.
Citrus and pine nose. Beautiful golden color. Lingering bitter finish. Very tart. Malts come through at the end.

Bottle picked up at GBBF 2014. Been looking forward to this. Pours a clear amber with a white head. A fairly light aroma of grass, caramel, a little veg funk and orange. Light to medium body, medium carbonation. Some stickiness to it, a little veg funkiness, orange, pine, lemon, caramel, light woody bitterness but still quite sweet overall. It¬ís tasty.

Good Beer! Enjoyed this as a guest draught on the ¬í8th line¬í at Lucky¬ís Lounge in Boston. Hoppy, lovelly aroma and great depth of flavour, good with food. Not in my top five yet...needs more investigation, but I would definately drink this again. Good Job!

Can- pours yellow with an off white head. I taste all the fruits that are advertised. This is by far my favorite IPA my lips ever touched. Smooth and subtle touch to the end. Great taste. 7% too win win win

16 oz draft at Alewife Baltimore in a standard pint glass. Clear golden yellow with off-white head. Aromas of tropical fruit, floral notes, citrus. Tastes of tropical fruit, citrus, floral notes, light booze, hop oils. Medium body with a dry finish. Medium carbonation. Juicy mouthfeel.

I will need to review this again one day when I have a fresh bottle. This bottle was about 2 months old. Delicious though. Fruitiness from hops and nice malt backbone, with a nice snap at the very end.

2 week old bottle poured into a Duvel tulip. The beer pours a mostly clear, brightly colored amber with a thick white head that slowly shrinks to a finger and leaves lots of lacing. This beer is beautiful. Immediately I smell tropical fruit aromas as I pour. Upon further inspection I can detect bright mango, pineapple, and bubblegum. Real nice and fruity. When finally tasting the beer I first note an immediate piney hop bitterness that is quickly met with the tropical flavors detected in the aroma. The resinous qualities of this beer come back just as quickly as they faded and mix with a somewhat restrained caramel malt. Very nice. The mouthfeel is nice and full and the beer clings to your tongue and mouth. It is still refreshing despite it¬ís body, and I could sesh this beer, at least for a 6 pack.

Overall this is a fantastic IPA and worth seeking out, fresh if possible.

Flaska bishops marina med p√§ronen - doftar otroligt friskt. M√∂rkgul med vitt skum och l√§tt dimmig. Tydlig men behaglig beska. Smakar lite blodapelsin.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours a clear orangish color. Aroma and taste are citrus, pines, and some mango sweetness.

Poured a light hazy honey with a small head. Aroma had a bit of hops, not as much as I expected. Flavour was of malt, with a light hops finish, nothing out of the ordinary, didn¬ít taste as strong as it apparently is.
Essa √© porreta. Ceva de macho. Gosto bem complexo, gosto di depois bem forte. Uma das melhores ipas que eu ja tomei. Daora, tiu.
Bottle. Pours orange with white head. Aroma is a bit if danky hops, mixed citrus. Taste is light, smooth, pine, dank, nice. Yummy ipa.

Bottle thanks to StephanSD for SSS. Big danky hop aroma, balanced caramel malt character. Mildy hazy pale orange pour with large creamy off white persistent head. Flavor is more malt forward, caramel malt, some danky hop flavor and moderately bitter finish.
Pours golden in color with a generous cream-colored head. Bright citrusy aroma. Light bodied with a citrusy bitter hop flavor. Some crispness in the finish. This was pretty good.
Awesome to see that Ballast Point¬ís Sculpin is starting to get the attention it deserves. A well balanced IPA combining some light fruit notes with well-rounded hop base.
Aroma of tropical fruits and melon. Piney and a bitter bomb at first. Hop bitters mellow as you go on. I prefer Terrapin high 5 or Two Heart esp at 12-13 bucks a sixer.

small can into an spig IPA glass. Pours clear golden sunset with a creamy white head. Nice aroma of orange, mandarin, apricot fruits. Very bitter and resinous in the flavour with the apricot flavour dominating, slight sweet caramel maltyness.
Very nice IPA. Lots of fruit on the nose grapefruit and pine. Orange pour white head. Lots of hops in a floral body with grapefruit citrus and mango like sweetness. Moderate body and carbonation.

Pours a clear orangey color, topped with very generous slightly cream colored head with very decent retention. 
There is a pleasant citrusy hops aroma, slight fruity notes and some spices. 
The body has a creamy feel. Decent bitterness in the taste, some spices. Quite some bitterness left in the aftertaste.
A nice one.
Flaske og siden fad: Orange let diset √∏l med flot skumhoved. Duften er citrus og let mango. Smagen er ikke bitter men har masser af tropisk frugt. Virkelig en forn√∏jelse.
Lighter in colour than the Big Eye IPA, Ballast Point Brewing is my favorite of San Diego beers. Dare I say less arrogant and more balanced makes Sculpin top notch beer.
A West Coast IPA that has a bite and a hop heavy, piny, citrus profile. Recently becoming more easy to find in the Chicago market. Perfect option for a canned IPA.

355mL bottle BB 14121...maybe?
Looks a treat in my "IPA glass"; pale gold with a tight white creamy, leaving level layers of lace on its descent.
Nose packs a punch; plenty o that typically biscuity, light caramel American pale malt goodness upfront with a stack of citrus rind, stone fruit, pineapple, pine needle, cedar and passionfruit hop character.
Chewy texture, good weight on the palate yet without alluding to its abv, carbonation is soft and creamy.
Palate hits hard with plenty of resiny hops, bitter citrus, green stonefruits and woody spice. Not to be outdone, there¬ís plenty of golden syrup & cracker biscuit-esque malt to provide a decent balance. Bitterness is also very well balanced - firm without being astringent or aggressive - lingering long on the finish. Alcohol extremely well masked!
Tremendously well balanced and enjoyable. This is an American IPA made the right way!
Poured from an imported bottle. Pours a little lighter in colour than the Big Eye IPA. Tropical hops aroma and grapefruit hop taste. A great hoppy IPA.
I¬ím not a fan of Grapefruit juice, and to me it tasted a lot like it, however, my wife absolutely loved it, will be looking for it in Colorado.

Orange-gold pour with a decent white head. Resin, citrus, tropical fruit, caramel - lots going on in the aroma but very clear, nothing overpowering. Smells good. Taste - it¬ís piney, it¬ís bitter, caramel, citrus, tropical fruit. Just like it smells, balanced. Good. Really good.
P√• fat p√• Broadway. L√§tt vackert vitt skum. Doft av annanas, grape och l√§tt kola. Ljusbrun/gul i f√§rgen. Sk√∂nt humlebeska i avslutningen. L√§tt kola, ananas i smak √§ven om citrusen dominerar.

{from notes based on a growler consumed Feb. 2012).
Pours an orange-amber with a very slight haze and a smallish off-white head. 

Exceptionally fruity aroma, featuring oranges and other citrus fruits. Some caramel here too. In fact, the aroma seems markedly sweet. Still, this much hop aroma can indicate a rather bitter brew; such is not the case here. The flavor is actually rather tame for style since there¬ís plenty of sweet malt to partially counter the hop bitterness. No question, however, that this leans to the bitter side, as it should, and eventually one is left with an aftertaste consisting of hoppy, grapefruit bitterness. The premier feature of this IPA, however, is the powerfully fruity aroma and flavor. This actually tastes like it was somehow made with a citrus punch featuring tangerines. [Citra hops?] 

M: very smooth; medium body; light harshness/bite from 7% ABV which is otherwise not evident in tasting. 

O: an outstanding IPA for those who, like me, are particularly fond of a citrusy IPA.

Bottle from Regional. My 1st top 50 Beer (according to RateBeer contributors - who am I to argue) - looking fwd to it. Lots of tight little bubbles in a light golden ale. Resin is upfront and then various fruits evident. Complex - with a 4 or five citrus (after the hop resin) then tropical flavors - most obvious being passion-fruit, giving way to some subtle flavors further down the track (with of course some bitternessity!). I don¬ít normally comment on Mouth feel - because it normally feels like there is just some beer in my mouth - but this I get - the tight little bubbles I mentioned earlier - give this a lightness on the tongue - and the beer dissolves quickly on the back of this - leaving the above tastes to linger. A quality Beer; its reputation in is intact, and the top 50 remains a good source of beer recommendations!

Presentation: It was poured from a brown 12 oz bottle into a tulip glass. The label lists the abv at 7% abv.
Appearance: It has a clear golden body with lots of visible carbonation. The builds up tall and thick with a just off white head. This head quickly faded out on me making next to no lacing. 
Smell: There is a bid hop presence here with loads of citrusy and piney hop notes.
Taste / Palate: The first few sips I mostly got loads of pine like and some citrusy grapefruit and lemon rind flavor notes. As I drank on and the beer warms more peach like fruit notes and maltiness comes out. The finish is all hop bitterness which lingers for some time. The body and carbonation feel spot on and I can see why Sculpin IPA is so highly rated.
Notes: Classic West coast IPA!!!

Got it at Kroger of all places. Amber pour with a medium sized white head. Aroma is apricot, orange and peach. Medium bodied, nice carbonation. Big apricot flavor and the advertised mango is there as well. Faint hints of orange rind towards the finish. Slightly sweet aftertaste. Pretty unique in a very crowde field, I liked it a lot.

got this beer recommended to me by a member of staff at whole foods and i couldn¬ít thank him enough what a beer this is fair play good amount of hops good kick of bitterness at the end a very very nice beer one that i will be taking home from new york with me

From San Diego. Bright translucent orange-copper with small watery white head. Lots of fruit in the smell - mango, pineapple, citrus. Tastes of fruity bitter hop and malt with a long slightly spicy finish. More malt and less hop than I expected. Body is crisp but juicy. Not very big and quite malty for an IPA but still very tasty.

Bottle from SD at home. Bright (almost neon) translucent orange pour - looks delicious. Aroma is apricot and peachy sweetness - not that strong. Taste is fruity hoppy with a very strong crisp bitterness. Not as big as I thought it would be. Solid crisp IPA with some juicy flavors. I think my expectations were too high.

From a can. Pours a light amber-orange and makes a nice white head. Smells of toffee and light caramel. Tastes of grapefruit, citrus, and hops. Reminds me of Sierra Nevada Pale Ale. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

355ml bottle. Pours a hazy golden amber, with a smallish off-white head, which lasts fairly well and leaves decnt lacing. Resin, passionfruit and pineapple hops notes sit over a light caramel malt base to create the aroma. Potent resin, lime and pineapple hops up front give way to mild caramel malt in the mid-palate. Kiwifruit and grapefruit hops give it an assertively bitter finish. A very high quality IPA, razor-sharp and with a good range of flavours.
Draft at Coasters. Medium amber body with off-white lacing. Citrusy hoppy aroma. Fruity hops in the flavor, moderate bitterness. Finishes sticky and tart. Nice IPA.
330ml bottle from Queens Plaza Beer and Wine 180714. There is nothing fishy about this beer. Big hop aromas with lots of fruit. Full flavoured and possibly the best Ballast Point beer I have had.

light copper in colour a shade towards cloudy, small carbonation bubbles are feeding the thin layer of a slightly off white head. hop flower resin and citrus aromas. heavy bitters with a sting* helped by the sharp carbonation followed by a thin mouthfeel. a bitter dry finish.

Love this one. Amazing appearance. Golden orange with aroma of toffee and alcohol. Body is super light. Bright fruity notes with bitter backbone and alcohol burn. Near perfect.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a clear orange with white head. Aroma or tropical and citrus fruits and some sweet notes. Taste is a nice clean assertive bitterness throughout with a caramel backbone. Pine, grapefruit, mango, and biscuity flavors. Medium bodied. Very well done IPA. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
A very good IPA that has a great finish and aroma that is not too strong but the beer is very drinkable. Something one could drink several of and not feel like overwhelming on the palette.

Beautiful golden amber color capped by a white, frothy, lasting head. Aromas and flavors of pine, citrus, mango, pineapple, kiwi and other tropical fruits. Substantial bitterness, but not the least bit harsh. Medium bodied with some bready malt which supports the tropical fruits perfectly.

Bottle [from trade with mista] @ weekly tasting shared with Dutchdrebus. Clear orange color, full sized off-white head that lasts for a long time. Aroma is malts, loads of hops, very fruity with grapefruit amd mandarin. Taste malts, hops, fruit hops, fruity, grapefruit, bitter. Lingering fruit and bitter hops in the aftertaste. Incredibly balanced flavor between the fruit hops and bitter hops. Medium to full body, perfect carbonation. I thought maybe this beer is hyped, but it is simply good. Very good, incredibly balanced. Lovely IPA.

Bottle @ home shared by benzai. Clear orange colour with a large white head. Smells hops, fresh, grapefruit, fruity, tropical, nice! Tastes grapefruit, hops, fresh, fruity, pineapple, nice. Very balanced, medium body, perfect carbo.

Hazy orange body and a lasting head of white bubbles. Grapefruit hop aroma with some hints of caramel malt sweetness. Citrus rind bitterness in the taste, some floral notes before a bit of sweet at the finish. Very tasty.

Bottled sample. Gold in colour with medium carbonation. Aromas are of apricot, cut grass, sweet citrus and sweet pale malts. I was expecting a sharper and dryer beverage, considering its reputation. Not sure how fresh it it, but consumed only a couple of days after purchase. Ok as is.
Crisp and refreshing. Very citrus and clean. Very detailed hop notes. Tastes like it just came from tap room. FRESH

Bottled 355ml. -Courtesy of MatSciGuy, shared with him and Marko (thanks!). Darker golden coloured, small off-white head, piney nose. Classic ipa. Clear light orange. Citrus, pine, floral. The taste adds lemon and apricot with some caramel malt. Sticky resin and bitter bitter on the finish. Overall, a great strong ipa. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Clear yellow of color with a white head. An aroma of hops, citrus and pines. A flavor of hops, citrus, pines, lemon peel and fresh.

Not sure what all the fuss is about, it seemed kind of weak to me, almost like a session IPA. Orange amber body with decent rocky head. Normal IPA/hop aromas, taste also, and somewhat subdued, less hoppy than a NW IPA. Good, but not great.

12oz can. Clear golden orange with a thin foamy white head. Flavors are pine resin, lemon, apricot, bread, honey, caramel and grass. Medium body, moderate carbonation, oily texture. Sharp bitterness, dry finish. Run-of-the-mill IPA.

Classic one with dry hops and some citrus fruits. Easy to drink with an unbalaned finish containing some unexpected bitterness. Good one.

Bottle from Douberd and shared by MichaelAwesome - many thanks! Pours out in a hazy amber-golden colour with steady head and medium body. Wonderful aroma of fresh hops, oranges and spruce. Taste of hops, oranges, mango, citrus, spruce, grass, mild pepper and light spices. Highly quaffable to drink, enjoyed it a lot.
Murky orange pour, with a thin creamy head. Bold grassy hops nose that delivers a sweet hop bomb.

Excellent IPA. I have heard good things about it but never got around to trying it but I¬ím glad I did. Really nice tropical pine aroma. Very West coast it¬ís awesome. It¬ís like not trying to be too much of something. It is exactly what it is and I think that¬ís what I like so much about it. The taste is obvious. It¬ís delicious. Nice soft fruit and dry finish. Very refreshing. Overall a fantastic beer.

On tap at Ridgewood (Raleigh). 

Pours a nice clear amber with a finger of head. Crisp hoppy aroma and taste. Touch of bitterness. Good, everyday IPA.

UPDATED: MAR 7, 2015 Bottle from saveur-biere.com on 06/26/2014. Amber, slightly hazy body, with a big, creamy, white head. Aroma of grapefruit, peach, mango, passion fruit, pine, candy, biscuit. Taste is bitter, with grapefruit, pine, resin, peach, passion fruit, biscuit, caramel. Mouthfeel is medium, oily to creamy, with a medium carbonation and it finishes bitter, dry, with lemon zest, pine, resin and some sweet malt notes.

Draught at Braukunst Live 2015.
Amber to orange, clear body, with a big, creamy, white head.
Aroma of peach and other stone fruits, pine, some tropical fruits, fresh grass, some biscuit.
Taste follows this, with more pine and grapefruit.
Medium, slick mouthfeel, with a lively carbonation.
Finishes bitter, zesty, wih pine, grass, subtle stone fruits, a bit malty.

Wow! One of the very best IPAs I¬íve had. Fresh, perfectly balanced and with lovely, complex hops. Especially the nose is really amazing. A pretty perfect IPA worth the hype!

UPDATED: JUN 28, 2014 Bottle. Slightly cloudy apricot colour, medium head which dissipates quickly. Fruity hops in the aroma, citrus, apple, a bit of malt coming through. Very hoppy flavour, nicely balanced between bitter and sweet. A very nice IPA, but a touch over rated in my opinion. I¬íve had better.
A super solid IPA! This beer sold me for this brewery and now I will attempt to try any and every thing they produce!

Bottle from Saveur-Biere.com - Color: clear copper blond beer with small carbonation and small white foam. Smell: hoppy domination with fruity note as litchi, pineapple, peach. Taste: nice fruity taste as pineapple, litchi with lemon notes. Great taste, really fresh! Easy drinkable. Aftertaste: small caramel taste good sweet bitterness. Really good balance of fruits and hops!
UPDATED: JUL 8, 2014 Fruity aroma, apricots, mango and exotic fruits. Decent head, big lacing. Very "west coast", was expecting more bitterness though. Bottled 15 of May.

355 ml bottle. Slightly clouded orange copper, off-white fading foam. Fresh nectarous tropical fruity hop aroma and taste, nice milder toffee malty balance, lightly floral and coniferous, some grapefruity bitterness. Average carbonation, lighter bodied, well hopped. Delicious and not over the top makes it: LBW (Lagerboys Be Wary)

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2015 Very beautiful beer. Clear, nice head and good retention. Aroma is dominated by tropical fruits which also come through in the taste. Dry and quite bitter aftertaste. Creamy body with just the right amount of carbonation. Very solid IPA!

Out of a 12oz can the beer pours a clear golden tan two finger head. Hundreds of tiny bubbles shooting up. Marvelous. Tons of fresh hops on the nose including mangos, pineapple, grapefruit,and sweet peaches. As beer warms flavors are more pronounced. Medium smooth mouthfeel. Extremely well balance between the hops and malt. Love the hop bite on the swallow. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle 355 ml, bottled on 12/13, poured into a tall tulip glass, ABV 7%
Deep orange colour on the body, small white head but with good retention, minimal lacing on the glass.
Aroma of sweet malts, cookies, tropical fruits, some mango, caramel.
Hoppy taste, very bitter from the very first sip all the way to the aftertaste, lots of pine, orange peel, citrus, tropical fruits on the finish, kumquats, fresh grass.
Medium body, oily on the palate and at moments dry, carbonation is good, maybe a bit higher than I wanted.
Overall a really great IPA.

On tap at Pizzeria Azzurri. Clear copper pour with a thin frothy white head. Nice thick lacing. Aroma of tropical fruits, sweet malts, citrus, and pine. Oily body, light carbonation, and medium bodied. Light and refreshing. Tastes just like it smells. Tropical fruits, pineapple, mango, caramel malts, pine, citrus, and a hint of tobacco on the backend. Dry hoppy finish. Nicely balanced.

This used to be up there for my favorite IPA, but recently I have noticed a decline in quality. Less of a grapefruity character, and less vibrant. Similar to Racer 5, but just better. Maybe the quintessential West Coast IPA in my opinion. Delicious stuff.

I¬ím pleased to say that this beer is as good as it has been made out to be. Aromas of pineapple, mango, banana and tangerine with a bit of pine resin and caramel. Light amber with a head of fine white froth and great clarity. Very well balanced taste, a little malt sweetness coming through with a lot of hop bitterness to finish but not overwhelm. Light bodied and smooth on the palate with a long, dry finish, lively carbonation. 
Overall this is a fine example of an American West Coast ipa and I¬íd be more than happy to drink a few of these anytime.
Can. Copper pour with small head. Aroma leans towards fruity and earthy hops. Taste is fruity, earthy and grassy. Bitterness is moderate. Decent IPA which fells short from the bests of its class.
Piney, hops, citrus and sweet fruit aroma. Slightly hazy golden color with a good head. Nice IPA taste. Not to bold, heavy or bitter. Nice and well balanced body. Good beer

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2015 Hell yeah. Ballast Point¬ís ale tastes every bit as aggressive as a West Coast IPA should, yet it has more balance than some of its peers. The aromas and flavors meld together with pine, spruce, grapefruit, resin, and the subtle juiciness of overripe tropical fruits. The balance between malts and hops is fantastic. You get just a hint of biscuit taste among the bitterness. There¬ís also a note of earthy, grassy sweetness. While these kinds of IPA¬ís have become extremely common, Sculpin shares the stage with a select few ales that truly embody the West Coast art of hoppy beer.

Bottle.

A- Citrus, pine, pepper, hoppy.

A- Copper color, clear liquid, white head.

T- Bitter, pine, resin, citrus, pepper.

P- Medium body, average texture, average carbonation, bitter finish.

O- A good IPA as far as IPAs go, but just wasn¬ít my thing. A little too upfront and sharp for my liking.

An amber body with a thin head. Typical IPA aroma. Nice taste. Happy I got in on tap :)

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
33cl bottle from systembolaget bs. Pours golden with fruity aroma. Balanced, hoppy flavours with sweet citrus notes.

Huge thanks to MatSciGuy for giving us the chance to try this! Poured a deeper golden body, good head. Grapefruit and sweet, sticky maltiness in the aroma, might not be perfectly fresh, but still very nice. Perfumey piney hoppy notes, somewhat peppery, balanced perfectly by the underlying sweetish maltiness, notes of sweet orange again. Looooong lasting bitter aftertaste. Superb IPA, I can see this going over 4 fresh.

Hoppy Nose, with a little yeast. Taste is crisp and hoppy, clear notes of citrus.
Medium body, average carbonation.
Nice and citrusy with fruit and golden raisins. Balanced hop aroma and flavor.

Pours a deep golden color with a finger of foam. Nose is a mixture of faint tropical hops, stale grass and earthy toasted malts. Palate follows with a round full mouthfeel thats almost jello like. Toasty malts, mango, earthy hay and old dusty dried grass. A bit underwhelming.
Fat p√• Monks. Ljus b√§rnstensf√§rgad v√§tska med vitt skum. Doftar mango och n√§tmelon. Wohoo vilken beska! Mycket besk med stor s√∂tma och fruktighet. V√§lbalanserad. Ruggigt bra ipa!

Bottle. Would love to have this on tap from the brewery, but that¬ís not possible in Australia. Ok IPA, great body and tastes a bit like a nice earl grey tea mixed with an IPA, but most of the aroma hasn¬ít survived the trip to Australia (I presume). Not as good as some of the local IPA¬ís I¬íve tried.
A fairly standard IPA with some accentuated floral flavors to it. Enjoyable, to say the least.

Shockingly good for an ipa. Bitter aftertaste. Commoner in the ipa style category. Lacks standout character. Pretty street. Commoner. Just like everyone else's. Why not standout from the pack?

UPDATED: APR 5, 2015 Bottled on March 3 and tasted on May 24...The aroma of this beer poured into a stout glass from a bomber is tantalizing and fresh, bringing apricot, mango and a nice strong hops. The soft, off-white head is small but tenacious, clinging to the sides of my glass and a nice contrast to the soft amber of the liquid inside. A median bitter, but long lasting on my tongue and nicely fizzy without feeling over carbonated. This is a most pleasant brew, nicely balanced, fruity but not too sweet, hoppy bitter and evenly balanced in all the experiences. Another go-to brew on my favorites list!

Draught st Babas, Stockholm.
Small but lasting white head. Perfekta Clear, Golden amber color. Fine American hop aroma in medium elevers. Light caramell taste with form bitterness and. Big hop taste. No residual sweetness.

Sharp. Good hops nose...Good summer ipa (would drink year round)not big on body but refreshing with rigHt amount of hops. Would be excellent with shellfish IMHO.......very quaffable and would buy again...very soon...but it is $$$ at 13,5 per 6. ... Very dry finish....a keeper
From a growler. Golden with nice head. Tropical fruit flavors. Not a hoppy as I expected. Very enjoyable.

Highly floral aroma. Lemon and tangerine taste. Medium bodies. Awesome bitterness. Light malt aftertaste, boozy. Long bitter finish.

Taste was good. Was expecting a bit more in fullness, although had a nice taste. Would buy it again for a quality IPA. Just wouldn't quite place it as a absolute favorite.

With Larry. Pours paler than typical IPA...almost a cross between between a typical IPA and a pilsener. Great nose -floral, pine, citrus. Taste has citrus and caramel malts up front - but a muted hop finish. Great except the finish.

UPDATED: AUG 6, 2014 Rating from a 6-pack enjoyed this week, less than a month old per bottle date. Sculpin was one of my first favorite IPAs and I had forgotten just how good it can be. When you find it fresh it is a monster. Juicy and pungent with powerful hop flavor and wonderful balance. When it¬ís been sitting on the shelf a while, it loses some luster. Check the bottle dates, explained on their website. If it¬ís fresh, buy it.

Can thnx to Jeff 
Pours clear blonde not much foam ( fades fast )
