Great everyday (and hig quality) drinking. Lovely balanced IPA with spicy hops, some resin, good length; everything just seems to fall into place. A little fruit early but does dry out a touch. Terribly sensible beer but very appealing.

Pours clear golden with clean billowing head. It dissipates gradually. Fairly thick lacing. 
Burgeoning juicy aroma. Exactly how I need my IPA¬ís. Fresh apricot, grapefruit, with a hint of lemon and floral pangs. A little dash of pine emerges as it warms. Beautiful. 

Taste is more apricot, a touch of citrus and some soft caramel malt. Grapefruit-rind bitterness creeps forward and punctuates the moreish medium-bitter finish. 

My only small qualm is the palate. It feels slightly diluted. Perhaps carbonation needs better integration. My preference is for more creamy IPA¬ís but the filp-side is this mouth-feel suits a more refreshing feel. 

Supreme drinkability nevertheless. A quality, juicy IPA. Really enjoyed it.
Bomber thanks to Chris. Light gold with a beige head. Nice tropical fruit and hops. Malty.
Best IPA yet, need to try Dorado. Great hop smell and hippy taste. Very smooth and great aroma.
Bottle. Pours a clear light amber, golden yellow hues when backlit. Lasting wispy head with lacing. Solid full flavor with dry, bitter finish. From notes 2/15/10.

Smell: Ruby Red Grapefruit, orange, citrus rind, and a touch of pine. Hints of tropical fruit. Pineapple makes a big appearance as it warms. Just a slight touch of booze. Very inviting.

Taste: Lots of sweet grapefruit up front, but remains present throughout. Wave of hop bitterness and big pine comes next, with a finish that reminds me of biting into bitter grapefruit rind. Oily bitterness and dryness lingers afterward.
Bomber thanks to Chris. Light gold with a beige head. Mango and hops. Malty with a medium mouthfeel.

Bottled. Brightn pale amber color, creamy and lacy head. Very fresh and fruity nose. Sweet mango, cataloupe, lemon zest and floeal notes. Dry, pale malt character has minor caramel notes and just a touch of biscuity toast. Crisp, grapefruity bitterness is intese and smooth at the same time. Lingering, slightly resinous but more graperfuity aftertaste. Smooth texture and medium body. Amazingly good IPA. Smooth and intense, dangeroysly drinkable. If it so good after bottling shipping all the way to Finland, how close to perfect it would be in San Diego?
I¬íve had probably over 100 IPAs and this is by far one of my favorites. Wish I could find it sold in more locations

Aroma: Nice grapefruit/lemon hops; herbal, floral. Bread, light caramel malt.
Flavor: Tangerine/grapefruit/citrus rind. Floral, and tongue-numbing hops spiciness. A little bready malt. Moderate bitterness.

Straw yellow color with a little persistent head. Aromas of fruity, aromatic and resinous hops. Flavors of fruity, aromatic, resinous and spicy hops. Couleur jaune paille, petit col de mousse persistant. Ar√¥mes de houblons fruit√©s, aromatiques et r√©sineux. Saveurs de houblons fruit√©s, aromatiques, r√©sineux et √©pic√©s.
Hazy orange brown color with light head. Citrus aroma and balanced taste with some sting. Very good

12 oz. bottle from Bevmo! Appearance: two fingers white head that lasts, great lacing, golden straw, clear. Aroma: grapefruit, floral, caramel, pine resin (all very strong). Palate: light body, average carbonation, bitter finish, sticky texture. Taste: nice light sweetness turning quickly into hop forward bitterness. Overall, great balance, great beer with strong tastes and aromas that compliment nicely and fit like a glove.

Pours a clear golden color with white head. Citrus, pine, grass, and some light fruits on the nose; follows onto the palate. Finishes pretty clean. I don¬ít quite get the hype, it¬ís a decent IPA, but nothing earth shattering.

Clear, deep gold pour with white head. Aroma is citrus, mango, peach, sweet bread. Flavour is fruity with sweet grapefruit, fresh bread. Bitterness rounds out nicely through the palate and finish. Very good.
UPDATED: OCT 21, 2014 All around nice beer. Great after taste. The price tag is a bit steep,but still a beer worth drinking.
Draught.Dark orange colour with White head .Aroma is heavy fruity really exotic frutisbox beer with pine,mango,citrus and nice dry bitter taste of hops and caramel,well balanced and refreshing beer.

UPDATED: FEB 5, 2015 Aroma delicioso y muy refrescante. Notas citricas y a la vez florales, en donde se puede percibirla naranja, lima, mandarina e incluso durazno, mientras que floralmente se perciben notas a pino.

En cuanto a apariencia color naranja claro con destellos opacos cobrizos. Cuerpo de medio a redondo, corona de espuma media de media retenci√≥n , carbonatacion baja.


 En boca sabores frutales, buen equilibrio, ligero amargor.

Al paladar se detectan sabores frutales, principalmente a durazno, un muy buen equilibrio y un final poco amargo, a diferencia de lo que se podr√≠a esperar.

En resumen una buena IPA, con caracteristicas notables agradables, buena apariencia y aroma, muy balanceada, quiza algo carente del notable amargor de las IPAs americanas.
Aroma of citrus zest, small short lasting head, cloudy caramel colour. Bitter hoppy taste with traces of citrus zest and dried fruit. A mildly bitter pleasant citrus rind palate.
UPDATED: MAR 18, 2016 Fantasic beer...full of hops and citrus....a very good ipa...great balance and a nice smooth finish.
Tap at Craftheads. Grassy and citrus hops. Decent bitterness. Not a wow factor for me, but still pretty nice. Slight candy sweetnes, bit of fruit.

Bottle. Pours orange copper with a white head. Aroma of citrus, pine, grapefruit and had some floral notes. Flavor was sweet and bitter with caramel, citrus, light fruit, pine and grapefruit. Medium body, lively carbonation, dry bitter finish.
Golden yellow with a small head. Floral and grapefruit hops aroma. Bitter and astringent flavor, but a bit of misplaced funk. This is quite good, if overrated.

A wonderful IPA!

I first tried this been in bottle, but had it again today on draught. Both have been wonderful experiences. Piney, citrusy, with bitterness on the end note, a lovely feel. Try this beer! I read about this beer before trying it and it is well worth the hype.
El primero en espa√±ol, es una gran cerveza, un aroma incre√≠ble y notas dulces de maracuya, el regusto es un poco amargo pero en general es una gran cerveza.

Clear burnt amber color, moderately frothy white head. Pine, herbal, caramel malt, and perhaps a little citrus. Resinous bitterness throughout. Smooth, a bit oily, and leaves a somewhat astringent finish.

There are aromas of apricot, mango, a small scent of lemon and other hops. It is golden in color, light carbonation, with some lacing with a white head. The taste is a combination of hops, apricot flavors, and a hint of lemon with a crisp biting finish.

Bottle from DandyWolfFloyd, thank you sir! Pours a slightly hazy golden hue with a white head. Aromas of citrus peel and some nice floral notes. Flavor is grapefruit peel at first with a nice resinous hop character in the finish. This beer deserves the reputation it has for sure. A very nice hoppy IPA. Definitely interested in trying others from this brewery!
Nearly perfect. Surprised at the lighter color and small head but lacing and retention is impressive. Lemon dominates for both aroma and flavors. Bitterness is well done and not too overwhelming.

@Basunen: trevlig men n√•got diskret doft. Ok smak men ganska len sm√• frukt och humletoner. Tr√∂tt?

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bue √† la pression. Classique IPA avec toutefois des notes de fruits jaunes et de sucr√©.
Bottle from Target. Aromas of tropical fruit, leaves, hint of honey. Taste is sweet and bitter, with very long length.
UPDATED: AUG 4, 2014 wow. grapefruit, pine, sweet citrus, mango, light malts, just a fantastic IPA. color is golden amber, nice off white head, great lacing.
Bottle. One of the best. Pours pretty clear orange golden color. Nose is juicy tropical fruit and pineapple. Maybe some pine in the aftertaste.

12 oz. bottle. Pours clear golden orange with a white head. Big citrus pop on the nose with orange and grapefruit, piney resiny hops. Flavor has citrusy sweetness up front with a big piney bitterness on the back of the tongue. Nice spiciness with the hops to give an extra kick and plenty of earthy sweet malt to tame it a bit. A bit if an alcohol kick on the way down. Good IPA, but a bit overrated.
Clear orange. White foam. Sweet grape fruit on the nose. Lots of bitter grape fruit and grassy harsh hops. Medium body. Very nice but a little too harsh for my taste.
Tasty IPA. Floral / citrus aroma. Nice bite from the hops in the first mouthful which smooths out over subsequent quaffs.
UPDATED: JUN 9, 2014 Nice orangey/amber color. Piney, citrusy and hoppy aroma with a hint of sweet. Taste is smooth, hops and citrus. A great IPA. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Very complex for a single IPA. Mango, watermelon and grapefruit on the tongue with a nice bracing bitter aftertaste. You can really taste the quality ingredients and the time taken to brew this right. Almost worth the $13 per six pack price. At $10 or under this would be the perfect beer.
Surpringly light. The gold of a rich lager. Nice maltiness. Malt lingers. Hop bitterness is aggressive but not harsh. Very good.

Golden clear, white foam. Aroma of tropical fruit, papaya and mango. Fantastic! Long and global mouth: malt notes, bread and grassy notes!!! Fantastic!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle from MSM. Pours a hazy orange. Thin white head. Scent is nice and hoppy. Taste is hops and mango. Good stuff.

Mango, grapefruit, kiwi, sweet resiny aroma. Cloudy honey gold with a thick foamy white head that sticks around for quite a while. Lots of grapefruit. But not so bitter that it's overpowering. This is very well balanced and very smooth. It has a crisp finish but then a bit of an after-warmth in the throat. Pretty good stuff.

Enjoy the slight dank hop aroma. Copper color with a decent head. Crisp and moderately light palate. High carbonation. Prominent bitterness up front that was slightly harsh.has a crisp malty caramel background. Well balanced over 7% ABV. Nice balance tward hoppy. not real available in my area,goes fast!

Pours copper orange, light haze, light white head. Aroma is full of fruit, pineapple, citrus, mango, light spruce. Infinitely drinkable, juicy, light sweetness, above mentioned fruits continue through to the taste, finishes up medium bitter.. orange rind. Medium body / carbo. Love how good this is, despite being fairly "available".
Sample at Malm√∂ beer- and whiskey festival. One of the best West-Coast IPAs i¬íve tried, what sets it apart is the rare and perfect balance between demanding hops and malt-base.

Enjoyed it. Pleasant hoppy aroma of floral and pine. Copper color with a decent head. Crisp and moderately light palate. High carbonation. Prominent bitterness up front that was slightly harsh. This moved into a crisp malty caramel background. Well balanced and felt sessionable even though it is over 7% ABV. Nicely done.

Aroma: grassy hops, flowers, light citrus. 
Appearance: dark gold, medium creamy white head. 
Taste:medium sweet. 
Palate: sweets turn to hoppy, flowery and grassy bitters, average-long finish. 
Overall: well balanced IPA, subtle aroma and palate. Pint at Akkurat, Stockholm.
UPDATED: APR 10, 2015 This is a great IPA! Bitter but still fruity. Great with spicy salsa. Refreshing. Apricot and grapefruit hoppy taste. Dry, but still quenching. Must try!

I¬íve been fairly impressed with the offerings from Ballast Point that I¬íve been able to try so far. It¬ís newer to me, but good beer. The aroma is booming with fruity hop smells of peaches, mango, lemon, and grapefruit. Had a nice golden tone to it with some haze. Some sweetness to start followed by a good medium bitter. If you haven¬ít had a chance to try Ballast Point, I suggest you do.
Light amber with a fine white head. Powerful aroma: pine, bubble gum, pineapple, tropical. Tons of bright and crisp hop flavour, dry clean hop finish. Exceptionally beautiful west coast IPA.
Cerveja muito equilibrada, com √°lcool e l√∫pulo harmonizando muito bem. Perfeita para acompanhamento de carnes vermelhas.
Too strong and too bitter for my standards so I can recognize its craftyness but not that fine neither.

A- Pours a golden hue with a nice, 2 finger, frothy off white head that is extremely chunky.

S- Deep citrus fruits, mango, floral notes, grapefruit.

T- Starts off light, floral hops, lots of grapefruit and tangerine on the back end with a deep bitterness.

M- Medium bodied with carbonation that is a little too low.

D- Very easy to drink. One of the best smelling IPAs out there. at 8.99 a bomber for an IPA it¬ís definitely a once in a while thing.
Pours clear gold. Has a sweet citrus and floral hop aroma. Has a malty start but a very hoppy taste that leaves a very bitter hoppy aftertaste.
Very well balanced, not to hoppy American West Coast IPA. Lots of tropical fruit. Why is not the yeast inclueded?

Pours with a nice greenish white head, great retention. Hop nose very stark with lemon and spice. Hopiness is over done and bites too hard. Cohumulone? It¬ís a great beer, but a stomach ache and hop toxicity may limit long term enjoyment,

Bottle, many thanks to StefanSD. L√°hev 355 ml. A: Red amber, transparent. S: Pine, tints of other hop aromas. T: After very short malt start, some herbs, grass, bitterness. Ends very bitter, with some liquorice at the end. M: Medium to deep. O: Decent American IPA.

I've had this before, but as I sit here waiting for my takeout order, sipping on a draught flute of Sculpin, I'm turned to write a review. I don't find this beer to be outstanding in any one area, and yet it is very good in all areas. The balance of citrus and sweet, with bitterness and malty dryness is fantastic. The beer is not heavy but does have a thickness towards the end, as the grapefruit-rind bitterness sneaks out and spreads into a thin, yet ever-present layer of ending flavor. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at WilliamK, Helsinki. Pours cloudy golden with a big frothy head. Aroma is rich in tropical fruitiness; peach, passion and orange mix, also some pine and floral notes. Taste is initially sweet, but hoppy bitterness appears in the middle and the finish is typically dry and very bitter. Rich exotic fruitiness dominates the taste with at least peach, apricot and mango featuring with the usual citrus. The palate is medium bodied and slick. Overall this is a very rich and varied IPA with strong tropical fruitiness.

Tap at the Rover, Gothenburg. Poured a clear light amber with a frothy white head and some broken lace. The aroma is grassy hop. The flavour is medium to strong bitter with a spicy pepper nettle hop light alcohol palate. Medium bodied with average carbonation. An excellent super hoppy session beer.

Beautiful IPA, light amber color with a huge citrus aroma. taste is citrusy, floral, but balanced and delicious with a dry bitter, but not overdone finish. Not usually available in rural MN, very glad I got to try this one!
Bottle. Dark straw color with a white head. Aromas of pine resins and floral hops. Big pine/citrus hop flavor. One of my favorites.

UPDATED: MAY 27, 2016 355ml bottle (Kitty¬ís, Helsinki) (5:3:5:3:10=2.6)
Woh, cabbage aroma?!?! Onion. Stinky dishcloth. Simple palate. Stick, forced carbonation. One-dimensional resiny bitterness. No depth, sweet malts, flavourless bitterness. Everything that is wrong about modern IPA. No balance, no drinkability, no integration of the flavours. If another ticker had appeared, I would immediately have offered my glass. I can finish this, but I¬íd rather give it away. Give me something tasty instead, I¬íd rather the spring onions in my salad.
Rerate: 355 bottle (5:3:5:2:11=2.6)
Sweet, slightly stinky hop aroma. Ditto taste. Really not not much better than before. Harsh palate.

Growler from the Beer Growler in Alpharetta. Pours a light orange, with a big, foamy, off-white head. The aroma is pine, resin, tangerine, straw, and light biscuit dough. Mellow bitterness, with a surprisingly sweet backbone. Medium body, sticky, and lightly effervescent. This is a flavorful, well-balanced, and drinkable IPA. Very nice!

Light orange, a little hazy, and a little more than a finger of white head. Awesome sweet fruit aroma of peach, apricot, pineapple, mango, orange. Taste has a nice shot of bitterness on the tongue and then the fruity hops take over. It¬ís near perfect on the palate, light on the malt and hop forward. Great IPA!

Clear copper colour with foamy big head on top and its lasts relatively long time. Leaves beautiful lacing. Aroma has grapefruits, citrus, pines and some caramel sweetness. A typical West Coast here. Taste has quite much caramel malts, pines, grapefruits and some other sweeter fruits. Body is surprisingly full and carbonation is medium-to-light. Slightly sweeter IPA, but definitely an excellent beer in the West Coast style.

Very tasty IPA. Not as fruity as advertised at the establishment I tasted it in. Excellent hop character. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Heard rave reviews about this and had to give it a go. Clear, golden pour with a nice, sticky head. Nose is packed with citrus and pine notes. The flavor keeps up where the nose left off, lots of citrus and dry, earthy hops permeating throughout. Can¬ít say I¬ím disappointed from what I have heard about this brew, it is solid through and through.

Really amazing IPA. Tons of piney citrus on the nose, followed by a crisp taste featuring the same flavors. Nice light copper color with a hearty lasting head. Super beer

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a clear caramel with a light foamy head. Strong aroma of grains and a hops. Very light and dry, with distinct aftertaste of grains and hops that is not to bitter. More drinkable than other IPA,s of its kind with a brighter crisp taste instead of a harsh earthiness. It almost has a fruity taste as you keep drinking, a menagerie of flavors but none of them fading to a flat aftertaste, it doesn¬ít leave much of a bitterness in your palate like "other" IPA,s. Its damn good and drinkable.

On tap at Henry√¢¬Ä¬ôs. FINALLY getting to try this. Pours a clear gold with a white cap settling to a thin blanket. Aroma of salt, pine, citrus rind, toffee. Taste is sweet and bitter. Creamy, long dry finish.On tap at Henry¬ís.

FINALLY getting to try this. Pours a clear gold with a white cap settling to a thin blanket. Aroma of salt, pine, citrus rind, toffee, fruit. Taste is sweet and bitter. Creamy, long dry finish.

Orange beer with a medium foamy white head that is actually pretty dense. Citrusy nose with grapefruit, orange, peach, and pear. Flavor has a bracing hop bite with some bright fruit notes reminiscent of the nose with the addition of some pine resin and pith, but overall it¬ís not really that bitter for an IPA. I would have liked a little more prominent malt profile to balance it out a bit. Still, it¬ís a refreshing, drinkable beer that is certainly worth your time.

Bottle @ Kitty¬ís, Helsinki, 12/03/14. Pours orange with a small, white head. Aroma is grapefruit, grapefruit peel, some exotics. Taste is grapefruit, pine, conifer. Mostly grapefruit. Some pineapple, decent caramel. Fairly light with some carbonation. An alright American IPA, but a disappointment after all the heaps of adoration. Big Eye was better.
very nice IPA, has a strong grapefruit presence and a nice bite, all while having a nice clean finish that has you sipping for more

UPDATED: FEB 10, 2015 Man, this beer is SO over rated. I don¬ít understand the hype behind it. It tastes very similar to a Lagunitas Hop Stoopid IPA, yet at TWICE THE PRICE! WHAT?! 

Frankly, if you¬íre that curious, buy a 22oz bottle. I wouldn¬ít shell out $16 for a six pack. That was one of the most retarded purchase of my life. If it was closer to $10, I probably would have rated this better.

(Bottle, 0.355 l - bottled on Jan 8 2014, at Kaisla, 20140311) The beer poured amber and clear. Its head was medium sized, white and it lasted long. Aroma had pine, citricness, fruitiness and malts. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours had tangerine, fruitiness, pine, sweetness, malts and biterness. Aftertaste had tangerine, citricness and biterness. The many different flavours were well balanced and the aftertaste lasted long. Very well done brew.
What can i say. Best IPA out there. Nice bite, drinkable, & clean bright flavors.

Bottle. Pours golden brown with a big clingy white head. Aroma of caramel, cereal, citrus. Taste follows nose. Ends with grapefruit pel bitterness. Probably a bit old. Ballast Point should date the bottles.

This beer has an absolutely fantastic nose. It is just exceptionally bright and brilliant w/ juicy citrus and nectarine aromas from the hops. It looks pretty decent too w/ a clear orange color and a large head of mixed sized bubbles. It¬ís bit sweet which emphasizes the fruit flavors from the hops as does the creamy texture. Perhaps this could use a touch more bitterness but that is only a small complaint. It finishes medium long w/ a lingering iced-tea like astringency on the tongue. This is a great IPA, cleanly brewed and w/ tons and tons of hop aroma for the ¬íheads.
Fantastic IPA. Citrus and grapefruit in the nose, great aroma. Taste is more citrus, slight fruity bitterness but not overpowering. Great drinking IPA, probably one of the best I've had.
Citrus aroma with a good foam. Orange slighty hazy color. Light to medium body, smooth bitter at first with a dry end requering another drink. Amazing taste & drinkability.

On tap at Duke¬ís, Malibu. Hot damn, this is a nice beer. Great aroma kicking my nose, nice great balance with malt. Alcohol is well hidden. I slurped two of these down in a hurry and would have had more but I was driving. Yummm0.
Bottle pour. A little underwhelmed by this, given the hype. Has a unique taste but a somewhat weak body. I don¬ít even know if i¬íd call it an IPA. Not bad though.

Clear golden pour, with just a touch of amber, coupled with a very nice head and long lasting lacing. The nose is a complex blend of grapefruit, mango and other sweet tropicals against a subtle spruce. Light medium body with a smooth texture. The carbonation level is a touch above normal. The outstanding flavor profile is expertly complex and follows the nose. Grapefruit leads then flows into the sweeter hop flavors. In the middle the biscuit malt comes through against a subtle spruce flavor. The finish effervesces into a grapefruit bitter tartness over a caramel sweetness. This is an outstanding complex hop flavor bomb.

355ml bottle shared with Charly and Finn. Dotted spots on the glassware from a persistent, bubbly, off-white head. Cloudy apricot coloured body. Hop fruity aroma containing grapefruits and lemon. Fruity taste of ripe orange, apricot, and pumpkin. Bittersweet citrus peels to the ending. Medium plus bodied. Good drinking (Troms√∏ 19.02.2014).

Pint on tap. I¬íve wanted to try this beer for a while, happy to find it finally. It pours a rich copper color with a big head and very good lacing. The aroma is rich, super-fresh. Taste is good, palate is just a little bit weak. It¬ís closer to a double-IPA in my opinion. Very decent.

This beer has a great floral aroma. The hoppy taste is strong but has a clean crisp finish. Definitely worth every high rating I've seen in the past. I tried it on draft and in cans and both had similar flavors.
Great ipa maybe one of the best ever but price is a little to high even for a world class ipa
This is a near perfect beer. Smell and taste the fruit. Apricot holds true to the description. Great tasting IPA but don¬ít be deceived. This is not your typical IPA. This one is a rarity.

Flaske 0,355l fra Systembolaget Lule√•, Storheden. Delt med Rune & Charly under samling p√• Nerstranda 19 Feb 14. Aprikosfarget. Uklar. Bra kremaktig skum. God aroma av frukt-tyggegummi. Smaken er s√∏t frukt. Banan & fersken. Avslutter litt syrlig & bittert. T√∏rr ettersmak.
On Tap at Frisco Grille. Amber with white head. Citrus aroma with notes of Mango. BIg citrus flavor with tropical fruits flavors.
I think this is a fine IPA but doesn¬ít really stand out in any one way to me. A bit expensive too
I know this is a quality ipa but just isn¬ít for me. Tooo much grapefruit and hops. Citrus aroma. Pale pour. Minimal malt. Hops aren¬ít crazy overpowering but they are bitter and long lasting
Bottle from Lazy Dog. Pours a transparent orange with a ring of cream colored head. Aroma of floral hops and grapefruit. Taste of upfront bitterness that has an undercurrent of citrus throughout.
Lots of grapefruit in this one. Bitter citrus hops, caramel, orange, tart fruit and pine with undertones of bread. Well balanced and a dry finish. Lives up to its reputation as a world class IPA
Excellent IPA. Perfect balance of hops and malt. Would love to have an unfiltered version.

355 ml bottle from Aeon Liquors, Jiyugaoka. Pours light amber, clear, with a small white head. Aroma is not too strong, has some nice hop fragrance, also abundance of fruitiness - there are mangoes, peach, melons and some other tropical fruits inside this glass! Taste is fruity at first, coming together with some carbonation. Oily resins and pine needles emerge, also bitter grapefruit seeds - and then it all comes down in long, dry and serious hop bitterness. As if I had a mouthful of quinine, nothing else than bitterness - in a pleasant way. Definitely a good IPA, and presumably on of the best in the world. My personal taste is a bit towards IPA¬ís with a bit more body - but I admit that hops are very well presented here.
Received in a trade from Jason! Been drinking so skipping to my overall, amazingly solid IPA, nothing gimmicky, just plain good. Want more.
Great beer! Smooth and fruity. A bit of peach flavor in this one. Pour is beautiful with a thin white head. Aroma is light and hoppy.

My my my..... I could smell this thing all day. Unbelievable. I wish it tasted as good as it smells. Flavor is still good however a slight letdown compared to the aroma. Very easy on the palate and one 12 oz bottle out of the 6¬íer disappears very quick, almost too quick. A very easy drinking IPA. Flavor is good, a little too resiny on my opinion and a slightly off aftertaste but good nonetheless. Gonna knock it down a notch or two overall simply because while it is a very good IPA for the price I¬ím paying for this 6 pack(recently available in GA) I expect to be blown away. Way overpriced. A great beer yes, but in a field filled with numerous solid IPA¬ís the price is just a little too steep. A great beer nonetheless.

Lite orange color, white head. Aroma of mango and grapefruit. Flavor is super fresh grapefruit (as if it was picked from the tree). Not a typical west coast IPA, the bitterness is friendly and balanced. Lives up to the hype.

On tap poured into a 4 oz sampler. The aroma is that of summer fruits and citrus - grapefruit, peaches, mango. It pours a clear, sparkling pale-orange color with a white head that disappears after awhile, but leaves an excellent lacing. Medium, smooth bitterness is accompanied by a light sweetness. The medium bodied beer is thin-ish but smooth in texture and has a high level of soft carbonation. Mellow citrus and caramel malt gives way to a sharp grapefruit and pine finish. The pine quality sticks around in the aftertaste with a bit of a resin touch.

UPDATED: FEB 18, 2016 First bottling, fresh (wanna say Summer 2006?)Peachy-golden body is clear (filtered, not bottle conditioned) with a moderate white head showing modest retention.Very interesting nose is full of a unique mix of yellow fruits (lots of peach, apricot and orange) with pink grapefruit and just a touch of pine on the end. Light honeyed maltiness sits in the background and the beer is clean and free of alcohol vapors. Aroma strength is high and eminently sniffable.The flavor, however, is where it shines even more. That same unique yellow fruits-meets-light citrus, with a strong, but not overwhelming bitterness and quite a bit of maltiness to balance. The peach-apricot flavor slowly turns in to the citrus-pine flavor, and not until the end, which I thought was the best part of the beer. Plus, the hop flavor is very very rich and fresh. Mouthfeel is probably the weakest link. Although it¬ís substantially malty, the lack of bottle conditioning makes it a touch watery/loose. Still, a phenomenal beer when you thought it¬ís all been done in the IPA category. 8/3/9/4/18Fresh on draught, late 2013Hmmm, I¬íve had this two or three times now, looking for the experience of having the original batches but it keeps coming up very short. Of course, hop availability changes, and even moreso, hop quality varies from year to year, but these drafts didn¬ít seem any where near what it used to be. Lots more piney bitterness, not overwhelming, but still quite forceful. Too much sweetness and actually too much body. Just seems like a forceful, classless double IPA with tons of malt and hop acid. Sharp and biting on the finish, with some alcohol sting/burn, as well. Still some traces of the peachy-apricot notes, but nothing like I remember. Score is for most recent sample.

Aroma - malt is caramel; the hops are resiny, floral, and citrus filled - also fruity with mango, and peach. There is also a little wet leather yeast aroma.
Apperance - body color is an orange amber; liquid is crystal clear; the head is frothy white and beautiful.
Taste - the taste is really excellent - the bitterness is medium - there is a real nice compliment of a caramel malt body with full hop assertiveness and some really nice fruit elements most notably peach, mango, and lemon
Palate - body is medium; texture is slick and somewhat oily; the carbonation is lively; the finish is bitter with a long hop bite

Bodacious! Lovely IPA!
Great aroma of peach and mango, big creamy white head flavors of citrus and lemon grass. With a beautiful amber hazy color .

12 oz bottle from New Seasons - Golden orange with a white head. Aromas of citrus, perhaps a little peach. Great balance between the bitter hops and enough malt backbone to keep it interesting. This is a really good beer.

12oz bottle poured into a tulip glass.
Almost clear golden color with a nice rocky and steady white head (good lace).
Rich tropical fruits aroma, with citrus notes (mandarin), spices (ginger) and flowers.
Intense hop flavors, big tropical goodness, high bitterness, decent sweet malts and faint alcohol notes.
Med-full body, good carbonation, long bitter finish, a bit too heavy but yummy. Cool.

Yellow with a white head. Nose is floral hop. Taste is mildly bitter, but very well-balanced. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Perfect combination of citrus and bitter. Pours well with a small head and average carbonation. Great starting and finishing flavor. Ballast Point really outdid themselves on their version of the IPA. Highly recommended, but it needs to be fresh. Noticeable dropoff of flavor two months in. But that¬ís probably to be expected.

Tasty... Smooth... With a hoppy and bitter finish. Very drinkable and tasty

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours hazy golden amber color. One finger diminishing head. Moderate carbonation. Aroma of strong grapefruit and other citrusy fruit. Tastes just like it smells. Loads if grapefruit and hops up front with a crisp finish and smooth mouth feel.

Draft. Tap takeover at Original Gravity during SF beer week. Pours half way between gold and orange. Loads of grapefruit. Orange. Bitter grapefruit and rind hops. Aroma is the same. There seems to be some peach in both the aroma and the flavor.

12oz bottle from Brewmaster¬ís in Wilson. Golden hue, normal clarity with mostly diminishing white fizzy head. Virtually no lacing. Aroma of grapefruit, citrus & lemon. Heavy bitter grapefruit hop up front with more of an average bitter orange-citrus finish. Crisp on the palate. I thought this was a solid IPA, my favorite beer from Ballast Point so far.

Pours goldish honey in a snifter with a finger of fizzy white head. 

Grapefruit, mango, and other citrus fruits in the aroma along with peachy hops (amarillo?). My favorite type of hops.

Light citrus and mango flavor that blends nicely into a hop bitterness bite after the swallow. Really well done. Balanced, not overpowering like other top quality IPAs.

I love the palate of this one. Not syrupy like some IPAs tend to be but fizzy and thin, which is pleasing. Refreshing. 

Easily one of the best IPAs I¬íve had. Lives up to the hype.

Keg at Deep Ellum with my dinner. Pours a crystal clear golden amber, nice half inch white head that holds nicely, and leaves excellent lacing. Very piney nose, with plenty accompanying fruitiness - grapefruit and papaya to the fore. Some nice light caramel maltiness present too. A delicate caramel malt sweetness is followed by a pretty prominent hop bite, with nice citric flavour. Dry finish, very dry in fact, with a slightly unpleasant yeasty aftertaste, that lasts. Nice prickly carbonation, medium body and a decent boozy presence make up for it though. Not as overwhelmingly complex as I expected, but pretty darn good as far as ipa goes.

Ticked this before but never rated. Not sure why. I¬íve had cases before and two kegs of it. Funny how that happens. Pour is orange in color, always a nice generous white to off-white colored head, solid retention, some ringed lacing too. The aroma is citrus, pine, tropical fruits, faint spicey notes. Flavor follows, grapefruit rind-like bitterness, the tropical, peachy lighter fruits (berries even?) all do wonders for this thing. Darn, this thing is beautifully bitter at the same time. Full body, moderate carbonation. A delight, a studly IPA, among my top 3 or 5 area-obtainable IPAs in life.... ever....

Awesome draft at the tipsy crow, San Diego and further, this orange nectar was my ruin in San Diego! With it¬ís lovely citrus notes and full on tropical harmony together with a good strong hop kick! Lovely beer!
12 oz. bottle pours orange, strong citrus mix grapefruit / mango with a crisp finish. A great beer!

Purchased in six pack can form at Bottles & Cans in Chicago, IL; enjoyed at home on a cold early February Friday night while watching An Idiot Abroad, which is pretty hilarious. This stuff is a pretty impressive IPA. Appearance is a rather clear gold with a rich carbonated white head that nicely dissipates. Aroma is light but potent, filled with apricot and peach notes, along with light citrus and bready characteristics, relatively delicate. Taste goes down with lightly tart notes and a nice bitterness, an incredible easy drinker, which is rare for an IPA which is quickly becoming one of my lesser favorite brews...but this one brings back my appreciation for the style. Great great brew here!

Pours a clear orange, looks like your typical IPA. Very pleasant fruity floral aroma. Taste is sweet malts with solid hop backbone. Some citrus in their but the fruitiness wins out with this beer, which I love. I love my IPAs fruity. I usually don¬ít have a sophisticated enough palate to distinguish certain flavors, but with this beer I was very easily able to distinguish peach/apricot, mango and a hint of pineapple. Fantastic, just fantastic. I think this will be my go to IPA.

To date my favorite ipa when fresh. I say when fresh cause we hardly ever get it fresh in NJ. When fresh the bitter, flavor, aroma combo is near perfect. As it ages the bitterness starts to become to much

Pours a golden honey color with a frothy cream-colored head. Nice retention and great lacing. Aroma is apricot, pineapple, honey, peach, tangerine, and floral notes; a pleasant aroma that¬ís very inviting. This beer is very crisp and refreshing. Flavor starts off with nice sweet citrusy notes, tangerine, mango, and pineapple, followed up by the perfect amount of hoppiness and spice as it lingers on the tongue. This is as perfectly balanced an IPA I¬íve ever had. Mouthfeel is thinner than you¬íd expect for an IPA with this flavor profile. Usually they are a little on the thicker and more syrupy side. This one isn¬ít, and that¬ís not a bad thing at all. It¬ís perfectly carbonated and the thinner mouthfeel just adds to the experience as it¬ís plays off that crisp and refreshing aspect of the beer that makes it a homerun in the aroma and flavor department. Overall this might very well be the best IPA I¬íve ever tried. It¬ís different than I expected, but in a very good way. I love this beer. If you like IPAs, this is a must buy.

Strong citrusy grapefruit aroma. This IPA is smooth for 7% ABV with an amazing hop flavor throughout. One of the better IPA's I've tried. Amazingly citrusy.

Appearance: Very bubbly, with a bright orange hue. Looks very refreshing.

Smell: Citrusy and tropical. Very appealing.

Taste: Hops were surprisingly sharp up front, given the aroma, but not in an offensive way. Just more punch to this beer than the smell would imply.

Drinkability: Very tasty and drinkable. I love the art and the tone it sets with the beer. A tough IPA with big hops.

Poured from a 12 oz. bottle. Golden orange in color. Tons of citrus and hops on the nose. Great balance between sweet fruit flavors - apricot, lemon - and hoppy bitterness. Fizzy feel on the tongue. You cannot do better for a wide release DIPA.

From 12oz bottle. Pours clear golden color with a big white head. There¬ís a big hit of tropical fruits at the nose, a really inviting smell. 1 Feb 2014, tap. yellow, clear, steady bubbles. nose is pine and light lemon rind hops. Thin body and mildly fizzy. tastes of lemon pith, slightly oily. pretty good for a west coast ipa. hops aren¬ít too huge and bitterness doesn¬ít really linger. nice.

Great big citrus hop aroma, just what I would expect from a West Coast Double IPA, only better! All of those wonderful tropical fruits came alive, Mango, Apricot, Stone Fruit. Sampled at STL Hops 6th Anniversary Party - Finally got to try this winner. Pours clear golden with a small white head. The aroma has toasty caramel malt, pine, fruitiness and citrus. Wow so delicious. Aromas bursting of citrus and other fruit, hops and more hops. Pours a nice amber color with a big white head. Flavors are fruity and hoppy but balanced out nicely with caramel malt. Definitely pretty bitter but not overpowering. A little fizzy. A masterpiece of a beer.

Tap. 12 oz pour in tulip. Gold. 1 finger head with good lacing. Very nice and clean aroma. Crisp and clean mouthfeel. 12oz can to Sierra Nevada IPA glass

A - Brassy golden body, crystal clear, firm 2 finger off-white head. Textbook retention and lacing showing off.

S - Awesome bouquet of citrus aroma. Grapefruit, apricot, spicy, light bready malt. Yeast comes out more as it sets. The aroma is spot on. A harmonious balance of hops, yeast and malt.

T - Spicy grapefruit bitterness right off the top. Bright and clean. Sweet and bitter grapefruit flesh morphs into resinous grapefruit rind bitterness toward the end. Citrus, pineapple, and, stone unripened stone fruit dominate the palate. It has a simple sweetness that plays off the hops wonderfully. Semi grainy malts add just enough backbone to support the strong citrus hops. Finishes crisp and clean with a long bitter aftertaste.

M - Medium full body, low to medium carbonation, smooth with a very clean finish.

This might be the best IPA I¬íve had to date. It is clean, precise, and executed almost flawlessly. It¬ís bursting with hop flavor and bitterness without being over the top which is hard to come by. The layering of flavors are very impressive. As of right now this is my favorite IPA to date. This 6pack was 15.99 but worth every penny.

Serving type: can

11-01-2013

The pale amber color and a clear body were typical of the West Coast style of IPA. The smell was a mix of pine and grapefruit, with some tangerine thrown in too. Taste was spicy, piney, bitter, and out-freaking-standing. Just exactly what a juicy IPA should be. Medium body and a slippery mouthfeel fit the style perfectly. A bit of sugary sweetness in the finish to complement the bitterness. Drinkable beyond words, Can I have another please.

12oz into a glass, pours a beautiful orange rose amber with sunshine ringing through. Head is fresh and bubbly, lacing is plentiful and sticky with a 2-3cm top that covers. Aroma is pine, lemon, citurs melodies, resin, and some peach vareities. Taste has a sweet mango/pineapple freshness to it that comes up first, then mixes in the nice hops that sprout all over the tounge, freshness ensues, pine, sap, grapefruit, fresh cut grass, and then somewhat bitter on the after taste. This is a wonderful ipa, brilliant, just brilliant.

Comes out of the tap a clear golden with a nice pale buff head. Aroma is seriously hoppy, mostly evergreen, with woody and fruity hints. Flavor - WOO WEE, hoppy from here to the South Pole! This beer pours out a pale orange with a white head and lots of bubbles. Aromas of weed, grapefruit, and alcohol. I like the flavor a lot more, waves of every kinds of citrus fruit I can think of. Delicious and refreshing, it showcases what you can do with hop aromatics and flavors over hop bitterness.

Pours a clear, dark golden colour with a one finger, slightly off-white head that leaves nice lacing. Aroma is noticeable. Big notes of pine needles, resin, citrus, and a hint of tropical fruits like mango, and some herbalness. Taste is bitter but delicious. Starts out with pungent pine and herbal notes laced over a bready backbone then moves to some citrus/tropical notes, then ends is a big, resiny, bitter finish. Medium body and carbonation. Resiny texture in the mouth with a dry finish and a soft carbonation that keeps it very drinkable. Overall very nice. A lot of flavours blended with a solid bitterness. Not for the faint of heart but very delicious if you enjoy the hops. Would buy again for sure. Cheers!
This beer is freaking great. Strong hoppy flavor, nice bite in the middle of the taste, and smells wonderful! This is a must drink beer!

The beer pours a dark golden copper color with tinges of orange. It produces a nice three finger off white head that dissipates rather quickly into a nice layer covering the beer and running around the edge of the glass. Big aroma on this. An immediate dankness rose up from the glass. I got hints of pine, with citrus, mild grapefruit with a hint of lemon. I also got big tropical fruits, definitely some mango. Maybe a hint of peach and a dash of apricot. There is also some nice malty sweetness coming through that masks the alcohol nicely. Starts off very soft on the palate. Not a ton of carbonation to speak of. A lot more lemon on the taste. Picking up a bit more peach and apricot on the palate as well. Middle of the mouth the bitterness comes back into play, some of that piney grapefruit. Slightly sweet towards the back and it finishes very clean. Not really any trace of the alcohol. The body on this is medium light to medium. It¬ís a rather crisp beer. Some lacing left on the glass. A nice west coast IPA.

Canned 6/26/13 and picked up at The Beer Temple in Chicago. Oh, how I¬ím looking forward to this...

Appearance: Pours with a massive four finger soapy head that stays for quite awhile. Sculpin has a pretty clear light amber color. The lacing is fantastic. Excellent looking IPA.

Smell: Grass and peaches are the two things that I get most. There is also a slight citrus note in there as well. Really does smell nice.

Taste: Quite a lot like the aroma, really. Kind of tastes like a ripe peach at first, and the medium feel of Sculpin gives that impression even more. There¬ís then a bitterness on the middle of the tongue, with a sticky, dry, piney and bitter finish. The aftertaste is just lingering pine and peach bitterness that I love. Sculpin¬ís an excellent name for this IPA, especially as it warms up. After being out for about ten minutes, the bitterness intensifies, and the alcohol becomes traceable. 

Canned and put onto my tastebuds here in Michigan just 12 days later. A six-pack ran me $14 or $15, which is definitely kind of steep (considering I can get a sixer of Two Hearted for $10), but this has an excellent bitter pine and peach flavor that I thoroughly enjoy. If this were available in Michigan, I¬íd definitely pick it up from time-to-time... even with the slightly higher price point.

The taste is nice, you can notice that some maltiness is there but it is only in the background and just enough to carry the hops. Just as the maltiness in an IPA should be. The bitterness is nice and pretty round and smooth. 
The body is light to medium, the carbination average and the finish is pretty long with the nice bitterness from the taste. The palate is okey but I prefer my IPAs lighter and more carbonated.
It is a relly nice IPA. It would be interesting to try this in USA to get it really fresh, ¬ícause even if it is good it still has nothing on some locally produced IPAs we get fresh here in sweden

This is my second tasting of this beer. First time was in Las Vegas at the Freakin Frog. This time was in Sweden from Systembolaget (Oct 4. 2013). Aroma is citrus and hops. Quite light and fresh. Color is light amber and a 2-3 cm fading head. Taste is good. Lots of mango, citrus, tropical fruits. Very nice. Quite light on the malty side. Some sweetness and a rather strong bitter finish. Just a little to bitter to find the perfect balance in my opinion. This is a very good beer, but there are better. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Systembolaget, best before June 2014 . Clear dark golden with a dense white head, leaving a nice lacing on the side of the glass. Aroma has pine, resin, grapefruit light red berries. Taste is bitter with a light sweet malty and red berries note. Medium dry bitter piney finish. Medium body and a light sticky carbonation.

Pours a nice bright gold with a small white head. Really looks good.

Smells of a west coast style IPA. Citrus/Grapefruit/Pine all hit your nose with a gusto. A little grassy too.

Piney hop burst up front. Then the malts become slightly detectable while finishing with a lingering dry bitterness. 

Mouthfeel is fairly light with good carbonation levels.

Sculpin has a reputation as one of the best West Coast IPA¬ís and doesn¬ít disappoint. The only knock is I would¬íve liked a little bit more grapefruitiness to balance out the piney resin, but a small nitpick at that as this beer is still good, just not elite.
Alla spina. Una delle migliori IPA assaggiate negli States, aroma di frutta tropicale, freschissima e intensa. Al palato ancora frutta fresca, esotica, pompelmo, kiwi e finale amaro ma non eccessivo.

4 finger beige head that sank to 6 mm, amber body. Nose: Peach, passionfruit, kiwi, starfruit, green pepper, melon and oranges. Aroma: Oranges, grapefruit, resin, cookies, starfruit, passionfruit, kiwi, caramel, green pepper and melon. Semi-long, semi-bitter ending.
Extremely floral, loads of citrus but yet very well balanced. Given in trade from Vikingguy - excellent brew - can see why it rates so high. Will search this out!

Released today, october 1:st, in Sweden.
Golden color with a 2 finger high, white, head.
Nose: Grapefruit, lemon, pine, apricot, tropical fruit and caramel.
Taste: Smooth taste of hops, grass, pine, mango and a lot of tropical fruits.
Body: A great smooth body with a little bitter taste at the end. Perfectly balanced! A really great brew!
UPDATED: OCT 19, 2013 B√§rnstensf√§rgad med mellanstort ljust skum! Annanas tropiska frukter i doft och smak! Lite f√∂r s√∂t i smaken pga av all malt!
This is probably my favorite IPA. The taste has a nice hop bite but still with a wonderful full mouth and smooth finish. Yum.

Det h√§r √§r bra, otroligt bra, aromen √§r att d√∂ f√∂r och smaken f√∂ljer upp smaken p√• ett exemplariskt s√§tt. Smaken bar toner av grapefrukt, mango och aprikos, kroppen var stabil men balansen gjorde mig lite besviken.

Bottle 33 cl from Systembolaget. Clear orange with a nice white head. Lots of tropical fruit, passion fruit, generic citrus, lemon, grapefruit, pine, grassy, caramel. Very well balanced. Medium/light body, medium carbonation, refreshing, smooth, bitter finish. Really nice!

A medium golden color with two fingers of white head. A floral hop scent with something akin to a wood scent, some citrus notes. A carbonated bitter upfront with some spiciness that gives way to a little bit of caramel backbone but not enough for me, bitter lingers on tongue, very little sweet character. Decent but nothing special. Need to try a fresher bottle. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
From a bottle on September 28, 2013 at ABR. Clear yellow pour with big head and lacing. I am not a huge IPA fan, but this was decent.

I paid a lot for a six-pack and was ready to love this (it got a 100 score, after all), but--and maybe this is because it had sat around too long? who knows!--it seemed bitter in an unpleasant way. It was a fine beer, I just expected nirvana, and got, well, something distinctly less tasty than Torpedo, my go-to beer which costs 1/3 the price (when I get the latter on sale).

UPDATED: JUN 11, 2017 Citrus pine aroma in a golden pour. Smooth hop forward balance easily hides its strength. Which is a good thing or a bad thing - depending on what one does with it (my suggestion is ¬íbe careful¬í).

People always told me to try this and for whatever reason I never have. Very happy I just did. Haven¬ít smelled/tasted this much melon in anything else except Maine Beer Co. "Another One."  Wish it had a brewed on date.

I¬ím not liking the lack of dating on this beer. It¬ís brewed in San Diego and I¬ím in Massachusetts, where I purchased it off a wooden uncooled shelf after a long, hot summer. I see that it is a highly rated brew (there¬ís nothing higher than 100, unless you play football and always give 110%), but what I¬ím drinking just seems pleasantly ordinary. In which case, depending on price and availability (never seen it anywhere else in MA other than Trubeer in Easthampton) I might have it again.

Amber. Caramel, hoppy nose. Medium full body. Loads of caramel, fruity us/nz-ness, with a good pine finish. Caramel, nice stronger IPA.-- bb

UPDATED: JAN 5, 2017 Draught @ sbwf13. Amber, thick white head. Grapefruit, floral, hoppy aroma, quite typical wipa. Flavor has grapefruity hoppyness, light caramel, bitter hoppy finish. Decent ipa.
738315
-- via beerbasher/winphone 7

15.7.2015. Rerate,  DE Klomp,  Link√∂ping. Draught. Pours deep amber,  thick white head.  Very fruity,  fresh,  grapefruity aroma.  Flavor has  tropical fruits,  grapefruit,  pine,  light sweetness.  Biting finish,  fruity. Very good. 838416

Wunderbar! This is an awesome IPA with more than just a hint of pineapple and grapefruit. It has a good solid amount of bitters which contribute to the fruity aroma. This beer will make you salivate, a must have!

Poured from a bottle. Nice and crispy mellow yellow color. First taste is caramel and as you palate its citrusy tones are revealed. Nice hoppiness. This will definitively taste better from tap. I had tried before a big eye IPA from bottle and from draft and the flavor difference is abysmal. A bit pricey for its type.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at BLB pours a slightly hazy copper/orange with a medium off-white head. Nice balanced aroma of tropical and citrus hops, grapefruit, with light caramel malt. Man the taste is smooth, nice bright hops balanced with the caramel malt and a perfect level bitterness to make this both flavorful and extremely drinkable. Very nice! Glad this is no available in the area.

UPDATED: JAN 16, 2015 Update:  First time out of a can.  Should be pretty fresh - just hit Rum River today.  No doubt this is a quality IPA, but I had it slightly overrated.  Aroma is solid before the head fades, but that goes quick.  -1 Aroma, -1 Appearance, -2 overall.  

Update:  The middle is a bitterness that you have to endure just slightly to make it to the more mellow aftertaste.  Aroma is where this beer shines.  Taste is very good but doesn¬ít quite live up.  Clean, sharp, crisp, bitter hops with a sugar cookie kind of sweetness to the malts, both in aroma and up-front taste.  No date on bottles, and I hate docking points when I don¬ít know the freshness.  This bottle is fresh from a new liquor store, so I feel OK with the re-rate.
On tap @ Muddy Pig. Pours a clear light amber with lasting ring of head and awesome lacing. Aroma is off the charts with grapefruit, mango, and pineapple. Taste is citrus with some pine, and very low on malt. This is crisp and bitter, a pure and simple IPA with an insanely smooth palate.   Furious has a bit more malt balance, but stays more aggressive with a sharper, meatier bitterness at the expense of a little smoothness.  Sculpin has a clean and pure malt-less bitterness that allows the hops to stand alone, all while somehow staying medium-bodied and smooth.   Slight sugar cookie aroma, giving it some malt balance as it goes down the glass.  Awesome beer.  10+5+9+5+18=4.7

Mystic golden amber body with thin white head. Lingering lacing on the glass. Very well balanced IPA with an orangy nose and a hint of malt in the back end. Smooooooth palate and finish. The hop never dominates the taste but it makes its presence felt. A surprisingly full body IPA which can¬ít be said to other noteworthy IPAs from Bells or Laguitas. highly recommended. Worth the price of admission.

New copper color. White lacy head lasts long time. Funky aroma like mosaic. Kinda stinky. Stinky taste too but somehow good. Must be a gmo hop. Earlier Rating: 1/4/2013 Total Score: 4.5Nice orange color with a frothy head. Intense citrus hop aroma you can smolders from a foot away. It has a bitter orange floral hop taste with a weak malt undertone. Just bitchin. Can¬ít find anything wrong with this one.
Draught @ Monte Carlo, Las Vegas. Clear golden pour. Aroma is very fruity, floral and fresh. Flavor is bitter hoppy, fruity and hugely refreshing. Amazing brew.

Poured from a can. Hazy gold with a very thick, long-lasting head. Very strong citrusy aroma. Bitter, but in a good way. Definitely would have again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I can see why this is so highly regarded. From the moment I opened the bottle and poured, there was a strong aroma of hops and citrus that permeated the room and my glass. Pours a golden-copper with thick, lasting head. Flavor is very bitter, strong hops, some pepper, and loads of citrus. Resinous and sticky on the tongue with a very bitter finish. Great IPA!

This is a fantastic IPA, one of the few that holds its own with Pliny the Elder. The combo of a smooth IPA with the fruit notes make for a great finish. Make it a point to try this beer

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JAN 29, 2014 Pours clear amber with moderate head. Nose is pine, mango, tropical fruit, hops. Taste is pine and peppery spicy hops on the front, on the back end it smooths out a lot with mango and tropical fruit notes. Very smooth and creamy mouthfeel for an ipa. For my money the best IPA out there. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Relatively fresh bottle with new label design, just a few weeks old. Bright gold color with very small white head and no lacing. Aroma is very citrusy and piney. Flavor is mostly citrus, with a clean bitter finish. This is so smooth and very crisp, and tastes good but its kind of boring. Price on the 6-packs are a bit high.
From tap at Mikkeller bar SF. Hazy orange with creamy head. Aroma of pine, mango and peach. Dry pine and mango taste.

Bottle from Fairport Brew review. I believe Mark said this is now available in the area, hallelujah. Light orange, mostly clear, caramel, citrus, dry palate. Decent. Some pine in the palate. I guess that¬ís what I usually mean by a dry IPA.

Pours hazy apricot, nice head and lasting lace, citrusy, apricot biscuits aroma, beautifully balanced sweet apricot fruit leather and hoppy middle palate, finishing full-bodied and crisp. No sign of the 7% ABV on the palate, a benchmark IPA!
22Oz Bottle Clear light orange, bright white head. Sharp papery hop aroma. Big bitter piney flavor. Still, a little sweet and smooth. Some caramel sweetness. Very nice

Deep golden color with frothy white head...thick lacing. Fragrant floral, citrus hop aroma. Taste...Wow, fantastic taste. Rich. Malty. Hoppy. It's sweet, floral, piney, fruity. Notes of grapefruit. Two Hearted is my favorite IPA. This is incredibly similar and just as good. Top Shelf!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a dark golden color with a white head that does not go away at all and leaves large amounts of lazing. Smells very fruity and a bit sweet maybe caramel on the head, yet the hops are there. This beer starts off with a bit og malty sweetness and fruityness at the the start and then goes into a hop parade and leaves a not so bitter finish. Great beer, wish I had more than one

UPDATED: NOV 30, 2013 Very nice aroma. Fruity hops. Some grapefruit and even a mango or nectarine aroma. Prob my favorite aroma of an ipa yet. Wish there was a bit more of the aroma in the taste. It is there but not as strong as the aroma. Malt level is well balanced. Slight bitter finish. Overall a great ipa. Like some things better than Heady Topper and some in heady topper more. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Appearance: Clear amber with finger thick off white head.
Aroma: Mango, apricot, peach, grapefruit, biscuit, a hint of floral aromas and gentle pine hints.
Taste: Low sweetness, medium bitterness and medium sourness. 
Palate: Smooth thin texture, light body and mouthfeel, average carbonation and slightly astringent. The finish is lingering with an initial fruit burst with apricot tartness that develops into a balanced bitterness.
Comments: Delicious and left a glass lace.
On tap. A perfect deep gold with a thin white head. Huge floral nose, grass, pine straw, citrus. Balanced deep rich flavor and a wonderful long finish.

Lightly sweet malty body with highlights of biscuit and very light caramel. A musty earthen quality that was very pronounced as I drank this interspersed with Racer 5¬í. Bright exotic tropical fruit quality with a nice subtle grapefruit component.

Draft. I love that this beer comes across almost as an imperial IPA with big aromas of light citrus and tropical fruit, is mouth coating with deep hop character, yet somehow still somewhat light and refreshing. I expected it to be somewhat higher ABV and was pleased to see it come in at 7%.
Great IPA is an excellent dry, refreshing example of this style. Aroma and hoppiness fit the category perfectly.

12 oz bottle. Pours clear golden with long lasting white head and nice lacing. Aroma is of citrusy hops, biscuit malt and ripe fruit. Body is medium and crisp. Huge amount of citrusy, herbal hops dominate the palate with biscuit malt and ripe fruit provide some support. Finish is long and hoppy. Great IPA but hugely overpriced.

Great IPA, I had it several times, but just realized that I have never rated it. The aroma, the look, the taste, the aftertaste, all of them makes it an awesome IPA. If you are a hop head, 70 IBUs are over flowing! Well done Ballast Point.

UPDATED: SEP 18, 2013 Poured from a 12oz bottle to a tulip. Truly from the time you open the bottle Sculpin reveals itself as something special. The aroma bursts forth from the tulip. Citrus and stone fruit come to the fore. The earthy hops and even a tinge of cat pee funk linger underneath. Intriguing, this is absolutely one of the best smelling IPAS out there. The appearance is beautiful in it¬ís simplicity and clarity. Pours like a medium colored lager with a minimumal white head. The carbonation is light. The taste is an explosion of strong grapefruit and lemony citrus hops. The front of the tongue is awash in juicy hop flavor and bitterness. A mild  rock candy like sweetness hits in mid swallow before the bitterness returns on the finish. Yowza!  This brew really is a marvel! It is well deserved of the accolades heaped upon it. One nosing, one sip and one swallow and you¬íll know you¬íre in for a game changer. I¬ím editing this review to reflect that in my area (Twin Cities) I can find this right at $9.99 a six pack. I¬íve seen several post that call Sculpin pricey but here at least it¬ís the same as other staples in my rotation such as Bell¬ís Two Hearted, or Odells and cheaper per ounce than Stone IPA or Surly Furious.

Bomber. Aroma is piney, grapefruity, catty, floral. Pours hazy cantaloupe with a thick off-white head with great retention; leaves constellation-like patterns of lace. Taste is beautifully citrusy and peachy, starting sweet before finishing with a lingering bitterness. Carbonation is fine, medium to full body. Excellent. Much better than Big Eye!

UPDATED: JUN 7, 2017 Deep gold color, crystal clear, forever lasting white head, tight lace. Expansive and beautiful floral nose. Full body, silky texture, packed with a rainbow of flavors, very complex and elegant, well carbonated but moderately hot mouthfeel, lingering on the palate with a tasty finish. Bitter predominately but moderately, crisp but not too dry. Hoppy, herby, citrus pith and rind, resiny, malty in the background. Delicious, extroverted but well balanced, worth looking for.
Bottle picked up in Charlotte. Pours an orange color with a white head. Piney, citrus, resiny, hoppy aromas. Piney, grassy, hoppy, earthy bitterness, and citrus flavors. Very nice hoppy IPA

gold pour with a medium white head.
aroma is slightly subdued, hardly any malt presence. Grapefruit citrus and herbal hop.
Flavour is apricot fruitiness, very forward grapefruit bitterness. maltiness is surprisingly low yet the beer doesn¬ít come across as overly unbalanced.

Tastes citrus & grapefruit. Aroma smells very hoppy and citrusy! Amazing IPA! One of the best I've had

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Strong citrus, grapefruit aroma. No malt on the nose. The appearance is slightly hazy with a light gold color. The flavor is super hoppy with a lingering bitterness on the finish. The malt is very light on flavor. The mouthfeel is medium -light and the beer coats the mouth on the finish. The carbonation is medium. Overall it's really hoppy for an IPA, tastes like a double IPA. I enjoyed drinking it and will order it again. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a golden amber color with a medium head the leaves decent lacing. Aromas of hops and citrus with more hops and a bit of pine. Flavors of hops grab you with citrus notes, a botter but pleasant aftertaste. Definitely a top selection for IPAs.

Clear golden pour. Very nice lacing. Aroma is grapefruit and hops, overall the aroma is all there, amazing. Taste is grapefruit start to finish. Very smooth. Very good. Top 5 ipa¬ís all time. Impressive.
Pours golden with a white head. Aroma is resin, pine, citrus, very hoppy. Flavor is sweet malt, citrus, pine, resin. Delicious.

UPDATED: SEP 5, 2013 Had at The Union, Encinitas CA. Delicious. Perfectly balanced IPA. Pours yellow orange, clear. minimal head. Intense hops on the first sip then mellows out. A unique floral hop notes linger on the palate, slightly spicy and like nothing i have ever tasted. A great high powered session IPA. Highly addictive and perfection at its best. Bravo! 
6-Pack in NJ, poured same clear yellow orange, minimal head. Same great freshness and flavors. It travels well, not cheap $14.99 for 6 12oz bottles. Well worth it. A flawless IPA

Incredibly fruity aroma that is intrusive - in a good way. Very fruity but still well- balanced. Not too sweet, still has that bitterness. A hefty 93 SEK (approx 14 usd) at Bishop Arms in Kiruna, but in Sweden that¬ís not too bad for great craft beer.
Bottle pour, two finger head, good lacing. Both aroma and taste are heavy on the hops. Overall, a pretty good IPA.

Taste is an explosion of tropical fruits with pine and earthy grassy flavors .
All the complex flavors are balanced eqaully.
Silky smooth mouthfeel. Delicious.

Light amber, cloudy....tall off-white head.
Candied orange aroma.
Fruit, orange peel, malt flavor.
Very smooth.
Nicely crafted.

2013 bottle to a tulip glass. Pours a translucent copper with a persistent off- white foamy head. Aroma is malt, a little yeast and caramel. Hops was only barely noticeable but the bottle was one month from expiration. Taste has a solid malt backbone with both piney and grassy hop flavor. The resulting bitterness ramps up in he middle and mildly lingering. A slight roastiness. Medium semi-dry mouthfeel with some astringency. Would like to try a fresher bottle.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Boy, I really seem to be striking out with the Imperial IPA¬ís lately. Another one that tastes like dish soap to me. Definitely not to my taste, due to the bitter aftertaste. This is another one of the kinds that I cannot stand.
Wonderful aroma. An explotion of citrus fruits. Lemon, mango, peach and grapefruit. Also some pine. Taste is light sweetness and pretty heavy bitterness.

Can to snifter. Pours a hazy, sunny golden with a thick off-white head that leaves some thick, sparkly fluffy lace. Nose involves tropical fruit (pineapple), plenty of toasted malt, some dank pine resin, earthy and savory notes. Pretty sweet flavor, with a fairly intense bitterness. Medium bodied, oily, creamy, sticky, juicy, with a long bitter finish. A tasty IPA, the toasted malt backbone really helps set off all the hop tones.

Pour is clear amber/golden with white head and lot of lacing. Aroma is very fruity, mangos, pineapple, citrus, . Taste is fruity hops, light caramel, dry finish. low body and good carbonation. Would drink this all day.

Bottle 0.33l at Monk¬ís American Bar Stockholm. Pours orange with a large white head. Aroma is full of grapefruit, peaches and more. Taste is an amazing blend of bitterness, exotic fruits without being sweet. A perfect IPA.

Just tried this at home from a 12 oz bottle. Pours with a nice big head that dissipates quickly. Aroma is unreal. One of the best I¬íve ever smelled. Luscious grapefruity floral citrus. Tastes wonderful with an excellent balance of smoothness and bitter hops. Definitely one of the best IPAs I¬íve ever tried. This one lives up to the hype. (and the price - $15 for a 6 pack)

Clear copper colour and a small white head. Aroma is dominated by hops with faint citrus in the background. Taste is incredibly soft, only slight bitterness after you have swallowed a couple of times. Rich body, super soft mouthfeel with moderate carbonation. Great IPA!
Bottle at BBS San Diego tasting.Clear orange amber with a firm head. Aroma is citrus and forest. Flavour is sweet orange, some grapefruit on a lingering grassy bitter finish. Nice balance.

Great tasting IPA. Very smooth with a very nice dry finish. Doesn't finish too dry. One of the better IPAs I have had.

Bottle. Pours golden with a lacy white head. Aroma is pine, grapefruit, peach, mango, and some more tropical fruits. Taste is light sweet and over-moderate bitter. Texture is a little oily, full bodied, lively carbonation and a long bitter, fruity finish. Had high hopes for this one and it did not let me down. Now, where can I find more of this stuff...

Bottle. Golden color, moderate head, big citrusy aroma. Flavor is big hop presence with some nice flavor notes of citrus and resiny pine, with just the right amount of malt. Substantial on the palate, with a chewy quality that I like. Has a long pleasing bitter finish with some other good flavors hanging in there too. Manages to stay just on the right side of line for bitterness. I can see why this gets the rating it does; it¬ís a new favorite.

clear amber, white head with long retention and lacing. stone fruit, citrus, mango, flowers, caramel, tangerine, a slight bite. medium-heavy bitter, light sweet. medium body, slick feel, moderate carb

Bottle. Pouts a orange color with minimal lacing. Aroma of grapefruit and slight pine. Wonderful taste. Well balanced. Def a west coast profile.

12oz bottle. Pours wells for color and head. Aroma of citrus plus. Taste some tangerine. Just getting local now.

Bottle, not sure how old this is but ¬íenjoy by¬í is Nov 2013. Pours a slightly hazy orange/amber. The initial cm of white head doesn¬ít endure more than 30 seconds. Smell - some tangerine and urine. Poured from a fresh 22 oz bottle into a tulip. Amazing IPA with aromas of lemon and mango. Smooth finish with a great hop taste. Tops IPA
