Nice citrusy ipa that is really crisp and refreshing. Aroma is citrus faint pine with only a hint of grapefruit. Taste is hoppy with lots of citrus and light resin with only a faint undertone of malt flavor. This finish is crisp and good. Wanted to be blown away by this one, but hey it¬ís still pretty outstanding!
This is a fantastic beer. Powerful aroma of sweet citrus hops and floral hops.

On tap at Hurricane Wings in Fort Pierce. Hazy golden brew with a white head. Aromas of lemon zest and notes of pine. Tastes of fresh pine needle hops, some grassy notes, and has a refreshing citric bite to it. Almost like some lemonade mixed with the hops. All masterfully balanced by a biscuit-like malt backbone. Very smooth and refreshing. This is delicious.

Bottle from Belmont Station. Pours hazy amber with white lacing. Noseful of all kinds of fruits: dark, tropical, and citrus. Taste is wonderfully balanced: huge fruity and pine hop flavour with a lovely sweetness. Perfect bitter finish that creeps up on you over time. Velvetty smooth mouthfeel. This beer makes me a happy man. Why can¬ít all IPAs be this good?

Bottle at Bishops Arms in √ñrebro and also later on through a friend. Hoppy and fruity smell, very fresh. Very fruity taste with tropical fruits, mango and similar. Awsome beer. Very easy to drink. One of the absolutely best IPA:s I¬íve had.

UPDATED: DEC 11, 2015 On tap at Blue line Pizza. Pours golden with an off white head. Aroma of push, tangerine, some pungent hop and malt. Flavor is sweet and fruity with some orange, floral and pungent hop. Medium body, average carbonation.

On tap. A lightly hazy dark golden beer with a reddish hue. A finger thick white head leaves curtains. The aroma is certainly peachy, with pine cones and a little malty touch. Some sweetness in the flavor, well balanced by the bitterness. The bitterness wins... peaches and pine cones too. Full body, soft carbonation, slightly warming. Bitter and fruity finish. Quite lovely this one. 130808

12oz bottle and on tap. Poured a golden orange honey color with thick foamy white head that retains well. Aroma is a mixture of citrus, mild sweet malt, and floral hop notes. Taste is like eating a grapefruit with a slight grassy bitterness followed by semi sweet malt profile. The alcohol is well masked in the flavors with a crisp mouthfeel and medium to light body. Carbonation is nicely balanced, while retaining a creamy feel. Great IPA.

12oz bottle pour. Light golden orange with about a finger of sudsy head. Citrus aroma. Taste of grassy and citrus hops with a solid malt presence. Pretty decent amount of bitterness. Killer lacing left behind. This was good.
12 oz draught at Library Alehouse Santa Monica. Pours dark, clear copper. Aroma of peach, citrus, lavender, pine. Flavor is citrus, pine. Slightly dry finish.
Pours a golden color with fluffy white head. Hop, citrus, pine and malt aromas. Big citrus hop flavor with notes of pine and malt. Medium light body and a hoppy citrus finish.

Aroma is citrusy hops, pine, a bit of malt, and musty mango. A taste reveals bright mango rather than musty, and lots of clear, strong notes of the other elements on the nose. Lots of cleanly bitter hops keep this nicely drinkable, although the caramel malt backbone (which is an appreciated note, generally speaking) does feel a bit sticky on the finish. Overall, a super tasty hop-extravaganza that will surely keep me coming back.

Thick off white head. Mostly clear golden amber pour. Big aromas. Tons of citrus, grapefruit, apricot, peach, and some pine. Flavor is also very full flavored. Peach, mango, grapefruit, lemon, and some pine. A slight caramel malt backbone as well. 

---Rated via iPhone

On tap at EJ Phair . 
 Big floral hop citrus pine . Clean malt fruity 
Flavor is mostly hops with sweet malt background 
Assertive bitterness is lasting but feels in place with others . I can defenetly see what the guys talk about with the whole San deigo hop madness . 
 I will be ordering this again !

One of the best beer around in the IPA category. You will feel the sting of the Sculpin on the first shot. Strong hops flavor, go best with seafood and sushi.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle sample at the tasting. Pours hazy golden-amber with a white head. Aroma - citrus, pineapple and mango. Taste - starts sweet with tropical fruits and malty tones, moderate hoppy bitterness, dry finish, piney aftertaste. Medium body, pleasant mouthfeel, soft carbonation, refreshing.

Clear gold with little visual carbonation and a small lingering head. Sweet peach aroma with some malt. Lots of hop bitterness in this one. Medium body with some sweetness from the malt. Dry hopped up finish.

Poured into a glass from a bottle. Hazy orange with a thin head. Smells of grapefruit. Taste hoppy with a bite at the end. Overall it's a great IPA.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Another solid offering from Ballast point. Good flavour, not sure its really a 4.05 but its is definitely a well made beer.

Slightly cloudy orange-amber colored pour. Small white head that persists, and leaves ample lacing behind. Orange aroma. Some grapefruit and caramel notes. Taste is a bready orange. Nice. Very good beer.

UPDATED: APR 23, 2017 A clean, light, tasty IPA. The body is bright tangerine with an average head and light carbonation. Lots of sweet citrus in the aroma; lemon and some melon, too. The flavor is crisp and tart. Orange and creamy, butterscotch malt. Poured from the bottle right out of the fridge, this thing hit the spot.

Draft. Awesome dry finish. Hop strong. Hammered yet appreciative. Yada yada, Portland OR.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
355 ml bottle. Golden amber with white head. Aroma very fruity; tropical fruit, citrus, pine and caramel. Taste is dry, wood, caramel, pine and huge tropical fruit.

Bottle 355ml. Thx GB
Pours golden with low white head. Nice lacing. Aroma is of malt, pine, fruits, citrus, sligth alcohol. Taste is of malt, pine, bitterness, fruits, citrus. Palate: Medium body, sligthly sticky. Overall: Very good, hoppy. Quite a bit of malt in there, but good balance.

If you haven¬ít had this west coast style ipa, you are missing out. This is one of my favorite ipa¬ís out there. Easy to drink, get balance, and big hop bite and aroma. A must have in the fridge at all times.

Happy to find this after seeing it on the Zymurgy list. Aroma was pleasant hop mixture tending towards the pine/dank side. Taste was appropriately bitter and well balanced; I found the mouthfeel somewhat towards heavy/mildly syrupy. I may have had unfair expectations.

Bottle.
Ar: grapefruit, resin, pineapple, citrus, bread, grain, pine, toffee, alcohol and apricots.
Ap: slightly hazy amber colour, big frothy white head, lots of lacing.
T: big, big bite, medium sweetness, grapefruit, resin, pine, caramel, toffee, alcohol, pineapple, apricots, lemon zest. 
P: medium body, soft carbonation, slick feel, and long lingering bitterness.
T: Indeed a very good IPA.

UPDATED: NOV 22, 2015 19.06.2013, cask @ The Ginger Man NY:
No head. Aroma is slightly dry fruity, light malts, dried fruits, tropical fruits, hops, pine needles, leafs, newly cut lawn, caramel. Taste is slightly concentrated dry grassy, light malts, lots of hops, pine needles, wet leafs, newly cut lawn, tropical fruits, hay, caramel. Longlasting bitterness, dry mouthfeel. Nice one, even though it¬ís a bit too dry and concentrated.

Old bottle rating, 24.07.2013, 0,65l bottle sampled @ BBGTC "best-before-last-summer-tasting" :
7-4-6-3-12=3,2
Slightly bubbly mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly fruity, light malts, hop pellets, citrus, wet leafs, grass, citrus peel. Taste is slightly fruity, light malts, concentrated hops, grass, wet leafs, citrus, cardboard. Longlasting bitterness, slightly dry mouthfeel. Not bad since it¬ís a old bottle.

UPDATED: JUL 28, 2013 Finally had this for the first time. Gold with slight hint of amber. White head that fades. Aroma is a grass field after a quick spring shower and sweet grain. Medium-light body. Flavor is on the resinous/sap side but hugely balanced towards bitterness. Light malt sweetness as well. I don¬ít see what all the fuss us. Had it next to Breakside India Golden Ale and thought that was several notches better. I must have a very different palate than many of the beer enthusiasts here.

UPDATED: AUG 19, 2015 Old bottle. pours a clear caramel body with an inch of white head. Aroma of herbal spices, faded resin and pine. Taste is piney and resinous with a solid malty backbone. Hints of caramel and herbal spices. Medium body and soft carbonation . 

Re-rated 0,335l bottle, b.b 2016-03-23.
Pours near-clear golden orange body with an inch of creamy looking top. Grassy herbal aroma with a light sting of resin along with caramel and pine. Taste is well balanced, light floral notes with hints of citrus and grapefruit. Light sweetness at first into a moderate lasting bitter finish. Very drinkable and semi-dry. Medium bodied and avg co2 levels.

UPDATED: DEC 23, 2013 Re-rate, December 2013. Clear golden body, medium white head. Nose is red berries and red fruit, grass, peaches, hints of garden herbs. Taste is resinous herbs, citric peel, kiwi and hints of spruce and pine. Light to medium carbonation. Considerably nicer than last time. 

Bottle, shared with BBGTC @ "Best Before Last Summer Tasting 2013". Pours a clear golden body with a medium white head. Nose is strong herbal-spicy peppery pine tones, red fruits, cardamum, hints of caramel and berries. Taste is tight resinous bitter hop tones, dry grass, pine, red fruits and hints of melon. Medium body, soft carbonation. Pretty ok for its age, probably way better when fresh.

pours hazy light golden with a small white cap, some retention. citrus and pine - moderate dankness, pears, apples but also strawberries, spicy malts - touch of caramel, oranges. moderate to low carbonation, light body - oily, medium long and slightly harsh piney finish. good and enjoyable but not excellent. remains a solid ipa.

Pours a very bright, lighter amber with a medium to full, slightly off white head. The aroma is powerful. It consists of grapefruit, peach, pineapple, mango, apricot, with some mild pine notes. All impressions are balanced very well. The taste contains much more citrus fruits than your typical IPA. Many of the initial impressions remain, especially grapefruit, peach, and apricot. The pine still balances things out and is noticed more at the end. There is a very good, bitter hoppy kick that this one delivers. Strong and lingering aftertaste is mostly pine with some more mild citrus. The body is medium to full, sticky in texture, with lots of good carbonation contained within. Although it is more of a bigger beer, it is refreshing, simply for the fact that Its delicious. This is an amazing offering, and is probably one of the best IPAs I¬íve ever had. This one cannot be passed up. Get it if you see it.

Multiple samples @ Empire Brew Fest. Golden orange with a thin white head. Hoppy aroma, pineapple, mango, pear and peaches. Flavor is just has great as the aroma. Flavor is tons of hops and has a great pale malt backbone, little sweetness, to help balance all the fruity hops. The taste is juicy fruits with light touches of pine. Solid bodied full and rich palate with just a hint of creaminess. Nice lingering bitterness. I would order this on draft in a heartbeat!!

Pours a clear golden with a creamy, white head that sticks and leaves good lacing. Aromas of grapefruit, citrus, and piney hops. Solid malt backbone with medium bitterness. Light bodied with a decent length bitter finish. Solid, but not one of the best.
UPDATED: FEB 15, 2015 From 22oz bomber with best by date of 8/25/20. Grapefruit and licorice aromas. Creamy head with good lacing. Citrusy start with bitter hop finish.

Bottle: Dull copper color with a smallish sandy head. Decent bits of sticky lacing. The aroma immediately wins me over; fresh citrus and pine, the sense that a hop assault is lurking. The flavors are strong, citrus, florals, and very light pine. Nicely balanced and it really drinks quite smooth. Fine stuff. Thanks Jeremy!

Bottle. Pours golden yellow with white head that dissipates. Piney hop aroma. Nice hop flavor that isn't too overwhelming or boozy. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Light brown/golden pour with half inch of white head. Aroma of bright lemon and orange citrus hops and zest, mellow yeast and some powdery floral hops too. Higher than average carbonation, slightly numbing, oily but thin mouthfeel. Sour on finish. Taste is robust and well blended between malt and hops but a bit on the bitter side. Serious carmel taste from malt and floral and pine hops. The blend causes a complex melon and/or apricot complexity. Good IPA but a bit overpriced to me, not exactly sure what the fuss is about.
Very hoppy but yet perfectly balanced. Fresh hoppy citrus aroma and taste without becoming too dry.

12 oz bottle pours a hazy orange with small off-white head and some lacing. Aroma made me say WOW: lots of apricot, pine, citrus and floral hops. Taste is bitter with some roasted malts coming out near the end, but with a bitter finish. Body is medium with a crisp mouthfeel and moderate carbonation. This is the most memorable IPA I¬íve tried in many months. Looking forward to the next one.
UPDATED: APR 20, 2014 Great Beer. It had a very strong hop aroma. Tasted great with a very strong floral aroma.

12 oz bottle poured into short wine glass. Light orange color with a small head that dissipates quickly. Enticing aroma of citrus apricots and zest with a hint of pine. Tastes great- orange, and hoppy citrus burst out of this one. Yum 
An IPA that deserves its high rating

Draught. 
Light hazy amber, off-white head, thick lacing. 
Fruity, tropical with peach, toffee, caramel, citrus, very drinkable.
Medium bodied. 
Very nice stuff, but can¬ít help but think about how this would be fresh on tap.

Bottle to glass. Pours a lovely light amber color with a small off-white head. Aroma is full of hops in all of their glory, citrusy, floral, all mixed together with a light caramel malty sweetness. Flavor is a pungent hoppy bitterness with a light caramel malt sweetness. Light to medium in body with a lingering citrusy hop bitterness in the finish. Always been one of my favorites.

Bomber. Appearance is a light golden bronze color with a cap of off-white foam and bubbles. Lots of pine resin, tropical fruit, grapefruit and lemon in the aroma. The taste starts with a potent dose of tangerine, pineapple and grapefruit rind along with some pine, hops resin and toasted malt toward the end. Mouthfeel is medium-bodied with moderate carbonation and a clean, bitter citrus finish. Overall, a fantastic West Coast style IPA with just enough balance and complexity.

Apricot and citurs aroma; golden, caramel appearance; light, crisp hpppy taste with a hint of sweetness; lively on the palate with a bitter finish; overall a very good beer with the charcteristically hoppy flavor of an IPA, but light enough that you could find yourself through three before you knew it.
On draught at Basic. Excellent hop aroma. More bitter than citrus. Very good for the style.
UPDATED: SEP 14, 2013 Has a faint aroma that is pretty good. A very crisp refreshing beer. Pretty citrusy with a hint of lemon. Fantastic beer.

Pours a bright golden hue almost resembling a lager. Aroma is unique. I get lemon, melons, and a decent amount of booziness. It smells really fresh. The body on this beer is very light making it dangerously drinkable. Tropical citrus notes and a crisp finish with warming alcohol all the way through. Similar style to Pliny yet its own entity, really enjoyable and fresh.

Very hoppy aroma. Pours golden. This is a good beer if you like hops. Crisp flavor

Revere Stryker dog!

This is an exceptional beer. I can¬ít understand how anyone could say that this IPA is overrated. There is a strong hops flavor with only a hint of bitterness. There is also a pleasant fruitiness that lingers on the palate. On a hot summer day this IPA really hits the spot. Hats off to the brewers of this outstanding example of an American IPA.

UPDATED: OCT 1, 2013 pours golden orange with a thin white head. aroma is mostly pine and citrus peel with some peach and tropical fruit. taste is pine and grapefruit... palate is dry and sticks around a long time. very good beer.
Tried this with 3 other people. All over the board. One loved it, one hated it and two of us in the middle. Smells and tastes like a citrus bomb with a little bitterness. Surprisingly easy to drink.

Disappointment ... It can't be old they just came here... Nothing .. Aroma nothing tastes old... Finish rough... Boooooooo...

Ballast Point Sculpin IPA is overrated. Not much aroma or interesting hop notes. Medium bitterness so is drinkable. Sculpin just doesn¬ít live up to the hype.
Draught. All time favorite IPA. Crisp, juicy and good bitterness. Perfect summer quencher.

Wow. This IPA has a very strong citrus grapefruit taste. I wasn¬ít able to notice all the subtle flavors because of this, but it was still a good brew. I think I may stick to their big eye for now though.
Clear golden copper. Smells of light sweet hops. Tastes warm light hops, a definite citrus rind bite to these hops. Leaves a bit of that citrus bite sticky on your palate in the after taste.

Pours a nice amber. Aroma is lots of fruit: mango, lychee, peach, apricot. Some grass & hay and pine as well. Taste: yeah! Mango, kiwi, orange, peach, some dew grass. Insanely well balanced!!

A beer with great color and a good taste. The bitterness lingers in the mouth. Overall enjoyable.

Pours a clear orange yellow with a thick head from a bottle. Nice to get a 6-pack for $15. Sweet hops and apricot is the aroma, very nice. Flavor is a really nice sweet hop on the back of the tongue. This was a great recommendation by the beer guy at Cardinal in Niles. I would have thought this beer to be more than 7%.

Draft and bottle at 16 Tons Taphouse, Eugene. Pours fairly clear medium golden orange. Decent amount of head. Aroma resinous, with malty overtones. Dank, to say the least, but with some hints of citrus moderating the overall effect. Body very lively, finish malty and resinous, abrupt, very easy-drinking. Good, but not the world-beater it¬ís made out to be.

Rated in 2010 (Backlog) - Bright orange in color with an average sized white head. Aroma is slightly peppery with lots of grapefruit and orange, light grassiness, and floral notes. Taste is of grapefruit, bitter floral notes and a bit of tropical fruit.

Bottle served in a tulip. Pours hazy bronze with a short+ head. Decent retention and lovely lace. Ohhh the aroma... ahhh the flavor. This is a legend. Beautiful nose of lemon and tart pineapple, with resin, pine, and pale malt. Minimally sweet and plenty bitter though never approaching astringent. Medium body, sticky-thin texture and a very bitter, oily, dry finish.
Beuatiful clear gold pour. Aroma is citrus rind and a little weed. Taste is sweet citrus, a bitter bite and some sour. Nice balance.
Drank from a bottle after a sauna. Fruity, strongly hopped traditional IPA. The taste is a bit sharp but otherwise it¬ís good.

12 Fl. Oz. Bottle. Poured Clear copper color medium head that leaves tons of lacing all over the glass. Aroma is predominantly floral and citrus hops, some fruit in there too. As hoppy as it is is also quite well balanced, good malts backbone with a great and strong bitter finish. Great beer, enjoying the heck out it.
Bottle. Pours clear dark orange with thick white head. Full aroma of sweet orange and apricot. Good flavour, citrus and mango notes. Strongly hoppy but not a bomb. Long hop finish
user_location: Munchen an der Willamette, Oregon, USA

text: Top end IPA; for sure in my top 5. Treated myself on father¬ís day to a 6 pack. Did the trick :)

In the bottle in Seoul. Decent IPA, but was overhyped and didn't live up the expectation.

UPDATED: AUG 9, 2014 Pours a cloudy golden color with a white head. Smells like citrus and the taste follows. Very citrus body, followed by pine and earthy on the end. Hops don?t really kick in until the finish. Very well balanced IPA.

12 oz bottle poured into my Ipa glass. Pours a golden amber color with a thick fluffy white head that leaves awesome lacing. Smells of pine, tropical, citrus and floral. Tastes of all the same things in the smell with a good hoppy finish. Mouthfeel is silky, creamy and chewy with good carbonation and a semi dry finish. Wow this is one of the best ipas I¬íve ever had. Well balanced and full of flavor. Glad this is finally on the Washington State market. Will be buying this regularly.
Bottle from local grocery. Good aroma. Well balanced hop flavor. Very impressed. Never had ballast point before, but will look out for their beers again. Very good.

On draught at baileys / pours a very clear copper color. Nose of floral, hop, and citrus. Taste of candied hop - nice balance of hop and malt.

On draught at Bailey¬ís Taproom. Clear dark golden color. Aroma is tropical fruit hops. Taste is really hoppy, but really balanced. Sweet tropical fruit leads to a tart dry bitterness on the finish.
Pours a golden amber. Two fingers of head. Very well balanced IPA. Expected a fruity citrus finish but it was more grass flower and hop notes. Outstanding IPA.

Pours a nice clear straw yellow. Medium head with nice lacing nice piney aroma but not overpowering. Very nicely balanced beer. Very drinkable perfect example of the style. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft. Pours clear orange gold with a foamy off white head. Aroma is malty, fermentation, light alcohol, pine, grapefruit, and orange. Flavor is sweet, bready malt, biscuit, bitter, grapefruit, pine, and lemon. Medium body with high carbonation. Dry finish.

Pours hazy golden color with medium tight white head that laces all the way down. Aroma is sweet juicy flowery hops. Taste is dank hoppiness with biting grapefruit citrus and a nice malty backbone. Follow through is dank bitter hoppiness that lingers nicely in the aftertaste. Overall this is a very well balanced IPA.

Very solid IPA golden slightly cloudy appearance, thumbs width head at pour, tastes of slight hops and citrus which comes off as a grapefruit flavor but doesn¬ít overpower like some I¬íve had with that grapefruit taste.

UPDATED: NOV 24, 2014 Bomber from Safeway poured into a tulip.  Cloudy, golden with a thin head.  Smells fresh, light, tropical fruits, light hoppiness.  Taste starts sweet, but moves to grassy, herbal, mellow but up front hops and ends with a very dry finish.  Medium body, perfect carbonation, easy to drink.  That said, I¬ím underwhelmed due to the ratings and the price ($8 a bomber on sale!).  This is a great starter into the IPAs for the uninitiated.

10.12.13 update - still feel exactly the same as above.  Smells great, but tastes above average but just not worth the price ($9 bomber this time).

11.24.14 Update: Tried a fresh 6 pack that was delivered to Raja¬ís this week.  Still feel the same - maybe even a little overrated.  It has a bitter finish when compared to Pliny the Elder and Lagunitas beers (which I also had tonight).  Not that it¬ís bad - it¬ís just the most expensive ($14/6 pack on sale) and it¬ís not quite the best.  Prefer the sweetness of Lagunitas or the lack of any bitter aftertaste of Pliny or the smoothness of Alesmith or Alpine to this one.

Very pretty foamy 2 inch head leaves great lace for the entire glass.. the brew is a slightly hop hazed tangerine orange..

The nose is honestly pretty astounding... like a fruity citrus juice concoction.. lemons.. limes.. melon... yummy.

Wow! Tangerine and tropical fruit hoppiness from front to back on this one.. only enough pale malts to deliver the hoppy goodness .. finish reminds me of grapefruit zest..

Body is on the lighter side for the style.. but it adds nicely to the overall package.. sorta dry too.. and I appreciate it.. dangerously drinkable.. But at $7.50/bomber, it isn¬ít going to happen too often.
Pours a golden color, aromas of pine and citrus, nice hop flavor an citrusy finish, overall pretty good

Pour is a clear orange with a small white head.  Aroma is a nice citrus hop presence.  Flavor is much the same but with more intense citrus blast with maybe some honeydew and cantaloupe.  Very little to no malt presence, this thing is all about the hops.

Bottle.  Amazingly underwhelmed by this.  Don¬ít have anything meaningful to add to the 1000+ ratings of this one already -- golden color, citrus and pine in aroma, bitter finish, blah blah -- nothing that stands out at all from any other decent IPA I¬íve had.  Don¬ít have anything bad to say about it, just remarkable how dull it is.  I should probably try this again and rerate, but I¬ím in no hurry to.

Poured from a bottle. Clear golden orange with foamy white head and some nice lacing. Fantastic aroma - citrus, pine and tropical fruit.  Taste is bitter throughout with some sweetness opening up in the middle followed by a bitter dry finish that lingers and lingers.  Very nicely balanced.  Really enjoyed this beer, only thing that didn¬ít suit my taste was the heavy dryness. Mouthfeel was moderate with crisp carbonation.  An excellent IPA.
UPDATED: DEC 7, 2015 Pretty much the perfect IPA, plus it¬ís always readily available.  Sturdy enough malt backbone that lets bright apricot and citrus shine.

Nicely carbonated and clear golden in color. The aroma is of citrus, hops, and lite sweet malts. A simple, balanced, and perfect IPA. The flavor matches the aroma. The finish has a mild bitterness that is very pleasant. It doesn¬ít linger either. Overall this is an excellent beverage to try.
May 2012. 22. oz. bottle. A masterpiece of an IPA. So balanced and well made and close to perfection. Only a few others can stand up to this one. Pine, citrus, hops, tropical fruit, it¬ís all there.

Bomber from Craft Beer Cellar in Belmont (love that place!). Pours clear golden with goodly white, foamy head. Aroma of malty fermenting beer/slight alcohol, pine and slight background orange. Flavor, carried by a medium body, comes on softly and well-balanced. This is one of the most well-balanced, well-behaved and well-roundedly delicious IPA?s in  my experience. It?s a crime beer like this isn?t more available on the East Coast. I would be drinking this every week if i could find it, and I?ve been looking for weeks now!

Bursting with citrus and pine aroma. Pours a deep golden color with generous white head. The taste is bitter but opens up to some sweeter tropical flavors towards the end. This beer is so good, I feel lucky to be able to drink it.

Ar: Bright grapefruit, orange, and pine.
Ap: Orange, clear - medium off-white head with good retention, and leaves a ring of creamy foam.
T: Sweet, bread malt, with some biscuit flavor - lots of grapefruit and pine, some lemon notes, too - high, clean bitterness - finish is orange, bitterness, and toasted malt.
P: Medium body with high carbonation - finish is dry.
O: Excellent American IPA - big and bright hop flavor with a clean and supportive malt backbone.
UPDATED: DEC 26, 2013 Orange pour into snifter. Piney and orange citrus on the nose then tongue. Dry. Missing the body of an East Coast IPA, but that¬ís the point, right? Lovely.

12 bottle supplied by SHERM1016....thanks!  Pours a rich dark yellow; moderate head.  No lacing.  Who cares....this is one very great beer.  Bitter / hoppy (juniper / pine) nose and dry / hoppy initial taste.  Bitter taste lingers....but what an excellent bitter it is!  Very tasty!!

12 ounce bottle divided into tulip glasses. I¬ím glad to see this distributed in the Chicago market in the past few weeks. It¬ís the gold standard, in my mind, for the single ipa style. I¬íve benefitted from a fresh bottle, less than a month old, so the hops were at their juicy finest. Slightly herbaceous and veggie in character, and those hops pair up deliciously in a non-citrus sort of way. Medium bodied, ruby red, good amount of bubble and foam presence.  At 7% abv, they¬íve crafted a finely balanced ipa that you can drink without knocking out your senses nor your tastebuds. If you haven¬ít tried this one, it¬ís worth hunting down.

Pours orange-amber with a white head. Aromas of orange, peach, grass, green tea, slightly floral. Taste is grapefruit, orange, apricot, grass, and resin. This is mostly hops all around, but there is a backing of delicate malt sweetness. Finish is resinous, bitter, and mostly dry. Citrus, tropical, green and juicy with great balance. Excellent IPA.

Bottle. Pours clear golden with a large, creamy, white head. Aroma has lovely hops, peach, grapefruit, resin, citrus. Medium carbonation, fine dry and quite creamy mouthfeel. Flavour is mild at first, bringing out sweetish doughy malts, then turns more fruity, peach, grapefruit and citrus with a piney punch. Lingering heavy bitterness.

Tight nose
Old fruit notes. Pretty smooth. Tappers off towards the end. Mild bitterness.

UPDATED: OCT 6, 2014 This coulda been a contender, if not for the onions. Awfully nice citrus and perfume on the nose, and then onion. No one else will really notice, but it¬ís there. Otherwise, excellent. Re-rate: The onions are milder this time. But I still don¬ít understand the hype. I like their Big Eye better.
Another incredible ipa from ballast point. Super hoppy and really bitter. Has a nice floral aroma ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Canned Sculpin, unbelievable this is available in a can. Holds true to the aroma and taste of a draft serving. Great beer.

UPDATED: FEB 22, 2014 The citrusy aroma is really great.  The taste is very, very good - first citrusy/fruity hops and then a decent bit of pine resin on the finish with almost no malt present.  It¬ís medium bodied - not quite light, but definitely not heavy.  If you like IPAs, this one is a must try if you see it.

Bomber. Pours a slightly hazy orangey color, thin white head, so-so retention and lacing. Nose is citrus and hint dank, with some malts. Mouth is medium bodied, peaches, grapefruit, some mango, medium bitter but downplayed compared to similar IPAs. Clean finish, particularly considering the body not much of an aftertaste. Solid.

Color and smell were amazing. Liked the body and head remained constant. Clearly deserves rank amongst the best.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours golden with a small white head. Smells of hops and peaches. Tastes of hops, fruit, peaches, and slight bitter. Very refreshing and delicious. Simple but complex.

Aromatics are lovely and very "light" in hops lots of citrus and bright fruits. Just a lovely smelling beer. Those aromatics are replicated in a super balanced taste lots of grapefruit and mild bitterness.
Nice fresh citrus/fruity aroma. Apricot, grapefruit flavors dominate, but all in all a extremely well balanced IPA. Very drinkable, but with plenty of character.

Hmm, I;m not quite getting the hype for this one.  It has a near perfect rustic orange pour with a big white head that fades into good lacing.  The aroma is a very generous amount of hops.  The taste is just a little too bitter for me.  It just doesn¬ít follow through in complexity.  I can see how the bitter hop heads love this but I don¬ít think it¬ís worthy of being 100, sorry - however, still a fine, fine beer.

UPDATED: NOV 19, 2013 Pours hazy deep orange gold with a fluffy, golden-tinged head that settles to a finger and fades gradual-like. Wafts a wonderful sweet aroma that carries over into the front end of a sip. Floral hop notes and vanilla, caramel, orange and peach. Taste has powerful and complex citrus from sweet orange and lemon to bitter grapefruit. Incredible balance - this beer dances along your tongue. Pine hops and caramel malt in there too. Creamy mouthfeel. Bitterness is enhanced with warming. Outstanding depth of flavor and truly amazing balance between sweet and bitter. A world-class IPA.
Crisp citrus and pine hops balanced perfectly with not overly sweet malt. Possibly my new favorite IPA. Damn fine beer.
Pours orangish amber with white head. Strong citrus and pine hops. Taste is hoppy with caramel and tofee notes. Excellent malt presense that is not to overwhelming.

P:  Pours a clear (tiny specks) apricot body with a off white milky head that leaves behind wet sloppy lacing. 

S:  Aroma delivers lush peaches and apricots are leading the way of the tropical parade. Lemon tartness and faint pine resin contribute to the sweet fruit. 

T/M:  Super sweet tropical fruits up front then the bitter lemon, grapefruit and orange oil take over the dry finish.  Toasted toffee malt and pepper. Medium bodied and moderate carbonation. 

O:  Lush tropical fruits delicate spice and toasted malt.  The bitterness in the finish really rounds out the sweetness.  Fantastic easy drinking IPA to seek out.

Bottle.  This particular one was almost months old and I believe the rating was affected adversely. Pour golden orange with off white head.  Smell is bright citrus and caramel maltiness.  Taste is orange/grapefruit and more caramel maltiness than I would prefer. Even for a 3 month old bottle.  Will rate this but seek out a fresh bottle as this was not memorable.

UPDATED: MAR 12, 2014 Great beer always a fine choice.  You can never go wrong with the fish ! If your looking for a great representation of a west coast ipa, sculpin is a safe bet. Drink it fresh.....

22oz bomber. Pours a bright gold/orange color with a frothy white head. Aroma has a strong hop presence of citrus, pine, and tropical fruits. Taste has lots of citrus, and pine. Slightly resinous up front, and lots of grapefruit bitterness follows in the finish.
Bottle from Binny¬ís in Orland Park,Nice amber pour with a nice white head. Big bold citrus, grapefruit, light malt. Taste is lots of citrus hops, nice bitter finish

NYC Trip Beer #8.  Nothing like following your very first AleSmith IPA with your first Sculpin.  Between the two, I far preferred the Sculpin.  Pours a pale orange with a lovely white head head.  Beautiful Citrus scents and flavor.  Well carbonated with a crisp hop finish.  Bought some to bring back to the A.  Bottle - Guilty Goose - New York, NY
A new top five ipa for me.  Orange, lemon, grapefruit, and something like toasted peach jelly.  Wonderfully flavorful bite, light body but perfect amount  of alchohol gives the flavor depth. Yes sir.

Pours orange with tall white head.  All sorts of citrus and melon wafting from the glass.  Not very malty which is the way I like ¬íem.  Mango, peaches, pineapple, absolutely delicious, almost perfection in a glass for this IPA lover.  Rather expensive (like Ruination) but you bet I¬íll be buying it now that it¬ís available in Texas.  If you like the Southern California style of citrusy IPA, you will LOVE this one.

Pours clear light amber with an orange hue.  Not much head, no real retention. Bubbles are streaming  up from the bottom of the glass. Soapy wet lace.  Nose is good deep caramel malt, breaddy and it smells really smooth.  Hops are fruity and tropical.  Mango, hints of citrus, very floral and tea like and just a touch of pine for depth.  Peaches too.  The malt is really captivating me and I love malt.  Taste is scrumptious. It drinks light and fruity and like iced tea.  Body is supple but not biting, carbonation is ample but soft.  The malt is so smooth and offers plenty of bread and a little cracker.  It doesn¬ít outshine the hops though which remain delicate as the fruit takes over the palate. It¬ís juicy and sweet.   It isn¬ít too oily or resinous but it has a good bitter and it it¬ís almost dry but not quite.  It has perfect balance and it isn¬ít too sweet and the bitter isn¬ít all there is.    This was so well done.  The malt was immediate, always near at hand. The hops were civilized and cultivated in this drink.  It was bold but not audacious.  This was extraordinary.

Excellent, reminds me a lot of two hearted. Great citrus, great balance. One of the best ipas I had. Tasty, complex, balanced. I like a strong citrus flavor and nose like this one. Very reminiscent if a dipa, not sure where ipa ends and dipa begins...good nonetheless.

Looks a nice copper with lots of lace. Smells a bit oniony, with some tropical fruit notes, faint rubber smells. Weird. Tastes a bit rubbery at first followed bit fruity notes. Mouthfeel is rich and fine. Overall an over the top IPA with a bit too much hop extract, pellets to the point of sulfur. A good run of the mill IPA but nothing amazing as ratings suggest. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I know that we are not to rate on style, but purely on if we like it. Too bad. Even though I am not a fan of west-coast hop bombs, I must say that this is one of the best highly-hopped brews out there. Lots of apricot and citrus. Amazing aroma. Hard to find, but worth the search. Did I mention the aroma? Wow.
UPDATED: AUG 12, 2014 Had it on tap at the Village Tap in Roscoe Village Chicago. Had it in a tulip glass had a slight head and even lacing with notes of citrus underlying its bold hop taste.

12 oz bottle poured into pint glass. Pours clear orange copper with 1 finger white head that laces the glass all the way down. Aroma is citrus, tropical fruits and piney. Taste is very much hop forward, but does have some tropical fruit and is quite bitter. Well carbonated and sticky on the palate. I am very happy this brewery distributes to Chicago now as this is a tasty brew i will enjoy time and time again.

I had this about 2 months ago on tap, but did not rate it. This rating is from a bottle. Pours ouf a clear light golden color with frothy white head that settles to a thin lace. Citrus-spice-piney aromas. Flavor is sticky and bready up front. Lots of sticky bitterness. Flavors are muddled. Was much better on tap.

P: A nice golden orange pour with a thick white head. S: Oranges, tropical fruits, pineapples, grapefruit, slight caramel, but its pretty much hops all the way. T: Pineapples, some tropical fruits, slight pine, some bready cracker malt, but thats really hidden, pretty much it just pounds you with hop. M: Carbonation sting, crispy, with slight bitterness with a grapefruit sticky finish. O: Just a wave of hops.

A great straw colored IPA with thin and quickly dissipating head.

Nose and flavor do not disappoint with great hoppy bite in some of the more floral hop varieties.

Malts still come through cleanly, making this a great drinkable beer, but perhaps lacks some of the depth or interest of other iPAs.  Nonetheless, Ballast Point has a great brew here with durability through the seasons, with enough character for fall and a clean and effervescent mouthfeel to deliver through the summer.  Cheers!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
(tap) clear golden yellow colour with a small white head; aromas of citrus, tropical fruit; predominantly bitter flavour with a long medium bitter finish

This holed IPA has an amazingly beautiful aroma. Very floral and citrusy. The flavor has a strong hop flavor with lots of bite.

Draft. Pours red/copper color with a small head. Aroma of floral and resin hops with notes of apricot. Medium body with a nice malt backbone and a bitter finish.

Malt aroma w/hints of mango.  Taste has bitterness, followed by malt, followed by hop taste of orange/grapefruit awesomeness.  Carbonation is a little much on the tongue.  Color is yellow with orange hues and is brilliantly clear.

Clear pale orange colour, medium Carbonation, tight fluffy white head. Aroma has Mango, citrus, apricot jam, most of tropical fruit you can get. Soft mouth feel. Mild bitterness but the sweetness is balanced. Taste follows nose. Could session this quite happily. Superb!

65 cl bottle @ home. Pours clear amber with a white head that leaves some lacing. Aroma is peach, grapefruit, pine, citrus, and caramel. Flavour is caramel, grapefruit, and pine ¬ñ with a bitter finish.
can. pours orange with solid white lasting head. big citrus aroma. taste is dank sweet orange with some bitter grass

12oz Bottle A - Pours clear pale amber with a pillow 2 finger head. Nice retention. Ok lacing. S - Lots of lush citrus, peach, mango, and rose petals. T - Very balanced. Citrus/Pine/Malt. M - Light/Medium bodied. Nice carbonation. Bitter/citrus finish. O - Quality sessionalbe IPA with an amazing nose.

Aroma of dank fruits and sweet fruity malt as well. Crisp looking orange color, not quite clear. It¬ís very bitter, yet has lingering sweet tropical fruit flavors all around. Heavier body, packs a wallop, but is well balanced and approachable for a heavy duty IPA. I¬íve never eaten a sculpin, although it looks interesting.

On tap at Carpool in Herndon/Reston, VA. 

Clear, orange-amber with a small off-white head and excellent lacing. 

Aroma of pineapple, grapefruit, orange, pine, caramel and floral hops. 

Taste of floral hops, caramel, pine, grapefruit, orange and pineapple. 

Medium body and medium/high carbonation. 

The quintessential west-coast IPA.

Aroma is tropical citrus, mango and peach. It appears to be golden with ample white head that leaves distinct lacing. Very smooth taste of vivid citrus. Back end bitterness, exceptionally drinkable. Bight and balanced on palate. Pretty amazing ipa.
Draft at yard house. Thin white head, good lacing. Not a lot of aroma, but big hop flavor. Citrus pine, and evenly balanced malt on the tongue. Good, average IPA.

Draught at The Library. Golden yellow pour. Light head. Piney resin aromas. Tastes like gymsock. Odd.

Pine and perfume nose, rose. peach.

PVC natl sales meeting- Reid ordered; a gentle but strong ipa with bold notes of drink me fast and get another. I'd seek this one out

On tap. Pours a medium gold with a white head and lacing. It has a rich aroma of citrus, pine, and grass, and the same notes are in the flavor followed by a bitter middle and bitter, slightly sweet aftertaste over a medium-heavy body.

Bottle: Color pale yellow, hint of orange. Aroma: Rotten fruit/Grapefruit. Flavor: Biting grapefruit flavor with hints of lemon and citrus.  Smooth yet extremely tart finish.
This is a nice thick IPA that has good balance but still a bite of bitterness as the end. A little sweet on the palate. Very good IPA but not the best.

Pours a clear light amber with two fingers of creamy white head that never completely disappears and leaves excellent lacing.  The nose smells of grapefruit and mango with some pine and grass aromas.  Taste is of tropical fruit with a herbal component and a grassy bitterness that is strong but not overwhelming.  Has the tiniest amount of sweetness but it is perceptible.  Mouthfeel is creamy and medium bodied with crisp carbonation.  A hop forward and drinkable IPA.  

---Jeremy H

Draft pour at Whip In. Pours clear amber with a white finger head. Sticky white lacing all down the glass. Smells of hops and a variety of sweet fruits ad citrus akin to a great IPA. Flavor is faintly fruity with a full hop and malt balance. Light and enjoyable IPA for any time of year.

Sampled at a recent Wirtz Beverage/Illinois seminar, and poured by the staff from bombers to stemware showing a clear, golden color, with creamy, off white head foam, and decent spots & streaks of lacing. The nose was light mid-fruit sweetness, resin, then grapefruity citrus. The flavor boasted a pronounced hop bitterness rounded nicely by the malt. Medium bodied, bold, yet rather sessionable.
Pours gold with a white head. Piney hop aroma with some malt.  Taste is bitter piney hops, a touch of citrus, and a decent malt back bone.

On tap at Capone's in Norristown, PA. Actually tried this a few months after first trying the Habanero Sculpin, which was a beer I loved. It was nice to try this without the spice. Definitely a top tier IPA.
Strong citrus IPA smell.  Pours clear orange with a white head.  Flavor is all grapefruit and bitter.  Light beer with average carbonation, very good!

Bomber poured into pint glasses. Pours a clear amber color with a  nice white head and solid lacing through the glass. Smell is resin, pine, a bit of grapefruit, and slight alcohol. Taste is again with the resin, juicy grapefruit, and again with the alcohol. Slightly oily finish, but still enjoyable. Note: there were 2 enjoy by dates on the bottle, so this quite possibly could be older.

EDIT: had a second bottle with and enjoy by date of 07/11/13 and was much better.

Light amber head that lingers.  Crisp hop aroma with light cereal notes.  Wonderful grapefruit citrus explosion that gives way to malt well balanced and delicious.  Crisp on the tongue and although relatively strong, it feels light.

Crisp IPA. Dark yellow pour with hoppy aromas. Lighter IPA in flavor. Very nice grapefruit notes, with a pretty balanced bitterness. Interestingly, what lingers for me is malt flavor, which isn't pronounced at the front end. ABV of 7% is quite cloy, particularly since the beer has a light mouthfeel. When I think La Jolla, this beer comes to mind.

Bottle at a.Kitchen in Philly. POurs orange gold with fluffy white head. Huge, huge nose of grapefruit, tropical fruits and pine. Great aroma.  Taste is all citrus fruits, pine resin and woodiness. The finish is slightly biteer and lingers. If the finish was smoother this would be out of the park.

Gets a 10 for the aroma, with perfect, full nose of Niagara Peninsula ice wine extract, peach and grapefruits and some evergreen resin. Dark, tranlucent gold, not copperish enough, with a respectable head. Flavours of tangerine, grapes, very hoppy - with a STING! - and a malty sweetness hidden behind the fruity/floral backbone, as a thin spinal chord, better noticeable at the finish. Nice resinous palate, medium bodied, ultra professionally brewed and very clever choice of name.  This would be my choice to go with a bouillabaisse!

Good IPA that I have wanted to try for a while. Date says drink by August 2013. Aroma is of grapfruit, pine, grass, alcohol burn, and slight malt. Taste is somewhat transparent to the aroma, although toned down a little bit. Not bad, but for the price here in Ohio, I can find better, fresher IPA¬ís.
Good beer. Citrus, apricot, pine and honey. Finishes a bit too warm and sticky to make this a truly outstanding beer for me, but I will definitely try another one.
UPDATED: NOV 15, 2014 Bottle pour from Whole Foods Market - Redwood City, CA. So crisp with heavy grapefruit and the right amount of honey. Ideal Sunday breakfast drinking.

Tap and bottle. Somewhat underwhelming aroma, mostly caramel and a little bit of grassy hops. Cloudy copper color. Flavor profile nearly identical to the Big Eye but the hops are turned up a little. Citrus hops, mango, pineapple, caramel. I think the most redeeming quality is the malt and hop balance.
Pretty killer IPA. Lots of floral hops with sweet fruit and citrus. Crisp and refreshing.
Had on draft at Aces and Ales in Las Vegas. The hops are citrusy, floral, with slight pine and resin. Caramely malts, a little bready malt character. A solid IPA.
Bottle pour smuggled in from out of state for me.  Tasty tasty IPA here that has got it going on.

Bottle (355 ml). Thanks to Tom for this one! Clear golden/orange with a medium off-white head and heavy lacing. Aroma is intensely fruity (mango, orange, apricot, peaches, pineapple), floral hops and slight honey presence. Taste is moderately malty with fruity notes (less than in the aroma), honey and moderate but long lasting bitterness. Medium body. Dangerously drinkable and extremely refreshing. Quite complex for an IPA. Wow!

Bottle pours medium-dark yellow with white head.  Aroma pine with slight citrus.  Taste initial malt sweetness replaced by citrus and pine.  Clean brief finish of citrus and pine.  Full palate.  Alcohol not evident.
I am not a huge IPA guy but this is a tasty well made IPA.
Review from  backlog. On tap at ale house Santa Monica. One of the best ipa.s I have eve had truly a west coast classic.

Poured from a bottle into dogfish ipa glass. Golden orange clean appearance with a hearty white head. Smells very heavy on pine with citrus overtones. Fruit is in the background too, apricot I think? Bitter front that gets a bit malty, then more fruit and citrus, mostly grapefruit, into a bitter finish. Nice, crisp, refreshing, balanced.

Pours golden with decent sized white head. Nice citrusy hop aroma. Pleasant and nicely balanced hop flavor. A good IPA, but frankly it doesn¬ít stand out. I was expecting more based on the high scores.

Bomber. Sweet but not overly hoppy aroma. Slightly hazy orangish amber. Thin almost white head. Flavor is flippin¬í unbelievable, which is what I said after the first sip. Perfect balance. Very hoppy yet somewhat fruity.
poured from bottle into pint glass. pours a hazy golden orange in color,leaving a thin head which dissapates quickly. Hoppy aroma with apricot . very tasty
On tap at The Reservior. Pours a clear orange color with a white head. S,ell is tropical fruit and citrus. Taste is Tropical fruit, citrus, grapefruit. Light/medium body with nice carbonation.

22 oz bottle. Poured a some kind of dark gold, but clear with a smallish head that dissipated rapidly. The aroma escapes me but there is no mistaking the potent bite of this fish! If you don¬ít like strong tasting left coast IPA¬ís you better stay away. In a place where a good IPA is hard to come by (Maui) this is a real treat.

Pours pale gold with some head and huge lacing. Nose is grassy hops, some grapefruit. Notes of apricot, grassy hops, some grapefruit, some floral, big and lasting bitter finish. Tastes are big bitter and light sweet. Full, almost sticky body with lively carbonation. What a beauty!!

Not available in Oregon and was happy to try.  Sweet on the nose with a good amount of balancing citrus.  Taste is fantastic and a little less hoppy than expected.  Easily session worthy.  Taking a sixer home.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Appearance-Clear deep golden a thick, white, long lasting head. Nice lacing.
Aroma-  Big sweet scent, honey,pine,fruity
Flavor-Bitter hoppy bite, sweet malt,citrus,creamy

UPDATED: JUL 11, 2014 Golden. Aroma is peach with superb clarity. Taste is peach, bitterness, mild floral - perfect! Good moderate level of bitterness. Palate is mild bitterness with great finish. Overall, best straight up IPA I¬íve yet had. Wowzers!

Great IPA. Well balanced, nicely bitter, and ver smooth crisp finish. San Diego brewery not available in Atlanta market.

Bottle->SA.  Hazy orange-gold with thick white head.  Aroma: citrus and pine.  Taste: predominantly pine with citrus peel.  Great flavor and mouthfeel.
Bottle.  Pours orange with quite a bit of white head. Good citrus and pine aroma with a flavor to match.

650 ml bottle, pours clear light golden brown with a good carbonation. Aroma starts with a citrus fruit tang, quite sweet and then follows a sweeping delicious crisp bitterness with caramel malt, loads of piney & floral hops in their too, with more grapefruit. The finish is very bitter but crisp and moreish. A complex, quality IPA
Toronado, San Diego. Orange amber pour. Bountiful head. Dry hop aroma that doesn't overpower. Classic grapefruit and pine on the front end. A surprising hint of lemon to spice things up.

On tap at Toronado in San Diego, served in a shaker. Pours clear golden-amber with a tiny white head that fades slowly to a thin remnant and leaves a small amount of fine lace. On the nose, there are big notes of fresh hops, with grapefruit, lemon, pine and resin. Just a touch of pale, biscuity malts come through. The flavour starts moderately bitter and becomes more so with hoppy notes continued from the nose. It closes with a long, hoppy and spicy finish with loads of resin. On the palate it is medium in body with a dry texture and average carbonation. Overall this is a very nice IPA with loads of resiny hop bitterness. Fresh and refreshing, it is great for an afternoon on the patio. 2013-03-21
Bottle. Lots of sweet and fresh grass hops, sweet hop taste, crisp but lingering bitter on palate, and a light amber. Great IPA but it seems everyone already is aware.

A: Pours a little on the light side but otherwise amber. Head dissipates pretty rapidly leaving some good lacing.

S: Aroma is very fruity. Appricot... orange are the big players. Some hops but lighter. 

T: Subtle fruit notes. A little bit of fruit. A little bit of malt. The bitterness seems to overwhelm the other notes and fade quickly leaving a dull bitterness. 

P: Carbonation is a little aggressive. Decent flavor development.

I was so excited to try this beer! Great ratings.... picture of a sculpin (my wife totally takes care of them at the aquarium!) IPA, Ballast Point!!! But this beer was pretty disappointing. It wasn¬ít bad but it wasn¬ít good either. A little uncontrolled... doesn¬ít bring anything special to the table. The Big Eye IPA and the Calico Amber were way way better. I have a growler of this bad boy in the fridge so I will see if it gets better.

Bottled w/ drink by date at 7/11/2013

Draught at Blue Monk. Deep copper, with an off white foam. Huge notes of citrus and fresh pine fill the nose, and lead to a bready malt profile. Very bitter with bright acidity and amedium caramel sweetness. Very well balanced, long bitter finish, full bodied. Excellent effort.

Nice IPA.  Aroma is not overpowering, but flavor is good.  Nice piney sharpness, citrus.  Slightly oily but pleasant.

Light amber draught.  Minimal but lasting head.  Very smooth IPA with limited bitterness.  Floral, pine, and citrus notes make this a fantastic alternative to the "hop head" varieties of pale ales.

Uploading old ratings that were missing comments. Once of the best IPAs out there. Huge citrusy and piney hop notes. Smooth rich palate and a lively carb. One of my favorites.

On tap at Pub Republic. Had this beer many times and it never fails to please. Intense hoppy flavors but so well balanced against the alcohol.

Pours a cloudy gold with typical lace. Lots of sweet orange on the nose, very nice. Taste? Well, maybe mine is a tad stale from being on the shelf for a bit, but I¬ím not seeing where this beer¬ís legendary status comes from. I get a fair amount of juicy orange, which I like, but it doesn¬ít have the biggest bite and there¬ís a funky aftertaste I can¬ít quite place. A good one for sure, but it wouldn¬ít make my personal IPA top-10.

Copper color. Somewhat frothy head.
Aroma has strong grapefruit, pine, caramel. Some tropical fruit as well, like mango.
Bitter like grapefruit pith (white part).
Body is on the lighter side.
Finishes off-dry, fairly clean.
Very drinkable.

UPDATED: NOV 3, 2013 bottle. Deep golden with one finger head. Pretty decent light malt base with big west coast hops. The aroma is excellent, but the taste just doesn¬ít match. This is pretty darn good, but I¬íve certainly had better -- the 100/100 seems a bit generous.

On draft. Nice amber color, decent white head. Smells of mangos, light pineapple and maracuya. This stuff smells fantastic. Taste is low residual sugar (dry), just light malt taste followed by a very flavorful, fruity, citrusy, hop experience. It does finish with a medium resin. This stuff is crazy good and is the kind of beer I could drink all the time. Guess that is why I buy it by the 1/6 barrel. :)

Pours a hazy amber colour with frothy off-white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, pine, caramel and hops. Taste is medium sweet of fruits and caramel leading to a well balanced hoppy bitter finish. Pretty damn awesome.
Pours gold with a white head and good lacing. Citrus aromas of grapefruit and a hint of lemon. Smooth flavor that¬ís balanced and not too hoppy.

From tap at Keg Cowboy. Pours deep orange in color with a small white head that lingers. Aroma is all citrus with grapefruit, passion fruit and bread. Taste follows with a lite body and smooth end. Not too bitter. Also this is a fruity IPA not Piney.
Draught/Growler. Took one taste to know this would be good. Enjoying the great floral and citrus flavor, grapefruit. Delicious.

Amber in color, with small white head. Sweet aroma, lots of peach, pine and hop notes. A lighter IPA, taste of hops and peaches primarily with bread and citrus notes as well. A great beer and a cool example of the range of the IPA style.

An outstanding IPA.  I know my ratings aren¬ít high enough to be counted, but I have been drinking exclusively IPA for the past 3 years and this is the best IPA to date.  The big difference between Sculpin IPA and the others is the aftertaste.  Sculpin IPA leaves a light aftertaste, so much so that I feel like I could still rate food and/or wine if so needed.  Much different than like a ruination IPA, which is so bitter it literally ruins the palette.  When my local beer mart has this, and the wife is ignoring the finances, I will indulge in this beverage any chance I get.
Got this beer for a gift.  Aroma is a citrusy hoppy scent. Wow very hop forward, nice blend of citrus and tropical fruit. Love this Ipa!!

Hazy gold with thin off-white head; aroma is strong, complex and pleasant array of hops grain w/ some woody+nutty notes; flavor explodes into a hoppy delight with some citrusy notes of grapefruit; feels silky smooth with a nice fizzy bite; finishes dry and roasty hoppy

draft @ redlight redlight.  Sweet pines notes on the nose.  Pours an amber gold color with a white head.  Bitter pine upfront with herbal notes and a very earthy bitterness finishes with a resinous sticky feeling.  Pretty good.
This is an amazing, clean, crisp, complex, delicious IPA.  Full spectrum of hop aromas and flavors: pine resin, melon, pineapple, orange, lemon grass along with a slight sweet malty base.

Ballast point nails it again. As soon as I cracked the bottle open, the hops made their presence. Earthy hops dominate the front of the palate while fruity hops and the malts take over on the back end. Great stuff.

Hoppy aroma is a beautiful blend of pine, citrus, and mango. Crystal clear, light copper appearance. Malts get lost in bitterness and finishing hops, but I wasn¬ít looking for that in this beer. Persistent, tiny bubbles of carbonation rise from the laser etched bottom of my glass, creating a very small but persistent head that releases those wonderful aromas from start to finish. The carbonation creates an incredibly light mouthfeel. Despite the lack of malt balance, an excellent beer with a very nice blend of hops.
Bottle but drank from a mug. Unfortunate. Great beer. Aroma is citrus sweet. Fruity ipa, but stays true to hop heavy ipa style. Finishes nice

I don¬ít know what all the hoopla is about this beer. I mean its slightly above average at best in my opinion. It is somewhat well balanced, it has very low malt undertones, almost so little malt it¬ís undetectable. The first taste you notice is the bite of the almost overpowering hops, for such a low alcohol content ipa, after holding it in your mouth a second or two you will get a slight tropical fruity flavor followed by a finishing note of pine. Don¬ít get me wrong this isn¬ít a bad beer but there are definitely better and this one is not worth the money at 15 bucks a sixer. I¬ím not a beer connoisseur I just like good strong ipa¬ís and imperials that taste good and get me drunk. For me taste comes first but I usually won¬ít buy it unless it has a abv of 8.0 or higher. If u want a beer like that try Lagunitas Maximus ipa, Flying Dog El Dorado, or possibly Mission brewery shipwrecked double ipa. All good solid ipas with high abv. The Ballast point Sculpin Ipa is more for your yuppie socialite drinker not a hardcore drunk like me that appreciates a good strong but solid brew... just bein honest, cheers.

Tap - fair size foamy head, medium copper color, nice grapefruit hop aroma and flavor with a fair malt balance

UPDATED: NOV 13, 2014 2/27/2013: Pours golden yellow, with zero head. Definite flavors of grapefruit and peach. Slight sour aftertaste.
Aroma = 5, Appearance = 3, Taste = 6, Palate = 2, Overall = 11

11/9/2014: Huge off-white head with good lacing.  Aromas of earth and leaves, with a definite grapefruit.  Medium body with fizzy carbonation.  SUPER BITTER/SOUR.
Aroma = 5, Appearance = 4, Taste = 4, Palate = 2, Overall = 6

Bottle.  Awesome hoppy nose, intense and rindy (a little pith), lightly rubbery, citric, grapefruit with a little lemon, tons of pine/wood.  Sickly pale, hazy body with a dense and foamy beige head.  Taste is quite dry, has that water-sucking soap quality, with strong but not overwhelming rubbery bitterness, not too oily or resin-filled but maxing out on the woody side of the hop spectrum.  A little perfume/florality starts to creep in with warmth, but it¬ís not a fruit bomb.  Love this kind of clean hoppiness.  Malt is light and mostly gets out of the way, maybe a touch of caramel but no overdone crystal or anything like that.  Fullish body, alcohol integrated, smooth but not flat.  This may be the best widely available, bang-for-your-buck IPA in the country; it¬ís certainly in the conversation.

Bottle pour into a tulip. When I find a good highly rated IPA that I havent ever had I try to compare it to the best IPA I know I can find. Today its Sculpin vs. Bell¬ís Two Hearted poured into identical glasses. I am a huuugggeee fan of two hearted so this is going to be a tough one, but here goes. Aroma: I gotta say sculpin wins on this one, helluva good tropical fruit aroma. Two hearted has the classic hop aroma, but sculpin is more nuanced, fruity and more tropical than most. I also have to give the appearance category to sculpin. Pours a good 1 inch head that sticks around. Its a clearer golden than two hearted with nice lacing that sticks to the side of the glass. Taste: Two hearted is so balanced piney and citrus, thats what I love about it, but the sculpin is so tropical. Ton of pineapple and mango, damn good too. These are so different in taste. Sculpin reminds me quite a bit of Shlafly Tasmanian almost in that pineapple mango. Each has its merits, and because they are so different the taste between these two is a toss up. I sat them both to warm up a bit, they were a touch too cold, but after waiting 20 minutes the tastes are better on both- but still a tie. I call tie on taste category. Overall: geez, two hearted has met its match. Even though sculpin won in aroma and appearance I think I have to call tie, but that is saying something huge(I have done the compare ratings with two hearted coming out on top over Racer 5, GD Titan, Stone IPA, Loose Cannon Hop3, Rogue Yellow Snow, Founders Centennial, 60 minute, etc.) They are very different. albeit American IPA¬ís. If you like pine and citrus two hearted is a god that will never disappoint. Sculpin is more interesting and may be the best IPA I have ever had that is heavy handed on the tropical flavors (other than Bell¬ís hopslam). You can¬ít go wrong with either of these. Unbelievable ale, I just wish it wasnt quite so expensive. Two hearted is a bit cheaper around me (DC area) so I¬íll stick with that, but Sculpin will be a nice treat from now on. Well done Ballast Point.

Smells fruity, like tangerine. I feel like mango, but maybe it¬ís just the tropical atmosphere. Faint initial fruitiness and tastes pretty bitter. Pours golden with good lacing and decent head retention. Alcohol well-hidden, average carbonation. Good but seems a little overrated. Tap at Taberna Lupulo.
UPDATED: FEB 28, 2013 Very good well balanced IPA. Other reviewers have described this well. Alost like half Anderson valley IPA half troegs perpetual ipa. Probably could be in my top 5 IPAs

Grapfruit in the aroma, tropcial fruit and a bit of malt. Copper colored, not very long lasting white head. Very piney dry taste upfront with a dry finish. Not overly complex but very unique. A bit of malt and tropical fruit in the aftertaste. Not overly complex but very refined and unique. Carbonation feels very fine. Medium bodied.
Damn good IPA. Reminds me of the Smutty Nose IPA, which I absolutely loved when I lived in New Hampshire. Strong hops, citrus, floral and pine aromas and flavors, which equals a fabulous brew.
Very bitter, dominant hops with strong citrus aromas. Refreshing and fun to drink!

Poured a clear golden/copper color with a huge white, frothy head. Aroma is  resin, floral, citrus, and grapefruit. Taste is grapefruit, lemon, pine, with a slight grass taste. This is what an IPA tastes like. Nothing more to say.
Probably the best IPA available in bottles in Texas, as we don¬ít get FFF, Bells etc.  My measure against all others, here anyways.

It's way dryer and hoppier than I expected. Very little malt presence. It was alright

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Growler fill from local mart. Aroma is huge floral of citrus, grass and golden malts, a lot of citrus. Taste of tropical fruits soaked in orange and lemon. The sweetness complements the bitterness so well. Can see my self cashing this growler tonight.

Bottle pour.  Big pine hop nose with a hint of citrus.  Mango and evergreen hop with big bitterness.  Balanced by a nice sweetness.
Draft at CWBF - pours dark gold with offwhite head. Cat urine nose. Grapefruit flavor. Quite bitter. Caramel under note. Light sweetness. Mid-full body. Nice.

Vigorous pour from bottle to balloon glass. Pillowy head that decreases to a steady thin foam. Prefect IPA orange. Lacing paints the glass on the way down. Crisp clean finish. Near prefect bitterness for the style.

I love this beer. Great crisp, citrusy hops throughout. An excellent example of the SoCal IPA.

Wonderful nose--so fragrant and with the taste to match. Very balanced yet exudes great character.

On tap at the Yard House in Northridge. Aromas of mango, and peach that dissipated quickly. Very smooth bitterness with a sweet peachy finish.

Aroma is very nice freshly citric and balanced well with the pine and dank notes, with a strong malt backbone. Flavor has a lot of the same, strong malt base, not too caramely with a nice soft orange citrus character. Mild to moderate bitterness. Good stuff.

Bottle from Brewdog shop. Amber color, white head. Bitter taste with citrus, grapefruit, loads of floral hops, tropical fruits , pine and resin. Strong bitter finish with fruits and resin. Magnificent IPA.

Strangely cheesy nose with only a small amount of hoppy freshness coming through. Pours steady gold with a fluffy beige head.  The flavour is where it comes into its own - spicy, peppery hops with some melon, some kiwi, some candy and some lemon peel.  A bot of paprika and coriander round it off and a big fat buttery mouthfeel provides the balance.  Very nice.

golden ale with hues of brown and orange. appealing aroma mainly of pollen, wood and citrus grapefruit that is represented exactly in the taste. some ivy as well, with a moderate body and powerful alcohol that burns or stings a little in the mouth. enjoyed only slightly chilled.

Very much like Firestone walker Union Jack.  Yummy!  I could easily drink a 6 pack....wish I could get this locally.

For a 7% ABV IPA this beer drinks like a session beer. It has great drinkability and will kick your d!#k in the dirt if you drink too many. Believe the hype and go buy a six pack.
You can¬ít go wrong with this IPA. Great from start to finish. The citrus is well balanced with the hop. Use this as your standard for comparison.

Aroma - Citrus, lots of lemon rind and pineapple.
Appearance - Creamy white head, hazy golden orange color.

Bottle from BrewDog Birmingham; clear amber pour thin white head glorious hop aroma at pour, taste doesn¬ít disappoint tropical hop with mango and citrus, perfect level of bitterness, decent body quite viscous mouthfeel, quite high ABV for an IPA.

Best before May 16, 2013.
Appearance: Pay attention other breweries, this is exactly how an IPA should look. The body is a crystal clear amber, not too dark like many other IPAs, showing off carbonation throughout lazily floating to the thick and creamy white head that takes up 1/3 of the glass on the pour. The retention is average, but it settles into a creamy thick coating.
Aroma: Hops, hops, hops. The aroma is dominated by the hops, but hints only slightly at bitterness. The aroma is strong of oranges and grapefruit in good balance.
Taste: This is balanced beautifully, the malts are mild on the intro and provide a pleasant backing for the flavorful orange hops with mild grapefruit bitterness. The flavor lingers for a bit of oranges then grapefruit.
Palate: Medium bodied, oily texture, with hints of carbonation.
Overall: World class IPA, this is the epitome of a West-Coast IPA. Everyone needs to try this, it¬ís balanced beautifully and very drinkable. Great beer.
UPDATED: NOV 16, 2013 Bottle at home. Pours copper color with frothy white head. Aroma is pine and citrus. Taste is bitter up front with an abrupt finish. Fine beer.
Love it! Very crisp aroma with hops and citrus. Beautiful lace and thin head. Light orange colie . Hops galore on the pallete. Not bitter. Awesome beer.

Light soft gold pour, thin white head.  Ripe soft fruit in the nose (mango & peach) with pine wafting through the back.  Pleasant, sharp bitterness.  Oily and coating with light dancing malt and and hops through the middle.  Creamy mouth feel at the end with a strong, but not overpowering, bitter hop finish. 7% alcohol is so well blended that it only show up now in my notes.  Spend the $ and try this one.

Bottle @ Brewdog Bar, Edinburgh. Pours golden to amber with a nicely proportioned head. The nose has the expected pine and grapefruit. The taste has more of the grapefruit but the alcohol has given it enough sweetness to tame the extreme bitterness. The palate is balanced as implied in the tasting note - medium bodied a nice creamy texture and then the bitterness cleans the palate nicely at the end.

One of the best IPAs. This is packed with hops. Tastes of pine and grapefruit. Very thirst quenching. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Fresh bottle from Premier. Pale gold-amber and a goodly white head with varied lace. Oodles of hop aromas showing cat pee funk and weed, plus hints of peach and lemon. Nose has an actual FEEL to it, a ¬ínose-palate¬í if you will, opens the sinuses. Taste excites the bitter receptors pretty well, strong grapefruit peel with an over wash of some sweet pale fruit and warming alcohol. Herbal-dry palate and long mineral-grassy dry finish. Taste is not layered & fruity as dreamed about, shows a hint match-stick and lots of grass & grapefruit pith & a fighting hint of lemon fruit plus standard-issue pale malt. Fresh and snappy.
Clear amber with an off-white head. Aroma of citrus, caramel, bread, and florals. Taste is really well balanced with a nice easy drinking bitterness. Tasty stuff.

Aroma of grapefruit. Pours a clear orangish amber with a none lasting white head and no lacing. The taste is is much like the nose. Grapefruit up front with notes of honey, some pine in the finish. Medium body with medium carbonation.  Overall, a well done IPA.

Aroma - wonderful florally/citrusy smell.
Appearance - Nice amber w/ decent head/lacing.
Taste - Wonderfully balanced and deep hop taste, not overpowering at all. Palate - Nice carbonation, good mouthfeel and has a lovely dry hoppy finish.
Overall - A class IPA. It just has outstanding hop balance from start to finish. One of my favorite¬ís and highly recommended.
Bottle pours a hazy yellow not much head. Smells tastes of honey grapefruit mango citrus some bitter resin in it. Nice crisp bite. Great beer.

Pours light amber/orange. Nice lacing. Spicey citrus aroma. Pungent hops. Taste... Wonderfully balanced. Sweet start with floral spicey hops kick. Perfect palate. Not too thin but not overly thick. Bitterness lingers until the next sips. Truly world class DIPA. On my short list.

Sweet, spicy grapefruit aroma. Almost clear blonde-gold, carpeting head.  Mellow caramel with a nice floral hop edge. Chewy.  Long woody finish with citrus pith.  Hop bomb.  On tap, Momo¬ís.  Thanks, Uncle Doug.
Cloudy gold pour with a two finger head.  Nice lace.  Aroma is full of grass.  A little citrus.  Taste is very grassy.  Mouth drying effect in this one.  Medium body.

Draft at Proof. Deep gold pour with a bubbly white head and laces all the way down the glass. Big mango, peach, pineapple and tangerine hops on the nose with a light sweetness. All the aroma flavor stuck around the flavor with a great balance and lingering bitterness. Great fucking beer.

UPDATED: OCT 11, 2014 Off the tap into a tulip glass. One finger of head on a deep golden colored body.
The aroma is pineapple, mango, lemon and grapefruit. Nice.
The taste is biting bitterness with a bit of honey at the end. 
A crisp texture and a bit smooth with moderate carbonation and medium body.
It¬ís a great IPA.
Sweet citrus hop in the aroma. Pours a cloudy light Orange with yellow tints in the light. Good hop in the front with a more constant bitterness throughout.. not really complex in the flavor stages.

UPDATED: JAN 21, 2013 Probably as fresh a bottle as you can get in the midwest (over 3 months before the enjoy by date). S: Great aroma, but subtle - sweet grapefruit, pineapple, grass, citrus zest, some breadiness, and decently resinous and astringent. A: Pours a pretty hazy gold with a nice white head that sticks clings to the glass T: Not over-the-top bitterness by any means - pretty dry. The layers of flavor are muddled and not easily perceived, but still very tasty. Lemon zest, grapefruit, solid malt backbone P: Feels like an IPA, does not linger very long O: A good IPA out of the bottle, but I image it√¢¬Ä¬ôs an entirely different beast when it√¢¬Ä¬ôs in its infancy on tap. Looking forward to trying it that way one day, but over priced for being bottled.

From a 22 ounce bottle into a frosted pint glass. Harsh hoppy bitterness follows this from aroma to first sip to aftertaste. Excellent. I get pine and citrus (grapefruit) together. I find it easy to drink.

On tap at Cole¬ís in Buffalo.  Pours light and clear with almost no head at all.  Aroma is strong and delicious with citrus and very hoppy.  Taste has a very mild bitter to it with the big citrus notes coming through.

Very nice.
Aroma mellow citrus fruits, well balanced but not screaming pine like some good IPAs. Slight passion fruit.
No head retention, not that pretty. Light amber.
Very well balanced with sharp but quickly fading citrus fruit. Beautiful bitterness it finish with a sharp tang at the end.
Great mouth feel. Coats your mouth like acrylic paint (that¬ís a good thing)
Overall very nice, not the best IPA in the world. Probably.

On tap @ Public House in Vegas. Bright clear orange gold. Incredibly vibrant hoppy nose, enormously fragrant tropical fruit, citrus and pine. Oily hoppy body possessing the flavours of all the fresh aromatics found on the nose, with an added vegetal depth and a long piney bitter finish. Truly outstanding!
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Bottle. Pours a warm, lambent orange-red with a low, fine-grained head. The nose is amazing -- peach, sage, sweet flowers, rosemary -- blows me away. Snaps like a dry twig on the palate with a burst of hops followed perfectly by stone fruit and caramel. Finish is tingly and dry with a trace of long-lived bitterness. Amazing.

Bomber bottle. The aroma is hoppy, but with some malt in there. I'm guessing cascades. The appearance is light bronze with good lacing. The taste is a hoppy citrus that is refreshing. The palate is good for an ipa. Overall, a good, balanced ipa. Will buy again.
