22oz bottle at BD Camden. It pours a deep golden color with a huge fluffy and soapy white head. Foam lasts long and sticks to the glass. Aroma is intensely hoppy and fruity but quite malty and balanced as well. Pineapple, apricots, citrus and toffee. Nice. Taste is sweet and malty upfront to then move into an intensely hoppy territory. Notes of toffee, pine, citrus and grapefuit. Leaves a bitter and dry sensation on the tongue. Body is silky with good carbonation. Overall, a masterful IPA, verging on the line of a DIPA though.

UPDATED: JUN 10, 2015 Trade from Ibrew2or3. Thanks. Had this just after a Westy 12, and it still shines. Pours loght orange, beautifully clear with a small and quickly receding head. This is one of the prettiest IPAs I have seen. Smell is divine, with floral grapefruit, pine, apricot, and mango. Smells sweet but not overly so. Best smelling for a non-double ipa for me. Bitter hop forward brew. Full bodied and sweet with heavy grapefruit and apricot hop notes. Medium mouthfeel with medium-low catbonation for the style. Lingering bitterness. Beautifully done.

As I keep coming back to this, it just doesn¬ít have the same kick I thought it did. Severe downgrade now, but still solid beer.

Bottled. Pours hazy amber with an avarage sized off-white head leaving a good lacing. Great nose of citrus fruits, mango, peach, caramel and pine. Sweet flavor that ends up quite dry and nice bitter. Medium bodied, oily texture and soft CO2. A world class IPA. ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ

12 oz bottle Whole Foods.  Golden pour, lively bubbles, medium-sized white head with nice retention; medium lacing all the way down.  Aroma floral, lemon, piney, bread, caramel-like sweetness.  Solid malt backbone; clear, bitter, clean hop finish.  Medium body, smooth, granual carbonation.  Overall, nothing about this jumps in your face, but it screams clean and balanced.  Not the most memorable beer and I struggle with this being 100th percentile overall, but this is an extremely solid textbook IPA.

Pours amber with white head and good lace. Aroma is fruity and citrus hops that come through in the taste with lots of sweet stone fruit flavor along side grapefruit and lemon. Good bitterness with a long dry hoppy finish.

Golden amber color with lots of head and lace. Love that. Great smell of booze mild hop citrus caramel and some grass. Girlfriend who doesn¬ít like hop said it she liked the smell. Taste is the same. Mostly sweet some bitter.

22 ounce bottle.  Pours a clear light gold with a very nice fluffy white head.  Aroma of citrus, pine, and malt.  Taste is grapefruit, oranges, lemons, pine, caramel, florals, and a bit of malt.  Very nice!!
Pours light orange with a huge hop nose. A dry spicy hop flavor but well balanced. An excellent IPA. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Now THIS is an IPA.  I¬íve had this both bottled and on tap, and I think I prefer it on tap.  It pours a clear, golden orange color with a light, dense, white head that leaves some pretty sticky lacing.  The nose is fantastic.  Barley, caramel malts, and robust, sweet, piney hops all surface in the aroma, making for one of the best-balanced noses of any IPA I can think of.  As crisp as the hops are in this, it as an incredibly smooth moth feel - so smooth that it¬ís hard to sufficiently describe.  The potency of the hops really control the palate of the beer, but are extremely well-balanced with the caramel malts.  Sweet and slightly fruity, dried apricots are the fist thing that come to mind, yet the fruitiness of the beer is only obvious if you search it out.  This is an extremely fine-tuned beer.  It has a grainy sweet finish with a hop presence that echoes the delightful experience you taste as it enters the mouth.  It¬ís like the flavor persists into the finish as-is.  This is surely one of the best IPAs ever.  Smooth, supple, sweet (but not too sweet), hoppy (but not bitter), and with absolutely no jagged edges.  Good job, Ballast Point!
Gould pour. Mildly hoppy aroma, sweet floral hoppy flavor. Nice bite! Great IPA.
Well defined and smooth triple ipa everyone should try once even if ur not an ipa fan.

Had at forum shops in Ceasars in las vegas. 6.75 for a twelve ounce. Expensive but in Vegas. Big floral  nose. not real bitter on ront end. Excellent hop balance. Very light to non exsistant malt profile, but perfect for an IPA style. would drink all day, but too much $$$$. great brew.
Crazy good ipa.  Citrus, fruity hops with a solid malty backbone.  Flavor is dry, with a great bitter aftertaste.

Wow. Very well balanced ipa with incredibly diverse hop flavors. Grapefruit, pine, very bitter tea. Nice

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Nice looking slightly hazy orange with decent white head. Aroma is dominated piney/citrusy hops. Flavors are much the same as the aroma. Firm malt body and aggressive, but pleasant, hop bitterness. Great example of a West Coast IPA.

Pours a golden orange color with a finger length off white head that dissipates slowly and leaves a blanket of lacing. Smells of peach, mango, grapefruit, like an apricot, resin. Nice carmel malt backbone to it. Taste starts and finishes with lots of peach or apricot. Also starts with some mango and grapefruit. Slight bitterness. Then a good amount of carmel and bready malt shine through to balance it. The finish is a nice combination of fruity flavors from the hops: lots of apricot or peach, get some lemon, orange, grapefruit, mango, maybe some other tropical fruits. Medium body with a good amount of carbonation that gives it a refreshing finish. A creamy and resinous mouthfeel. A very balanced, flavorful, and drinkable IPA.

Finally in Maryland!! Been waiting a long time for this one.

22oz bomber into a craft glass. The pour is a very clear, light golden color. Aroma makes my mouth water. Peach blasts the nose right away. I get citrus and tropical notes as well. Mouth is also blasted with peach right off the line. Solid hop bitterness throughout. Nice resin character and slight dryness in the finish. Superb IPA! Now I must find a way to try AleSmith¬ís.

UPDATED: AUG 4, 2013 Glad these guys are in MD now!  Bomber poured into snifter glass.  Light golden-orange color with thin white head.  Aroma is heavy pine/citrus hops.  Taste doesn¬ít disappoint, nice hop bitterness with a fruity element balanced nicely with malt.  Medium body, somewhat dry finish.  Solid, waiting for the cans to get here.
I love IPA and this was the best IPA I have had.  Great flavor, appearance, and aroma.  Highly recommended

[4781-20120915] 341mL bottle. Resinous piney grain and light citrus hops aroma. Clear, dark orange body with a small long-lasting creamy off-white head. Bitter resin pine sap hops flavour finishes with a sweet tangy orange peel bitterness. Medium body. Delicious blend of bitterness and citrus and resin notes. (9/4/8+/4/17) 4.2
(w/ jercraigs)

Even though I don¬ít play favorites Sculpin IPA could be my favorite.  Its always tasty, I have it everytime I come to San Diego.  I have had it 3 or 4 times now and never rated it, well here goes.  Aroma is peach, mango, grapefruit and orange, theres alot there. Appearance is beautiful orange gold with a nice frothy head.  Taste is only amazing, thats it. Bright punchy sparkling liquid gold, with hops at the front mid and back of your swig, followed by a beatifully citrus swallow.  Palate is hoppy, spicy and very tasty.  It leaves some hoppy residue but for an IPA lover this is bliss.  Overall super awesome you have to try it. 5.0
Very nice IPA. Hoppy, but very balanced and not at all over the top in any way. Fresh.

Bottle. Pours a bright golden color with a small white head. Aroma is very nice freshly citric and balanced well with the pine and dank notes, with a strong malt backbone. Flavor has a lot of the same, strong malt base, not too caramely with a nice soft orange citrus character. Mild to moderate bitterness. Good beer

Pours a very light orange color with minimal head.  Upon closer inspection there is a slight haze and I can see some extremely small particles floating around.  Aroma is citrus and pine and I also detect some tropical fruits.  There is a lot going on here.  Taste is similar to the aroma with citrus being well represented along with some pine notes.  The body is light to medium and the finish is very dry with a lingering bitterness.  This would be fantastic on a hot summer day and what you would expect from a West Coast IPA.  One of the better IPAs I have had.

UPDATED: DEC 22, 2012 Glowing orange with a white head.  Not a lot of big flavors.  touch of citrius.  crisp and hoppy,  somewhat biter.  Very smooth abd drinkable.  Underwhelmed by this one, not sure what the big deal is.  Yes it is a very good IPA but nothing about it really stands out.  The flavor is very good but there is not much of it.

Rating the nitro version since I¬íve had regular more times than not. Pours a nice bubbly orange with pillowy white head. Aroma is muted with the nitro but still slightly cat piss centric and some pine. Taste is velvet smooth with a great hop bitterness, peach, orange, rind, lemon and grain. Overall, another solid IPA.
user_location: Morro Bay via Orange County, California, USA

text: An amazing beer that in my opinion is what IPAs should be all about congrats on a phenomenal brew!

12oz bottle from Southern Season. I¬íve sought this for quite a while, so I¬íll try to be reasonable. Pours orangish dark golden with fluffy head that laces well. Aroma is heavy citrus and a hint of pine hops. Taste is big fresh earthy punchy hops with tons of citrus flavor. Clean crisp finish. Dare I say it - this reminds me of Pliny. Nothing spectacular, just an excellent IPA lacking in flaws.

UPDATED: DEC 22, 2012 Re-rated:  I¬íve enjoyed this a few times more since my initial rating.  I do like it better, and perhaps appreciate the velvety mouthfeel and smoothness of it more than I did.  1st rating:  What am I missing here?   Sorry, but I was just underwhelmed by this beer.  Is it a good IPA?  Yup.   Maybe even in my top ten...I will have to try a few more at different sessions.  But I just can¬ít see why this beer is rated so incredibly highly.  I didn¬ít think it had much of a nose, the head was nothing special, and the taste was characterized by smooth but very uncomplicated hops.  A very dry and lingering bitter aftertaste, which is okay.   I just don¬ít see what all the fuss is about.   I don¬ít even consider this the best IPA from San Diego...I find Alesmith¬ís IPA significantly more impressive, and probably Green Flash¬ís West Coast IPA a tad better.

Bottle from Asahiya. Lovely pine and citrus hop combo in the nose, also tobacco, and light sweet fruit. Hazy orange straw color, creamy off-white head, and great lacing. Hop shock initial nearly precludes any initial assessment; bittering hops snap the palate to attention; final hop burn slowly simmers and fades over several minutes, and even after that lingers on the sides of the tongue.Medium heavy body. A true feast for the palate and the nose. A great IPA.

Bottle from Mcgee Liquor in Tucson. Clear gold pour with a short white head leaving moderate lace. Nose is pine, ganja and some caramel. Medium body with moderate, fine carbonation with a creamy mouth feel. Pine, ganja, caramel, lemon and a hint of orange, pineapple and ethanol. Finish is more bitter, with grapefruit and dendelion. Nice balance for a West Coast IPA, but a bit hot. Sorry, but this one just doesn¬ít stand out to me.

Pours into glass a hazy amber/orange, with minimal white head that fizzes away within a minute. Almost no lacing.

Aromas of grapefruit, pineapple, citrus, hops. Very pleasant.

Really pleasant, heavenly mouthfull of citrus hops, grapefruits, pineapple all swirling on the tongue complimenting each other. With a medium body, this is good stuff.

Fantastic. A great example of the great West Coast IPA. Look forward to more.

UPDATED: JUN 15, 2013 Appearance: not much head at all, but it has a nice bright orange-gold appearance, and the little head it does have leaves good lacing.  Aroma - lots of orange and grapefruit citrus, some pineapple, and lots of sweet caramel malts.  Flavor - mmmm!  Nice grapefruit and orange profile with a solid malt backing and some hops at the end.  Very well-balanced.  I was expecting something a little heavier and sweeter from the aroma, but this isn¬ít a sugar-bomb at all.  This is really easy to drink, yet full of flavor - doesn¬ít whack you over the head with hops, but they are there.  What a refreshing IPA.  This would be even better in the summer.  The more I taste, the yummier it gets - lovely citrus at first, and then the subtlest of hops and malt to complete it.  Nomnom.  The taste and palate of this are just perfect!  Enjoyed slightly beyond the "best by" date - wonder how this would be fresh?  JUNE 2013 UPDATE: Now enjoying this on a hot summer day.  Every bit as good as the first one I had late last year.  It¬ís fresh, but it smells and tastes the same as I remember my slightly expired one did.  If this beer had a slightly more impressive appearance and more floral, balanced aroma, it¬íd easily rank as the top overall single IPA in my book.  As it is, the palate and taste are definitely #1 for me, and that¬ís what matters most, IMO.
Nice floral aroma and citrus taste.  Great mix of hops. One of my favorite ipas out there!

After pouring you get a great aroma of fruit and the hops.  Decent amount of cream colored head.  The taste is crisp with slight hints of citrus.  The finish is smooth with a slight bitter undertone.  As good an IPA as I've ever had.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft. Very good ipa all around. Clear, hold, white head. Pine aroma tasteful finish.strong recommend


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Hang on, hang on. A 100pt IPA? Really? Not that I doubt the numbers, as 1000 raters can¬ít all be wrong. It¬ís just that I can¬ít believe I tripped over one in the supermarket without looking for it.
Here goes:
Appears light golden with a good collar of white head that seems to be leaving a marshmallowy lace behind. Aromas of dehydrated apricots, papaya, guava and plenty of lemony hoppiness. There¬ís also dried mango, and light maltiness. Sweet at first and then a growing wave of sour fruit, and lemon sherbet. Excellent tanginess contributes to a long changing finish. Fruit and sour at first and then puckering bitterness and sweet malt next, then tropical flowers... You¬íd have to be very proud if you brewed this beer. Very proud indeed.

Bottle thanks to a very crunchy friend pours a orangish amber with lacy white head. Aroma is very fruity definitely mango comes through and some citrus flavored hop. Flavor has a lot of hop, great balance in the use of hops nice bitterness but with lots of great hop flavor that is more citrus and a little bit of a spicy malt character. Overall this was a gem of a beer that I was not expecting but it¬ís an impressive beer that is very true to the style good balance of hop malt flavor aroma and alcohol warmth.

Poured into a snifter out of a 22oz bomber.

Pours a nearly clear brownish gold with a half finger white head. Head retention isn¬ít especially impressive but lacing is good.

Aroma is an amazing balance between malt and hops. Earthy hops with a very faint hint of tropical fruit along with a healthy dose of wood and caramel. A touch of biscuit and apricot.

Faint tropcial fruit in the flavor balanced with pine and earthy hops. Caramel is quite prominent with lots of wood. There is a little bit of toast but it is faint along with a vanilla, almost bourbon, note. Bitterness is fairly high but not harsh at all and lasts long after the flavors have dissipated. Full, smooth mouthfeel is nearly perfect.

Overall, an amazingly balance IPA that is extremely easy to drink. A great marriage between malt and hop and bother perfectly compliment one another. A must-try should you ever come across it.

Appearance:
Clear brilliant oranges under a slightly off-white head which fades slowly and purposefully into a thin collar bordering a soft blanket. Lovely layers of lace linger and remain mostly undisturbed with a few teasatory swirls.

Nose:
Massive grapefruit, key lime, and lemon esters abound ¬ñ take whole fruits, cut, peel, squeeze, enjoy. Grapefruit is the dominant citrus which directs and carries the key lime and lemon. Pine needles and fir trees underneath. Whisper of mint leaf in the back. Crunchy white table crackers. Dew-dropped freshly mown grass as far as the nose can smell in-between row after row of citrus trees equally dew-dropped with fruit hanging low.

Palate:
Grapefruit abounds ¬ñ pink, white, and yellow ¬ñ fresh, tart, sweet, and bright. Mint, fir trees, and pine needles in the finish. Bracing parching cleansing finish. Cut dew-dropped green grass. Closing the eyes I envision myself amidst rows of citrus trees hanging heavy and damp forests of vivid green fir and pine trees. Crisp, clean, and brilliant. Rind lingers atop my tongue after each swallow.

Final Thoughts:
I¬íd drunk many a glass of Sculpin from Ballast Point before I realized I had yet to take tasting notes. Oops. Guess I¬íll just have to ¬ìsuffer¬î through another glass, and so I did and here we are now. Amidst it all I seem to have developed a mighty thirst and I know exactly why. Make mine a Sculpin, please and thanks.

Bottle - Heavy fruits and some nice sweetness.  Clear orange with minimal head.  Grapefruit and other tropical fruits, great bitterness that lingers and cuts through almost anything.  A great strong IPA, beware palette.

Bottle @ home from SF (thx Erik!!)
Pours clear gold-copper, smooth white foam.
Nose is fresh, with stone fruits and pine. 
Taste starts fresh and crisp with citrus, to descend in depths of flavour: Granny smith apple, citrus, sugary white grapes and bags of hop. All in perfect equilibrium and with a modest 7%ABV.
It doesn¬ít get much better than this.
Hazy orange pour with little to white-beaded head. Fruity aroma. Very tart with a crisp hoppy apricot finish.

Crystal clear golden in color with moderate amount of head. Aroma is dominated by fruity hops. Lots of tropical fruit in the nose and in the taste followed by a hint of malt sweetness. Great balance between bitterness, malt sweetness, and hop character. Currently my favorite IPA.

Aroma is citrus floral light caramel malt. Appearance is light orange yellow. Small tan head that dissipates quickly. Taste is grapefruit aroma hops and bitterness forward. Floral aroma hopping as well. Palate is medium and crisp. Overall an excellent IPA. Nothing new here though and overpriced.

Tap. Pours clear gold with thin, creamy white head; decent retention and spare lacing. Aroma is floral and grassy hops, citrus fruit (mostly lemon and grapefruit), biscuit and cookie malt, and light spice.  Flavor is fresh hops forward (medium bitterness) with supporting sweet malts and citrus esters; dry hoppy finish. Medium body and low carbonation.

UPDATED: MAY 5, 2013 Exceptional, really. Very well balanced across a great range of temperatures, which is rare for American IPAs I think. Very crisp, bitter, and refreshing when served very cold. Lots of citrus notes. The malts come out as it warms. Once it hits around 50-55F after sitting for a bit, it becomes full and well-rounded. The hop profile is excellent, for the style, and has a aromatic presence and a finish that easily make it one of the best IPAs I have had. Highly recommended.

Update 5/6/13: I found a bottle marked "Enjoy By 4/20/13", indicating that as of today, it was bottled about 135 days ago. Figured it would be a good experiment. At this age, the citrus has dropped off considerably. The hop flavors are very hollow and papery with only some minor resinous pine and some dry bitterness left. It has definitely become a different beer. Closer to a Stone IPA.

Pours golden yellow with white head which settles quickly to the rim.  Aroma is honey, citrus and piney hops.  Taste is a nicely balanced with initial brief sweetness followed by floral piney hops.  Crisp and light mouthfeel however left a little bit of pill bitterness in the finish - par for west coast ipa¬ís though. Nice IPA.

Draft to taster
Beautiful hoppy, straw and flowery. Clear light amber with almost no head.

Drank from a 22 oz bottle poured into a glass. Pours with very little head but a rich peachy/gold color-beautiful. Aroma is piney with a hint of apricot and mango. Taste is fabulous mix of bright crisp hops, citrus and apricots. Neither sweet or dry, and one of the easiest to drink IPAs I have tried. Good thing it is light on alcohol (for an IPA that is). Perfect amount of fizz to go with the fresh flavors and aroma. Overall a delicious beer perfect for late afternoon relaxin'!

UPDATED: DEC 30, 2012 Drank in shorter pilsner glass from 22 oz bottle at home. Aroma- very nice hoppy smell with notes of cirus. Appearance- golden orange color with very light head. Carbonated. Taste- very smooth and hoppy with a citrsu twist. Excellent! Palate- clean hoppy mouthfeel. Once again with just a hint of citrus. Overall- one of best ipas i have ever had. Clean and drinkable but still substantial hoppiness

12oz bottle from Shane. Thanks! 

Drunk on 10-12-12, reviewed from notes

A: Golden-copper yellow. Great white head lasts for the duration of the beer.

N: Oh Lord in Heaven. Pineapple, mango, citrus, mandarin orange. This is like walking around a fruit stand.  Some pine. This nose goes on forever.

T: As fruity as the nose is, the body is equally piney and earthy. Very, very bitter and dry. A little pineapple, but this is an overwhelming spruce bomb. Some bready/biscuity notes and malt. Quite the dichotomy.

M: Palate is dry to the point where it¬ís like a hop covered with spikes and razors. Fair amount of alcohol.  

O: The epitome of the West Coast IPA. Dry, scraping, and lacking in most of the malt needed to balance out the hops. If only the dry hopping lasted throughout the body, this might be my first perfect 5.
Excellent choice. Color is amber and slightly cloudy. Hoppy start and finish. Please try one.

Draft at Hopping Pig, San Diego. Food pairing with braised bratwurst. Piney hoppy aroma, pleasantly bitter but not overwhelming. Good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours a hazy orange with a thin sticky foam. Smells like apricot, hay, and pine. Nice spicy hop flavor with some malt and light fruit. Finish is dry and refreshing. One of the best IPA¬ís.

Pours a hazy golden orange with good off-white head and moderate lacing. Aromas of citrus and piney hops, sweet maltiness, and slight lemongrass qualities. Taste is piney resins, citrus hops, bittersweet finish. Great IPA, hopefully I can find it again.

Fantastic beer. Just the right amount of hops that lingers in your mouth ninutes after taking a sip. Very easy drinkability, light yet hoppy, not filling and with notes of orange and grapefruit. Even a non-IPA lover would love this beer.
Had at Brewzilla during Cleveland Beer Week.  Floral and citrus notes, just the right amount of bitterness.  Finished nicely, very solid IPA.
UPDATED: OCT 4, 2013 Bra balans med fin god arom med frukt o citrus. Beskan ligger bra i munnen med l√•ng eftersmak. Detta √§r utifr√•n att vara en Ipa en mycket bra s√•dan.

Wow. What a tasty beer.  Very complex hop character.  Grapefruit an lemon with a light malt backbone. This one leaves a good taste in the mouth.  Would drink again.

Nice hazy orange with white head. Aroma is alot of sweet malts, orange, sweet fruits, tropical fruits, honey. Taste has a nice piney bitterness, grapefruit, caramel sweetness, orange, lemon, resin. A very nice IPA. THis bottle was enjoy by 10/24/12 so not sure how old the bottle is? Still an awesome IPA and I bet that it is even more awesome fresher! Cheers!

Orange, amber color..not very aggressive pour..into snifter leaving 1/2 finger head..what carbonation..great  action that rises to the top in somewhat even rows..aroma of orange, mango, citrus dominant, quite juicy on the nose..hop juice..palate is very smooth and grapefruit heavy..almost like the bubble action is continually pushing up more waves and layers of hoppy ipa goodness...this is extremely drinkable and fresh.Solid dry finish..bitterness is spot on...glad that this is now available in MD..can see why this is one of the finest west coast ipa¬ís..everything is so well done here hard to find any real flaws..

Look: Light shade of amber, 1.5 finger white head. Smell: Apricots, oranges, lemon, dank, mango, sweet note, smells like I¬ím going to enjoy this. Taste: Citrus, tropical fruits, grass, lemon peel, dank hops, powdery dry bitter finish. Feel: Medium-light body, soft carbonation. Overall: I enjoyed this brew very much. Very balanced. This brew is Worthy.
resin, floral, citrus, golden, clear, frothy, tan foam, medium sweetness, very bitter, medium sourness, medium body, thin feel, oily feel, lively,
On draft at the lost dog cafe in mclean va. Pours a medium amber with a white head. Massive floral aroma. Apricot and citrus notes. Bitter finish.
From notes, at Craft Beer event in Puerto Rico. Cloudy amber orange colour. Aroma of citrus fruit, noticeable lemon, and some tart apples. Nice hop bitter and carbonation.
After seeing the other scores this beer hardly needs another recommendation, it¬ís delicious, it could use a little more malt for my liking but that certainly is just me, great beer.
Aromas of summer fruits, mango, grass, pine. Centre is sharp zesty hops, followed by lush caramelized fruits, expanding back into a bitter finish. Soft carbonation, smooth mouthfeel. Excellent.

Twelve ounce bottle pored into a small tulip glass. Nice two finger head. Red/amber color. Smells of sweet malt with citrusy lemon and mango. Tastes nice bite upfront with grapefruit and pineapple. Good medium mouthfeel.  Overall, I really enjoy this beer. One of my favorite IPAs

Smakprov p√• SBWF12. Gulorange med gulvitt skum. Mycket fruktig doft, citrus och exotiska frukter. Smaken √§r mer tallbarr men √§ven citrusen fr√•n aromen.

Bottle. Pours a orange hue with a nice off white head.  Aroma is citrus with orange, mango, lemon, and grapefruit. Sweet maltiness aroma comes through as well. Excellent tasting IPA with a nice balance of sweetness and bitterness. Finishes with a nice grapefruit flavor on the tongue. The palate is smooth with the right amount of carbonation, not crisp but it doesn¬ít need to be. Somewhat sweet but hoppy IPA. An excellent choice for a nightcap beer.

Aroma:  Beautiful aroma, smells of orange, lemons, apples maybe, a little hoppiness at the end, pineapple, amazing.  Appearance:  Really nice, lacing is excellent, head is small but that could have been a subpar pour, continuous bubbling almost like Champagne, and a murky orange coloring.  Taste:  Hmm, surprising, a little watery actually, but maybe thats just the lack of hops, it¬ís definitly light, and the aroma doesn¬ít come out as much in the taste.  Palate:  Nice, the bittery hops stay on the palate for a while and it has a strong feeling as it goes down.  Overall:  I¬ím a little surprised, it seemed like a homerun in the beginning but actually felt a little watered down, maybe too light for my tastes.  Definitely worth a buy though.
Amazing surprise to find this beer in Sweden. perfection? hops aroma and taste very fresh, head retention and flawless appearance. It makes my mouth water just thinking about it.

Tap. Pours a dull gold with medium head that lingers.  Great hop aroma.  Initial taste is strong citrus hops.  Lots of pine and grapefruit.  Medium bitterness in the aftertaste.  Perhaps a bit too much bitterness for my tastes as it warmed up, but excellent overall.
UPDATED: DEC 5, 2016 Best Ipa i¬íve ever  tasted. Clean, fresh and perfect. Nice foam retention, brilliant and a really strong hop aroma. Perfectly balanced.

Review #50

Poured from bomber into snifter

A: Pours a nice clear golden apple color with a light peach 1.5 finger head. Great retention on this brew. An incredible net-like lace follows me down the glass. 

S: Nice light citrus hops, sweet honey, floral hops as well. 

T: Very sweet flowers with a light citrus hoppy note. Just a tad bitter on the backend but mellows back to a nice sweet oak. 

M: Light bodied, incredibly smooth and a nice light carbonation as well. Leaves a nice sweet and bitter taste. 

O: I think this was good, but the flavors and smell sort of fell flat. There was some sediment in the bottle so I plan on revisiting this when I know I¬ím having the freshest Sculpin I can have.

Bloody nightmare. Shelf in my beer fridge fell out and this crashed to the floor! Bottle didn't smash but sprayed hoppy foam everywhere. Needless to say, remainder of bottle had to be drunk there and then (3pm on a Wednesday afternoon).
Beautiful hoppy aroma from a golden amber body with creamy head with good lacing. A little flat but that could be because I dropped the bugger!
Initial hop onslaught is nicely balanced by the malt tones. Leaving z very smooth finish.
A very drinkable beer despite its abv.
Quality.

Pours an orange color with nice frothy head.  Aroma is fruity and citrusy.  Lightly malty up front with good grapefruity taste.  Carbonation is about right for an IPA.  Great tasting beer.

Bottle. Pours a clear light amber, almost gold. Slight head. Aroma is a perfect mix of citrus and pine. Taste has all of the characteristics of a great ipa. Grapefruit, some lemon, and a subdued pine flavor are the highlights. Bitterness is not cloying or biting making it very easy to drink. Great ipa.

Pours lighter than many IPAs, a golden/copper with good carbonation. Aroma is full of citrus bouquets, sweet with a little bitterness coming through. Taste is well balanced, especially considering the amount of hops that go into this brew. Sweetness is always present with some puckering bitterness, especially near the finish. Mouthfeel is light with nice, crisp carbonation. Overall a great beer within my favorite style that I¬ím sure to go back to from time to time.

UPDATED: OCT 24, 2012 Takes home the Gold thats all there is to say, If you don¬ít believe me put your hands on this one and you too will confirm my rating. By far the best IPA you will ever lay hands on. Pours a nice golden amber color and retains the lacing throughout of a nice white frothy head. Orange, Pine, Mango and Grapefruit are all present in this perfect example of what every other brewer should set their standard at. By far and above the best IPA available that I have had the chance to sample. And yes kids I did get a six keg to enjoy for my own pleasure. If you have not yet tried this one you owe it to yourself to scurry on down to your local store and pick it up. out of this world

Spectacular West Coast IPA.  Bright, full aroma and flavor.  Resin and grapefruit flavor that persist in an extraordinary aftertaste.  One of the best.

Bottle. Pours orange amber with white head. Nose/taste of mango, pineapple, peach pit, citrus, lemon and caramel malt. Dry citrus finish with hints of resin/pine. Body on the lighter side of medium. Hops are slightly perfumy. Easy drinking.

Maybe ts too cold, but there was not much of an aroma, but I did notice a hint of lemon peel. Definitely a good looking beer; amber body and slightly cloudy with lasting SUDS. Light on the palate. The taste is outstanding with something different than other IPA; almost a bit of smokiness to the hops. The hops are intense but not too overpowering. As far as IPAs goes, this one is up there with Bell¬ís Two Hearted.

This was a fantastic beer.

The hop profile was fantastic bright and hoppy.  Plenty of citrus and tropical fruits, a pleasure to drink.

From The Hopster...crisp IPA notes of apricot grass pine smooth drinking very good

2012-09-15. Lightly hazy bright orange body, nice off-white/beige head. 3+ Pleasant hoppy flavour, lovely tangerine citrus and orange seeds. Perfect amount of bitterness throughout, very muted green leafy hop undercurrents. 8++ Hoppy aroma, modest citrus and leafy green touches. 7+ Average plus to medium bodied palate is fairly carbonated and suits the beer well. 3+ Very nice IPA! 22 ounce bottle poured into a pint glass.  Pours an orange color with medium head.  Nose is peach, pineapple, citrus and pine.  Flavor follows the hose, with a bitter hop finish.  A very good summertime brew.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Had this on tap 3 weeks ago, pouring from the bottle as I taste tonight. Equally enjoyable from the bottle, orange-lemon aroma that translates to a somewhat piney flavor, I¬ím thinking Simcoe hops in here somewhere. Clear golden color in the glass, carbonation and viscosity add up to all you¬íd want in an IPA, not as thick as some Imperial IPAs but approaching that slightly thicker  mouthfeel. Not a "session" IPA, a bit of a palate-wrecker, so best to reserve to end of the evening or better yet, just enjoy it on a night when you¬íre just ready for ONE exceptional beer.  Because YES this one is worth the 100-point rating, outstanding effort.

Trade from StefanSD, thanks buddy. Clear amber body with a large frothy white head. Aroma is peach, mango, citrus, hops. Flavor is lots of bitter hops, peach, mango, lemon, grapefruit, pine needles, fresh wet newly cut grass. Delicious.

Pours a cloudy medium orange color with almost no head.  Very nice fruity and malty aroma.  Lots of peaches, apricots, lemons, oranges, and pineapples come out.  Taste is very nice blend of all the aromas and backed up by a decent amount of malt.  Moderate bitterness in the middle helps to balance the sweet fruit.  Spicy finish brings out flavors of peppercorns and more citrus.  Slightly bitter in the finish too.  A very good IPA.  Lots of flavor packed in, nice amount of bitterness, decent complexity.  Highly recommend.

UPDATED: SEP 21, 2015 1) Tap, Church Key, San Francisco, 16/08/12. Wild green, deeply stewed and spliff-like aroma approaching a 10. Rasping, enamel-stripping grapefruit softening into tropical fruit and Darjeeling. Simcoe and lots of it? Mad, balanced and sampled to Tom. FAR too good to leave in your cousin¬ís fridge 7000 miles away. 
 2) Can from Leicester BrewDog. Fat honey pour with clouds of lace. Floral honey and herbal aroma with peach liqueur, grapefruit, pine, rosemary and Jelly Tots. Slick lemon infused sponge sweetness to the fore swiftly demolished by resinous pine, sun baked conifer, almost lavender, mandarin jelly. lean chaffy backdrop of malt. balance bob on with neither an excess of sweetness or bitterness. The citrus flavors really pop in this beer, but not too overpowering. Very good beer.

Draught, floral hop notes, crisp taste indicative of a nice fresh IPA, great beer overall

Aroma is very citrus sweet grapefruit hopy floral cascade I also get some sort of sweet peach or apricot. Pours a copper color with lots of creamy off white foam. Leaves some lacing and has quit a bit of carbonation. Taste is sweet at first lots of grapefruit little malt and pine. Sits a little bitter towards the end. Some floral tones as well. Overall this is an amazing beer wish I could buy it for my every day beer. Damn it¬ís good! Thank you Brian.
UPDATED: NOV 9, 2012 Great IPA! Smooth citrus bomb! Last longer than others that lose the kick.Right up there with the great IPAS! Close to perfect if fresh.

Bottle from GBBF 2012. Colour is rusty brown clear copper, white head. Nose is sweet caramel, marmalade, citrous fruit, grapefruit peel, orange drink, dab of pine. Taste is sweet bitter grapefruit, orange, prickly hops. Body is clear and lightish though, with a crisp prickly hop bite on the finish.

Bottle. Caramel malt, pineapple orange hops aroma, quite tropical. Hazy golden with a small white head, nice sticky lacing. Resinous piney citrus hops and some caramel malt flavor. Full sticky body, slightly dry finish. Good, but I prefer more malt balance with my hops.

Bottle.  Orange-pineapple caramel malt and orange peel aroma.   Hazy golden yellow with small head.  Mildly sweet orange malt and moderately bitter grapefruit peel, pine, quinine bitterness.   Smells nice - malt flavor very subdued though.

Bottle. Very pretty clear gold pour with white head. Aroma is hoppy, quite fruity, lots of mango, pineapple, with some very light resinous notes, spruce, lemon also. Taste is bitter, dry palate, everything a good IPA should be. The hops come out tasting quite fruity, almost adding a sweet honey-nectar like flavor. Delicious.

Bottle. Absolutely amazing IPA. Super hoppy in both taste and smell, but without the balance a lot of brews strive for. This is one of those beers that will kick you in the ass and say "I¬íM AN IPA, DAMN IT!" As it should. Great beer. Glad I found this.

Golden orange with a small head. The aroma is very citrusy, with orange and lemon. There is some caramel an pine resin as well as floral hops. The flavor has a nice sweetness to it that carries the hop flavors well. Some bitterness creeps in a 10seconds or so after swallowing.  Nice body and balance. Super tasty too.

Pours a golden orange with a nice off white head that fades and leaves good lacing in the glass. Aroma is lots of mango and apricots, a bit of caramel malt. Taste is very bright and fruity with tons of apricot and a bit of mango, bitter hops and then some sweetness then more hops cleanse the palate, good ipa but stone ipa is still way better.

Liquid gold with a little reddish amber.  The citrus and grapefruit punch you in the nose first.  Medium boddied with smooth carbonation.  Grass, wet hay, grapefruit and lemon assault your tongue and lead the battle against boring brews.  This is a great IPA.  Very drinkable becasue it isn¬ít obnoxiuosly bitter.

Clear golden pour that gives half finger of white foam, that quickly dissipates to a persistent ring of lacing. Sugar & lemon aroma, with some grassy notes. Big piney taste on a sugary caramel backbone with a slight copper/metallic finish. Low carbonation with medium body.

I enjoyed this one, but it was different than i expected.  cloudy appearance. has a very apricot/peachy sweet flavor with a big load of dry hop in the finish.  i think its just personal taste, because obviously this is a well made beer, but i prefer my IPAs more on the bitter and dry end of the spectrum while this one is more bright and zingy while still having some IBUs.  I will have to revisit someday, as i¬íve only had one 22oz bomber, but as it stands I prefer their Big Eye to this one.

Such a nice IPA.  Big, good god this is big.  Loads and loads of citrus hops in the flavour and the bitterness.  Pours a hazy deep golden yellow with a frothy white top that laces beautifully.  Aroma is a beautiful citrus hop flavouring with light fruity and sweet malt.  Taste is big beautiful citrus hops and dry bitterness with a resinous mouthfeel.  Not an everyday beer but definitely a nice treat.

UPDATED: AUG 27, 2012 the aroma right off the bat was the citrus of the hops and as it warmed some i picked up the apricot and peach...what a wonderful scent to have in this beer...medium bodied and smooooooth...hops do no over power this beer at all..the citrus flavor and the apricot are forefront on this one and the smoothness as it goes down. on the back end you do get a bit of the lemon blended with the bitterness of the hops and it works...very very good beer.
Beautiful dark orange color, very frothy head, strong hoppy aroma and taste, bitter,  citrucy, mango, orange, apricot, very tropical, awesome ipa!
Decent beer. I¬ím not fond of the amount of apricot however and the beer literally feels like it¬ís evaporating off your tongue at the end. I want the middle to linger. Meh.

22 oz bottle poured into a tumbler pint glass. Best by date is 09/07/12, so this should be nice and (relatively) fresh...

A: Pours a lightly cloudy golden amber color with light carbonation. The head is a nicely frothy two finger offwhite head with excellent retention and texture. Leaves a nice ring of lacing, and is a generally beautiful beer.

S: Nicely tropical, with notes of mango, apricot, and passion fruit. A little bit of the malt backbone pops up here, too. Nice smelling, but not quite as boldly aromatic as I was expecting.

T: Much like the nose, strong tropical fruits (mango, grapefruit rind, and apricot) open things up, and stay there throughout the flavor progression. Aside from the citric notes, this is also very piny (and almost peppery) in its hop composition, especially on the finish. The malt backbone is just there - all it does is provide a neutral canvas while giving a nice balance. I like the complexity of the hop character, but this isn¬ít the end all be all I was expecting it to be. It¬ís still a good IPA, though.

M: Very dry and very oily. It¬ís a rather coarse and prickly beer in general; a little more smoothness would be incredibly welcome. While the coarse, well carbonated character gives it nice drinkability, it means it¬ís a little harsh going down.

O: It¬ís a good IPA. It¬ís a very good IPA. But it¬ís NOT the masterpiece I hoped it would be. I feel like it¬ís too resinous and dry to truly belong in the elite tier. And given its price here on the East coast, I doubt I¬íll revisit this again (except on tap).

Citrus, balanced hops, nice finish. Beautiful beer. If you like Ballast Point check out Mother Earth Brewery just north of them, small brewery about to take off. One of the few legit breweries in their area.
Sense cap mena de dubte una de les millors IPA¬ís que he provat. Enviada directament des dels Estats Units per un bon amic. Fresca, equilibrada, llarga... Un 10!!!

The citrus and tropical aromas immediately seduce you into the secluded part of the world where tourists disappear and legendary tales begin. Are you ready for adventure?  Sculpin lets you know she¬ís not your everyday IPA as soon as you wash up on the shore. She flashes her delicate pineapples and you finally wrap your tongue around her sweet mangoes for the first time. You see little difference between the celestial bodies as both the sun and her white gold complexion refresh your soul and tingle your libido. Her hops playfully nibble and bite, but never lose sight of why you came.  She wants to satisfy but she doesn¬ít want you to leave. Each sip is a tease that both surprisingly exceeds legend and leaves you yearning for more.   You want her again and again. Her siren song calls you and you only.  This is why you¬íre lost, sailor.  It¬ís because you want to be.
Good ipa with malt and hops abundant. Missing something, some watery-ness but very very slight. Lemon zest with minor vegitation from hops.
Bottle at CCB Day, S√§tila 2012-07-07. Golden beer with a offwhite head. Hoppy, fruity, grassy aroma with a metallic notes. Hoppy, fruity, citrus flvaour. Sourish. A nice beer :-)

From a Liquor store on Lake Mead Blvd in Vegas. Hazy yellow with great retention. Smell juicy peaches, malt, tropical fruit. Taste is like peaches and cream. No alcohol, hoppy and bitter, earthy and a bit of tea. Awesome ipa.

A-- Poured the typical IPA color, yellow gold. Lots of carbonation bubbles and beautiful head to this. Head stayed at about a solid two finger level. Well compacted, tight head to this. Just a little off white in color. Good, thick lacing on the sides of the glass.

S-- Mango, passionfruit, fresh citrus and a little bit of pine. Great nose and so full of flavors.

T-- Candied grapefruit, turns to fresh grapefruit, turns to pine and Carmel. YUM.

M-- Got how the grapefruit turns to several different flavors. Also get lemon, a bit of grass and then to bitter pine and grapefruit at the end. Long lasting pine and grapefruit flavor. Medium high carbonation and very creamy. The way the flavors change is excellent.

D-- Excellent. great beer.

Bomber.  Poured deep gold with a medium-sized off-white head.  Aroma and flavor were hop forward but not overly bitter.  Lots of citrus, some pineapple, very dank and earthy hops.  Enough malt to keep it from being off-balance.  Medium to thick mouthfeel, but not particularly sticky or oily. A really good IPA.

Purchased in a bomber from a Las Vegas convenient store. I was super stoked. Also had on tap at Public House in the Venetian. (Notes from the bomber though)
Appearance: hazy golden orange with sticky, heavy lacing. Off-white head.
Aroma of citrus and pine hops.
Super resiney bitterness, smooth, well balanced with malt. Complex hops with grapefruit and citrus.

This beer is absolutely fantastic.

Tap at the Ginger Man, Manhattan - 29/02/12.
Pours to a slightly obscured orange/golden colour, good finger of creamy head with plenty of lacing and good retention as I drank.
Full on piney nose, grapefruit, mango a little sweetness on the nose and a touch of caramel.
Tastes allied to the nose, again with a litte sweetness and malt, not as bitter as you may expect from the aroma.
Medium bodied, moderate carbonation and a smooth feel/finish.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle bought at Great British Beer Festival 2012, Olympia, London. A golden/amber coloured pour with a healthy off white head on top. Hoppy, citrus fruit/tropical fruit aroma. Tastes hoppy, citrus/tropical fruit, nice bitterness, very well balanced, complex and delicious. Ballast Point are top draw.

A clear golden/yellow colored beer, with a small light beige head. The aroma of fruits like citrus, a lot of hops. The taste is fruity, citrus, dry bitter hop. The aftertaste is a little sweet, mostly hop bitter.

Rich, yet with so much balance. Very complex... Herb, concentrated citrus, tropical fruits... Bitterness definitely in control. Big and smooth, without being heavy and sticky. Long lingering finish. An impressive IPA.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Excellent IPA!!  For any hop head out there, go out of your way for this one!

Bottle poured a light copper with orange hues, large white head, and excellent lacing.  Huge citrus and piney resiny hops aroma flow from the glass before apricot and tropical fruits reveal themselves.  Taste begins with citrus zest and tropical fruits and then palatable hop bitterness takes over leading to a smooth crisp finish.  Nice active carbonation, good mouthfeel, and flavors linger on the palate long after each sip.  Solid IPA.

UPDATED: DEC 11, 2012 Thanks to Paul (Lunch) for sharing this growler.

A: Mostly clear and light yellow in color with a thick, white head and an ample amount of sticky lacing.

S: Great fresh hop and tart citrus aromas. Simply wonderful.

T: Absolutely awesome flavor. Grapefruit presence is very prominent. Tangy and hop forward, this beer is incredibly smooth and bursting with flavor.

M: Medium / thin in body, the feel is smooth and creamy with just the right amount of carbonation.

D: I could drink this all night. One of the best IPAs I have ever had.

Serving type: growler

Reviewed on: 01-30-2011

22oz bomber, gift from a friend. pours orange in color with a white head and much lacing around the glass...the aroma right off the bat was the citrus of the hops and as it warmed some i picked up the apricot and peach...what a wonderful scent to have in this beer...medium bodied and smooooooth...hops do no over power this beer at all..the citrus flavor and the apricot are forefront on this one and the smoothness as it goes down. on the back end you do get a bit of the lemon blended with the bitterness of the hops and it works...very very good beer.

UPDATED: JUN 30, 2015 2011 GGBF, cask and bottle
Pours dark amber with fluffy white head. Oranges and magoes nose. TRopical frut, plenty of bitterness, fairly gentle carbonation.8 4 8 4 15
Can from brewdog online
Pours fairly clear burnished gold with fluffy beige head collapsing to lacing, fruity passion fruit and mango aromas on nose. medium body and carbonation, quite biscuit, tonnes of grapefruit, touch of bitterness, juicy, long dry finish. Alcohol becomes quite apparent as drink progresses with growing pithingess. No change

Thanks to Zio Aldo for this bad boy, from a bomber pours an orange to gold hue with a frothy white head.  Aroma is subtle, citrus, tropical fruit, touch of floral.  Can¬ít believe how smooth and light the mouthfeel is.  What a fantastic experience on the palate, light, but complex.  Outstanding beer.

Interesting beer. Thought I should try this as I like more balanced IPAs that have the malt backbone to support the hops.

The pour looked great, clear amber/copper color with white head and smelt strongly of malts, maybe a hint of piney hops in the nose, but mostly the caramel & breadiness of the malts broke through. Slight hint of grapefruit in the nose, but not as much as I would have liked.

Taste wise it wasn¬ít at all what I was expecting, strong malt-forward beer here that had a strong caramel and breadiness/yeast like flavor with the grapefruit noticeable, but not dominate. For an IPA I was baffled as to how the hops had fallen to the back in this beer.

Mouthfeel is great, it¬ís a very drinkable beer that¬ís very smooth, almost no bitterness to this beer, probably due to the lack of dominant hops. Light carbonation.

All-in-all a good solid beer, but not at all what I expected in a balanced IPA. Most of the time I think IPAs as overly hopped up and never would have figured there¬íd be an IPA that was overly malted up.
Solid IPA but it doesn¬ít live up to the hype of one of the best IPA¬ís in the world. Rather tame for a westcoast IPA.

Acquired in a trade. Enjoyed in a chalice. Beer was in the fridge but served at around 50 Degrees F.

A - Poured a hazy dark gold. 1 finger head appeared but faded fast.

S - Very tropical. More maltiness for a DIPA than I had expected. Hint of citrus as well.

T - Taste is dominated by grapefruit. Hint of tangerine and pineapple. Big malty finish is mildly depressing. 

M - 80% carbonation on the mouth swish. Medium body. 

O - I think this bottle had sat around for too long. I loved the DIPA from Ballas. This beer really falls short. It¬íll be hard to finish the bomber with a far better citra IPA in my keg from a recent homebrew.
2012 OBF. Outstanding IPA that I have been wanting to try for some time. Citrus, tropical fruit and resiny pine. Finish is crisp and bitter. Tasty.

Bottle thanks to pellegjr - cheers my friend! Pours hazy orange with thin but lasting bright white head. Aroma is a fruit explosion of mango, papaya, apricot, sweet orange, grapefruit - wonderful. Taste is another juicy fruit hit with tropical notes combining with pine resin notes; nice dry finish & a lasting bitterness. What a cracker of an IPA.

On tap at OBF. Blonde with a little blush, white head. sharp citurs and resin aromas, with distant malt. Light weight wiht good carbonation.  Strong citrus hops approaching a metallic rasp, a little oak, a little honey. bitter finish
Bottle (several of them) - Pours a medium orange with a decent head. This is one hoppy SOB. Excellent grapefruit hop aroma and taste. Medium body and not too dry on the finish. Simply excellent!

UPDATED: SEP 5, 2013 12oz into snifter, thanks to Scalene for sending this in ¬íEverything Local BIF¬í. Bottle says ¬íEnjoy By 080912¬í
A- Golden, lacy 1 finger head.
S- Big citrus, a bit dank
T- Very bitter, but not much flavor. Where is the citrus from the aroma?
M- Good carb, good consistency.
O- Was really excited for this one, but its simply not good. Everything seemed promising, but it just doesn¬ít taste good. Really bitter with very little flavor and not much balance.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 06-01-2012 09:03:16

Trying this again fresh, weak aroma but decent flavor.  At 7% with moderate hops, why the fuck is this beer 14 bucks a 6 pack?
Bottle. Orange blonde color. Oily hops, grapefruit and pineapple in the aroma and flavor. Blackcurrant. Thinnish. Long earthy oily hopbitter finish. Well balanced, but not a hop monster.

A vicious bite but so smoothly satisfying after the sharp beginning. Hop-raisin notes trickle down the palate and fall into a symphony sweet nectar beneath the abrasive bitter crust. Gorgeous lacing with a fine head and a strong aroma. Overall,a remarkable IPA.
190712. Tap at city beer, SF. Piyra clear golden with a small head. Aroma fresh hops, citrus. Fresh medium bitter finish. Very well balanced. Not Bad.

Tap @ Crowne Plaza San Diego: Clear gold color with a small white head.  Musty grass aroma with light citrus notes in the background.  Hoppy bitter flavor in full swing with a floral, bitter aftertaste.  Another solid offering from Ballast Point.

Bottle shared at Tkrjukoff¬ís CCB-day in S√§tila. Pours almost clear yellow with a medium sized off-white head. Very fresh hoppy aroma. Hoppy, citrus and pine in the taste, very fresh. Medium bitter finish. Very nice.
what can i say is that i am in love with this beer. it was recommended to me to serve at a party and everyone loved it. this is by far the king of ipas.
tap @ city beer tasting room, SF clear golden, white head. aroma of grapefruit, citrus. grapefruit in the flavor too. nice aftertaste
On tap. Copper pour, small white head. Medium carbonation. Aroma of grapefruit, a little sour milk. Mild ¬†palette. Dry hoppy finish. Pleasant but didn¬ít knock me off my feet.
Had as part of a 4 beer flight at rattle and hum in NYC.  First of the flight, very well balanced hoppiness with a citrus smell and after taste.  Not overwhelmingly bitter

On tap at the Hopping Pig.  Golden beer with a sticky white head.  Big candied orange peel nose with hints of peach.  This is a big juicey, hoppy IPA with grapefruit peel, peach, pineapple and hop resin.  Long bitter hop resin finish.

650 ml. bottle. Pours a medium, well retained white head, with minimal lacing, over a clear amber (SRM 7) body..........nose is pine, grapefruit, hints of apricot, pineapple, hint of toffee/caramel.......taste is heavy pine, grapefruit peel, hints of toffee/caramel, apricot, pineapple, finishing with a moderate biter bite.....mouth feel medium, carbonation high adding spritz. This is obviously a "Left Coast" IPA. It is redolent of hop aromas and flavors with the bitterness nicely balanced back by the malts. This is a cleansing, refreshing, delicious confection. BJCP8/3/15/4/7

Draught at Monkey Paw. Clear, light amber/golden liquid with firm medium off-white head. Aroma of grass, blackberries, fresh hops, mango, weed and biscuit. Very well balanced. Taste is dry and medium bitter with notes of simcoe hops, fresh hops and mango. Drinkable. Meidum bodied with medium carbonation. Stellar IPA. Very refreshing.
Listen, 950+ ratings can¬ít be wrong.  You won¬ít get any complaints if you bring this home.

UPDATED: JUL 2, 2013 Bottle. Amber with a white head that laces well. Aroma of lemon, kumquat, stone fruits, pineapple. A little oily, but pretty light-bodied. Taste is barely sweet, but quite fruity, with stone and tropical fruits; lemon. Crisp finish with a fair bit of bitterness (although a little more wouldn¬ít have hurt). Alcohol is dangerously well-hidden. Not interesting to drink, just very good. [4]A bunch of these about 6 weeks old, if the bb is 150 days. A little more complex than before with some citrus flowers in there with the rest. Probably better within a fortnight, but this is very lovely indeed.

UPDATED: DEC 12, 2013 First ratingBottle shared @ Timo¬ís/tkrjukoff¬ís CCB Day tasting on July 7, 2012.Slight bit hazy honey color, small white head. Hoppy, some cheese scent. Hoppy, bitter, some malt taste. Smooth mouthfeel, medium high bitterness.8/3/7/4/15=3.7RerateBottle at Monk¬ís Caf√© Sveav√§gen, on December 9, 2013.Hazy golden color, small white head. Sweet, malty, caramel, hoppy scent. Sweet, malty, caramel, hoppy, bitter taste. Medium mouthfeel, medium7/3/7/3/13= high bitterness.3.3

22 oz. bottle- Pours cloudy golden with a nice dense two finger head that has duration. Aroma is resinous oily hops, some citrus, but mostly piney resinous hops. The taste is sweet light malt with a wallop of piney bitter hops, now this is an IPA, bold and in your face hops, yet light enough malt to be massively drinkable, there is a nice fruity character to it without it being fruity too, if that makes any sense. I loved this beer, one of the best IPA¬ís I have ever had, man I love beer.

bomber shared by phirley. orange with a lasting off white head. big hoppy aroma with backing malt. huge complex flavour, wave of hops progressing from hop flavour to long dry bitterness. the malt provides structure but lets the hops lead. lovely.

UPDATED: JUL 15, 2012 Bomber shared @ tkrjukoffs CCB Day tasting. Pours tiny hazy pale golden with a frothy white head that slowly dissipates while leaving some thick lacing on the glass. Smell is slightly sweet and hoppy fresh with mango, passion fruit, lemon zest, grapefruit juice, fresh grass, orange zest, pineapple, lemon grass, dry soil, straw, lime leaves and mandarin oranges. Taste is tiny sweet and very fresh with grapefruit juice, lemon zest, orange zest, freshly cut grass, green grapes, unripe mango, lemon grass, lemon balm, gooseberries, pine and unripe plums. Mouthfeel¬†is round, slightly oily bitter, slightly watery and light bodied. Finish is tiny sweet and bitter with grapefruit juice, orange peal, lemon zest, grass, pine and grape zest. Incredibly balanced and drinkable.

UPDATED: SEP 27, 2013 Bottle at CCB Day, S√§tila 2012-07-07. Golden beer with a nice white head. Hoppy fruity aroma, pineapple, grass, mango, pine, apples, grapes, metal, pear. Hoppy flavor, fruity, grapefruit, citrus, lemongrass, perfume notes, pineapple, sourish, mango, pine. Bitter citrus finish.

bottle 12oz.(with jarad200p) Pours a cloudy amber with a nice frothy head. Loads of citrus on the nose. Lots of citrus with medium sweet taste.medium bitterness, medium body, creamy, sticky, average carbonation, bitter finish.
Nice color. The aroma has a hoppy citrus smell.  The taste is great. Very good IPA.

I've had this before and didn't much care for it. This batch (6-pack that just arrived at the store) was fantastic. It pours a beautiful orange and smells like fresh sticky hops. Fruity hops, like citrusy orange, mango & grapefruit. It tastes much the same, juicy! Bitter on the finish but not overly, all in all it's delicious, balanced and in my opinion, what a great IPA should taste like.

---Rated via Beer Buddy

On tap at Money Plays. Pours a clear amber with thick frothy white head sticky lacing. The aroma is floral hops and pine. Medium mouthfeel with a strong hop bite and bitter finish. Easy to drink,really enjoyed this one. An impressive IPA from Ballast Point.

Hazy amber/orange color; Medium creamy body; Aroma of rich floral hops, pine, & citrus; Flavor of slight sweet malt, pine hops, caramel, and citrus (notably grapefruit); Finish is bitter; Nicely balanced; A very good IPA.
This should be the reference for an IPA.  Tastes amazing!  I wish it had better availability here in Maryland.  Really nice hop balanced with the malt backbone.  A joy to drink.

Dark yellow color with fluffy white head, Dark yellow color. Strong aroma of pine, grapefruit and a touch of honey. Taste sweet, well balanced. A little easy on the palate compared to stronger ABV ipa'd Overall, a great drink.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Rich aroma of orange peel, malt, bread, a little pine or rosemary. Appearance is a clear, burnt orange, minimal head that laces on the glass. Somewhat viscous body that slides over the tongue, leaving it¬ís rich taste behind to linger in a long finish. Lively but soft carbonation. A nice balance of rich body, slight sweet notes of currant, with an exploding carbonated dry bitterness A long, dry finish turns from slightly sweet to strong, dry bitter, leaving a clean lingering taste that lasts.

Pours a burnt orange with gold highlights and a good sized white head, plenty of lacing on the glass.  Aroma is definitely on the fruity side of hoppy with mango, orange, lemon, and a subtle pine but not much.  Definitely fresh and inviting.  The flavor shows a bit of malt as well with some biscuit, breadcrust and caramel, but it¬ís the citrusy hops that dominate.  Finishes very flavorful with a well managed bitterness and flavors of toast, grapefruit, orange, and nuts?  I dunno.  Mouthfeel is easy going and unassuming yet gets good points for that.  Great beer that maybe didn¬ít wow me, but I can recognize excellence when I drink it.

Had this beer in Dallas.  Sharp amber color and good level of hops.  Pair up nicely with fish and chips.  Nice citrus taste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
65cl, American brew, thx to Secret Santa!, complex bitter brew, bitter/fruity and slightly sweet, very balanced, hazy, rocky head, very good brew, yet expensive!

Pours a rusty amber orange with a nice head. Nose is citrus, tropical fruits and pine. Taste is full of flavor, not terribly bitter and finishes smoothly on a sweet note. Alcohol well masked, drinks as a lighter IPA with a lower ABV. Quite nice from a great microbrewer. Quaff Score 9 / 10

Pours a hazy golden orange with a white head and nice aroma of citrus and hops. Taste is of hops, citrus, and pine, while subtle, with a slight bitter, smooth finish. Very nice IPA, drinkable and great tasting.

Ah, finally, an IPA that is really good.  Seems a lot of the "hey lets make a brewery" brewers are producing things that are labelled IPA, but really taste like old stale hops!  Don¬ít get me wrong, you have a few out there that are making some really great IPAs and this is one of them.  Clean, fresh, bitterly hoppy, foamy, citrusy......hits all the marks!  Really nice IPA!!!  I¬ím drinking one now!!!!!
On tap, BrewDog Edinburgh. A fantastic IPA. Dark yellow/golden in colour, sweet pine and grapefruit aroma, taste is sweet, bitter, hoppy and delicious. A fantastically balanced beer.

22 ounce bottle from the Brass Tap, poured an range color, aromas of pineapple, tropical fruit, and light malt.  Flavors are the same, with the malt playing nicely off the tropical fruit, and light bitterness.
Dark yellow colour with creamy white head. Strong aroma of pine, grapefruit, honey. Taste is bitter, sweet, well balanced. A little thin on the palate. Overall, a great brew.

On tap at Good Dog with brewers for the Ballast Point takeover event. This version was double dry hopped with dank simcoe. Pours a hazy gold, creamy off white thick head and tons of awesome lacing. Aromas and taste of are insanely tropical, pineapple, cantalope, mango, apricot heavy citrus pine, some Buttery smooth mouth from the cask. Earlier Rating: 1/25/2011 Total Score: 4.5Bottle. 25.4 oz. Pours orange-gold with a thick, frothy white head. Aroma of hop resin, orange, pineapple, honey, Granny Smith apple, vanilla, caramel, and sweet malts. Fuller bodied; perfectly balanced with a juicy, tart, smooth mouthfeel. Slow-burning, crisp, carbonated finish. Outstandingly executed, outrageously delicious, incredibly satisfying Imperial IPA. Great west coast IPA
Golden color with a big beige head. Aroma of floral and citrus hops. Taste of sweet malts and resinous hops. Very good.
Very nice ale, served on draft at a spot in San Diego. Medium fizz, light golden colour.

Auburn pour with a thin head. Aggressive aroma, very fruity, with notes of orange, pineapple, peach, and spicy hops. Light to medium bodied, thin palate, gentle malt, resinous hop profile, the finish is very long and dry, coats the mouth with a sticky pine hop shot. Outstanding.

Bottle. Pours bright orange apricot color with a white soapy head that fades and leaves some spotty lacing. Aroma has a nice blend of pineapple and malt and some spruce. Taste is bitter grapefruit and citrus flavors with the malt really kicking in the finish. Palate has good carbonation and leaves a chalky dry finish. Very enjoyable! Would love to try again fresh!

Clear orange with big, creamy, off-white head / Muted, sweet nose of pine, orange, and peach / Medium body, creamy but some bite, lightly sweet, malty with good balance and bitter finish / Flavors of orange, peach, apricot,grapefruit, pine, and spun sugar / A good, big, solid ipa.

Bottle. Aroma was quite fruity, citrus, peach, mango I picked up in addition to floral. Appearance is orange golden medium-full off-white head. Light sweet taste. Medium-light malt body, texture on the thin side, mild bitter finish. Smooth finish mixing hop and malt. Not my favorite IPA, but definitely one of the better ones out there.
Pours orange with white head.... Aroma is odd..hints of fruit and cake batter...  taste is totally diffrent.. Smooth caramel pine. Very well made... Will get again
Bottle. Orange colored pour with a medium to large sized foamy off white head. Notes of caramel, flowers, citrus, and green hops. Smooth and long lasting. Very nice.

Pours a nice golden straw color with a one finger head. Very clear. Head reduces to a thin layer that persists throughout. Great citrus hop aroma with grapefruit notes. Solid hop bite that is balanced by a gentle malt backbone. Overall a great hop forward IPA that is one of the top on my list.

12oz bottle at ballast point. Pours thin with a finger of head. Head disappears pretty fast.  Golden yellow appearance small steady bubbles.  Taste definitely has bite.  Hops, citrus, grapefruit, with a slight alcohol taste. Piney on the back end.  Pallet is light and somewhat smooth. Overall great beer.  I wish this was easily attainable.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Great looking orange clear pour.  Floral citrus grapefruit pine and hopppy taste. Well balanced.  Almost a perfect beer in my opinion!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAY 26, 2012 Draft. Hazy gold with a small frothy head. Very nice full flavored IPA. Nice dry citrus notes from the hops. Lots of citrus with. Mid to light roasty flavors. Lemon grass. Cinnamon. Dark wildflower honey. Fresh watercress. Somehow crisp and syrupy at the same time. Well blended. Hop bitterness throughout but a soft enough finish. Nice. Nice. Nice. A must try!
beautiful light aromatic citrus hops. The bouquet of hops is my favorite characteristic-slaps you in the face. Extremely drinkable.

The Beer, the Myth, the Legend.  After waiting/searching 2 years for this brew, I finally got my mouth on it.  Great IPA!  Wonderful citrus notes in the nose and in the taste.  Nice sticky white lacing.  Beautiful orange-gold color.  A must have to Hop Heads.
Amber in color, clear with a thin head.  Big hops forward aroma.  Floral and fruity.  Very nice malt backing and flavors.  This was a very tasty IPA.  One of the bets I have had in a long time.

Appearance was amber gold with diminishing whitish creamy 1 finger head, spotty lacing.Aromas where sweet honey malt with grapefriut, lemons, oranges and spices. Taste was sweet figs, honey sweet malty backbone with melony citrus lemony hops comes through in the back. Palate was smooth creamy carbonation with beautiful medium balance of sweetness and hops. Wonderful IPA...
Orange color body with big hop flavor and bitter grapefruit finish. On point for sure.

UPDATED: JUN 27, 2013 re-rate with a more mature palate:

Pours and looks the same as I described below, but the taste is nowhere near as mind blowing.  3.6

Pours a clear light amber with a generous 4 finger head.  Very citrusy aroma, grapefruit, mango.  Taste follows suit, very sticky hops, very bitter.  A beautiful beer. 4.3

Bottle.  Golden orange pour head with a foamy white head.  Grapefruit hop aromas.  Fantastic balance.  Good body.  Loads of grapefruit and melon hop notes supported by a sturdy caramel malt backbone.  A very nice IPA.

Great and nice                


 - a a a a a a. A a-&/$:$:$:'dndnkdn$&$)$$&$$:& via Beerology

UPDATED: DEC 30, 2013 Bomber from Wilibees in Petaluma. Orange pour with great white lacing on the glass. Nose is bright citrus hops - grapefruit and mango - with some resin to round it out and make it a very full aroma. Moderate palate. Taste is sharp citrus hop that is well balanced. Great beer.
What a lovely, tasty beer.  Lots of hop and a gentle wash of malt.  Slight amount of minerality, like stones washed in a river.  Draft.

Bottle. Pours a nice golden orange color with a white head. Aroma is filled with sweet grapefruit, grapefruit peel, peach, orange and tangerine and is super hoppy. Flavor follows the nose with a touch of sweet malt, I get floral notes, sweet grapefruit and grapefruit peel, subtle tropical fruit and orange and tangerine. The body is medium with a dry mouth feel. Overall a great IPA.

A pretty citrusy IPA.  Very strong grapefruit flavor - round citrusy nose.  Tastes more sour than bitter.  Finishes very dry.  There are plenty of hops in there...but it starts off and ends with so much citrus, that it feels like a hop cameo.
12 ounce bottle pour.  Nice golden white headed citrus iPa.  Very drinkable and refreshing.

Deliciously balanced IPA. Floral hops with just a hint of citrus. Crisp, clean flavors. Gorgeous dark golden color and the smell of fresh hops. One of my absolute favorites.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

(22 oz. from Grain and Vine) Hazy gold-amber with a sticky, frothy white head. Aroma of big fresh citrus-grapefruit and pine over caramel and vanilla. Mouthfeel smooth, full but mildly pebbly-abrasive. Lots of sticky, sloppy lacing. Aroma of fresh citrus-grapefruit and lighter pine over caramel and vanilla with a hoppy, bitter bite. Maybe a hint of sweat.

Pours copper with a pillowy cream colored head with some nice patches of lacing. Smell is light citrus and a touch of sweetness. The taste is balanced if not a bit mild. Pine, grapefruit, bready malt, and just a touch of skittles. I usually like my ipa¬ís more hop dominant, but this is a pretty solid offering. Well balanced, tasty, and refreshing.
Draught from BTigeer.  amberish pour, hops aroma, caramel - exceedingly well balanced.  Liked.

Beautiful sunset orange color, two finger head; aroma is mango, peach, lemon, grape, and some pineapples, but follows up with an abrupt metallic taste and nuts; lively carbonation with an oily texture, dry bitter herby finish

Wow, I can¬ít believe how highly rated this beer is... I mean it¬ís good, but I don¬ít know if its this good.... Aroma is citrus hops, flavor is dry but not as dry as you might expect from a West Coast IPA... Definite citrus and fruity notes, nice bitter finish... Nice....

Bottle.

Hazy orange with a medium white head. Nice hoppy aroma with mango, pineapple and orange. The taste was balanced and nicely fruity. Not extremely bitter but very enjoyable. I liked this one!

Pours a light nearly transparent gold. A thin head retains well as the beer is drunk. The hop flavor is pronounced citrus and is crisp and refreshing for an IPA. Overall I think the beer is a tad overrated, but is none the less a strong example of the category.

Pours gold with a thick white head. Aroma is pine and exotic tropical fruits. Taste is a mellow blend of pine, mango, and light malts. The hop resins linger in the aftertaste. Pleasant IPA & good session beer.

(bottle). Not overhyped or over-hopped. This is a world class IPA. Hazy gold complexion with thick long-lasting head. Flavors include ripe fruits of apricot and mango.  Smooth mouthfeel. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Refrigerated bottle set out on the counter for a little bit, compliments of sparky.  Pours translucent deep golden with light orange hue and medium bright white head that dissapates quickly.  Some lacing, medium body,  low carbonation, and light estery aroma (mostly citrus and a hint of pine).  Taste is citrus, light pine, and light bitter hop finish.  Back to back comparision with Bells Two-Hearted ale, so close but this edges out two-hearted ale.

Originally reviewed: 7/23/09. I was so pumped to see bottles of this at my local store. Whenever a beer has this high of a rating, I wonder if it really is that good. This lives up to the hype incredibly. 

Poured this into my tulip glass. Pours a dark orange with a good inch-sized ivory head on top. Decent retention, but little lacing. The scent on this brew is phenomenal! Huge orange, tangerine, pineapple, lemon scents all over this. Absolutely wonderful smell. 

The mouth is crisp and wonderfully bubbly. Excellent for gulping. Flavor is big citrusy notes with some bitter grapefruit, sweet oranges, and tangy lemons. Finishes bitter and a bit on the drying side. There¬ís some sweet notes in there that balance this out well. The alcohol is pretty well hidden but makes itself known near the end of the bottle. Oh yes. I could drink this all night. This isn¬ít as bold and in your face as I was expecting. This is just an unbelievably good IPA. Freaking highly recommend.
Tap at Birdsal House.  Pours orange with great citrus nose.  tastes great of grapefruit, pine, malt, bubblegum, grass, resin,and wood. Really good ipa that I would have again and again

Cloudy yellow orange white head.  Beautiful floral citrusy nose. Big hop floral flavor, clean, fresh

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Ray's. Clear dark golden, soft white head. Nose is bubblegum, mango fruity hop nose. Soft and smooth on the palate and really well balanced from sweet to bitter. Resinous hops with just enough malt sweetness. Big fan

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: JUN 26, 2012 I prefer a ipa with a bit more of a malt backbone. But it is a good sd style ipa.

Pours amber, but with minimal head. Nice aroma, with strong grapefruit overtones. Taste is well balanced, with strong hops bitterness, some citrusy flavors. Slightly bitter aftertaste. This is a very good IPA, but i just can¬ít put it in the same class as Green Flash or Stone.

Bomber. Pours golden with a white head. Very tasty IPA that has it¬ís own character setting it apart from other IPAs which usually have a stronger pine flavor. This leans more to citrus tastes of lemon plus maybe some apricot with a much less subtle pine flavor. Crisp, light and delicious.
Bottle with Nate. Gold with white head. West coast hoppy, citrusy and bitter. Lasting finish, decent body.

Pours a bit cloudy and light gold with just a tad bit of head. Great citrus and bubblegum aroma. Really nails the balance between sweet and bitter that blends together to leave a real nice creamy feel on the tongue.

True to the label, notes of apricot, peach, mango and lemon are detected in the aroma.  There is something floral going on as well, which really elevates my olfactory enjoyment.  It pours golden with a textbook soapy IPA head.  The taste is very well balanced, not too bitter that it overwhelms the palate.  It is a bit thin for the style, but not enough to be penalized.  Sculpin is a damn fine American IPA, and should be sampled if you have an opportunity.

On tap at a local bar, hazy golden color with a small thick head that lingers the entire glass. Refreshing pine and citrus with a hoppy kick at the end. Really enjoyable, especially for an IPA which I typically avoid like the plague.

What I wish every IPA could be. Layered nose with caraway seed, pine and citrus. The palate is medium bodied, and shows excellent balance. A hit of grapefruit lingers as this is crisp and seamlessly transitions to the hoppy finish.

Tap at the Moth Dallas.  Pours bright gold and clear. Nice fresh piney hop nose. Taste is slightly milder than the nose-not how I remember the bottle version. Piney bitter flavors with an alcohol kick on the end. Not bad but not as good as I wish it was.
user_location: Seattle still not near Beersel., Washington, USA

text: Pine, citrus--strong and very bold for an IPA. Heavy finish. Hops fruity veering toward cloying without ever crossing over.

Pours clear pale golden with a large off-white head. Smells both piney and like grapefruit. Taste is intense bitter, lots of grapefruit and pine. Medium-to-full bodied with a slick texture and mild mouth-carbonation, Ballast Point Sculpin IPA finishes quite bitter.

Medium to medium-high hops aroma with some dark grapefruit, tropical fruit, and resiny/piney tones. Classic "Simoce" nose (polarizing to some). Gold to light orange color with some haze and medium-low head retention. Flavor mirrors the aroma with medium-high hop bitterness, medium-high grapefruit, citrus, mango, with a hint of resiny hops. Low malt flavor, which is AOK by me for a West Coast style IPA. Overall, one of my new favorite IPAs; all of the flavors marry quite well in this beer. Impressed with how the hop flavor and aroma survived in a bomber!
Bottle. Fantastic nose of hops, some sweetness. Pours a golden amber with a nice frothy white foam. Fantastic taste, hops, malt, balanced and lasts longer on the palate.

12oz bottle, best by date: 7/6/12. Thin, off-white head, audibly fades to near-minimal. Clear amber color. Little lace. After hearing a lot of buzz about this one, I was excited to try it. Light crisp carbonation, dry texture. Great, powerful hop aroma. Nice bitter taste. It¬ís definitely an above-average IPA, and was good to enjoy with some Subway.

Bottle. Hazy orange color with a big, pillowy white head. The nose is orange, tropical fruits, pineapple, mango, seagrass. The taste is wonderfully fruity, plenty of juicy sugary fruit notes. Hop-forward. Some pepper. Slightly husky dry finish. Medium body. Very drinkable. Overall, a great IPA. A real pleasure to drink.

Just arrived in the Cincinnati market. The beer was served chilled in a Imperial Pint glass.

Ar- This beer has a fantastic hop aroma. Lots and lots of mango, pineapple, citrus, citrus zest and pine in the aroma.

Ap-  The body of the beer is a peach coloration with a thick creamy white head. Nice head retention and thick streams of lacing mark my glass.

T- A major delivery on the aroma to taste. Nice juicy pineapple, citrus, going into deep pine resin bitterness. Very brief malty sweetness that is immediately swallowed up into bitterness.

P- The body of the beer is light carbonation is moderate. 

O- This beer is dam near like cat nip for hop heads. Fresh Sculpin is hard to beat bang for the buck. Nicely executed!
UPDATED: APR 26, 2012 Fantastic ipa, ... pine, citrus, bready goodness. Lingering smooth bitterness. Quenching and easy to drink.

Bombs away into an appropriate drinking vessel.  Don¬ít care too much for the murky yellowish appearance, but I do care for every other aspect of this delicious IPA.  Beautifully crisp with plenty of citrus and pine--with lingering resins on the outside.  This beer makes a favorable 1st impression from Ballast Point.
The pale gold draught came with a light head, and that¬ís the way I felt when I left. The aromas and flavors were more hoppy than malty but faily balanced. Full bodied and tasty.

It poured a light orange color with a white head. The aroma was of fresh and fruity hops, some caramel malts and floral notes. The taste was of fresh hops with floral notes, malts, some caramel, toffee and fruits. A very good IPA.
One of my favorite IPA¬ís, especially on tap.  Dark amber/orange pour with a substantial white head.  Tropical fruit and hop aroma.  Same taste, extremely well balanced with well hidden alcohol.
Bottle from Rozi¬ís, cool colors with west coast feel... the trip from SDiego to Cleveland didnt hurt this beer at all, still drinking real nice.. good hop bite and quick finish.. well done.

Pours clear golden with a good sized white head. Aroma is pine, grass, and lemon.  Huge bitterness up front. Taste is pine and some grapefruit. Lasting bitterness. Aftertaste has citrus notes. Really good one.
