Bottle from Choice Beverages in McKinney.  Pours a light copper/yellow with a medium white head.  the aromas are grapefruit, grass and bread.  The mouthfeel is dry, butter and has a medium body and good carbonation.  Great beer!  Worth the wait.  Cheers!

12oz bottle.  There is a code of some sort stamped on the side of neck, but it¬ís smeared pretty good.  Last I heard, Ballast Point still wasn¬ít bottle dating, but hopefully that¬ís changed.

Appearance: Pours orange in color with pretty good clarity.  There¬ís a touch of haze, but this one¬ís fairly clear.  Off-white head stood about a finger tall initially, but has settled to a thin and spotty layer after only a few minutes.  There¬ís some lacing being left behind with each sip.

Aroma: A good mix of citrus and pine in the aroma.  I¬ím definitely getting orange and grapefruit, but I¬ím also detecting a touch of blue spruce if you will.  Very appealing to say the least.

Taste: The bitterness jumps in the drivers seat right from the get-go.  After that, the citrus and pine carry over from the aroma and take hold of your palate.  There¬ís a touch of sweetness towards the middle, and it¬ís needed!  Bitter hops linger on through the finish and LONG after the swallow.

Mouthfeel: Medium bodied with an aggressive bitterness and moderate carbonation.

Overall: A  top 10 IPA .....hands down.

Morey¬ís Bottom Line:  As I mentioned, this beer is one of the few IPAs that I¬íve had that combines both citrus and pine, which makes it somewhat unique in my opinion.  I¬ím very confident that I could easily pick this beer out in a blindfolded IPA tasting.  Recommended.
Appearance is golden and deceiving about what is to come. The aroma is somewhat flowery. Citrus hops flavor good body that is heavier than its appearance lets on. An overall pleasant experience.
It has a dark golden color with a nice head. Aroma is tropical fruit with some floral notes. Taste has citrus with pine. The bitterness definitely comes through in the finish.

Nice IPA but unexpected. I get stone drug from this though not heavy amounts. It is smooth and refreshing. Clean crisp finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Gorgeous golden ale with beautiful white head. Perfect balance of sweet hoppy citrus at the front end with nice punchy bitter on the back end.  (22oz Bottle / Walnut Liquorette, Walnut, CA / March 2012)
Just a fantastic blend of hop and citrus tastes, with a smooth finish.  This one lives up to the hype.

Bottle to snifter.  Looks good; burnt-orange.  Smells good too; nice and hoppy.  Tastes very nice; one of the better IPAs I¬íve come across.  Mouthfeel is good too.  Overall, a very nice beer (although a little pricey at $14.99 a 6er).

Shared at Jackie-O¬ís. Poured from a bottle into a snifter. Appearance is a hazy gold with a frothy white head of foam. Aroma is citrus, floral, and herbal hops. Not much in the way of a malt bill. Taste is medium to high bitter, and just a light sweetness. I really enjoyed this and I¬ím glad to see this is starting to show up in Ohio. Thank you for sharing.

So, I never tasted it because it was pretty expensive for cheapy. However, I gor a sample of 5 oz for $2, go figure and I don¬ít even care for IPA; its there so I tried it as long as it was not over $2. Nice lacing from the start. Yes, big bitter on tap pour. Large and dull unsharp hops impacts. Tho not real sharp it is on stupid style. Looks like a pale lager fer sure.
user_location: Beaver Valley, Beaver County, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Bottle with HUGE thanks to peteinSD! Thanks Peter! Aroma has notes of citrus, grapfruit, tropical fruits and caramel malts.  Medium amber orange hue with an average white head that mostly diminished and left good lace.  Flavor is medium sweet and heavy bitter.  Palate is medium bodied with average carbonation.  Overall a stellar IPA.  Great nose and perfect in every other way.  Very very good.  Loved this one.

Bottle. With Pat.  Last of a 6 pack purchased about a month ago.  Much of the  delicious hoppiness has faded.  This is so good when fresh.  Aroma is currently very onion.  Was much more citrus and pineapple previously. Nice clean golden color with great head and solid lacing.
Bottle from half time, pours golden hue with small white head. Nose of citrus. Grapefruit and pineapple bitterness backed by light caramel malt base.

UPDATED: APR 8, 2012 On tap at the IJTBP.   Pours a nice golden amber with a big fluffy white head.  Aroma is pine, some citrus and floral notes.   Taste is pine,  citrus and grapefruit with a little bitterness before completely mellowing out.   Almost no trace of the 7.0%.  Excellent!

UPDATED: OCT 4, 2013 Pours golden orange color with nice lacing.  Aroma of citrus and pine hops.  Taste reminds me more of a double IPA than just an IPA.  Big bold taste with big mouthful.  Tons of piney hops and alcohol with a bitter spicy bite at the end.

12 ounce bottle, stamp on bottle says best by 070612.  Served in a nonic pint glass, the beer pours a slightly hazy golden/orange color with about an inch off-white head.  Head retention and lacing are both good.  Aroma is mostly pine and citrusy (mango, grapefruit) hops, along with some caramel malt.  Taste is similar to the aroma, it tastes like pine, citrusy (mango, grapefruit, lemon peel) and spicy hops, and some bready malt.  There¬ís a nice lingering bitter/fruity finish.  Mouthfeel/body is medium, it¬ís a little bit slick and has good carbonation.  This is a very good brew.  But at $14.99 a 6-pack here in Ohio, I can get either Columbus IPA or White Rajah at a much better price.  With that being said, Sculpin is definitely worth trying, I wouldn¬ít turn one down!

22oz bomber thanks to csteele2144, thanks Chris!  Pours a clear bright orange with a thick white head and lacing through out the glass, aroma has a nice floral touch with some pineapple and grapefruit as well, the flavor has a fruity front end with a nice bitter pine finish, awesome mouthfeel, very light and enjoyable at the same time, awesome stuff
Good citrus and spice hop balance. Heavy body and excellent mouth feel. Good piney aftertaste.

Aroma: This is a colorful beer with instantly recognizable aromas. Nice bouquet. Fuzzy winter peach up front. Bright Citrus, grapefruit, pineapple and mango is hushed by slight floral and pine hops. Piney hops are very aromatic and green. 

Appearance: Creamy cake icing head with big bubbles nice lacing and retention. Brilliant golden to light copper color. Clear and nice natural carbonation. 


Taste: Nice balance between sweet roasted caramel malts and delicate citric and pine hops. Not overly bitter.
Alcohol is hidden behind a nice complex array of flavors. Hops have a slightly noble bite. 

Palate: Creamy. Balanced. An easy drinking IPA. Medium bite of bitterness. Nicely refreshing.

Overall: Refreshing and balanced. Worth the few extra bucks this thing costs. A hop aroma like this is hard to come by. It also helps that this beer reminds me of a sandy beach on a warm summer day.

Aroma is a equal mix of hops, pine, citrus and fruit.  The flavor is fresh grapefruit, piney hops, citrus and a hint of various different fruit.  There were quite a few flavors going on but they all worked well.
Bottle, pours a nice bright yellow, decent head. Aroma is quite citrusy and the flavour is very full and overall it is quite nice, interesting stuff, look forward to trying again
Great IPA - had on draft at Blue Dog in PA. Not my favorite but certainly above average

Nice cloudy golden amber, about an inch of head settles to a half finger, pretty good lacing.
Aroma is full of fruit and citrus. Lots of mango, pineapple, apricots, hops, grapefruit, and little honey.
Taste is pretty close to the nose. Lots of mango and hop. It is sweet, tangy, and bitter all at once. 
Mouth feel is pretty bright, lots of "zing" from the carbonation. Smooth going down with some hop bitterness and a little sweetness in the body.

22oz bomber poured into a Bruery tulip glass. Pours a clear golden color with a one and half finger head that leaves all sorts of lacing as the beer goes down. Aroma is citrus, peach and mango with a hint of piney hops. Taste is unbelievable!! This is very well balanced beer. I can see why everybody rates this beer so high. The hops are not overpowering but deliver the right amount of kick at the end.

22 oz. bottle poured into a Becker Pint Glass.

Ar: Citrus and honey notes with a very slight pine undertone.

Ap: Pours a hazy gold with orange highlights. Pure bright white three finger head that takes several minutes to dissipate. Beautiful lacing.

T: An opening salvo of juicy orange, grapefruit, and orchid transitioning into smooth slightly sweet malt and closing with a bite of just the right amount of piney hop bitterness and returning to very slight sweet malt.

P: Highly carbonated, silky amooth, and just the right amount of body.

O: This is an extremely well-balanced and enjoyable IPA. Incredibly easy to drink and full of flavor. I¬íd love to have a stockpile of Sculpin in the summer. Without a doubt one of the best  IPA¬ís I¬íve had.

22oz bottle from Ceebs25, thanks Brian! Pours a clear, golden-orange colored body with an inch thick, dense and foamy, white head that dissipates slowly and leaves a nice lacing throughout. Aroma is really nice with a lot going on. Pineapples, big tropical fruits, mango, apricot, florals, resiny pines, and a light caramel malt sweetness to balance, but allows the hops to shine. Flavor isn¬ít as complex, but really solid. Tropical fruits, peach, grapefruit, and a light melon with some florals and moderately resiny pines. The hops are balanced nicely with a slightly grainy, lightly sweetened pale malt as well as a light caramel that stays in the background for the most part. Finishes dry with a nice, fruity, slightly sweet hopping that leaves a medium, resiny and piney, floral bitterness as well as a light malt backing to balance. Lengthy aftertaste following a light-medium body and a moderate carbonation. Overall, a really nice IPA that I¬íve been waiting to try for quite some time. The aroma is great and the flavor is solid as well. Tons of hops with a malt backing that allows the hop complexity to dominate, but provides just enough balance and keeps this very easy drinking. Love the tropical fruits in this one. Excellent IPA.

This is an unbelievable beer. The look is a bright golden orange color with a good head. The aroma from this glass is complex and unique with some citrus, mango, lemon, pine, and on and on. Then the taste is unlike anything else in the IPA world; it changes as you drink it with a hoppy and fruity taste. One of the top three IPAs I¬íve ever had.

22 oz bottle from Julio¬ís Liquors. No freshness date on the bottle. Pours translucent gold with a 2 finger foamy off white head. Head recedes to leave a ring of foam and bits of lace. Nice fruity aroma with lots of peach, mango & grapefruit. Flavor begins with some malt sweetness, then the hops kick in. Very well balanced. Full, wet palate with surprisingly little aftertaste. Top notch.
Very good west coast IPA.   Its what you expect with the style.  Hops and fruit taste come together very nicely.

Bottle. I was a bit dissapointed due to all the 4.5 ratings etc etc. 

This is a solid brew., nothing I¬í haven¬ít tasted before, bit it hold true to IPA form.

 nice floral piney aroma. A good balance of caramel matl , toffee,  citrus fruits, wood an pine. A really good beer, but don¬ít let these guys who have only rated 1- 100 beers fool you.

Poured from a 22 ounce bottle into an Arrogant Bastard 0.5 L glass. There is no freshness date. Beer is hazy and amber in color. Carbonation is moderate to high with biggish bubbles. Head is thick, large bubbles, leaves some lacing as it falls away.

Beer smell like funky pine hops and not much else. Smells fine for an IPA.

Spicy, citrus and pine hops. Beer is not dry but rather wet. Almost no aftertaste. The hops cover you mouth. Second taste oranges, pine, lemon, some sweetness, a very good tasting beer.

Medium body good connectiveness in the flavors, hits all the centers on the palate, drinkability high.

Serving type: bottl
One of my favorite IPAs, i would really like to use this site to track my personal beer thoughts, this character count limit is sometimes annoying
Tap. Clear light golden with a small but pretty head. Clean crisp grapefruit aroma with pine- mmm...Flavor follows. Tinge of lingering sweetness but dry and bitter takes over with progress.

Great IPA! Aroma is floral and citrusy hops. appearance is golden orange which is lightly colored for an IPA. Great taste of complex hops flavor but the floral really stands out in the bottle, where as on tap way more fruit forward. Finished off with light malt and hop bitterness. Love this IPA!
Bottle from beerboxer.. great ipa. Taste nice an hoppy. Smells fresh an piny. Awsome beer.

Dark golden color with large, bubbly, bleach white head.  There is a ton of lacing on each sip.  The aroma is full of resiny hops with all the complexities of a big blend (grapefruit and pine).  The flavors are mildly sweet with lots of bitterness and spciiness from the hops.  There isn¬ít any one character of the beer that really makes it pop, but the balance of the very strong flavors makes it extremely enjoyable.

Appearance: clear golden orange color, frothy white head. Aroma: very tropical fruity, orange maybe a little grapefruit.  Taste: floral up front leading into medium sweet fresh citrus, finishing with mild hop bitterness. Mouthfeel: thin to medium creamy body. Overall: one of the most citrusy fruity hopped beers I've had. Very pleasurable. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a hazy gold with nice big white head. Aroma is awesome with some fruit, caramel and pine notes. Taste is very hoppy yet a bit sweet with some grapefruit and pine as well. Palate is nice and has decent carbonation.  Overall, i really enjoy this IPA, it is a bit on the citrusy side and is really bright with a long finish.

Big tropical and deep citrus on the nose.  The taste is... wow....  Pineapple, tangerine - a nice lingering bitter mandarin orange.  Great carb + mouthfeel.   One of my favorites of all time.  Great now it is in a 12oz.  Must be fresh, fresh, this beer falls off a cliff.

One of the perfect examples of an IPA. Aroma, taste, color, and palate all shine in unison. Grapefuits, lemons, hops, and crystal malt come through and leave you wanting more.

My review: http://beerhatesme.blogspot.com/2012/03/ballast-po

From notes.  First reviewed 11/25/2010.  Poured from a 22 oz. bottle into a tulip.

Sculpin pours a slightly hazy golden color, with a huge foamy white head. Nice retention, stays with the beer the whole way, along with some sticky lace.

Great floral hoppy smell, some cooling pine, and a splash of juicy citurs as well. 

The taste starts with a candy sweet bready malt, quickly taken over by the robust hop bill. Floral, pine, and apricot and mango citrus. The pine almost turns into a cool mint flavor. Finishes slightly bitter.

The simcoe hops help to provide a cooling sensation on the tongue, with the dry hopping providing a tingling sensation on the tongue. Good, crisp, slightly creamy carbonation with a slightly above medium body. Finishes pretty clean. 

This is a great IPA, in pretty much every category. Hopefully these bottles will be regularly available in Chicago soon.

Bottled.
Pours a medium gold, white head.
Very hoppy, floral, spicy aroma, spruce, grapefruit peel, passion fruit, malt, pine resin.
Dry, medium to full bodiy, high bitterness, balanced CO2.
Very hoppy taste, spruce, apricots, mango, caramel, malt, grapefruit.
Well balanced, delicate, yet still packed with flavour. (2012-02-15)

Pours golden.  Aroma is citrus hops.  Taste is citrus hops and good amount of bitterness.  Palate is a bit fizzy, but smooth finish that leaves bitterness on the tongue.  Easy drinking IPA that would be great on a hot day.
Resin and bread on the nose.  Pretty complex, there¬ís some kind of chile flavor I pick up.  Had to search to get this one, thought it would be more readily available.  Great IPA a bit different.

Copper color with an average frothy white head that lasted with good lacing. Medium body with a slick texture. Moderate to heavy sour citrus hoppy aroma. Moderate to heavy bittersweet flavor with a moderate to heavy bittersweet finish. Nicely done!

Pours clear amber with a good beige head leaving lace. Aroma is sweet caramel citric piny fruity malty, very nice. Flavor is excellent fruity bitter caramel malty, like aroma. Finishes bitter sweet malty.

Gorgeous light orange color with about a finger¬ís worth of head that just sticks to the glass.

On the nose, Groves of fresh orange, apricot and mango.  Awesome west coast style.

Delicious hop bitterness.  You get a lot of the citrus with a splash of malt to balance it out.  Just a really nice, crisp beer.  World Class

Long Island, NY - 22 oz. bottle poured a clear amber color with moderate head and medium lacing.  Aroma is complex with fruits, mango, citrus, floral hops and pine. Taste was initially sweet then developed into fruity hops and the a crisp bitterness. What I liked from this IPA was that the hops was not over powering. A really good IPA.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from bottle sent by Peacehammer, thanks again Dominic.  Beautiful golden orange with a bright white head. I am picking up smells of caramel, toffee, and what I believe are fuggle/willamette hops. Also, hints of wood in the aroma. Taste is balanced pretty well, but a little on the malty side for me. I am definitely a hophead and was hoping for a hoppy punch in the face. Overall, solid IPA, but just not up to the hype.

Too big of a head. I served too cold. Nice lacing. Orange pale cloudy color. Reminds me of hoppyum aftertaste. Nice bottle. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Another one of my all time favorites I had just never rated. ¬†dark gold, with one finger foamy head. Strong pungent hop aroma, with some hints of grapefruit. Very well balanced taste for a big west coast IPA, plenty of hops but also nice body and some malty characters.

Easily one of the best IPA:s out there. Pours light orange amber, slightly cloudy, with a medium white to off-white head. It doesn¬ít look very spectacular, but then again if the looks are the weakest part of a beer, then I¬ím good with that. Nose is tropical fruits (apricot, mango), citrus and grapefruit with a very strong hop presence. Hard to tell, but maybe cascade, amarillo, some nelson sauvin? I don¬ít know, but it¬ís definitely rich, fruity hops. Flavour is immediately bitter with a nice pungent quality. The bitterness increases through the sip until gently settling into a long and very enjoyable finish that mellows out but stays with you for a long time. Body is medium with a creamy quality and a somewhat lively, refreshing carbonation.

This was my first time ordering online and none of the hop forward beers I purchased came with any dates that I could tell, disappointing. This one is over the hill.

Nice golden pear tone, thinner head that recedes to a minimal cap but then retains throughout

Nose is a bit subdued, mostly citrus but truly difficult to discern, I have an easier time smelling the glass that I poured it into.

The character isn¬ít nearly as muted as I would¬íve guessed by the smell - all that citrus - tangerine, grapefruit, abstract bitter... clearly outdated though.

Mouthfeel is thinner than I would¬íve expected but seems appropriate for this particular brew, carbonation is still spot on.

Overall, I guess I¬íll just wait for a good trade opportunity or a vacation to give this one a real review.
My sister got me this beer for my birthday and she got 2 others. This is by far the best one. Great taste and it was straight from the brewery so that helped it out. Definitely recommend it
Fantastic aroma, great color, nice floral notes, not too bitter...yeah definitely be looking for this one again.

UPDATED: MAR 19, 2012 A - pours clear light golden orange. 2 finger high head that lingers, strong lacing. S - citrus and tropical fruit hops. Notes of grasses, and soap as well. M - creamy mf light body. Very bitter middle, lingering sweet malty ending. T - light citrus hops on the nose. Very bitter grassy hops hints of tea bitters and grapefruit, on the palate. Sweet malty and basic notes on the end. O - very good aromas, very bitter linear taste. 7-

Wonderful hoppy aroma, with a hint of tropical fruit...golden color with a hint of red/orange...very sharp hoppy taste right from the get-go, hints of mango/pineapple, splash of orange...super-slick going down, with a monstrous aftertaste...an outstanding IPA!
Bottle from brewdog.com. pours bright amber with a thin white head. Lots of tropical fruits and some tobacco. Tasty. Tasty ipa.
On draft. Pours crystal clear bright orange with a nice white head. Amazing hoppy aroma. Flavor is strong citrus, mango, and peach. Lighter body than the flavor and aroma let on. Great great beer.

0.65l bottle from BrewDog webshop. This one pours a golden orang-ish - almost glowing - bod with a nice medium sized egg shell-colored head. The aroma is lovely fruity with a good amount of piny hops. It¬ís really intense peachy with mango and a kiwi-like sweetness. Also something here that reminds me of summer-barbecue. Lovely and fresh aroma. A fantastic smooth and almost creamy mouthfeel that really sets the good old taste buds in action here. Lots of that lovely fruitiness in the aroma follows the flavors. It¬ís peachy and with pine cones, a fresh summer strawberry tone, honey and the finish is perfectly balanced between hoppy-bitter, passion fruity goodness and malt sweetness. Goes on and on in the aftertaste. A really nice one this. 01.02.2012

22 FL.OZ bottle. Golden color small inconsistent head. Nice citrusy hop aroma, same in the mouth, super dry finish, and balanced bitternes. Very drinkable, it could be a session beer although the consistent abv.

light amber color, aroma is citrus with lots of grape fruit, flavor is citrus and grape fruit and more grape fruit, slight caramel malt sweetness with a very dry finish, my favorite IPA! amazing beer!

Location/Date: 22 oz. bottle bought at local grocery store on 2/5/12 (pre-Super Bowl, but post Chelsea/Man U - a perfect beer day!)

Appearance: Pours to a clear gold with a light white head. 
Aroma: sure doesn¬ít smell like a fish! There is a citrus aroma with a balance of hoppy scent. 
Taste: Not overly hoppy for a San Diego IPA. It doesn¬ít taste like it looks. Citrus/Apricot & delicious hoppiness and a definite fruity aftertaste.
Palate: excellent body, nice creamy front end with a great transition to a lingering finish that is slightly rough and tough (in a good way!).

Summary: A great example of the west coast IPA. It doesn¬ít need to hop it up any more to show off. I think it really does as the label says - it has a sting, but tastes great.

Medium offwhite lasting head.  Amber body with strong carbonation
made hazy by little floaties.  Strawy strawberry chewing gum
aroma with citric notes.  Dry strawy resiny taste with citric
grassy notes. Mid-bodied.  Dry resiny strawy aftertaste with
grassy wooden notes.  Nice, but a bit harsh.  Probably was much
better when fresh. Should rerate. (0.65l bottle, City Beer, San
Francisco.)

Pours a slightly hazy golden hue with a 1/2 finger. Aroma is big apricot, mango, lemon. Taste follows with a super crisp mouthfeel. Very drinkable and damn tasty. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAR 11, 2014 650 ml bottle.
Pours a copper colour with a small white head on the edges. Aroma of strong citrusy hops, passion fruit and toffee. Flavour of strong bitter hops, caramel malts, citrus, toffee and passion fruit. Medium bodied, slick mouthfeel and a very long, bitter and fruity finish. Awesome IPA. 8-4-8-4-16 4.0
Draught @ City Beer Store, San Francisco @ 10/2012.
Very fresh. So much fruitiness. Excellent drinkability. Even better. 8-4-9-4-17

65 cl bottle.
Originally rated on 31.12.2010. (8+3+8+3+15)
Pours clear golden colour with medium head. Aroma of hoppy exotic fruits, goose berry bush, mild caramel notes, grass, floral notes. Flavour of exotic fruits, grass, mild toffee notes, herbs and some berries. Crisp and refreshing brew.
4615

UPDATED: JUN 15, 2014 65 cl bottle @ home, no BBE info
Aroma is rather strong with flowery hops, gooseberry bush and some exotic fruits. Flavour has lots of flowery hops with gooseberry bush, some fruits and hints of sugar. Good, refreshing and not too sweet.

8-4-8-4-16=4.0

35,5 cl bottle @ Vastarannan Kiiski
Aroma is fruity and hoppy with peaches, grapefruit and passionfruit. Flavour has grapefruit, aggressive hops and some peaches. Qute as good as I remembered.

8-3-8-4-16=3.9

660ml bottle from City Beer, San Francisco, CA

Pours light orange with a foamy white head. Aroma of fresh and fruity hops, caramel malts and floral notes. Taste of fresh hops with floral notes, malts, caramel, toffee and fruits. Dry, bitter and hoppy finish with fruity notes. Well balanced and tasty IPA.

Pours a light amber colour, almost golden, clear and with a frothy white head. Strong grapefruit and orange aromas, with subtle hop scents too. Taste is bitter with little sweetness, a pretty good balance for an IPA. Lighter body, creamy and smooth on the palate, with lively carbonation. A very strong IPA overall.

Draft/bottle$ I¬íve had it plenty of times, rating it now off both. Copper shiney brown color with light head and lacing that lasts on the sides of glass. Sweet, smooth, peachy and delicious. Great perfectly balanced west coast ipa

UPDATED: SEP 4, 2013 Re-rate. Draft at craft ale house. Pours hazy orange with a medium sized white head, great retention, big bubbles. The aroma is very floral, has some grapefruit, pine, lemon, some spicy notes. The taste on this blows the style away. The bitterness is hard to describe as there is such a complex hop bill. There is a nice citrus balance that fades to more bitterness.

Bottle shared by ? At abraxas. Golden with slight haze. Resinous, dry floral hop aroma is intriguing. The nelson sauvin white wine quality is predominent and nice. Body is chewy in a good way. The balance is great. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Stringing the senses of hops, fruits, and sweet flowers. It appears as a darker honey color. The taste is of hops but with a twist of a lemony acid sting. Encoats the palate is hops and the flavor stays even after the drink is gone. Overall, this beer is great on a warm summer day and you just need something to drink to refresh yourself.

translucent gold with a thick dense head. medium-full body with high carbonation.

aroma: bright citrusy apricot slight-pine hops, sweet pale malt with a rather helles-like character.

taste: grassy piney hop bitterness, a definite woody note, pale malt, mild minerality, and a touch of yeastiness.
Bottle from BrewDog Edinburgh. Strong hoppy aroma. Cloudy amber brown colour, good head. Tropical fruit & hop flavour, bitter aftertaste. Decent IPA.
This looked amazing in the Hallertau Willi Becher glass it came in. Juicy tropical, resiny, citrus aromas and flavour, dry, crisp and punchy. Drinks down so easily.

Hazy orange with mild head/lacing.
Aroma smells pretty tastey,with fruit candied sweet bready pastry,slight peppery spice,nice overall hop aroma.
Initially a tart citrusy presence,then some light sweet malt witha light bready toastiness,grassyness followed by orange citrus/mild piney bitterness,nice floral tones even in the bittering flavor.Seems a bit undercarbed with a slightly noticable flatness to it. I have no idea how long this has been room temp shelved though,it held up prettty well. I would drink this anytime.Very nice ipa

Hazy golden body, white head. Well, the outlook of this beer is mediocre, but thats fortunately the only thing. Very pure caramel aroma with exotic fruits and some pines in background. Flavour is dry, charasteristically same as aroma, but couple notches down.  Floury mouthfeel. Nice rough maltiness in aftertaste. Excellent IPA.

Bottle. Wow! This is one of my favorite IPA¬ís of the last year. 

Sweet caramel scent with a mildly citrus hint, orange more than grapefruit. The appearance kept with the orange, a peach tint almost, with huge lacing. Beautiful. The palate was silky smooth, medium bodied, and the taste was vibrantly present although with a mild hoppiness, leaving a sugary taste on the tongue with the finish.
Yellowish amber color with a whitish head, not very dark. Punchy, bitter taste with floral hoppiness. Light hints of citrusy fruit underneath. Very good IPA.

Odd duck; in some ways just an ordinary brew; but in others, a rocking draught. I really ike that they don¬ít follow the standard citrus/resin formula. Served again perhaps a bit too cold, still eminantly drinkable, a smallish off white head that lasts forever, and total lace. color is a honey amber. Aroma is a fragrant wet grass, hop, caramel, yeast. Flavor¬ís about the same plus carbonic tang accenting the high, bitter points.Body is great, ditto carbonation. Finish is a funky hop finish

12oz bottle at Brouhaha, honey gold color, with an off-white bubbly head, soft soapy, floral leafy, grassy, citrusy hop, and  a hint of metallic in the nose, with some candied lemon, grapefruit peel, mild coniferous, piney bittering accents in the aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with a nice flowery fruity apple skin, leafy, grassy, piney, candied lemon, grapefruit peel hop character with some soft coniferous, minty leafiness backbone, and a faint honeyed pale, toasted malt undertone, leading towards a mild candied citrus, lemon, grapefruit, orange peel, piney, coniferous, grassy, leafy hop bitterness finish. A bit disappointed, maybe because probably it was an old bottle! dont know

First of all, this is my favorite style, so I am biased for sure.  But, I love the aroma of beautiful citrus.  Pours a hazy, golden color.  Taste is lightly sweet, lightly sour, and some, oh so tasty, bitterness.  Palate is average carbonation, and a wonderful bitter, dry finish.  Overall, this is what I LOVE to drink and BP does a wonderful job.  I could drink this all day....and maybe I will.

A slightly cloudy dark amber color with a short lived light beige head. Fantastic aroma of pine tar, grapefruit and cotton candy. Crisp and hoppy up front, loads of grapefruit peel, very nice bitterness. Has some mild sweetness  in the middle but it is quickly engulfed with that industrial strength hop follow. I just finished a Ballast Point 2XIPA but this is even better (IMO). Another very pricy addition to the local import beer shop.

Bottle.  Clear amber with a medium to thick, lasting white head.  Sweet, fresh aroma of grassy hops, berries.  Taste is mild sweet, medium bitter.  Nicely fruity and hoppy.  Has a dry finish, very drinkable.  Medium bodied, well carbonated.

bomber pour. light orange pour, clear liquid. thin white head. strong aroma of grapefruit, lemon and pine. very fresh + clean hop flavor from the first sip. a little sweet as well. very well done ipa! thanks for sharing peteinSD !

Had a few times before, first time rating. 22oz bottle, bought at a place where it had supposedly been refrigerated the whole time. Pine, orange and tangerine in the nose. Taste is orange blossom honey, pine, tangerines along with a little of onion skin/dankness. Strong bitterness that lingers in the finish. Certainly a nice IPA, but I don¬ít think it is worth all the hype and $10 for a 22oz bottle.
Nice IPA, but comes off soapy.  Taste is rather thin and not terribly lasting.  Aroma is standard IPA fare with more sweet fruit than citrus.  Light.
UPDATED: DEC 27, 2011 Pour is a coppery Orange with nice lacy sticky white head. Smell is lemon wheat grass. Taste is sweat wheaty hay with lemon and mandrin oranges. Good stuff.

Bottle from the beer store in Southampton, PA.  $20 for a six-pack.  Hazy orange pour.  Aroma of mango, peach, citrus, grapefruit, pine.  Slightly fruity initial taste - tropical/mango, followed by a nice bitterness as the hops dominate the rest of the way through.  Reminiscent of Dreadnaught.  The high rating is completely justified.

22 oz bottle. Definitely a quality ipa here. Bold pine and melon citrus are strong and unrelenting, with a big, chewy finish. Pours a bright burnt orange, with fine starch white head and scattered lacing. A full aroma, though maybe a bit too dense as the full notes don¬ít project quite as well as I would like. Woody pine and big, mixed citrus fruits here, pinneapples and pears. Toasty pale malts, light nut, caramel on the other side of things. Body is full for an ipa, with a bold flow through out, densely bitter though not unbalanced. Toasted cereal grains up front, then a wave of various fruits and bitter. Estery melon, blackberry, mixed citrus, wood, and pine. Each note really bites and makes its presence known. Overall, a big, bold ipa with a great combination of strength, flavor, and drinkability. Up there with the best.

Pours a nice golden color with a decent head that only sustains a minimal amount.  Aroma is not huge but very nice, notes of bitter and sweet hops, citrus providing the bitter and an almost fruity sweetness.  Taste is fantastic, notes of citrus orange zest and floral bitter hops, an absolutely awesomely done IPA.

66cl bottle.
Thin white head.  Clear blond pour.  Lovely bitterness.  Very nice beer!

650 ml bottle. From GBBF, London, England. Courtesy of Brandman.
Cloudy deep orangey golden colour with small white head.
Aroma is near perfection. I could be sniffing this all night. Fruits (a lots of), mild pine, candy, marmalade and balancing malt. Flavour is also very balanced. Much more bitterness, but also caramel malt. Pine, marmalade, fruits, tree leaves and malt. Dry Bitterness stays. Excellent blend of hops. Very enjoyable. Probably the best IPA ever.

Pours a clear, dark golden with a finger of white head. Lots of grapefruit aroma.  Tastes of apricot, pine, mango.  Quite bitter... more than other west coast IPA.  Alcohol is well hidden.  I wish I knew the bottled on date of what I¬íve got.  It feels like its a bit more tame than others have said.

Bottle. Pours a clear golden with a white head. Smells of grapefruit and orange peel. Tastes of a light bitter with a medium sweetness, well balanced but not perfectly. Light bodied. Light carbonation. Texture is syrupy. Finishes dry.

Tasty.
floral, grass, spruce, amber, orange, minimal head, medium body, average carbonation,
A lovely big hoppy IPA from Ballast Point.  Ticks all the boxes and is very palatable.

22-oz bottle at On Tap w Andy, James, Streets. Really light-looking pour with nice white head. Aroma is fresh as hell with citrus notes. Palate is a deep, earthy base with incredible balance and a fruity hop profile (grapefruit, orange peel). Great stuff.

It¬ís all been said before. A delicious brew. Aroma isn¬ít the thing with this great concoction, It¬ís everything. The smell the look and especially the taste. Incredibly satisfying. Each taste leading you on toward the next and in each a new surprise. almost perfect.
Bottle from the beer store. Pours golden with minimal head. Aroma of grapefruit/hops, and taste of citrus/hops. A nice IPA that has some good depth.

Poured from a draft into a plastic up at Gaglione Brothers in San Diego, Calif. Color was golden orange. Minimal head when I got it, maybe ¬Ω inches. Decent amount of lacing on the top. Healthy amount of film on the sides. 

Smelled of citrus hops, mainly lemon zest and grapefruit. Some pine in there, too.

First tasted was a bitter, strong alcohol bite. Grapefruit dominated the taste after. Still very bitter on the finish.

Medium body. Lively (moderate) carbonation, maybe even a bit higher. Bitter finish. 

Not a bad beer, but nothing really ¬ìwowed¬î me. I had to give it a try considering how rare it is to fine.

22oz bottle courtesy of wavers1. 

Pours hazy orange with a thin white head that sticks around leaving thick lacing. Aroma is juicy, citrusy hops. A little breadiness in the background. Body is full, but crisp. Flavor is not very bitter, but very hoppy. Again, citrusy, juicy hops without being resiny. A little crisp maltiness in the finish. Incredible IPA!
Great beer.  Aroma is strong in hops, fruit, and sweetness.  The appearance is a clear light orange.  Taste is complex with hops, fruit, bitter, then a bit of a sweet finish.

On tap at Capones during their Black Friday event. Light amber with a white head. Grapefruit, some pine resin, mango, lemon zest, light malt. Light on the palate yet medium bodied, soapy and sweet with a bitterness that grows.

How can anyone not love Sculpin.  It is the quintessential California IPA.  At 7% it presents everything you want in an IPA, hop driven throughout, enough maltiness to supports the piney and citrussy nose and palate.
Beautiful

Mostly grapefruit/citrus comes through in the aroma. I also smell light pine and floral hops. Appearance is a light gold/amber with a medium foam head. The taste is dominated by grapefruit and nice hops. Very large grapefruit on the finish with a nice bitterness and spice. Texture is smooth with a somewhat light body. Overall, this recipe caught me a little offgaurd, it was much more focused on grapefruit and citrus, which dominated the flavor. I definitely enjoyed this brew, there was a nice combination of citrus/fruit flavor along with nicely balanced malts and hops. I¬íd give this an A- rating.
A bright, fruity, florally beer with a great light hop flavor. Not too heavy or overpowering flavor. Easy drinking beer. Great for summer.

(bottle) pours a clear deep golden colour with a frothy off-white head. aroma of honey, passion fruit and cherries, deeply resinous. flavour is the same, the resin being quite dominant again, with a medium tropical fruitiness and a nicely integrated medum-bitter finish. medium-bodied with average carbonation.

Sampled at SBWF. Stockholm, September 29th, 2011. 

Dry and pleasantly hoppy and fresh aroma. Grass, grapefruit and some pine needles. The taste is also quite and and very low on the sweet side - something that I really enjoy. Big hoppy punch with a nice bitter finish. Great IPA!
citrus, pale, clear, white foam, light sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour, light body, thin feel, average carbonation, bitter,
(bottle) amber/gold with white head. Aroma of citrus/fruit with some malt. Flavor was citrus/peach with enough malt for balance.

UPDATED: SEP 3, 2015 (Bottle, Stockholm Beer Festival, 8 Oct 2011) Deep golden colour with foamy, off-white head. Fruity, malty nose with grainy malt, orange and apricots. Malty, fruity taste with notes of orange, apricots, grainy malt and a generous grapefruit bitterness in a long finish. More than medium body, with balanced sweetness. Very nice and tasty IPA, and quite drinkable for such a bold beer. Rerate: (Bottle 3 Sep 2015) Amber colour, slightly hazy, with frothy off-white head. Malty, hoppy nose with apricots, orange peel, pine needles, honey and lots of fresh floral/citric hops. Fruity, hoppy taste with notes of apricots, orange peel, grapefruit, honey, resin and fresh floral hops in a finish with a generous bitterness. Medium body, with a touch of sweetness. Solid and well made IPA, with a generous hop character. Excellent beer.
Bottle.  Pours light Orange, grapefruit nose, taste indicative of the aroma.  Citrus and dry.  Crisp.
Poured from a 12oz bottle.  Pours an amber color with white head.  Aroma is tons of citrus (grapefruit) and a bit of hops.  Taste follows the nose.  Grapefruit and a bit of bittering hops.

Keg at BrewDog. Pale yellow amber, thick white head. Nose is massive tropical fruity hops, slight mango, pineapple, something bready too. Palate is massive citrus hops, only the slightest hint of caramel, finish is soft but assertive bitterness. A "real" example of an American IPA, all about the hops, not sweet but very well balanced.
Nice smooth and yet hoppy IPA.  Good flavor and body, but not overly sour or spicy.  Good job.

Sample @ SBWF
Aroma: Apricot, pine, grapefruit.
Taste: Blood Grapefruit, pine.
Mouthfeel: Medium body, balanced.
Bottled at GBBF 2011. Hazy pale golden with a lasting white head. Rich hoppy aroma of grapefruit, peach and pine. Dry and very bitter hoppy flavour dominated by peach and pine. Just perfect.

UPDATED: MAR 15, 2012 Bottle @ home, courtesy of daknole. Thanks! Slightly hazy, golden appearance with an off white head. Potent resiny, mary jane, piney hoppy, earthy, apricot, grapefruity, mango aroma. Resiny, sticky, piney, organic hoppy, sweet malty, fairly fruity, mango, grapefruity flavor with a sticky, organic hoppy finish. One of the more assertive IPAs out there and quite nice!

12 fl oz bottle from Bieropholie, served at cellar temperature in a tulip glass. 
App.:  Clear amber with a nice fluffy off-white foam.
  
Aroma:  Strong, juicy, fruity C-hops, grapefruit, pine/resin, peppery citrus, a touch of eucalyptus?, a little peach/apricot, not much in the way of malts, a touch dusty/musty.
  
Palate:  Medium body, moderate effervescence with some prickly bubbles.
  
Flav.:  More malts ¬ñ caramel, a bit brothy and mashy, still plenty of pine/resin, less of the juicy, fruity hop notes, light apricot and other fruits, a touch of eucalyptus/menthol, brown/burnt sugar; dry with good bitterness and a pleasantly balanced finish of C-hops, brown/burnt sugar and light dusty/musty notes.

Pretty nice.

Slightly hazy amber with a one-finger white head and excellent lace. Big citrus and pine hops aromas dominate, with hints of earthiness and malt. Same with the flavor profile - big bitter hops with a bite of tang on top of a solid malt foundation. Medium to full body, lively carbonation, rich creamy mouthfeel, and a crisp bitter finish. Outstanding.
Crisp citrus hop aromas. Pours clean and clear orange with a small white head.  Hop resin flavors. Finishes mildly bitter.  Overall a very good IPA.

Bottle.  Pours an unclear orange with an average, off-white head.  Aromas of light malts, caramel, and lots of hops (pine, orange, grapefruit, peach).  Flavor is slightly sweet with a strong hop flavor. Hop notes of grapefruit, pine and other sweet fruits nicely balanced by some moderate malts.
Bottled at Stockholm Beer Festival.  Hazy golden, small head. Salty grapefruit aroma. Medium bodied with rounded mouthfeel. Salty and hoppy, some grapefruit. More bitter than aromatic. Standard IPA.

7/10/2011 on tap @ Blind Tiger, NYC (2011-542) 
Clear deep orange beer, creamy yellowish head, unstable and adhesive. Aroma: exotic fruits, passion and pineapple. MF: good carbon, full body. Taste: very fruity, passion fruits, bit of spices, grapefruits, bitter hop, pretty sweet too, some alcohol. Aftertaste: lemony, citrus, sour pineapple, very long lasting bitter. Very nice balanced IPA!
22 oz bomber pours a golden amber color with a nice white head.  Aroma of grapefruit, pine, citrus.  Medium bodied, balanced beautifully with a hops up front and some sweet malt.  Great IPA

UPDATED: MAY 14, 2016 Bomber poured into a Duvel Tulip - Bold amber colour with 3 fingers of head.  Fresh citrus fruits in the aroma - Mango nectar, Apricot.  Taste is a bit more complex with citrus fruit, apricot, a touch of alcohol, toffee malt.

[keg at BrewDog Bar, Edinburgh] Just a fantastic IPA, from start to finish. Inviting clear gold with a thin white head, the aromas of fruity hop come out even from a cold keg pour. As it warms, the tropical and orange aromas become even more in evidence. Very drinkable, lovely slightly sweet fruitiness before a bitter hop finish. Alcohol is there, but only just noticeable. I think this one does well because it¬ís so balanced, and everything is restrained ¬ñ there¬ís nothing in yer face about this one, it¬ís superbly crafted [07102011]
Tasted at Ballast Point. Light orange color with a fizzy white head. Good hoppy aroma of pine and citrus. Very good piney hop taste transitioning to a smooth sweet caramel flavor.

On tap at The Dirty Truth. Pour is pale blonde/gold with a large bubbly white head. Great carbonation and lacing. Aroma is of sweet flowers with some pungent grapefruit and a bitter hops perfume. Flavor is hop juice with a sweet caramel/candied sugar finish. Taste is very much like an imperial ipa but without the alcohol burn in the finish. Quite good, but not that well balanced.

Beautiful orange copper with a pillowy white head. Gorgeous lacing throughout. I just have to sit and admire this baby. Bouqet of grapefruit and melon.  Pungent hop flavor with citrus and the perfet malt balance. Lingering sweetness with long lasting bitterness. Dry finish with some alcohol warmth, I can¬ít put it down, it is soo good.

Sample at Stockholm Beer and Whiskey Festival 2011. Aroma has a lot of tropical fruits, mango, pineapple and other sweet aromas. Taste has a punch of bitterness but balanced by a heavy malt base with sweetness that rounds the beer off as it goes down.
Aroma of citrus, grapefruity.  Pours orange with white film.  Tastes sweet of grapefruit.  Delicious wet mouthfeel.  love it.
Bottle.  Translucent golden pour.  Half inch head.  Aroma of pine and sweet malts.  Tastes sweet up front with a bitter hop finish.  Not as hoppy as I expected.  Soft mouthfeel.
Bottle (Stockholm Beer Festival 2011) - Amber in colour. Peach, passion fruit and hops in the aroma. Peach, tea, passion fruit and ice cream lolly stick (!!!) in the taste. Not bad at all.

This is by far my favorite Ballast Point beer.  Smells very citrusy and resiny.  It looks bright yellow in color with a bubbly white head that leaves behind great lacing.  It tastes very bitter from start to finish.  At the very end there is a slight pit of malty sweetness to balance out the high bitterness factor.  It is a light to medium bodied beer with a very lively carbonation level.  Overall the alcohol is low enough that the beer does not become to sweet which is a major plus to the drinkability of Sculpin.  One of the better IPA¬ís I have had in a while.

Ported from BA.

Appearance:
Lots of foamy white head, almost 3 fingers of it. The beer itself is more of a golden yellow honey color. It has some slight haze to it, but that might be from the low temperature.

Smell:
Piney and lemony. What we have here is a bottle of Pinesol, no doubt. Some apricot also comes in, which is a pretty nice little change from the usual grapefruit flavors we¬íve been seeing lately.

Taste:
Wow, WAY drier than what I was expecting from the smell. On top of that, it¬ís extremely piney. The bottle mentions several fruits, but if they¬íre in there, they can¬ít stand up to the crazy amount of pine in this thing. There¬ís a good amount of bitterness sticking around too.

Mouthfeel:
A light body that really sticks to you. There¬ís something kind of syrupy about it actually.

Overall:
Solid, but not as well balanced as I¬íd like. Definitely has a high drinkability, and it might be a good introductory IPA due to it¬ís light body and non-overwhelming bitterness. Would I have another? Maybe. Would I buy another bomber? Probably not.

UPDATED: JUL 17, 2013 Bottle at SBWF 2011/Draught at Akkurat 2013.
Pours dark amber with a big head.
Aroma of alcohol and hops.
Hop oils, passion fruit, oranges and all other citrus.

Pour orange with a nice white head and good lace. Aroma pine, citrus, grapefruit, pineapple, tangerine, light caramel, stone fruits. Taste quite bitter pine, grapefruit, citrus, stone fruit,light malt back bone. MF medium body long lingering bitterness opened up by a light fizzy carb. Super bitter outstandingly tasty hop bomb extremely well done.
Sample @ SBWF 2011. Grape. Pineapple. In other words: citrus candy. Serious bitterness. Some nice gooseberry notes in the aftertaste.

Pours a light red-orange with a fluffy off-white head. Aroma is very hoppy; grassy, pine, citrus, pineapple, some grapefruit, and a bit of caramel. Taste is pine, grapefruit, bittersweet lemon and orange peel, some bready malt flavor and a bitter hops finish. Clean mouth feel; not the smoothest ever but still quite decent.
Hazy yellow orange pour with a clean hop citrus pine aroma.  Sweet and light mixed with a pine spice and some grapefruit towards the end.  Leaves a bitterness as it goes down.
Bottle at brewdog. Bit disappointed with this one. Non descript hop aroma, slighty fruity. Taste is the same. Slightly bitter finish, nothing special in my opinion

UPDATED: FEB 16, 2016 Tap at Blue Rock. Pours lightly hazy golden. A typical west coast IPA, but perhaps with more balance than most. Piney with plenty of citrus but enough malts to balance. Nice full mouthfeel. Excellent fruity pine fade.

Shared this bottle at the BrewDog Bar, Edinburgh. Pours a little hazy, golden colour with a fair yellowish head. Aroma of apricot, peach and mango with barley and caramel notes. Big Nelson Sauvin character with some passion fruit also. Nice and resinous with similar flavours to nose, including peach, mango, passion fruit and an orange - apricot finish. Great malt backbone to balance this out very nicely. Moderate carbonation. I absolutely love this beer!
another fine IPA offering from So Cal. Pours an orange with a white head, nose and taste is of floral and citrus hops. Easy drinker, must be enjoyed fresh.

Pours clear copper hue with a bright white head that seems to last for quite a while.  Smells of tangerines, caramel malts, grapefruit, lemon zest, pine a bit of earth.  The caramel seems to mix well with the citrusy tangerines and grapefruit giving this a terrific aroma on the nose.  Sweet oranges and tangerines on the palate lead the way but quickly turn to a stronger hoppy presence.  Nice piney presence mixes well with the earthiness but the sweet citrus fruits and strong hops are the predominate flavors.  Wonderful!

Aroma:grapefruit hops,apricot...
Appearance:Hazy amber good head...
Flavor:bitterness,grapefruit,resinus...

Hazy orange with a creamy off-white head.
Nose : Loads of peaches and apricot, enticing.
Palate : Medium to full bodied, creamy, refreshing, great bitterness, really bold with grapefruit and tropical fruity hops in dominance. Long lingering fruity bitter finish. Amazing IPA
Cask at get real ny - sweet candy malts and caramel, very fruity with plenty of citrus notes. Crisp malts and some grains. Perfect IPA.

Light unclear medium orange color with a average, frothy, good lancing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate to light heavy malty, caramel, moderate to heavy hoppy, pine, orange, fruity - tropic ala peach - mango - lemon.

On tap at Toronado SF.  Deep hazy orange.  Pretty decent pine and citrus aroma.  Pretty hop balanced with little malt background.  Not to say its not there, just overpowered.  Moderately high mix of pine, citrus, and a touch of grapefruit that lingers on.  Crisp finish, lighter on the palate than the flavor suggests.  Great stuff.

Poured from bomber into tall glass.

Appearance: Hazy honey gold with large stark white head and pretty lacing.

Aroma: Very tropical and hoppy, with mango, grapefruit, lemon and a herbal spiciness.

Taste: Once again, very hoppy, but not as tropical. Some grapefruit and tropical notes, but the herbal spiciness steals the show. Quite bitter throughout, with just a minimal malt presence.

Palate: Moderate carbonation with a very creamy body and an exceptionally dry finish.

Overall: Very strong IPA, but the taste didn¬ít quite live up to the aroma or my expectations. Great choice for a West Coast bitter fix.

Petite bouteille. Bi√®re dor√©e-jaune, la mousse est blanche. Le nez est une compote d¬íagrumes, de houblon frais avec une touche de malt sucr√©. La bouche est une bouch√©e de houblon avec une bonne masse de malt sucr√© encore une fois. La finale est longue et tr√®s gouteuse pour les amateurs de houblons. Un classique des west coast IPA. 8/10
UPDATED: AUG 25, 2016 Tr√®s peu complexe mais terriblement efficace. Fruits exotiques avec une finale pamplemousse. Tr√®s rond et facile √† boire.

Le liquide a une couleur dor√©e.  Des s√©diments sont observables.  La t√™te mousseuse est bien belle et persistante.  Une dentelle d√©core le verre.  Au nez, les ananas et les p√™ches se fondent dans des parfums de mangues et d¬íagrumes.  Des ar√¥mes de pin et d¬íherbes se font sentir.  Excellente r√©ponse des malts sucr√©s en fines touches de caramel et de miel.  Les saveurs vont dans le m√™me sens avec des houblons go√ªteux et complexes.  Le choc des c√©r√©ales sucr√©es et des houblons aromatiques et am√©risants est tout √† fait superbe.  L¬íamertume est solidement ancr√©.  Les c√©r√©ales apaisantes et judicieusement dos√©es.  En bouche, le liquide a un corps moyen.  Le p√©tillement est mod√©r√©.  La texture est huileuse.  En finale, une amertume pleine de r√©sine et de fruits, intense et justement longue.  Toute une bi√®re.

Quite yeasty blonde colored IPA.  Deliriously appealing aroma of mango and grapefruit.  The intense hoppiness takes a lot of place in the overall flavor, with its piny and tropical fruits notes; very pleasant mouthfeel, especially in the deepness, or the ¬ìfull-mouthness¬î of the hop flavors  Not much sweetness comes out, except in the cookie notes provided by the delightful malt backbone.  Amazing IPA, amongst the best I had.  This beer is not overrated; it is just awesome!

Bebida en varias ocasiones en city beer,san francisco...
buena carga de l√∫pulol,con toques de mango,limon,albaricoque,
buena retenci√≥n.parece mas una  pale ale extra mas que una ipa.
MUY buena y f√°cil de beber.

This is a tremendous little IPA from BP. One I didn¬ít know much about prior to the GBBF ¬í11. Pours very pale golden, looks like a blond beer. Nice one finger bright whit head with average retention and decent lacing. Aroma is pretty knock out stuff, big tropical aromas of passion fruit and mango with a heavy resinous and slightly spicy character, real earthy in the background, but very fruity at the same time. Nice touch of a honeyed note to keep a balance to the earthy hop/tropical hops. Flavour is so incredibly crisp for the style, I was expecting mouth coating San Diego style IPA, but no, it¬ís almost Pilsner in feel but with massive flavour, Incredibly crisp and refreshing, it opens with citrus and peach, moves to a slightly honeyed cereal note in the mids and out of nowhere comes some note worthy bitterness which takes you in to a great highly aromatic finish with grapefruit bitterness, orange, perfume and highly floral notes. Oddly enough the characteristic I love most about this is also the only gripe I¬íd have: I want more body, but yet at the same time I¬ím blown away by the crisp drinkablity of the beer, so do I need more body? It just drinks like it were 4.5-5% rather than 7% It¬ís a real master class in how to make a light crisp and ultimately highly refreshing IPA but pack in as much flavour without it becoming cloying or oily. Brilliant stuff.

UPDATED: DEC 22, 2013 Served on cask at Al¬ís of Hampden into a nonic pint. This was the fuggle dry hopped version.


A - Pours a deep, hazy, copper orange with a small one finger white head that leaves light, sticky, lacing down the glass.


S - HUGE hope aroma. Hints of grapefruit, tangerine, and other pungent tropical fruits. A slightly sweet aroma from the malt is a welcome addition to all those hops. One of the best smelling IPA¬ís I have ever had.


T - Starts out sticky sweet thanks to the roasted malt but that gives way quickly to the HUGE amounts of hops. Hops are similar to the nose with grapefruit coming thru more than the others. The grassy hops are not as pungent as in the nose but are still plenty strong. An absolutely amazing cask offering from Ballast Point. How can I drink normal sculpin after having all of these cask versions?


M - Fairly smooth feel with medium-light body and flavor with moderate carbonation. It hides the 7% very well but the big bitterness takes its tole.


O - Really incredible version of Sculpin. I could drink this every day for the rest of my life and be very happy. I have now had four different versions of cask Sculpin and this was my favorite, narrowly beating out the simcoe version.

Appearance is orange with a medium white head. Aroma is strong floral hops. Taste is similarly floral hops with a good bite of bitterness. IPA isn¬ít my style, but this is one of the better ones out there.

Der hopfige Antrunk ist vollmundig und rund, blumig, harmonisch. Der kernige Mittelteil geht zu Lasten der blumigen Noten, insgesamt etwas milder, z.T. getreidig. Fruchtig-blumig zum Ende, der Hopfen ist weiter vollmundig. Bittere Noten sind erstaunlich wenig vorhanden und werden vom Hopfen einfach ignoriert. Ein rundum gelungenes und s√ºffiges IPA! 10/12/12/12/13/12

Bottle from CASK Pub & Kitchen earlier this year. Pours a clear amber, with a medium off white head. Grassy, piney, quite tropical, basically a tropical fruit punch with a bitter kick and slight heat at the finish

On tap at the Good Dog in Philly. Hazy orange amber pour supporting a long lasting pillowy white head. Grapefruits strive to smell as fresh as this. Huge citrus flavor with touches of lemon zest, toffee, milk chocolate and toasted sesame oil. Perfectly balanced on healthy malt rails. Smooth texture and a citrusy, piney, bitter, dry, snappy finish. Amazing brew.
Bottle @ GBBF, 2011. Thanks to Caesar. Pours cloudy yellow with a small creamy white head. Pine, grape and citrus. Dry and hoppy bitter flavor with lots of citrus. Smooth and medium bodied.

UPDATED: MAY 19, 2013 650ml bottle. No date. I hope it is fresh.

It pours a lightish gold with a frothy white head. There is some decent lacing as it recedes. 

The smell is nicely hopped. It is mostly pineapple and generic like smarties or something.

The flavor is really nice. It tastes like it gets way too much hype though. It has a clear cut bitterness which is great but it is the support act that isn¬ít as great as I was hoping. There is some tropical fruit backing, but I want more.

Overall though it is a solid IPA.

New bottle best by 9/13, Crustal clear appearance. Aroma is citrus, pineapple, caramel, bready malt, some spice. Flavor is round, fruity, citrus, nice pine, very good bready malt base. Like drinking a pilsener if it were an ipa. A finely crafted brew that took me a few times to really appreciate.

Very good IPA.  Citrus and tropical fruits dominate with a nice balance of caramel sweetness.  7%abv seems to be the perfect level for an IPA as all the best ones land about at that point.  Really refreshing and tasty beer.

Aroma is fruity, wooden as well as some honey and mild nectary notes. Flavour is fruits, nectar, wood and some mild honey and sweet maltyness. Wellbalanced and quite pleasant IPA.

Tap, Closed For Business, Charleston SC.  Pale gold, fine white head. Stunningly fresh and beguiling hop nose--lemon sorbet, a whole grove of orange trees in bloom. Very generous without being overbearing. A tough balancing act to pull off. A bright wash of perfume-infused grapefruit citrus flavor, light body with a clean dry finish. Impressive and sophisticated if you¬íre paying attention. But not so egocentric that you couldn¬ít enjoy it while doing something else. A classy world-beating-but-not-so-crude-as-to-brag sort of beer. Roger Federrer in a glass.

bottle @ GBBF. Small white head, almost clear, golden yellow. Nice hoppy aroma of orange, grapefruit, maybe some apricot. Bitter aftertaste, hops in every way. Very fruity: citrus, grapefruit, a hint of vanilla. Good IPA

Poured with a golden hue and an inch of head that quickly faded. Tasted of lemons and a little peach. Hoppy as an imperial ipa, but much lighter bodied. The bitterness lingers and has a cumulative effect. The more I drank the more similar to a bitter Belgian ipa it became.
Bottle into a pint glass at the Great British Beer Festival 2011.  Cloudy yellow with little head.  Slightly overhopped to make it a bit sharp, but otherwise nice.  Flowery hoppy aroma.
Tap at Pony Bar. Pours a pale gold. Loads of perfume in both the nose and flavor. Some juicy grapefruit notes as well. Great hops bite backed by flowers and perfume. Awesome IPA!

12oz bottle unknown date.  Served around 45F.  Thanks to Ryan for this unexpected extra!

Pours lightly hazy golden amber with a three finger fluffy white head that holds a great cap and leaves nice spotty lacing.

Aroma is lemon, apricot, floral & grassy hops, some light tropical fruits, some melon, a bit of pineapple, some orange and grapefruit, caramel and bready malt.  Good to very good strength.

Flavor is citrus, lemon, orange, grapefruit, some pineapple and apricot, a little bit resinous, balanced against some bread and light caramel malt, finishes with very good bitterness.  Minimal alcohol.

Mouthfeel is medium bodied, a bit oily, medium carbonation.

An excellent IPA for sure although the hype train leaves a tad bit to be desired, particularly in the aroma department.  I¬ím stoked to finally get a chance to try Sculpin and while it may not be quite everything I had hoped it is still a fantastic IPA and one I would seek out again.

I split a 22oz bomber with a friend and poured it into an English nonic pint glass.Appearance: Bright, slightly hazy apricot or banana skin hue. Some carbonation visible. Forms an average size, eggshell colored frothy head. Excellent retention and lacing. Smell: A clean, bright, strong aroma of citrus fruits, tropical juice and flowers. Taste: If I was a little less ethical I¬íd copy and paste my description of Stone¬ís Ruination IPA because that beer and the Sculpin IPA are extremely similar in their taste. It begins with a sharp, dry bitterness quickly followed by a sweet, rich and refreshing juice-like taste. Just like the nose, tropical fruits and citrus create for a m√©lange of acidic tartness and juicy sweetness. Orange and an orange sherbet-like flavor are very prominent throughout the palate. The beer finishes with an even strong burst of dry bitterness than it begins with. This is easily tolerable, but the intensity does wear down the palate a bit.Mouthfeel: Medium bodied with plenty of hop energy. More tepid than carbonated. Drinkability: What prevents Sculpin IPA from being a perfect beer, in my mind, is the fact it¬ís a challenge to drink. The massive hops create for plenty of flavor, but they also account for a sharp bitterness and an aftertaste that grows a little more dry and cloying with each sip. There¬ís a lot of energy and weight to this beer considering it¬ís only 7% ABV. Ideally, a great beer to have with food, although one serving in and of itself is more than satisfying.Overall, Ballast Point Sculpin IPA is a embodies the West Coast double IPA style and reminds me why I dig beers like this so much.

UPDATED: JUL 23, 2014 Rated on IPA day. Sampled from a 12 oz brown bottle this beer poured a very cloudy apricot color with a medium sized foamy orange-white head that lingered and left good lacing. The aroma was strong grapefruit, pine, lemon and pineapple. The flavor was bitter,t art and tangy with strong pine and grapefruit and light notes of lemon, orange and perfume. The finish was long with pine, grapefruit and orange lingering. Medium body. Well done.

Pours a pale golden, almost pilsener in color. Aroma is probably the best part of this IPA, pineapple, mango and grapefruit dominate the nose. I find myself sticking my nose in the glass in-between sips. The taste starts with a strong citric hop bite followed by some bready malts, the hop profile is the best of any IPA I¬íve had (IMO). Mouth fell is crisp and refreshing, perfect summer beer, or any time of year for that matter. If this beer wasnt $11 for a bomber I would drink it daily.
Light bodied, mid range bitterness with a higher alcohol content than most IPA¬ís.   Citrus and pine hops, and maltiness.   After a few you may get ¬ístung¬í by the Sculpin.

Bomber.  Pours slightly hazy and bright orange with hints of yellow, topped with a 2-finger meringue-like off-white head.  Nice retention, with rings of thick and creamy lacing left behind as the head recedes.  The aroma is vibrant spicy pine, lemon and grapefruit peel, candied mango, and peach.  The flavor is tart lemon peel, spicy pine and earth and dirt, and slight mango.  Nice bitterness present initially and in the finish.  Light to medium body and medium carbonation, slightly warming, and a bit tangy.  Really tasty, I¬ím glad this showed up in town.  [747]
Clear, dark golden pour.  Great floral aroma.  Resinous pine flavor, huge hop bite with a bitterness that lingers on the palate.  Flavor that lets you know your drinking a beer!  Freaking awesome!

[Bottle] Lightly hazed orangey amber hue, soft pillowy enduring foam. Sweet fruitiness to the hoppy aroma, orange and grapefruit, very aromatic. Plenty of hops on the palate, slightly dry orange at first followed by a mild, light biscuity malt then a big strong grapefruit finish.
Deepngolden pour with a big white head. Aroma is huge with hops and very floral and citrus. Flavor is incredible with juicy hops, fruit, and very slightly sweet. One of thr best.

On tap @ The Bruery Provisions Store.
Pale orange pour with a nice white head.  Lots of tropical fruit in the nose - mango and pineapple.  Tastes as good as it smells with orange and other citrus - finish in quite bitter and lingered on my tongue for a while.  Great West Coast IPA.

Draft at Green Leafe.  Mouth-watering pour.  Deep bronze with a solid foam top.  The initial sniff has the same effect -- well-rounded wet hops and pine.  This drinks with a definite warmth, rife with acidic citrus.  Slippery, oily mouthfeel.  Wicked.  (#4174, 7/17/2011).
One of my favorite IPA¬ís.  Pours hazy yellow with citrus notes up front.  The palate shows deep hops with Grapefruit, citrus fruit and a nice light bitter finish that lingers but yet refreshes.
On bottle bought at the jug shop i SF. Pours golden with medium bodu. Aromas and taste of lemons, peach and mango is there. Also full of fresh hops. A very very good IPA.
Orangy yellow pour with small white head. Aroma of pine and grapefruit. Taste of grapefruit and a sweet malty taste in the background. Nice mouthfeel and a bitter dry hop finish. Good beer.

UPDATED: JUL 7, 2012 Bottle, at le mondiale 2011. Typical orange pour, with a big frothy sticky head. Huge amounts of lacing. A huge hop, grapefruit punch to my senses. Piney resins, just a hop assault. Im glad i had this last before i left the mondiale for teh day, cause this destroyed my palate. Bit bitter hoppy finish, a hop heads wet dream.

UPDATED: JUN 6, 2015 Can 355ml @ Hotel room, Fairfield Inn, Flushing, NY
Pours hazy deep golden with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, citrus, grape and pine. Taste is medium sweet and medium to heavy bitter with a long light malty, slightly dry, bitter, pine, citrus and grape finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. 

Bottle 650ml @ Craft Bar, New York, NY
Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, caramel, citrus and grape. Taste is light to medium sweet and medium bitter with a long fruity kind of dry finish. Body is full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [8 3 8 4 16 = 3.9 7/9/2011]

Bottle. Pours a fairly clear golden-yellow with a thick white head. Considerable hop and citrus aromas. Citrus, spice, and floral hop tastes make way for a very long, bitter finish, although the flavors continue to resonate long after the beer has passed down the gullet. Very delicious, although I prefer the balance of their Big Eye. Not sure it lives all the way up to the "100/100" label, but easily one of the better IPAs I have tried.

(bottle - 22 oz) Slightly hazy orange pour with a very thin white head and mild carbonation. Very sweet and fruity hop aroma. Lots of citrus notes. Flavor is mild, a lot milder than I thought it¬íd be, with a sweet and slightly grapefruity flavor. Finishes with a very light bitter peppery note with a lingering bitter aftertaste.
i absolutely love ipa¬ís and this is my favorite by far- i buy this one every pay day

Thanks to Chipalsa for the bottle share! Magnificent aromas of grassy/herbal notes and solid grapefruit/pine hoppiness. Pour was hazy and had quickly dissipating head and thin lacing. Flavors were well balanced leaving a hoppy citrus and pine flavor on the tongue with caramel malts settling in as well. Great stuff.
Crushed at GABF ¬í10.  Was so excited to sample this beer.  It did not disappoint.  An almost perfect example of an IPA.  Packed with flavor.  Citrus and grapefruit abound.  One hell of a beer.

UPDATED: JAN 26, 2013 Draft. Poured a slightly hazy golden color with a medium sized white head. Aroma was citrus, lemon notes. Aroma was less like an IPA and a bit more like what I¬íd expect a pale ale to be like, not to say that¬ís a bad thing - just an observation. The flavor was mild, very smooth, I had heard that this beer was phenomenal,. so I may have been a bit too amped up about it  when I finally cracked into the beer. I got a bottle that I may have a different opinion about once I crack into it.This is the beer¬ís 666 rating. Time to watch Exorcist.

Tasting at the 18th Mondial de la bi√®re, June 8, 2011. Honey blond, little head. Hop aroma with citrus and peach powerful and floral. Taste a little similar to the aroma, but less strong, good bitterness. Enjoyable, nothing more!

Sample at Mondial de la Bi√®re (Montr√©al). Golden body with low carbonation and a thick white foamy head. Sharp hoppy taste with strong melon/grapefruit hints. Its hoppy taste hides the alcohol pretty well and ends with a decent bittersweet finish. Very good example of IPA.

Sample, Mondial de la bi√®re, savoured on June 8 2011; eye: golden, clear, light effervescence, tiny ring of kaki head; nose: citrusy hops, grapefruit, orange; mouth: citrusy hops, grapefruit, orange, finale in bittering hops with presence of grapefruit, full body, good carbonation, rather bitter, mild astringency, grainy texture; overall: quite good

FRAN√áAIS

√âchantillon, Mondial de la bi√®re, savour√©e le 8 juin 2011; ¬úil : dor√©e, claire, l√©g√®re effervescence, petit anneau de mousse kaki; nez : houblon citrique, pamplemousse, orange; bouche : houblon citrique, pamplemousse, orange, finale en houblon am√©risant avec pr√©sence de pamplemousse, cors√©e, bonne carbonatation, plut√¥t am√®re, astringence moyenne, texture granuleuse; en r√©sum√© : bien bon

Bottle:  The aroma consists of moderate orange, peach, mango, and grapefruit.  It pours a mostly transparent amber with lots of sediment and a two finger off-white head.  The flavor starts with moderate orange with a touch of peach and mango. The finish has moderate grapefruit with a touch of pine.  Medium bodied with mild carbonation and a soft mouthfeel.
Nice, bright hoppy nose with assertive citrus and resin notes. Bitterness on the palate is sharp and is backed by a decent malt presence. Really nice IPA.

On Nitro tap at brewery.  Beautiful golden pour with thick, puffy, white head that only nitro can do.  Nose is citrus, pine, and some tropical fruits.  Taste follows the nose but the hops are dialed down a little compared to other IPAs.  Mouthfeel is crazy good and creamy.

Lots of lemony grapefruit and pine in the nose.  Looking for a little more malt to balance all those hop flavors.  Some honey up front in the taste.
however the bitterness does not over power the taste.  Clean and very dry finish.  Very good.  There could be a couple of IPAs I like better, but this is up there.

Bright gold pour with a thin white head that left a few spots of lacing. Bready aroma with a lot of pine and citrus hops, which lean more towards lemon and grapefruit. Flavor is very lemony, somewhat doughy, with a sharp pine bite. Light and crisp, pretty refreshing. Well carbonated. Lingering bitter finish that seems slightly abrasive. A good beer, no doubt, but I¬ím having trouble trying to figure out why this is highly rated. For the trouble you have to go through to get it, I¬íd rather have Pliny, or even Blind Pig.

Aroma is citrusy hops, tangerine and lemon. Nothing but sweet goodness.

The appearance is banana yellow, tiny bubbles of carbonation. Fluffy head; decent spotty lace. Very "pale."

The flavor is citrus: tangerine, orange, lemon, hint of apple skins. Very sweet with just a hint of pale malts. Meshes beautifully. A touch of dry yeast at the finish.

The palate is slightly fizzy and juicy. Very hefty finish. A little dry. (It reminds me of Rogue Yellow Snow, So. Tier Krampus.) This is a sweet, summery IPA and a damn good one.
22oz - Phenomenal representation of the style.  Frothy head, orange liquid, bright hoppy flavors, bitterness balanced by malt.
On tap a fathers office in culver city. Pours orange in color.  Great citrus and hop taste.  Super beer.

Sampled from the tap at Rattle N Hum. Poured a hazy orangish gold with a white head that dissiapted slowly to the edges. Aroma had a nice combination of citrus, grapefruit and backing pine and resin. Flavor had a more pine and grapefruit with the citrus and resin calming down a bit. Nicely balanced ipa.

22oz bottle. Pours a golden yellow with an orange tint and a medium white head. Aroma is fantastic of apricots, pineapple, grapefruit, lemons, and hops. Flavor is lemons, pineapple, grapefruit and pine. Medium body with a little heat. Great IPA.
Pours light straw with thin white head. Really nice aroma of citrus. But the flavor is somewhat lacking. Not a lot of bitterness. Not bad just not a kick in the pants I thought the hops would be.

On tap at Dublins Downtown Los Angeles. Pours out a hazy yellowish orange witha good head. Aromas of grapefruits,  California hops lemon ppeels, a pineapple that has been picked too early  and roasted malts. Tastes of intense hops at first which settles into a crisp bitterness. The citrus fruit flavors  adds a refreshing quality to this beer. Nicely balanced with the malt sweetness providing the backbone. This brew finishes perfectly crisp and leaves a subtle bitter taste. One of my favorite single I P A s.

pour almost tan yellow in colour and good lace. Can say that i dislike the aroma on this brew as it is very hoppy, pine cones and very west coast goodness.more of the same on the palate, very good length. Very full bodied, very nice, I¬íd almost be tempted to call it a double.. Amazing.

650ml bottle in a tasting glass. Light, hazy copper pour with a slightly off-white head. Spruce and grapefruit hops on the nose with a real lemon zesty vibe. Fairly light on the palate with the fresh citrusy hops really shining through, balanced nicely against subtle hops. Finishes with a smooth lingering bitterness.
Seemed pretty intense at the first sip then the palate adjusted and it went down a treat, golden straw body with lasting head, big hoppy nose with plenty of bitterness in the taste. Good beer!!

A really fantastic full flavored IPA. This is so balanced. The aroma is super herbal and hoppy. Tons of citrus. Same with the taste...with a really nice and sweet malt backbone. Palate is perfect and this finished dry and balanced. BALANCED! Its alittle pale yellowish with haze....I love those IPA that are bright orange and clear.  A wonderful brew.

UPDATED: JUN 25, 2011 This one was kind of hard to find, kind of. Poured from a bottle, instantly the nice big bubbly head settled to little or no lacing. Scent was very dry, with ginger and light spice, citrus even. The taste was impressive, almost too dry for me at first, but then settled to a nice spicy sweetness with notes of grapefruit and light caramel. Very light on the palate, a rather filling and flavorful beer.

UPDATED: APR 17, 2015 Bottle. Light amber, hazy, average to large and mostly diminishing head. Moderate, malty and lightly sweetish aroma, faint caramel and some fruitiness, lots of piney - some grapefruit hoppyness. Body is medium to full, malty and dryish flavor, faint caramel and light fruitiness, lots piney - some citrus hoppyness. Finish is average, malty and dryish, faint caramel and light fruitiness, lots of piney - some citrus hoppyness. Dryish IPA, really nice hoppyness - not too malty/too much caramel. Ace.

This starts with a great hoppy aroma, with pine, citrus, and tropical fruit notes.  This pours a clear light amber, with a huge amount of visible carbonation, and just a thin white head.  There¬ís a nice blast of chewy hops, with a touch of tropic fruits in the finish.  The beer leaves thick lacing on the glass.  This is a great example of a West coast IPA.

Cask at Get Real NY. Dry hopped with Fuggles. Very nice fruity aroma, lots of citrus, grapefruit, tropical fruit. Taste is hoppy, pine and fruit, but very smooth. Light bitterness on the finish. Very fruity, flavorful, smooth, complex, amazing IPA. Need to try this again, and soon. One of the few beers at Get Real that really stood out.

They must add a half ton of hops to this after the boil.  The hop flavor is just ridiculous.  The amount of hops that San Diego goes though is staggering.  Anywho, malt is well in the back, bitterness is understated, and hop flavor with all sticky grassy citrus-y goodness.  No taste of alcohol at all.  A fine IPA.  Might be the hoppy-ist single IPA I have had.  If you really pay attention the malt under all the good hops isn¬ít that great, but it is buried so deep I don¬ít care.

UPDATED: MAY 29, 2011 On tap at The Monk. Pours an opaque yellow golden with a small white head leaving some nice lacing. Aromas of mango, apricot and lemon. Great nose. Smells like a tropical punchbowl. Taste brings out some more lemon with zesty citrus flavours combined with a finishing bitterness and mango. Best ipa at The Monk so far. Very pleased with this one

Poured a golden color, mediocre head.  Lots of citrus and hop flavor, grapefruit, apricots.  Taste was med bitterness.   Palate is med body, slicker texture, soft carb.  Aroma was better than taste but this is got promise.  Just needs tweaked a bit and it could be a big winner.

Botella, thansk for sharing this 3rd best IPA on RB Plovmand! Hazy golden with a nice white medium head. Pleasant ripe fruity sweet like hoppy aroma with bit wet dog underneath. Good filling mouthfeel. Ripe fruity hoppy piney caramel sweet and  bitter flavour. Fruity dry bitter finish.

On tap. This was different from what I was expecting. Not so much citrus but definitely a different fruity blend. Must be the apricot/mango flavors noted in the description. Pours a great looking golden color with a lasting foamy white head. Thick mouthfeel for an IPA. Not my favorite IPA, but a great offering.

On tap, in bottles, multiple samples; quit rating a while ago.  Figured I might as well so I can keep track of what I have drank.  Looks like an IPA; orange with a white head.  Smell is huge on the hops, piney, floral, and grapefruit.  Taste is similar, strong and crisp.  A good beer that holds its own to the beer I always reach for (two hearted).  However, the 10.99 / 22oz price tag that it comes with around here is not justified.  Give me a six pack of two hearted instead.

Bottle shared by faroeviking and Plovmand, thanks guys! 
It pours a hazy golden colour with a white head. 
Aroma is peach, pine, earl grey tea and typical American hoppy with some sweetness to it. 
Flavour is peach, grape, grass, apricot and pine. Ends pine-grassy bitter.
