Bottle. Pours hazy deep golden with a medium white head. The aroma has loads of exotic fruit like passion fruit, mango, pineapple, citrus, lime and caramel. Very fresh and quaffable flavour of mango, citrus, orange, passion fruit, caramel, light pine and grape fruit. Lots of exotic fruit in this one!

UPDATED: JUN 4, 2011 Bomber my bro brought back from his 24 hour FLA trip - thanks for sharing, ck1!  Pours a pale orange/brown with some foaminess.  Very nice lacing.  Aroma is massive fruity hops -- melon, grapefruit, tangerine, pineapple -- with some pine.  Taste actually matches the aroma well; sweet fresh fruit, pine, and some bitterness.  Somewhat sticky.  For as hoppy as it presents, and as understated as the malt presence is, it does not come across as one-dimensional.  Finishes long and leaves the great sweetness/bitterness mix.  This is one terrific brew!  Re-Rate 6/4/2011.  10.4.10.4.18.  Bomber was the last of my "smuggled from FLA" brews.  Pretty much same notes as before - perhaps the best combination citrus fruity/piney aroma I have ever had.  Terrific flavor combination with good blend of citrus fruit, pine and stickiness.  Finishes solidly with a sweet/bitter blend.  And very drinkable!  Are you kidding me?? 

This is a really, really good beer!

On tap at Rattle N Hum. It pours golden yellow with a thick foamy off-white head. The nose is grass, hay, nettle, apricot, peach, raspberry, pear and red apple. The taste is more subtle than anticipated: hay, grass, well hidden alcohol, lemon sherbet, red apple and resin, with some hop bite at the end. A really enjoyable IPA.

UPDATED: FEB 18, 2014 A: Bright orange/amber body... has a radioactive glow to it, which might scare some people but i¬íll take it as the mark of greatness... the head is a flawless 3/4 inch fluffy white cap... good retention while leaving moderate lacing on the glass (perhaps the only "flaw" in this beer)

S: Heaping citric hops bombard the nose, if i didn¬ít know any better i¬íd think i was drinking an immaculate mixed drink on the shores of tahiti on a cloudless day... that being said it was dark, gloomy, rainy Philadelphia... ah, spring in Philly... back to the beer... The hops take on a dynamic character, layering bright blast of grapefuit, mango, peach, apricot, orange, passion fruit ... its like drinking a Jackson Pollock painting

T: If there was an ideal citrus IPA flavor profile, this is it. Like the nose, the fruit flavored bitterness is relentless. There is enough here to explore for days. Almost no alcohol presence, and a nice, subtle sweet malt backbone keeps this beer from becoming juice.

M: Smooth, crisp finish. Refreshing. Nice bitter bite. Ideal carbonation.

O: I¬ím mesmerized by this beer. While its not Pliny the Younger.... this beer is right there and NEEDS to be respected as such. If it wasn¬ít for a law school final that I need to prepare for, I would have stayed all night. I¬ím serious... I would have been at the bar from 5pm til they carted me out drinking this gem.

Golden pour with small white head, lots of lacing.  Aroma of citrus, some hops.  Flavor was more muted, less of citrus and more hint of hops.  An OK IPA, but I think overrated consider how high its been scored and hyped.

Tampa, Fl - Whole Foods - 22 oz bomber. Nice dark golden - light orange pour with a soft pillowy white head that leave plenty of lacing. Oh so pleasant aroma with some honeysuckle sweet accents, just a hint of spruce. Flavor is smooth, yet tangy. Pick up some mango, papaya and just a hint of grapefruit. Hope forward flavor with not much of a malty back end, but sits right on this one. Thick, rich mouthfeel. Had a few from this brewer in Hawaii a few years back - brings back fond memories - good to see them on the East Coast.

The pours a hazy amber gold with a one finger head that doesn¬ít give much retention. The lacing is surprsingly great.

The aroma is light and I instantly think of PtE. There are light sweet hops with some citrus and a touch of apricots. 

The taste is pretty good, very sweet, lots of grapefruit, not a ton of hops, just enough to make it an ipa.

The moutfheel is great with a rewarding lasting finish and the drinkabiltiy is great.

22 oz bomber via trade courtesy of Snojerk321. Poured into a tulip. Pours a clear golden color, similar in color to Two Hearted, with 1-finger white head. Aroma of huge citrus and fruit - lemon, orange, papaya, mango, peach, along with some pine. Taste of sweet caramel malt and big bitter citrus, nicely balanced. Mouthfeel is creamy and smooth, with medium carbonation. This is considered a world-class IPA for good reason!

Ballast Point
Sculpin IPA
Pours golden with a medium white head and good retention. Oily appearance. Aroma is grassy and floral with citrus undertones. Very nice smell. Flavor is grassy hops and alcohol with some light sweetness to offset the bitter. Grapefruit like citrus character with some light malt notes. Good shit.

On tap at the brewery location just north of San Diego.  The color is more golden than I would have expected, it¬ís clear that there has been no attempt at tempering the hops with big malts.  The bright west coast hops and their resiny character is what shines through in this delicious beer.  A great representative of the area for my visit to Cali.

Bouteilles de 12 oz. Consomm√©es fra√Æches, moins d¬íune semaine apr√®s l¬íachat. Ar√¥mes tr√®s invitants de houblon am√©ricain, s¬íexprimant principalement dans la gamme des agrumes et des fruits tropicaux. Robe abricot et l√©g√®rement trouble (chill haze), petite dentelle blanche et effervescence moyenne. En bouche, le houblon est tr√®s expressif, montrant de belles notes d¬íoranges et de pamplemousses sucr√©s. Le malt, tr√®s l√©g√®rement sucr√©, montre un caract√®re de biscuits Grahams. Longue amertume en finale. Une excellente IPA de la c√¥te ouest!

Bottle (bomber) from the Cracked Kettle. Hazy amber, medium off-white head. Hoppy aroma with apricots and other tropical fruits, pine needles, and some citric and perfumy notes. Medium bodied, medium carbonation. Dry with long bitterness. A very well done IPA.

Pours slightly darker than straw-colored with a large white head.  There¬ís definitely orange and cat piss in the nose.  I swear I smell marijuana, too.  Bizarre.  This would be a great summertime IPA because it is so refreshing. Lots of citrus on the palate, with flavors of orange and grapefruit. It¬ís not particularly dry and there¬ís just a small bit of sweetness on the tale end.  Really great beer, but the hype seems a bit over the top.

Bottle pours amber with an off-white head.  Aroma shows notes of caramel, mango, orange, and pine.  Flavor shows the same with additional notes of peach, tangerine, and apricot.  Overall body is moderate, and exceptionally fruity with well balanced bitterness.

Sampled at an ESBLS tasting at Bigelo¬ís.  A hazy dingy gold beer with a big soapy white head.  Nice lacing.  Very nicely done!  Soft citrus flavors with peppery spice, bread, some bitterness.  This one has a cool personality.  Pretty much what one wants in an IPA.

UPDATED: JUN 3, 2011 Man, what a great IPA.  Smells like mango, tastes like grapefruit, all wrapped in a bitter hoppy shell.  The malts give Sculpin the tiniest bit of sweetness on the front, but the beer truly is a showcase of hops, bitter and citric and dry as the finish turns piney and resinous.  Not an IPA for the timid, this bottle does stretch the limits of the amounts of hops that can be pounded into a single India Pale Ale.  But, hey, fuck the timid.  Life¬ís too short to drink underhopped IPAs.   So drink Sculpin.  It¬ís delicious.

Sampled at Brewvival 2011.  On cask, it was a little flat.  My palate could have been blown out by the time i got to this one, but I didn¬ít really think that highly of this.  Faded mellow "c" hops.  With as much as this beer is hyped up, I can¬ít wait to actually try a fresh batch sometime.
22oz Bottle. Pours golden, creamy white head. Floral hop aroma, nice body to the beer, slightly off aftertaste.
From the tap poured an amber color with a good amount of head.  Hoppy flavor with a lasting finish.
At a tasting, thanks DSG, bottle, pours cloudy yellow, tropical fruits aroma, lychee and pineapple taste, excellent bitter aftertaste, and overall an astounding beer.
UPDATED: AUG 29, 2012 A really nice IPA, but for some reason it tasted a little bit thin to me.  But overall, pretty strong.

picked up this beer when i was exploring the many unknown beers to me out there i tried many but this one stood out my new absolute favorite beer in the world. At 8 bucks for 22oz its pretty pricey though.aroma is full of citrus and it makes me excited on whats to come, hints of peach and mango are definately there as the bottle indicates on the label.

Nice pour, very foamy, nice aroma as well, lures you in like the song of the siren.  Smell floral and citrus.  Very murky, surprisingly murky.

Taste is a hop bomb, torches the tongue, sweet, floral, and citrus hops, very well hopped IPA, not alot of backbone to it, but as an IPA this is excellent, ranks right up there with the best due to the hop profile and full flavor.  Very well done, one of the best IPAs out there.  I had this once before and was not that impressed but I think it was old, this is fresh, and it is nice.

Bottle courtesy of my father-in-law. Thanks Nuriel! The pour is a bright murky orange with some gold and amber colors dancing around. There is a big fluffy pure white head that leaves very elegant lacing on the glass. The nose is super high pitched with lots of C-hops and their citrus zest aromas. The flavors are intensely bitter with lots of citrus vest, grapefruit and fresh pine needles. The malts are so light and easy on the palate that the hops build a deep flavor base that only intensifies as I keep drinking. The balance is out of whack, but in a way I love. You can tell there were some sugars hanging around once upon a time, but they¬íve all left town and the floral bitters are running a one horse town. I love this beer.
UPDATED: JUN 7, 2011 very well made IPA, hops and malts are very well balanced in profile and aromas, highly recommended if you can find it

Pours clear light gold with almost white head that quickly diminishes.  So fragrant, some floral with notes of honey and peaches; a bit of resinous hops.  Taste starts fruity sweet, nice and crisp.  Bitter hops finish, but just the right amount of bitter.  So refreshing and a fabulous warm weather beer.

Received in trade from jtrockchalk, thanks for the opportunity!

Pours a crystal clear golden with a tinge of orange. Surprisingly light in color. Smallish white head dissipates quickly. Smells of hops. Pine, resin, citrus, perfume, floral, some malty sweetness in the background. Taste is malty sweet with a citrus hop punch. Bitterness hits the tongue up front, finishes dry with a resinous almost mineral aftertaste that makes your mouth salivate for another sip. Medium body, resinous sticky mouthfeel, crisp carbonation. Lots of bitter hop punch and a surprising amount of sweet malt. Great Ipa, but I can¬ít say that I enjoyed it as much as some others I¬íve tried.

Bottle courtesy of Pollack.  Light golden hazy pour with a small white cap of foam.  Didn¬ít leave much lace.  Aroma was subtle hints of tropical fruits, mango and peach.  Delightfully fresh smelling.  Tasted of light fruit, more bitter than anything else, incredibly smooth and soft on the palate.  Light fruity finish, bittersweet.  Medium to full body, carbonation light.  Overall a good IPA, comparable to a 2HA but lacked something to make it great.

Bottle. Lightly hazy bright marigold with a lovely cap of pure white head, with some decent lacing. Grapefruit and dank aromas that nearly push to harsh, but stop just short for the bitterness in the aroma...really nice burst of hoppiness.  Hops dominate, but are a bit softer in the flavor...not by much, loads of fresh grapefruit, only a tiny hint of some sweetness and caramel, and a bit of tropical fruit, with a dank finish. Lighter to medium body, and softer carbonation.  One of my all-time favorite IPAs.

Verre de d√©gustation, provenant d¬íun f√ªt, d√©gust√© au Winter Beer Gathering 2011 chez Hill Farmstead Brewery (Greensboro, VT). Ar√¥me: Odeur d¬íagrumes et de fruits tropicaux. Apparence: La couleur est orang√©e voil√©e. Pr√©sence d¬íun moyen col mousseux et d¬íune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Go√ªt de zestes d¬íorange et de pamplemousse avec une pointe de mangue. Dur√©e moyenne de l¬íarri√®re go√ªt. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture l√©g√®rement min√©rale. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Arri√®re go√ªt houblonn√©. (Rating #3519)

Had this at Happy Hour at Smoky Oak in Chas.  Was almost the end of the cask-conditioned ale- poured very flat with no head.  Bit hard to get past the appearance of it - doesn¬ít make one salivate like the traditional bubbles and foam topping one is used to.   Flatness led to limited aroma and low score for appearance/ palate.   Made up for it some with taste- very fruity, refreshing. Definitely unique.  Would pair well with spicy food.  70 IBU¬ís.  Definitely hoppy without being dry or bitter.  Worth another taste- maybe tomorrow :)

amazing fresh-hop aroma full of apricot, grapefruit, and just a touch of cheese.
pours a clear light yellow/orange with fizzy white head.
flavor is predominantly bitter, but mild
medium-thin body, crisp, lightly carbonated, with long hoppy finish.

Aroma is full of apricot and peach notes backed up by the hops. The appearance is very light golden. Taste is similar to the smell, however: the smell cannot communicate the crispness of the flavor. It is wonderfully balanced and light. It allows you to taste the hops more delicate notes due to the crisp and clean finish.
Really impressive stuff.  Very clean drinking and finishing IPA with tons of pine and a resinous finish.  I wish I could get it easier....strongly recommended.

A - pale yellow. Ar - Peaches, mangoes, limes, lots of fruity lusciousness. T - Delicate but with a lovely hop balance. Superb. Shows how big hop beers don¬ít need to be massive malt monsters, but can show poise and verve. Awesomely good beer

UPDATED: NOV 29, 2011 One of the finest IPA I¬íve tasted. It¬ís an incredibly smooth brew that does down terrific.A wonderful array of citrus flavors, orange peel, grapefruit, peach. I tried sculpin after a stone ipa (which is also great) an sculpin was noticeably superior. Top notch.

Bottle; Pour is light golden with a frothy white head. Excellent retention and lacing in this shaker. Terrific juicy fruit aromas - Grapefruit, orange zest,and a nice bouquet of hops. Juicy hops fuse with a malt forward feel. The hop profile tingles the tongue. I lied. This brew is so close to the Alesmith brew. I give that one the nod though, side by side.

UPDATED: FEB 9, 2011 Draught at Galbraiths Alehouse (Auckland, NZ). Poured a hazy amber/yellow. Huge peach aroma. A creaminess to the palate that balanced out the hop and brought out the caramel in the malt. Went down very well with The GrandMistress, so kudos indeed.
Best aroma I¬íve had since Hopslam. Big grapefruit bitterness and piney hops. The foam is filmy and clustery, like sea foam. Nice oily finish. Really good, I hate I¬ím heading home away from this!

22oz poured into a tulip lass.  Pours a nice orangish yellow with a nice offwhite head that is substantial and leaves nice lacing on the glass. Aroma is straightforward IPA, resinous, citrus...yum.  The taste has notes of apricot and lemon, with a pungent hop flavor.  Nicely bitter...and the mouthfeel is thin with medium carbonation and a long bitter finish.  Overall, this beer is a straightforward and delicious IPA....not one to miss.

Courtesy of NorCalgrowler.  Lots of citrus fruits in the nose, potent hop and pine bouquet. Smell is fantastic.  Pours a nice orange color with a full fluffy white head, dissipates to a persistent thin head.  Flavor is full of hop character and bitterness, honey, pine, fruit, and a good malt presence to balance.  Medium body, a bit resiny and sweet, smooth with good carbonation.  Overall a great beer, very well balanced with hop additions in all the right places.

Golden, amber, copper with a white, two-finger, frothy head.  

Smells piney, not super big (reminder that this one isn¬ít imperial), malt comes through as toast, butter, and a bit of caramel.  Standard ipa aroma and no citrus or fruit.

The tastes come through in cycles.  First is hops, pine leads.  Then malt, mostly butter, some biscuit, a little bread, and in there is some fruit.  Bit of pineapple and a tinge of grapefruit.  Then pine comes back into the mix.  

A well-rounded ipa, that approaches drinking like a double.  Multiple flavors are present.  It¬ís not hop or malt dominant.  It¬ís also not totally pine or fruit dominant.  Very good.

A pale blonde IPA with a thick white head. In aroma, nice citrussy hops with light pinhey notes, floral, pure californian. In mouth, a smooth IPA with light biscuit malts, floral hopping, well balanced and smooth.  On tap at  Cajun Caf√©, Jan. 5 2011.

Frothy large head deep gold pour medium carbonation aroma some floral touches fruity hops slight earthyness good hop variety flavour a bitter that bites plenty ibu taste of citrus lemon grapefruit resinous some apricot sweetness of peach bright stirring tastes sharp on the palate floral influence barley malt smoothnessfinish sharp ipa hoppy fruit tastes strong vibrant floral influence lasting bitter good catch this bottle

Bottle.  Pours  bright orange with a frothy white head, nice thick lacing on the glass.  Heavy pine and citrus in the nose,  a touch of melon underneath.  Nicely balanced flavor, bitter hop blast to start, lemon tartness with a touch of sweet malts, ends long with the hops lingering on for quite some time.  Medium carbonation makes this smooth and drinkable.  Just a well done IPA, nothing unusual, just an almost ideal example of the style.

Pour was murkey orange, aroma was slightly funky.  The flavor was light and fruity and a medium to high level of bitterness.  You really could taste the melon-like flavors.  I was surprised.  Nice carbonated mouthfeel, but still rich and smooth.  I¬íll bet this is pretty awesome in tap.  Not quite as good as I had hoped and not really worth $9 for 22 oz, but pretty good nonetheless.

Poured into a snifter. Big thanks to afausser for this one.

4.5 A: Hazy yellow orange color. Two fingers of thick creamy off-white head. Average retention for most of the head, but the last 1/8 inch or so sticks around for a long time. Tons of uniform lacing down the whole glass.

5.0 S: Wow! This isn¬ít the strongest smelling DIPA I¬íve had (it¬ís up there), but it is the most harmonious mixture of citrus I¬íve ever experienced. Pineapple and mango are the most intense, followed by orange, tangerine, and grapefruit. Touch of pine underneath with some floral hops in there as well.

3.5 T: The taste is a bit disappointing after the nose. Bitterness is there, but there isn¬ít nearly as much fruitiness to balance it out. Still, there is some pineapple and some lemon. There¬ís more pine and grapefruit than in the nose.

3.0 M: Lighter medium body, but it strangely lays heavy on the tongue. Could be a lot creamier. I¬íd also like a heavier body. Good moderate carbonation.

3.5 D: Pretty good, but one of the reason I really like DIPAs are for the awesome creamy mouthfeels. Still, I¬ím glad this comes to Pittsburgh from time to time.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 05-10-2010 01:13:55

(Sample Date: 12/11/2010   Source:BrewEngineer)   Floral resiny hop aroma with underlying caramel sweetness. Mostly clear yellow golden with moderate off-white head. Big resiny hop flavor but well balanced by sweetness. Medium body and mouth. Finish is medium with resiny floral hop flavor and medium bitterness lingering.

220z bottle poured into a tulip. No freshness info. Pours a relatively clear and bright amber, more yellow than orange. One inch of frothy foam slowly dissipates leaving good lacing. Little carbonation. Beautiful nose! Mango, pineapple, and fresh, piny hops. A hint of rich malt sweetness can be detected under it all. Medium-light bodied but also flat. Not syrupy at all though. Goes down smooth without destroying the palate. Bight and playful hops have only light resiny character. Citrus, orange blossom, and pine on the palate with almost no trace of malty heaviness. Just the way I like it! This is probably the best non imperial IPA I have ever had. I can only imagine how good this would be if it were fresh from the brewery.
has a flavor of tea and subtle grassy hops flavor. pretty soft on the mouth-feel with a bit of malt.

The aroma is very hoppy with a good amount of malt. The hops are both citrusy and piny. The appearance is hazy amber gold with a large head for the style. The taste is like the aroma. The palate is smooth. Overall a very nice beer.

Awesome apricot and citrus aroma, peach and coriander a little bit; appears a beautiful yellowish golden color with a nice feathery head. Tastes very light yet flavorful at the same time, lots of hops complemented by that fruity citrus. Bitterness is nothing but pleasant the whole way. Extremely light on the palate, with a thin texture and an average level of carbonation that yields a perfect finish - a sense of satisfaction and lasting flavor, but a feeling of slight thirst that another gulp satisfies. Overall you can¬ít do much better than this beer.

22 ounce bottle courtesy of trade from mobz24, poured into a snifter glass.

Clear golden color with frothy head. Very aromatic -- citrusy, tropical fruit flavors come through, especially pineapple, mango and grapefruit. Mainly grapefruit and more tropical fruit flavors in the taste. A bit of sweetness to start off, but then comes hoppy bitterness taste that mixes citrus, tropical fruits, piney and grassy notes and some resinous flavors. Mainly citrus and grapefruit in the finish. Light and crisp mouthfeel, good carbonation. Very long dry finish that leaves a resinous grapefruit flavor tingling in the mouth. Very drinkable and enojoyable beer worth seeking out.

12 ounce bottle poured into Duvel tulip. 

Pours an undistinguished golden orange color that is fairly translucent. 

Barely-off-white head is fluffy with relatively lengthy retention duration. 

Nose is green apple hops, some grainy aroma along with resinous hops, and medium amount of malty sweetness. Hint of vegetable aroma as well. 

Taste is piney hops on front of palate. 

Grain and cereal mid palate. 

Resinous hops on back palate.

Bitter finish. Finish has short duration. 

Mouth feel has nice and pleasantly lively carbonation. 

Overall, enjoyed the hop aroma and taste, though found this IPA, generally, a bit grainy.

On draft at Naja¬ís. Sampled next to Pliny. Both were incredible and very easy to drink. No harsh bitter bite whatsoever. Earthy, piney aroma¬ís and flavors were the forefront of this bad boy. It was hard to choose the overall winner between this and Pliny. Both were outstanding.

On tap at Hashigo Zake

The fruity nose described in the commercial description did not really present itself to me. I might have agreed on the vegetative growth of fruit trees however. It has a sense of the field and orchard other than the smell of ripening fruit. It is quite nice. The hops are in clear evidence too. It is clearly an IPA; -- 

- looks like a premium mainstream pilsner, even a champagne without the effervescence. good lacing and medium head; -- 

- bitter hops taste - nothing vaguely sweet, there is the sourness that one associates with grapefruit juice and no hint of saltiness though it is well rounded leaving me to suspect that there is salty aspect to the taste -- 

- medium body, good but not overdone effervescence, nothing oily or creamy and lacking anything suggesting thick or  or sticky - it is clean and clear on the tongue. nice clean slightly bitter finish; -- 

- consistently a well rounded example of IPA.

Awesome beer.  Felt right in the mouth and ended with a pleasant aftertaste.  Nice and bitter.  It smelled and tastes like I was walking through a pine forest with my tongue hanging out.  Thank you Smokepot23.  I am glad you sent an extra!

Light golden with a lighter head but lasting ring on glass.  Extremely potent floral pined hops present a marvelous bouquet to inhale.  The Sturdy hop character is sublimely countered by a slightly burned and sugared backbone and fruited green apple slightly sparklingly sour echo, which gradually yeilds a lingering and lasting bittering dusty twinge tract down the center of the mouth.  An outstanding brew, with an incredible aroma and impressive depth and character.

Slightly hazy golden coloured body with orange highlights, a thin tan head and a bunch of large-ish bubbles rising from the bottom and sides. Aroma of light but grassy hops, malt, a ton of citrus and a touch of white pepper. Medium-bodied; Strong hops at first that fade from grassy, herbal notes to a slightly piney and a touch resiny at the finish. Aftertaste is a bit bitter from the hops, but relatively mild compared to the style. Overall, a solid IPA, but nothing amazing, but that¬ís perhaps because I kept this one for a few months after purchasing it - letting the hops lose their edge. I sampled this 65 cL bottle purchased from Liquor Outlet in Boonton, New Jersey on 11-July-2010, sampled at home in Washington on 21-December-2010.

Tap.  Solid resiny hop profile on the flavor and aroma.  But, it wasn¬ít really all its cracked up to be around here.  I was hoping for some more juicy fruity west coast citric goodness, but wasn¬ít getting much of that.

12oz bottle thanks to footbalm, thanks 
Appearance: Clear golden with a medium sized foamy head and good lacing 
Aroma: Tropical fruit and floral 
Taste: Grapefruit, pine with a slightly bitter finish 
Very good IPA, enjoyable. Crisp and clean.

Have had this beer on a couple occasions both fresh and a few months old. It continues to rate high but I was not overly impressed and though a well made beer I think this one is boosted by local support. Good hop balance that doesn¬ít overpower and decent nose. Well balanced and highly drinkable but could be a little thicker on the palate with the malt base. Overall a nice beer but does not live up to the Midwest IPA¬ís or other West Coast upper tier IPA¬ís.

Pours a hazy deep golden color with a thick white head. Aroma is loaded with centennial hops, citrus, slight pine, and malts. Flavor has hops, grapefruit, yeast, and bread. Has nice lacing and leaves a crisp hop finish. Recommended.

Citrusy nose of tangelos, peaches. toasty sweet malt aromas as well. Some pine resin. very full aroma. Some pleasant grassy notes. Feel is substantial without sticky sweetness finishing relatively clean for a beer this size. Good value - even for an $8/bomber.

22oz bottle - 

My last great bottle of beer from Ballast Point was Dorado, which to this day is one of my all-time favorite IIPA¬ís.  Thi is an equally amazing, incredibly tasty beer that deserves to be considered, in my mind, one of the great IPA¬ís I¬íve ever had.  Like Dorado, this tropical fruit in the aroma and flavor is simply amazing.  It¬ís aromatherapy for beer lovers.  The mangos and pineapple juice go so well with he rose petals, and lemony zing.  The flavor is simply  homerun.  Multiple waves of juicy hop goodness...apricot, peaches, citrus, candy-like malts...some crazy pepper-like notes get picked up and grass clippings but wow.  Just an intense, sensory-pleasing IPA.

22oz Bomber - NIce floral aroma with hints of mango, grapefruit, peach. Pours a yellowish-orange with a somewhat large bone white head. Medium light mouthfeel with lingering grapefruit and pine on the finish. Great regular IPA.

Was lucky enough to get a bottle of this in California from Freddie over at Beverages 4 Less.

A: Pours a copper orange with white head. Decent amount of lacing as it goes down.

S: Plenty of tropical fruits and citrus; there is a lot going on in the hop bill here.

T: Much along the same lines as the smell, although the hops aren¬ít quite as strong as I was hoping, and I know that this was the freshest batch, so I feel like I was missing something, but it was the first beer of the night for me, so I don¬ít think there was anything interfering.

M: Right in the range for the style, helping it to drink quite well.

D: Very drinkable. This is where it might have helped that the hop bill wasn¬ít too strong in the taste. Good brew all around, and I¬ím looking forward to trying it again.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 09-24-2009

What a tasty brew I picked for dinner tonight at this nice little steak and seafood restaurant. Has a nice orange color with an off white head. Smells of pine needles and citrus flavors. Maybe a bit of grapefruit and orange. Taste is a bit like pine trees. I like it. What tasty beers they make out here in san diego.

UPDATED: FEB 25, 2013 This was puchased at Whole Foods for the Thanksgiving weekend.  The aroma of various fruits was present immediately after pouring.  The ale poured with a huge head that laced down the glass.  The pale gold color was very inviting with a sharp taste of orange peel.  There is a bitterness that continues throughout the experience.  The finish is smooth.   This is a special IPA that luckily was available here in the East.  While in San Diego on a business trip I was able to visit the brewery.  Sculpin was enjoyed more than any other beer during my travels.
22oz Bottle from Pinnochios¬ís in Media.  Pours a haystraw color with a big white head.  Aroma is beautiful hops.  Nice bitter hops flavor.  Glad I got to try this one.

Poured from a 22 ounce bomber into a Duvel tulip.

Appearance: Pours a hazy golden orange color with a 1-2 finger foamy white head. Excellent lacing.

Smell: Pine and grapefruit with subtle notes of orange, tangerine, mango and pineapple. Smells amazing. Probably the best IPA aroma I¬íve ever smelled.

Taste: Pink grapefruit up front followed by orange and lemon in the middle then ending with resinous pine at the finish. There is a hint of caramel malt in the background. Aftertaste is a mix of bitter lemon peel, pink grapefruit and fresh orange. The taste doesn¬ít feature much of the sweetness that I expected coming from the aroma.

Mouthfeel: Medium bodied with a nice amount of carbonation. Goes down very smooth. Hops are very sticky.

Drinkability: High drinkability. After finishing a bomber, I could see coming back for seconds.

Overall: Excellent IPA overall. This is a must try for any hop head. I¬íll definitely be buying more once we get a distributor down here in Fort Myers.

pours a hazy golden color with a huge creamy white head...great retention and lacing.  aroma is spicy with some grassyness and subtle pineapple.  flavor is much the same but has some dry grapefruit that i couldnt detect in the aroma...nice light malt backing too.  mouthfeel is resinous yet lively with a long, lingering dry spicy finish.  awesome ipa!  i love that it showcases spicy hops while hinting at some grass and citrus...this is the opposite of many ipas.

OMG! I paid for this one and it was worth it! Pours a golden honey colour with tons of white head and lacing. Tha aroma is amazing flowers, violets, mango, citrus. Tastes like it smells, a great balanced beer malty, mango, rose hip water, citrus. Wow a truly great beer complex yet easy to drink. Pay the price and try it!
UPDATED: APR 27, 2017 Intensly dry hoppy aroma.  Golden in color.  Flavor is dominated by the dry hops, pine and citrus notes.  Really a solid, although overpriced beer.

Bottle.  Strong floral aroma with hints of apricot, mango and resin.  Golden body with thin lasting head, nice lacing and carbonation.  Begins with a strong pine and grapefruit flavor with subtle apricot and mango.  Long bitter finish.  A great IPA

On tap @ Ballast Point. Slightly cloudy yellow/orange with a medium off white head. Big aroma of citrus, pine, flowers, and light toasty malt. Perfect balanced flavor of bitter and sweet that is of course heavy on the bitter side. Medium body with average carbonation and a dry, refreshing finish. This is sooo good... clean, dry and refreshing. Wish I had access to this one all the time, I¬ím sure having it fresh on tap at the brewery doesn¬ít hurt.
Bottle acquired from a trade with stefanje, thanks much.  This beer is everything I look for in an IPA.  Very well balanaced, with a fantastic hop profile.  Sadly, I have only one bottle.

22oz bomber bottle - ordered from San Diego - consumed in Melbourne, Australia the day it arrived. I haven¬ít had a better IPA. Remember we are not talking DIPA, but single IPA here. 7%, relatively low ibu, compared to others. Its the beautiful ¬ísessionable¬í qualities that this beer has that make it stand out. So smooth, light mouthfeel and body, 
Pours a clear, bright golden hue, dense white head that sticks around.
Aroma, peach and beautiful fresh fruits overwhelm, freshness (and my bottle has travelled).
Taste, light bodied, with medium bitterness, kick ass, simple. The finish keeps giving long after you have tasted the brew, but it doesn¬ít build unpleasantly like some. I love you.

Draft at Brass Tap (Wesley Chapel, FL).  Pours a slightly hazed orange yellow color with a foamy white head.  Tons of grapefruit and hops in the aroma.  Delicious flavor with a nice mixture of citrus hops and malt.

Pours a light amber/yellow.  Nice aroma of fresh hops, citrus and grass.  Taste is pretty smooth with a nice hop flavor that is well balanced.  Again, towards the citrus and grassy hops.  Very nice IPA.

Bottle.  Light, clear, golden color with a massive off-white head.  Nose is hoppy and spicy, abundant grapefruit and pine notes with lighter notes of peach, caramel, and grass.  Medium to full body with a sticky mouth feel and good carbonation.  Flavor is slightly sweet and herbal, up front I get lemon peel, grapefruit, and pine resin, there is a good amount of bitterness but it is a bit aspirin like and stays with you for a long time.  Pale biscuity malts are present but don¬ít do too much to balance the beer out.  Secondary notes of toffee, grass, and spice.  Finishes aggressively bitter.

Thanks kmweaver for sharing this bomber: Tremendous resin and orange notes in hop aroma exponentially increased in hop flavor. I suspect a touch of crystal malt supplements the lean base malt profile. There is a curious drying note in finish that I find leans toward solvent warmth, yet my knowing informal tasting partner kmweaver calls ¬íslightly vinous¬í. This may be balancing, or possibly a mark off (most prominent as beer warms). Amazing hop schedule-- is it simcoe/amarillo?

From a bottle.  Golden orange in color with a small white head.  Big citrus fruit aroma.  Orange, grapefruit, some sweeter fruit like peach jolly ranchers.  Flavor is sweet with caramel malt and some peach that lead to a slightly bitter finish.  Some lemon is present in the finish, too.  This is fairly easy drinking due to it being only lightly bitter.

Bottle split at a tasting.  Hazy orange-yellow.  Soapy, patchy head.  Bright, dry hoppy aroma.  Lemon and tangerine flavors.  Quite fruity but not sticky at all.  One of the best IPAs I¬íve had.  Honey and melon flavors.  Awesome mellow body.  Medium malt, maximum hops.

Ballast Point Sculpin, 22oz bomber picked up at Liquor Outlet Wine Cellar.  Pours beautiful hazy orange color with large white head in shaker.  Head sticks to glass nicely.  Great aroma of grapefruit and hops.  Super citrus flavor, clean malt base.  Light, smooth and silky.  Very drinkable, this is a superb brew.  I was worried that the bottle may not be fresh but that was put to rest the moment I open the bottle and poured it.  It smelled excellent before I could even get my nose near the glass.

UPDATED: NOV 23, 2010 Deep gold,white head.Musty citrus hop nose.Thin, unbalanced palate.Musty citrus hops, some bitterness,faint malt,medium hop end.Acetic and soft carbonation.
Don¬ít really see what all the fuss is about, I obviously had a bad bottle

Aroma is mildly sweet floral, fruit, citrus, hops medium. this smells delicious. nice white head with lite lacing as it breaks up. A lite clear golden amber. small amount of tiny bubble rising up. Taste is not close to the smell. hops up front are balanced nicely with malts. The fruit, citrus sweetness is more buried than expected. Lite body to the palate not too much carbonation that holds up start to finish. Goes down easy with just enough mix of hops, malts, sweetness, bubbles to keep it interesting. Mild alcohol warmth in finish. A good brew I¬íd have again

22 oz. bottle, pours hazy golden orange with a white head. Piney hop aroma, with lots of different fruits: peach, apricot, mango and lemon are all noticeable. Flavour is a barrage of fruit flavours, with the peach and apricot jumping out in front, and lemon toward the finish. And of course, a massive burst of hops that kick towards the middle and finish off the palate. Creamy, buttery mouthful. Wonderful brew.

Bottle: &nbsp Orangish golden, a bit fiery, fairly clear, moderate to large frothy white head, nice lacing, lively carbonation. &nbsp Bright floral aroma, hoppy, minor citrus peel and pine. &nbsp Rather sweet on the tongue, certainly hoppy but has a soft fruitiness. &nbsp One thing I notice is that this is very crisp and clean. &nbsp Finishes smooth. &nbsp Body and mouthfeel are moderate to full. &nbsp Lingering hoppiness, floral and pale fruitiness. &nbsp This is a top notch IPA. &nbsp On the sweeter side for sure, with softer hop bitterness. &nbsp Very drinkable! &nbsp Thanks Kyle for the bottle!

I could spend all day sniffing the grapefruit-piney aroma which sends out a nice bouquet of Earthy tones. It took me a bit but there is some peach and lemon in the aroma as well. Flavor is loaded with citrus as well but has a rather bitter resin-like finish to it. Some lemon character is present in the flavor which seems to give it a nice balance. Alcohol is well hidden.

Yet another California IPA that rocks the house.  Had this one 10/7/2010 from the bottle.  Pours a beautiful golden color with just under quarter an inch of head.  Nice lacing on the glass as well because I keep drinking this beer very quickly.  I smell malt, slight citrus from the hops.  I taste citrus with a strong bitter finish to let you know that they did not skimp on the hops.  Not the most balanced, but this IPA is a true representation of why the West Coast IPAs rule the roost.  I am so happy we were able to get some of this liquid nectar in Richmond.  Medium bodied with a very smooth mouth feel for being so aggressive.

wow.  650ml bottle poured hazy gold with rocky sticky yellowish head. Aroma is bright and very flural with sweet mago and grapefruit notes up front other citrus fruit notes in the mix also like oranges and peaches.  Taste is hoppy and piney notes but still holds a citrus fruit taste with a very good body.  Extreamly complex and the aroma is very strong.  phenominal IPA

Key Food, Brooklyn bomber ($8.99): Pours a golden color with a long lasting moderate white head. On the lighter side of possibility for the IPAs. Aroma is very fruity; I get the biggest noseful of peach, although there are citrus notes in there as well that I detect. Lots of hops in the aroma as well. Taste is bitter, but it does not quite get into hop slaughter territory. The hops may actually be most present in the sustained aftertaste. Even though this beer is medium bodied, it is still rather easy to drink and the hops don¬ít stop you from enjoying a second one (Green Flash Hope Head Red I¬ím looking at you). I¬ím actually a bit disappointed. I know this beer was good, but it didn¬ít strike me as the third highest rated IPA... In any case, I enjoyed it. I just hated seeing that bottle always looking at me beckoning me to its hoppy goodness.

UPDATED: JUN 23, 2013 Deep hazy gold, with a hint of orange, nice compact head.  Aroma bracingly grapefruit and lemon.  Flavor is also hop oriented, grapefruit, lemon, and as it warms, a hint of apricot.  Very, very faint caramel sweetness for balance.  Not bad, but this is so oriented on citric hop notes that the flavors probably are harmed a bit by bottling and travel across the US.  Still nice.  RERATE:   A past due rerate now that this seems to be on draft with some regularity.  And by golly, that is the way to taste it.  Basic notes are the same, but beautiful fresh hop flavors just leap from the glass.  Worth a few extra points.  Would love to try this fresh at the source one day.

Poured a dark hazy yellow with a thin head which still had a nice lacing. The aroma has some strong aromas of fruits like apricots in addition to some vegetable like sweet baby carrots. Taste is quite heavy on apricot and some rather strong bittering hops. The high alfa acid bitterness lingers heavily on the aftertaste. Body is also quite heavy for the style. It¬ís very enjoyable, though certainly an unabashedly unbalanced IPA.

Bottle. Amber with a rocky white head. Strong citrus laden hops, light pine, and soft caramel. Taste is big citrus (grapefruit juice and orange peel), soft caramel, sweet malt, herbal hops and tropical fruit. Body is medium and resinous with a bubbly carbonation and a strong lingering bitterness. Finishes with more citrus notes (grapefruit juice and orange), pine sap, soft caramel, sweet malt and more unripened tropical fruit notes.

Bottle; shared many thanks with Angelo. WOW. Massive hoppy nose, hold out so well in the fridge, great lacing, slightly hazy coppy pale appearance, lovely yeast clean yeast strain, strong tropical fruits and grapefruit, really big and bold and aggressive on the tongue, lovely US bittereness, hops are just bang on gorgeous, I enjoyed this more than Pilny, baby this rocks. Loads of candy, great dry fruity finish, succulant down the throat and damn damn drinkable. One hell of an insane top big bold US ipa which should be setting titanic waves accross the industry. Stunning. Thanks mate. Legend. Damn I need to cool down.

grownfool¬ís Impromptu Tasting.  Sample from a bottle thanks to one of the guys.  Hazy yellowish, whitish foam.  Aroma is citrusy, grapefruit.  Taste is more fruity, citrusy, orange, lemon, grapefruit, light malt.

Poured from a 22oz. bottle into a stemmed glass.

The color is a clear orange/gold with two or three fingers of foamy white head and some thick lacing.

The smell is pretty floral hops with some funky citrus flavor. This has a nice west coast IPA feel and I am impressed already.

The taste is pretty sweet and pretty bitter but with a fruity citrus flavor that does give off a bit of zing. Pretty good spiky flavor that does poke with a bitterness that is not surprising but fun. Some tropical fruit I can¬ít name brings you to a slapped back fruity flavor.

The feel of this beer is a pretty smooth beer. It goes down pretty darn smooth but does leave it¬ís mark on your mouth as it bitters the palate with some nice flavor.

22oz bottle from 16th St. Liquor in West Van. Pours a crystal clear orange with a large sticky white head. Aroma is piney hop forward citrus with tropical fruit notes. Flavour is citrus hops, pine, malt pepper, grass and spices. Finish is bitter, grassy, hoppy yet balanced goodness. Very pleasing.

Wow, this is a gem from the first mouthful. Sl cloudy golden and this head but that¬ís about as bad as it gets. Rich honey malts with a raspy citrus hop bite. Mouthfeel is all grapefruit, best pink grapefruit. Lovely balance of malt and sweet and bitter citrus and that dry mouthfeel with afterburps for a long time to come. The best beer I¬íve had for a long time - well done

UPDATED: FEB 6, 2013 Poura a amber orange color with a small off white head.  aroma is of lots of grapefut and pine.  flavor is nice and hoppy with alot grapefruit and pine, with some malts in the background.  has a medium body with a creamy, slighty oily mouthfeel and a nice dry, crisp finnish.  overall, a very good IPA from Ballast Point.

On tap at Pizzeria Uno Bensalem. Surprisingly nice light color. Aroma is pine and citrus. Very little head. Taste is wonderful. It has a very upfront hop kick that isn¬ít overbearing, and doesn¬ít stay thick or harsh on your palate. Brought me joy.
Yellow pour white head grassy pine, grapefruit nose. fresh Pine and citrus dry taste. Bitter crisp finish. Perfect

UPDATED: MAY 3, 2013 Holy cow, this might be my new favorite beer.  Smooth and delicious with a juicy grapefruit aroma.  Oozes hops, and delicious IPA flavor.  Incredible.  VERY smooth drinking for such a big beer.  If this were more readily available, I¬íd drink it all the time.

Near perfection in my book.  I¬íve never had anything better.

20100917  Bomber from Al¬ís of Hampden.  Nice surprise finally running into this beer, which I¬íve been seeking for a while.  Medium golden color with small but lasting creamy white head leaving clumps of foam on the glass.  Aroma is tropical with a good dose of passion fruit, citrus, dandelion, and also some lightly sulfurous garlic.  Body is a bit on the light side without much carbonation to help get it across the palate, but at least it¬ís not sweet or sticky with malts.  Weedy, sharply bitter with citrus notes, and some soft underlying bread crust sweetness.  Nice balance while still showcasing the hops in this quaffable IPA.  Surely a beer that would be super if very fresh.
At a tasting: amazing aroma, strong guava, lychee, pinapple, peach, in the flavor the same but weaker, more citrusy and bitter - less hop flavor, good malty backbone, very good beer.

At a tasting, thanks DSG, pours orange with a nice head, fresh aroma of pine, grapefruit, tangerine and lemons, feels dry with flavors of grapefruit, orange, quite bitter with a full body. Very refreshing IPA

UPDATED: FEB 26, 2012 Re-rate 2/22/12: Bottle sample at a tasting at Dagan¬ís place. Thanks Dagan. Almost clear golden with medium white head. Hoppy aroma with citrus and some tropical fruits notes. Bitter flavor with decent fruity hops. Medium-bodied. Maybe slightly past its prime, but still a good IPA. 7/4/7/3/14=3.5

Bottle sample at a tasting. Huge thanks Ambar for bringing me this bottle from the States! Slightly hazy golden with a white head. Incredible aroma of citrus and tons of fresh tropical fruits.  Flavor has a bit of sweetness at first with some malt and then continues bitter and hoppy with tropical fruits, pine needles, and a bit of resin. Medium-bodied. Really good. 9/3/7/4/15=3.8

UPDATED: SEP 19, 2010 Sampled this again at GABF ¬í10.  Ratings stand...this thing just screams pink grapefruit pith to me from the nose through the finish.  If you like this, these guys do the best one I¬íve had as far as balancing it all out.

Tap at Capones.  Suprised I havent rated this since I have had many times.  This was a good sample so worth rating this one I guess.  Pours a light copper bright orange- some haze, massive white head sticky with sick lacing.  Aroma is dank weed hops, columbus, pine, tropical notes, and resinous- very powerful with little malt to get in the way.  Flavor is tons of hops, but doesnt get too slick or oily- light pale malt backbone, little sweetness, tons of green fresh hops, resinous, sticky, dank, low vegetal hints, and lots of citrus.  Finish is sticky and resinous without getting slick- and malt profile is dry- very very easy to drink.  Awesome.

At a tasting, thanks DSG, small stable head, hazy deep orange colour, flowery aroma with grapefruit, peach and pine, flowery soapy flavour with peach and a hint of alcohol, very strong bitterness but not completly out of proportion. A fair IPA.

Poured a hazy orange with a thick 3 finger head. Nice lacing. Aroma is incredible, citrus and floral hops. Light to medium body. Light to medium carbonation. Good mix of grapefruit, mango and pine. Very drinkable. This just might be my favorite IPA yet.

Bottle as a sweet extra thanks to daknole. This was the second time I have had this the first was at the 09¬í GABF (no notes) and then now with a note pad in hand. Pours out dark gold topped with a nice tall head. Aroma was so good tons of citrus hops and sweet caramel. Taste was more of the citrus/floral hops along with a great malty backbone and the sweet caramel to keep it all balanced out.

UPDATED: OCT 22, 2010 Sample from a bottle courtesy of JaBier at the Day Before Labor Day party. This brew is a hazy orange-gold color with a medium white head that dissipates steadily. Thin rings of lacing. Great aroma of ripe peaches, citrusy hops and pine. Medium body with a moderately bitter piney hops character along with flavors of citrus and malt. The finish is hoppy with a lingering citrusy aftertaste. Good IPA all around.
An excellent IPA.  Nice citrus, floral hop aroma and flavor.  One of the better IPA¬ís iv¬íe tried.

22oz bottle, although I¬íve had it from growler as well.  Beautiful amber hue, and great carbonation, very fresh at time of sampling.  So much citrus intermingling with the resin aroma, little bit of a tropical note.  Very well balanced, hop profile goes right through the palate start to finish.

UPDATED: OCT 7, 2014 
++++ Re Rate 5 Oct 2014 ++++ 
Rerating this to increase the score.  Over the past years I have had this beer in can, bottle and on draft again and it is consistently amazing.  My favorite IPA at the moment. (9,5,9,5,18 - 4.6)


++++ Original Rating 4 Jun 2013 ++++
12 oz draft at City Beer in San Francisco. Pour is a hazed orange golden with a well formed one inch off white head. The head is lasting, and leaves behind great lacing.  Pretty beer.  Aroma is all hops, dank pine citrus and full of resin. Fresh, also some balance provided by biscuit malt. The taste is initially the big, fresh hops, lingering with a pleasant dry bitterness. The biscuit malt of the nose gives it a nice body and balances. Palate is medium to full bodied, with lowish carbonation and the clean dry finish. A really nice IPA, happy to have it tried it on draft. (8,5,9,5,17 - 4.4)

Bottle [650ml] shared with rudolf, HogTownHarry & garthicus -- c/o rudolf. Pours a hazy golden-orange with an average size diminishing white head. Aroma of citrusy hops, resiny too, some fruit and all backed by caramel malt. Flavour of lots and lots of citrusy hops, It¬ís mostly just hops but it¬ís awesome. Big bitter finish. Medium bodied. Fantastic stuff -- thanks rudolf!

UPDATED: JUN 16, 2014 clear orange with a small, stable, whipped white head.  fruity and stemmy with floral notes in aroma.  superb, easy palate with proper carbonation and slick mouthfeel without being too full.  flavors are melony with some citrus and just slight hints of dry hopped vegetal notes.  a really nice beer.  
22oz bottle.  work trip to Wilmington, NC.  took a trip to the beach and to lighthouse beer and wine(right near da beach) after work.  sculpin pours a clear orange under a medium off-white head.  big peachy, mandarin aroma.  palate is light to medium.  burning warmth in finish.  very bitter and quite dry.  flavor of white grapefruit and orange.  not enough malts for me.  8/31/10 8/3/6/3/12

From a 22 oz bottle.  Thick creamy head.  Pour is a dark orange/amber color.  Fruit hop aroma as advertised.  Citrus hops are definitely present in the taste.  Nice solid hop taste.  No afterbite.  Although only a 7% ABV the alcohol is well hidden.  Good IPA.  I would definitely drink again.

Bottle shared by Nate.  Pours yellow w/ orange hues and a big white head, rocky and glorious.  Orange and lemon nose with resin.  Citrus, lemon, resin, mild bitter with some litterbox notes.  Solid IPA

22 oz bottle.  Pours a light amber with a small white head leaving a small white head leaving a small amount of lacing on the glass.  Aroma is strong of citrus hops with a bit of alcohol.  Taste is strong of citrus hops with a little bit of bready yeast and a strong bite on the finish.  Medium bodied.  Strong carbonation.

from old notes Mostly clear, orange-copper hue; fluffy, white head. Huge mango-apricot aroma, slightly dank-catty, lightly toasty. Cookie and caramel sweetness, bright and crisp fruits and acidity, almost overwhelming in the aftertaste. Huge, lingering hop tingle alongside Finnish pinesoap. Slick texture, bountiful carbonation, medium-full body. Massively hopped with wonderfully restrained malts. 22 fl oz bottle.

Near perfect beer. Nose is super citrusy, grapefruit and some sweeter orange too. Taste is citrus hops, a touch of bitter peel, and more of a malt backbone than I expected.  I know people are putting hoppier, higher abv IPA¬ís out there, but this one is just perfect.

UPDATED: APR 26, 2011 Rerate 4-26-11

Very consistent, right now I¬ím drinking this on a nightly basis. This is pretty much IPA perfection, and is pretty much everything I want in an IPA. Decidedly better in bottle than on tap. Unfortunately I can¬ít find it in bottle anywhere other than Julio¬ís Liquors. Will stock up soon for the summer before going back home, thinking ~20 bottles, ~$200, hope that will be enough.

10 5 10 5 19

Orig. rating 8-25-10

Clear amber; medium frothy white head; appetizing appearance. Incredible aroma, lots of grapefruit, passionfruit. Easy to gulp down; medium bitterness, white grapefruit, slightly powdery texture. On the dry side but carrying a lot of flavor. This hits you in the same way that peeling a grapefruit releases its aromatics. Exceptional IPA.

10 4 8 4 18
It¬ís damn good .....but....for the price there are many just as good and comparable IPAs out there with higher abv and a cheaper price.

Someone gave us this bottle at the end of the RBSG 2010 grand tasting. alexsdad06, I¬ím looking at you.... do we owe you the thanks on this one? Pours a light golden color with a good head and some lace. The aroma is orange and citrus with some garlic and some fresh hop florals. I reckon the flavor is nicely bitter and very fruit forward. There is  a wee bit of onion in there with some light sweet malty notes there at the end. Very tasty stuff.

Draught at Stone 14th Anniversary Celebration. Light gold pour with an off-white head. I feel as though previous batches of Sculpin were a bit darker and more hoppy, but this beer still rocks. Aroma is sweet with all the fruit, grapefruit and hops. Extremely bright beer - the carbonation works great with the lemon, peach, and grapefruit that I picked up, among the other fruit flavors. The hoppy background and light body accentuate these and lead to a good finish.

UPDATED: SEP 27, 2011 22oz bottle.  Pours golden copper and a nice fluffy head.  Amazing scent of mangoes and guava.  I was ultimately disappointed with this beer, however, as the taste of this did not match the expectations provided by the aroma.  There is a sweet bitterness here that I wish was featured a bit more, and there is definitely no "sting" that supposedly earned this beer its¬í name.

Bomber. Looks like a perfect IPA, and smells as good as any beer I¬íve ever had. Just filled the room with delightful hop smells. It¬ís crisp, piney, and delicious with a fairly long finish. I enjoyed every drop of this great beer, but I can¬ít say it¬ís worth the extremely high price tag when there are other great IPAs available for a fraction of the price.

Rating #1900. Sampled at the Bistro¬ís 13th Annual IPA Fest on 8/7/10. Didn¬ít rate much at the festival because pretty much every beer was a palate wrecker, but made sure to try this one first and only rate it and the one immediately after it. Pours clear gold with a huge white head. Citrusy and piney aroma, smells like a hop bomb. Citrusy hop flavor up followed by a bit of malt, then a ton of pine before a clean grapefruit finish. One of the best of the festival. Right up there with Headhunter, Hopfather and IPAX.

From bottle. Fresh piney resinous hops, mild citric rind. A bit of sweetness. Ozone. Golden amber hazy with white head. Medium body and carbonation. Great taste. Smooth sweetness with caramel. Huge hop taste from start to finish. Big bitter after with nice balance.

650 mL bottle.  Gold with a small head.  Citrus and resin in the aroma.  More citrus in the flavour.  It¬ís almost grapefruit juice!  (But I like grapefruit juice).  Not a lot going on by way of malt, but, somehow, it doesn¬ít seem to matter.  This is a fine adult beverage.

Golden  pour with a thick white head.  Aroma is strong with a mix of citrus, light fruits, and strong hops.  Palate is really nice, just the right thickness without being too heavy.  Nice carbonation as well.  Crisp flavor, clean hop profile and just enough malt to balance everything out. Easy to drink and enjoyable.

Bottle thanks to RegSpeir. Pours slightly hazy with a small white head. Nose is orange, peach, lemons, fruity hops, and various bright citrus- very nice. Flavor is big hops of citrus fruits, pines, grass, and just big resinous dankness. Nice light, thin mouthfeel and light carbonation finishing crisp, dry, and bitter.  Great IPA!
Bomber. Nice hazy orange. Pillowy white head. A bit oniony for sure. Oranges. Body is spot on. Not much for malt there-which is good. Grapes. Maybe even a bit cheesy.

22 oz bomber.

A: Pours a cloudy orange with a bit of yeast sediment and a one finger white head.
S: Various citrus fruits and hop aromas.
T: Citrus fruits, perhaps grapefruit and peach, followed by hop bitterness, and then finishing with the fruit flavors.
M: Medium to light bodied and well carbonated.
D: Not a typical representation of the West Coast IPA, but Big Eye would fit that mold more. This fruit flavors balancing out the hop bitterness were a pleasant surprise, and this reminds me quite a bit like AleSmith IPA, another great San Diego IPA.

From a bomber into a pint glass.  Pours hay colored yellow with plenty o fluffy head.  Not much lacing, kinda surprising.  Aroma of hops, mango pine, skunk, etc.  Palate is very, very, good.  Not sticky and not light... as Goldilocks says, just right.  Tastes like a West Coast IPA (or DIPA more accurately).  Lots o¬í hops.  I liked that this one was very smooth and not too biting.  Very solid IPA; reminds me a lot of Deshutes Hop Henge, another very good IPA.

New review updated 8/10/10 and score from this one.

A-pours a lightly hazed pale golden color with a dense creamy white head with a great lace left behind.

S-caramel and biscuit malt are light and present up front, hops dominate, tons of peach, orange, and notes of pine.

T-caramel and toasted biscuity malts up front, light pine, sugar, tons of fruit flavors, orange, peaches, tangerine.  Moderate bitterness that lingers for just a moment.

M-medium to light in body, smoother on the palate, a little syrupy, strong carbonation, crisp clean finish, quite wet throughout.

D-this is a darn tasty IPA every time I drink it, there is enough malt to keep a balance but the hops are really the focus of this beer dominating the palate.  the bitterness is quite present but doesn¬ít linger unpleasantly.

*****************

A-hazy golden yellow color, two full fingers of white head that leaves a light lace on the glass

S-hops it is! love it! big hops in the nose of tropical fruit, grapefruit, citrus and some apricot. I¬ím excited!

T-expected hops, got hops! I am getting huge hops similar to the smell, I¬ím drinkin tropical fruit juice, big pineapple, apricot, some citrus, with a nice bitter hop finish

M-very smooth and lightly carbonated, slick down the back of the throat and lingers in a good way

D-I love the taste of hop and bitter hop, I could drink a million! this just became one of my favorites of all time!

22 oz bottle purchased by my buddy who just brought a case back from PA. The aroma is very pungent - just a beautiful blast of tropical fruits and citrus. Flavor with a lighter malt profile (pale, maybe a little vienna malt) then comes a full-on explosion of papaya/mango, tangerine/citrus/grapefruit and a little pine. Extremely tasty. Full, round and creamy with moderate carbonation. Just great.

bomber shared by rudolf with me, blankboy and garthicus.  Looks the part - hazy gold, quite bubbly, average lasting white frothy/fizzy head.  Well-balanced aroma - lovely sweet maltiness, peach & pineapple, sweet and tart both, with plenty of hemp, citrus and lemon zest bitterness.  Taste follows - again, nicely balanced, and the west coast bitterness takes its sweet time building, but when it finally arrives, it¬ís pretty big, bitter, and acidic - good thing there¬ís a lot of malt alredy on the scene - somewhat strong alcohol too, just what I wanted.  Solid body on this one, well-carbonated, enough hops in there to make it both acidic AND astringent, and it lingers a long time - dry, bitter, a bit alcoholic and definitely resiny - this is top-shelf stuff, big and balanced both, I want more (thanks, Rudy!!!)

Bottle from Southbay Drugs.  Gold, thin white head.  Nose is citrus, grapefruit, pine needles, mint.  Flavor is mint, pine needles, tangerine, pink grapefruit.  Nice enough, but not particularly robust.

Clear orange with a medium sized frothy white head. Aroma starts with nectarine and peach, then moves to a citrus with pink grapefruit and lemon, and a touch of spruce and cedar bark at the finish. Awesome nose for an IPA. Flavor starts with a drop in the fruit character, moving towards pine, orchid, and perfume notes in the hop column. Palate is light and drinkable, but not watery. Incredible regular IPA.

Bottle, thanks to Rudy. Appearance: deliciously hopped, lots of mango, hemp, pine, perfume, spice, mango, lemons, amazing. Flavour: Super bitter hops, pine, malt, so much hops!!!! Lots of tingly carbonation, marijuana, makes my mouth water. Just delightful, long orange skin & pine finish.

This ale is a murky light copper color with a faint touch of carbonation.  The nose of this beer is complex with notes of farmers market peach, passion fruit, citrus, and apricot jelly. On mouth this is a smoothly balanced IPA with a medium body, plenty of hops, and the slightest green hop flavor. The finish is chewy and of medium length.

UPDATED: AUG 6, 2010 OK, first beer from Ballast Point that i truly loved.  Like the offerings from its geographic neighbor, Stone, this one is hopped to hell and back, but unlike the Emperial IPA, this IPA works.  Off the scale bitter, yeah, but with complexity.  Nose of sweet malts, bitter hops, and a touch of sweet ripe fruit (peaches maybe?).  Beautiful gold body with a firm white head, which leaves great lacing as the beer disappears.  Taste of sweet malts, bitter PNW hops, grapefruit, pine, and yeah, peaches again.  Long bitter finish.  And not overly alcoholic, especially given the intensity of the flavors.

(22oz bottle).  Pours copper color with white head. Aroma of grapefruit, green mango and peach.  Beautiful!  Taste is mostly bitter with some sweetness.  Surprisingly light.  Light bodied with thin and oily texture.  Finish is bitter.  The aroma is excellent and it¬ís quite easy to drink, but that is also part of the ¬íproblem¬í.  It doesn¬ít seem to have much depth, but this is an admittedly nit-picky criticism. Overall,  this is a very good beer and one that I wish I could have in my fridge all the time.

Pours a light orange with a foamy off-white head. Sharp, piney hops are balanced with sweet mandarin on the nose. Some nectarine as well. Strong, refreshing, bitter hops in the flavor - pine resin and grapefruit. Big, but clean - goes down smooth. This one is seriously tasty - I¬ím a fan.
7/23/10.  Thanks to Tim for sharing!  Piney, floral aroma, very nice.  Sweet floral hop flavor with just enough balancing bitterness.  This is very good!

Pours tea-orange into the glass, with a retentive frothy head. The nose contains a huge bouquet of pine and citrus elements. Flavors of grapefruit, mangos, pine resin, tea-leaf tannins and fresh grassy hops intermingle in a perfect balance. Although complex, each pull provides an easy quaff and a light-round mouthfeel. Carbonation is smooth, yet provides for a lightly zesty palate. Perfect execution of an IPA. Great brew.
22. A very large IPA, XXXL. Massive hops press strong citrus & piney resins on your tongue.  Last bomber. Will purchase again.

Bomber thanks to Amy
Appearance : Clear pale yellow big foamy and creamy head. Extensive lacing.

Aroma : Fresh and green hops. Very leafy and slightly floral. Nice notes of mangos. Quite malty. Light notes of honey.

Taste : Some spices. Lots of malt. Leafy hops with fruity mango notes. I was expecting a bit more hops considering the powerful nose. Finish is slightly resinous. Rather bitter. 

Overall : Amazing nose, leafy and fruity hops. Taste is a bit disappointing compared to the nose but still very good. Highly drinkable with a nice sharp but light bitterness that only makes it even more drinkable. Nice crisp bitter finish. Amazing beer !

Really liked this brew. The aroma was full of really big citrus flavors. Really smooth drinking, full of bubbly froth and quality malts. The citrus really kicks it up a bunch, very mangoish. Great brew.

Tap @ the OBF Buzz Tent...  Poured orange with a white head.  Aroma of fresh, floral, resinous hops.  Slight hop bitterness, but mostly a lush hop, earthy, floral character.  A little sweet, a little bit of malt to cover the lose holes.  Definitely a hop bomb.

22 bottle at Smith¬ís in downtown Springfield.  This might be my new favorite IPA.  The citrus flavors are over the top.  I love the orange juice finish balanced with a light sweet malt.  As it warmed up a bit, the floral and grassy flavors appeared.  This was the perfect break from the kitchen renovation.  I asked Jimmy for something with citrus hop flavors from his private stock... and he delivered.

22oz bottle in a shaker.  Pours deep golden with a lingering, lacy head.  Aroma strong of caramel with underlying hops that are strong but somehow still feel like a background scent.  The flavor is the same way.  You can sense the presence of the hops but the smooth texture and caramel malts are more apparent.  A really good beer that competes with a lot of imperial/double IPAs.
5th March 2010. Pre ZBF. Hazy gold beer. Hoppy nose. Dry palate - soft. Pleasant hops - a little spicy. Dry soft finish. Perfectly good but forgetable beer.

First night in rented Decatur digs.  Welcome to Emory.  Marking the moment with this promising bottle, a cool sendoff, compliments of darn1207.  A bomber.  Pours golden amber orange, not cloudy yet opaque. Snow white head.  Attractive.  Amazing nose, all floral hops and citrus fruits.  Really a great smelling brew.  Light-medium bodied, slightly watery mouthfeel.   Grapefruit, orange, mango, pineapple.  Clean bitter aftertaste.  Delicious.  Nice lacing as she goes.  Apricot emerges as she warms a bit.  A beautiful balanced IPA that doesn¬ít try to kick your ass.

22oz Bomber. Pours a medium golden color with a slight haze. A short head leaves some scattered lacing in my Alesmith shaker glass. Pungent hop aroma with notes of pine, bubblegum and  nectarines. Body is medium and slick with a biting bitter finish that lingers. Flavor is quite balanced and reminds me of Hop Devil in that respect. Quite bitter and hoppy with a good balance of malts. Overall a really great IPA!
user_location: Cape Coral Waterfront Wonderland, Florida, USA

text: Bottle courtesy of tarheels86 - thanks!  Bright amber color, large off white head, great lacing.  Aroma of tropical fruits, pine needles.  Taste is light citrus and flowers.  Light body.  Good stuff.

Served from bottle into a Spaten mug.  Pours a nice golden color with a two finger frothy head that subsides to one finger slowly.  Maintains nice lacing throughout.  The aroma is comprised of an excellent sweet hop note.  The flavor is of pine, spicy hops, and a hint of malt.  It has medium feel on the palate with high carbonation.  Overall this is the second time I have had this brew but the last time was prior to reviewing brews.  I am glad I was able to get my hands on it again so I could relive my previous experience.  You NEED to try this one if you are an IPA fan.  No excuses... Believe the hype.
A hazy gold pour with a medium white head. Scent of piney hops. Fantastic fruity and bitter blend, dry finish. Wonderful and possibly my new favorite IPA!

UPDATED: AUG 7, 2010 A clear golden pour with medium carbonation in the body and a beautiful topographic white frothy head. The aroma holds nectar fruits and gratuitous pine. Mango, pineapple, mandarin orange, apricot, and a slight caramel malt all come through definitively. Pretty much every hop facet is covered in this dank wonder of a brew. The flavor blasts me with resinous evergreen at first, but that quickly changes to apricot, nectarine, mango, and mandarin. The malt character is light, which I really like here. The palate is super crisp and resinous without being smacking. An incredible rendition of the style.

UPDATED: JUN 27, 2014 Light Golden honey color, just very slightly cloudy with small head that lasts and just a little lacing on Tap at Mad Mex.  Very nice full mouth with all kinds of hops for good balance.  Funky aromatic mop tastes and of course a great bitter clean finish
2011 Bottle every bit as good except lacing was great too.
6/14 On tap light golden color and seemed not as big. still a good drink

Bottle from PeteinSD
Awesome aroma dripping of resinous hop oils.  The flavor is a little lighter than the aroma and has some more fruit than the aroma would lead you to believe.  Grapefruit surrounded by cannabis.  A DIPA aroma with a lighter IPA flavor and body.  Good stuff.
citrus, floral, orange, golden, minimal head, lightly bitter, medium body, average carbonation,
Pours a hazy amber with an impressive white head that sticks around.  Aroma is pine and grapefruit with maybe a hint of caramel as it warms.  Taste is resiny sweet.  Very smooth.

Mango, pineapple, lemon and honeydew greet the nose along with some earthy and spruce-like notes that offer counterpoint to the dominant fruit and sweetness.  Lightly hazy, golden body is topped by a decent, off white, fine bubbled head that lasts well and leaves some sticky lacing.  Strong fresh fruit flavours up front become a bit muddled with the strong bitterness and malt sweetness.  Medium body is somewhat slick in texture but this is mostly offset by strong carbonation.  Alcohol is not at all apparent.  Tulip glass.  Cellar temperature.  Bottle purchased at Hill Farmstead Brewery in June 2010.

UPDATED: AUG 18, 2011 Bottle. Moderate malt aromas of roasted and caramel, heavy spruce and grapefruit for the hops, light soap for the yeast, with background notes of date, toffee, pepper and solvent. Head is small, wispy white with good lacing and is mostly diminishing. Color is clear light amber. Flavor starts lightly sweet and moderately acidic then finishes lightly acidic and heavily bitter. Palate is on the fuller side of medium, oily with a soft to lively carbonation and a moderately dry finish. The heavy dose of hops combined with the relatively medium palate makes this one easy drinking by high quality IPA.

Had on Cask, Tap, and Bottle 

IMO, Cask tasted the best, this is rated on experience on cask. 
cloudy amber/orange pour
Great aroma of floral citrus, 
soft pleasant to drink.
near perfect balance of hoppiness and floral flavors.

Hands down one of the top 10 IPA¬ís on my list.

UPDATED: MAR 3, 2014 My Bottom Line:
This artful India Pale Ale organizes sandy, citrusy hops and polished honeyed malts into a colourful array of aromas and flavors until a wooden, resinous hop bitterness rises like the dawn upon the back of the palate.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A layer of foam decorates the nearly translucent blond. 
-The softly effervescent mouthfeel works wonderfully with the healthy body. 
-This is very drinkable for 7% abv. 
-The flavour profile is multifaceted and firm while never being boisterous. Just beautiful. 
-Those lemony tips help the impression of quaffability.

Many bottles and on tap at a few places, including their Linda Vista brewery.

Serving: Bottle. 
Pours a very light gold color with a small, foamy, white head.  The nose potent with notes of tropical fruit, cotton candy, and big herbal hops.  Fantastic!  The taste has great malt and hop balance with lots of bittering hops and tropical fruit including notes of mango, pineapple, and papaya.  Medium bodied with average carbonation and a long, bitter finish.  Overall it is one of the best IPAs I¬íve had and is certainly worthy of the high praise.

Bottle, thanks to Doodler! Pours pale orange with red and gold flashes medium off-white head, lovely lacing. Nose is floral, plus honey (malt?), pine, stonefruit, grapefruit; palate is perfectly balanced between bitter and juicy. Notes of juniper, peach, grapefruit, hints of malt, nice dry finish that keeps developing 15 seconds after swallowing. No alcohol presence. Great!

22 oz. bottle.  Pours a slightly hazed gold with a moderate linen white head that lasted through two-thirds of the glass and laced the glass well all the way to the end.  Very pleasant aroma of fresh grapefruit with a few notes of caramel as well.  The flavor is mild caramel followed by a solid dose of grapefruit that, unlike most west coast IPA¬ís, is more fruity with a lesser dose of the bitter pith.  Moderate bitterness at the finish is not overdone or overwhelming.  Very good IPA.
Juicy apricot and tangerine nose. Clear amber, thin head. Apricot and orange peel flavor, finishing with more of a lemon zest character. NIce juiciness and bite. Well made and delicious.
UPDATED: OCT 15, 2010 poured light and golden with a decent head and good lacing smelled and tasted very hoppy crisp and clean

If you¬íre reading this, it¬ís too late, you already know: Ballast Point¬ís Sculpin IPA is really something special.  I had tried it at the brewery in Scripps Ranch, San Diego, CA a couple months ago, and today picked up 22 ouncer at Home Brew Mart.  The two guys who came up with the recipe were actually there at the time.  Poured a golden / light orange color, thick head, with clean lacing.  Wonderful flavors of sweet grapefruit and lemon-doused pine.  The bitter aftertaste is not as harsh as Ballast Point¬ís Big Eye IPA.  Overall, a top-notch West Coast San Diego style IPA.  This beevo is on base!
Golden in color with a thick white head. Very West Coast IPA aroma. Clean, crisp piney hop aroma fills the nose. Touch of sweetness in the flavor followed by a drying, bitter finish.

UPDATED: FEB 12, 2011 Bottle. Poured into a DFH tulip glass a hazed apricot orange color with a fluffy 2 finger head that leaves some clingy lace on the glass. This is a rather fruitful IPA to me with notes of mango, pineapple, and orange along with a citris rind hop bitterness. Starts of subltey sweet with the tropical fruit notes which is then accompanied by a building citris rind bitterness that lingers all well after your drink is finished. Some warming alcohol notes on the back end. Overall, just a wonderful IPA and in my top 5. Medium mouthfeel.

On tap at smokin joes in pittsburgh.  Pine and floral hop aroma.  Nice tart grapefruit taste.  Somehow really well balanced for a brew that tastes like flowers.  Light caramel malts.  Smooth finish.  Great.

On tap at Capone¬ís on 5/29/2010.  Pale yellow, mostly transparent with a bit of head.  Aroma has lots of clean pinecone hops, very similar to PTE, but a bit less dry.  Flavor has lots of pinecone hops, good bitterness, some flowery and herbal character.  A faint vegetal astringency and a touch of sweetness are all that separate it from PTE.  Good carbonation and mouthfeel, hoppy bitterness finishes it nicely.

UPDATED: AUG 27, 2011 On tap at Capone¬ís, consumed as Roy Halladay was pitching his perfect game on the bar TV.  But I was more interested in the IPAs than the IPs and Hs and Ks.   Excellent aroma on this very West Coast IPA.  Dry, herbal, and astringent, with lots of pine.  Sharp, with lime and tropical fruit notes, and the flavor gets richer as it warms a bit.  Sculpin is a remarkably good beer, in what has been an excellent week for rating IPAs.  Rerated upwards in 2011.
Into a wine glass, poured a nice golden color with a thin lace of head.  Different citrus hints off the nose.  Overall a smooth and well balanced IPA.

Wow, very original aroma that¬ís pine needles and skunky (in a good way)!   Beautiful golden copper with billowing, persistent white head with very fine bubbles.   Biting, puckering bitterness with a grass clippings flavor that was evident in the aroma but fully expressed in the taste.  Body is very thin and smooth with the hops dominating but not obliterating the malt backbone.   I love the comparison to the sculpin fish which has a poisonous sting but a sweet and delicious flavor.  Very unique for a West Coast IPA!

Pleasant aroma of citrus, almost floral, hops. Hazy golden appearance with a nice white head. Extremely smooth on the palate with a light bitterness. Medium to full-bodied, very slick, citrus hops dominate the flavor. $10 for 22oz. and worth every penny.

22 ounce bottle split in pint glass.  Bright golden orange with slight chill haze dense head and lace.  Lemony pastry grassy aroma.  Mild peach apricot fruity sweetness with assertive bitter citrus grapefruit mild pine pleasantly lingering finish.  Medium quaffable body.  Nice carbo.  Pretty fresh.  A great beer.  Worthy of the hype.

I¬íve had this beer multiple times in bottle, on cask and draft and am finally getting around to reviewing it.

Pours a dark golden tangerine/orange color with bright golden yellowish orange hues when held to a light source and a large 2.5 finger frothy, soapy white head. Excellent retention, only slowly fading into a thick lasting cap that leaves chunks of soapy lacing in it¬ís wake.

Uber-fresh luscious hop aroma that is bursting with sweet tropical and citrus fruit notes. There is also a slight dry earthy pine/spruce character in the nose along with subtle alcohol sweetness and perfect malt balance. The maltiness is there with some slightly toasty biscuit and graham cracker but the nose on this beer is all about the hops.

Medium bodied but on the lighter end with a slightly chewy hop forward presence that lingers over the subtle malt backbone into a sweet yet dry finish. Again, the flavor of this beer is dominated by insanely fresh delicious hops that give off a slight dry bitterness and a huge tropical/citrus fruit notes. Lots of mango, pineapple, orange and lemon peel and grapefruit. There¬ís also a slightly lactic creaminess that adds to the beer¬ís complexity and makes it incredibly smooth and quaffable. The malt backbone is subtle and slightly toasty with hints of caramel, biscuit and graham cracker. Perfectly balanced with sweet fruit, dry bitter hop and subtle malt flavors bouncing off of each other. I can¬ít say enough about this beer. One of my favorites of all time and highly recommended!

I drank Alpha King for the first time earlier today, and this beer is eerily similar, but to me it is a decent bit inferior in quality.  It starts with a rather boring appearance, a golden color verging slightly into orange territory but with a head that fades quickly and leaves little or no lacing.  The nose is of similar quality to AK, with mango absolutely jumping out and a slight note of pineapple juice acidity.
