Heavy on the grapefruit both on the nose and on the palate. I just happen to like this style. A little low on the suds, not overly carbonated. Amazing to squeeze so much flavor out of a regular 7% IPA. It¬ís tough to compare but with a bigger malt back bone and more hops ypou get into Hopslam territory. One very decent and hard to get brew, but worth the effort.

Bottle shared with Sparky27...THANKS ERIC!!!  Amazingly balanced IPA...24 karat pour with a dense 1-inch ivory head that left a significant amount of lacing.  Ripe grapefruit, orange rind, and lemon zest in the nose.  Fresh and fruity flavor that is bright and exhibits just enough caramel to offset the citrus and pine.  Medium mouthfeel...top-notch in its style.

Bomber with much love to gorditoabd.  Body is a golden orange, while head is about a finger of froth.  Aromas are simply lovely... a nice mix of citrus and tropical fruit:  lemon and mango come to mind, but it seems a little like cheating using descriptors from the description.  I can also pick up a little grapefruit and just a hint of pine in there.  Flavor is simply fantastic!  A lovely mix of the elements from the nose, but even more full than I would have guessed.  This is a fairly interesting IPA in that the fruit flavors seem to be much more tropical and sweet than citrus.  Still, they are well balanced and the malt stays away from the cloying sweetness.  In sum, this is a crisp and very well made IPA.
user_location: The Wet Side of a Dry Town, Pennsylvania, USA

text: 22oz bottle. Pours orange with a foamy white head. Lots of carbonation. Aroma is of oily hops, grapefruit, pine, and caramel. Taste is of very oily hops, lots of citrus, and pine. Has a very nice caramel malt base. Also has big characters of honey and grass. Has a very sharp alcohol bite that lingers long after each sip. Lingering oily hop and honey taste. Mouthfeel is heavily carbonated. Very enjoyable beer, but way too damned oily.

Thanks to Cletus for thiis.  Pours a deep yellow orange with thick off-white head.  Aroma is very refreshing of citrus and ever so slight floral hops, some sweet fruits, and grass.  Flavor matches very well and is quite a nice brew to drink.  Just wish I had this available to me.
22 oz bomber.  Pours a light orange vistalite with a medium white head.  Aroma of floral hops, citrus and light piney resin.  Taste of pine, pine resin, citrus and floral hops.  Very nice IPA.

Bottle courtesy Doboy, shared with my brother.Clear gold with a smalish off white head. Huge grapefruit aroma with lots of pine resin build on a base of toffee and honey. Medium body and carbonation, quite resinous as expected, very dry palate. Fleeting malt sweetness gives way to an assertive bitterness that extends into a lengthy dry finish. This is one big, bad IPA.

Bottle from Turdferguson.  Pours an orange color with a thick frothy off-white head.  Heavy lacing.  Citrusy hoppy aroma escapes as soon as the bottle is cracked with a lot of grapefruit and a lesser pine scent.  Citrusy, grapefruit, orange, lemon, this pretty much tastes like you think it should after smelling it although perhaps not quite as sharp as the aroma indicates.  Probably because it¬ís so easy to drink and refreshing without huge bitterness.  A very good IPA.  Thanks Sam!

22 oz bottle

I only let this sit for a week before I could resist the urge to open it.  West Coast IPAs seem to lose something even when chilled and I wanted the best experience possible.  I don¬ít know how much this costs in California but if it were regularly accessible I may just buy it on a semi-regular basis.

Aroma / Appearance - The transparent golden body and stark white head formed a picturesque decoration on the coffee table.  Bright and grassy, the nose was fruity with the main aspect being canned mandarin oranges.

Flavor / Palate - The hoppy bite grabs you from the first sip and is consistent throughout.  A mixture of grass, pine needles, flower petals, and citrus it sits nicely on the tongue.  Despite being 7% ABV this was not tough to polish off as spring transitioned to summer.

UPDATED: FEB 6, 2011 pours a deep yellow. very citrus nose with some pine and floral hops mixed in, sweet caramel. Perfect balance of citrus, pine, mild fruit and caramel sweetness. Finished dry with some fruit tones. One of the best IPAs out there.

Bottle courtesy of tpd975. Pours a golden yellow color with thin white head. Aroma is sweet and floral with notes of apricots, citrus, caramel, honey, grapefruit, pine. Flavor is sweet and floral with notes of citrus, sweet caramel, apricots, fresh fruit, some hints of honey and pine. Generally medium body with a pleasing hoppy finish.

This poured a cloudy light orange color with a pretty big white head. Aroma was just freaking awesome, lots of citrus hops, some piney notes as well. Just fresh hops. Flavor was much the same, very pungant fruity hops, some peach notes, pine at the end, and then a rather dry distinguished finish. I wish I had more of this stuff!

22oz Bottle. Noses with a lemony Simcoe heavy aroma. Catty. Pours a very clear pale yellow, with a foamy whitish. Flavor is sticky, fruity, juicy and fresh. A fresh, piney snap of fresh foam filling out the balance. This is classic and juicy. Dry finish. A prototypical West Coast sticky IPA.

UPDATED: JUL 24, 2009 courtesy of tpd975.
pours golden, white head.
Aroma and taste, hoppy, citrus with notes of pineapple, some floral hops.
Not my fav IPA style, too much hops bitterness up front, still highly drinkable.
re-rate, lots of hops, grapefruits, with nice malt balance but still with hops giving the beer a nice warmingpalate.

UPDATED: DEC 22, 2010 Thanks IBrew2or3 for the share.  Pours clear yellow with a white head.  Nose is grapefruit, orange, some pine, and a bit of a caramel backbone.  Flavor is similar with lots of caramel and grapefruit, all manner of citrus and a plethora of other citrus goodness: apricot, peach, and kumquat.  Flavor finishes off with lingering citrus hop bite.  Unique, yet balanced and goes great with a sharp cheddar.  As Admiral Akbar says, [your taste buds] "cannot repel firepower of this magnitude."

22 oz bomber acquired via trade. Poured out a nice orange tinted amber with a finger and a half off white head. Solid aroma of grapefruit, pineapple, orange and light pine. Flavor much the same with a little bit of caramel malt to balance it out. This one was a few months old and still damn tasty, I need to get my hands on a bottle when it¬ís fresh!

Orange-amber pour with a two-fingered, frothy white head.  Very sticky lace.  Awesome hops blast up front with fresh squeezed grapefruit and pine juice.  Flavors of lemon pith, ruby red grapefruit, pineapple and pine resin.  A good portion of caramel malt for a complimentary backbone.   Good body, nice balance with a strong, lingering, bitter finish.  This brews most significant feature is its freshness.  Not bad at all.

UPDATED: SEP 30, 2009 Thanks to JCB for giving me a bottle from North Carolina. Clear amber with a medium head. Aroma of pineapple, grapefruit, papaya and  oranges. I know a lot of IPA¬ís are fruity, but this kicks it up two notches. It¬ís a veritable fruit salad in a glass! My wife agrees (that it smells of fruit), and usually she doesn¬ít like hoppy beers. Lite tasting malt and dry. Dry, fruity finish. OMG. I¬íve gotta try this on tap!

Bottled. A hazy amber beer with a lazing beige head. The aroma is sweet with strong notes of hops and medium notes of elderberries and grapefruits. The flavor is sweet with strong notes of caramel, as well as medium notes of malt, grapefruit, and elderberries, leading to a dry and bitter finish. Thanks Papsoe for sharing.

2009 Bottle - Thanks Snojerk321! - Poues dk yellow with a medium white head...aroma is massive citrus, little malt...flavour is similar, I was looking for more malt, but had to remind myself this was not an IIPA, great bitterness that lingers just the right length, good alcohol...very nice!

This stuff is chocked full of grapefruit; grapefruit until the cows come home.  Surprisingly light on the palate for all of it¬ís flavor, but it doesn¬ít suffer any for it.  On the contrary: it keeps it from getting syrupy.  Superb.

UPDATED: SEP 6, 2010 On tap at the Thirsty Monk. Pours slightly hazy gold with a great foamy white head. This is certainly hoppy. It is a predictable but welcome delivery of citrusy hops. This one brought Avery¬ís IPA to mind, just a little more balanced and a bit lighter on the palate. This is refreshing for the style with plenty of grapefruit and juicier citrus flavor. Malts are just sweet enough and not too thick. I¬íd drink this on a regular basis if I could. 

[September 2, 2010]

On tap at Smoky Oak. Y¬íknow, when I originally had this beer I enjoyed it very, very much but was surprised to see it in the top 10 IPA¬ís. I didn¬ít think it was quite on that level. I have changed my opinion after enjoying a delicious pint of it again. The nose is powerfully hoppy with cutting hints at grapefruit and herbs. Hops are everywhere in the flavor too with a vast, bitter and herbal attack. It combines what I like about Two Hearted with Sweetwater IPA.
Slight hazy gold pour.  Thick off white head a thick drippy lace.  Piney aroma.  Light citrus notes, grapefruit and pine.  Big malty backbone which is perfectly balanced

Pours gold into a shaker. Off-white head with excellent retention craters and recedes leaving sheet lacing.  Summer fruit, resin and pine aromas. Crisp and well balanced with apricot and resin from front to back. Dry lasting grapefruit finish.

Let me just say, I don¬ít know how this is rated any less than pliny.  It¬ís hard to tell the difference.  Pours a clear golden with a white head that turns a little rocky. A solid IPA, just the right amount of alcohol, pine, resin, and grapefruit.
Very piney scent but not an overpowering piney taste well balanced. Nice frothy feel a and nice bitter finish. Not the best but its a great single.
Aroma reminsicent of pine and grapefruit. Pine flavor from the hops comes through very balanced. This beer has everything you love about piney hops.

bottle.
Pours a crystal clear light amber color, small half inch of bubbly white head that clears quickly.  Bright sharp hop nose of lemons, apricots, and some sticky resinous notes.  Nose also shows some heavy bitterness and some light toasted notes.  Aroma shows plenty of that sharp citric bitterness from the nose; grapefruit, lemons, and other sharp fruit notes.  Light malt backbone of toasted biscuits and caramel.  Flavors blend decently, but lack the depth or uniqueness of many other IPAs.  Palate is full and creamy, with a light bitter finish.  Certainly a good IPA, but nothing especially incredible.

22 oz. bottle from South Bay Drugs.  Pale orange in color with a white head.  Aroma of grapefruit and fresh cut grass.  Surprisingly understated in comparison to their Big Eye IPA.  In fact, dare I say, more balanced.  Flavors I detect are lemon, pine, and apricot.  Dangerously drinkable.  I still like the Big Eye IPA better but this is another fantastic beer from Ballast Point.

Bottle from Snojerk321 (Thanks!)  Pour was orange pour, medium carbonation and plenty of sweet citrus on the nose.  Flavor was mellow orange citrus, pine hops, some grapefruit and apricot.  Very mellow and well balanced for being 7% ABV.  A well done IPA, although I generally like mine a little more bitter.

22oz. Bottle:  Aroma of hops, hop juice, pine, tropical fruit, grapefruit, resin, citrus, and tangerine.  Poured amber/orange in color with a medium-sized white head that diminished but lasted throughout.  Clear.  Slightly sparkling.  Good lacing.  Light to medium sweet, heavily bitter flavor.  Tastes of hops, pine, caramel, hop juice, pale malts, and tangerine.  Medium body.  Sticky, dry texture.  Average carbonation.  Bitter, hoppy, dry finish.  One of the more bitter beers I have had of late.
Pours a golden color with a fairly nice white head. Big peachy and citrusy nose. Super hoppy flavor with more the aforementioned peach and a piney finish. A solid example of an American IPA.

UPDATED: AUG 10, 2009 Bomber poured into a very clean snifter, slightly chilled.  Slightly tarnished brass color with streams of healthy bubbles and a casual white cap.  Very tropical nose, maybe I hould have an umbrella?  Mango, passion fruit, and tangello juice dominate the stage as a sweet grain peeks out from behind the curtain. Palate actually begins dry and bitter, like the skin of stone fruit.  The teeth continue to drive into the meat  and hop flavor resonates. The grain seems to well up from a terra haut of lush malt and adds an incredible balance to what looks like a hop bomb.  This beer drips the sweet smells and warmth of a brewery with refreshments at the end of the tour.  A round hop lingers in room but doesn¬ít f%&k with the thermostat.  As good as they come. 

Re-rate, 8-10.  The numbers stay the same.  I will say that the nose has turned the volume down with a few months in the bottle. No worries, this is still an intense experience.  Last time I was obviously overwhelmed by the nose and entry.  The palate is very interesting.  This IPA finishes with some subtlety.  Carbonation finishes smooth and the hops linger like a recessing tide.  Very clean, with just the spice elements of the hops lingering.  Interesting.  This must be a seriously dry hopped beer.
Strong citrus bitter hop nose. Gold amber, with a small head and great lacing. A little syrupy. Tart acidity undertones

Bottle from Bri @ Holiday Wine Cellar.. Pours a light golden color with a fluffy white head...Alot of citrus hops in the nose. This one has a really great smell..The flavor from begining to the end is all hops. That being said it is not as harsh as other IPAs that I¬íve had. It has a nice citrus sweetness that is very easy to drink..This one will bring out the hophead in all of us.
Bottle shared by emacgee. Thanks Ethan!  Man, this was tasty.  Very fresh, tropical fruits, citrus abound the nose.  Flavor is nicely balanced between juice and dry bitterness. Very enjoyable IPA.

22oz bottle from Hillcrest Whole Foods (San Diego, CA).  Pours a little paler than most San Diego IPA¬ís, a light golden amber with large carbonation bubbles clinging to the side of the glass.  About one finger of white head.  The wonderful hoppy aroma is less citrusy than many others in this style but still fruity -- I do get the mango, apricot, and peach in there as the label promises.  Tastes hoppy and bitter with pine and grapefruit but the bitterness finds a very pleasant level.  There is a definite hint of some fruity sweetness in here as well.  Lighter body than most others in this style; good carbonation.

Bottle.  Pours a clear medium gold with a fluffy lil¬í head.  Nose is dank pine forest, and something reminiscent of juniper berries.  Flavor is a gloriuos expression of west coast hops.  Citrus rind and pine forest.  Maybe a bit on the bold side for a single IPA, but a really good one at that.

22oz bottle courtesy of a trade with KingG, thanks! I always take a sniff off the bottle before pouring and this smells great! The color is a dark, but transparent, yellow and the head is full, sticky and firm. The aroma is pure West Coast IPA, piney, fruity, citrus, very nice. The flavor is a very green, almost vegetal hop flavor. There are also melon-rind notes which remind me of the Dorado DIPA. It does not quite live up to the aroma but it is still tasty. The mouthfeel is decent and the drinkability is good. Overall, this is a good West Coast IPA but I prefer the Big Eye from Ballast Point.

update 12/30/08 most recent batch

This is a very good IPA. I don¬ít really taste the vegetal I got last time, just fruity, dank IPA. This is much better than Dorado or Big Eye. Friends said it was like Green Flash westcoast meets odell IPA. Awesome.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 03-20-2008 03:13:20

Most delicious new IPA I¬íve had in years.

Color is a bright golden hue, transparent, with a slight tinge of orange.  Head is white and frothy rich, thick, meringue-like and jiggles when nudged.  Head recedes to a thinner, but long lasting lace and Belgian lace surrounds the inside of my glass as this one goes down.

Nose is full of bright citrus and citrusy black tea aromas.  I¬ím leaning towards tangerine and peaches with that black tea component, and a slight suggestion of biscuits.

Sharp on the palate right away, but not an overwhelming in your face hop presence.  It¬ís big but not an assault like some APA¬ís can offer.  The bright citrus comes through and again some of the black tea qualities.  Faint biscuity malt is in there, and it has a smooth creamy mouthfeel.  I pick up some lemon towards the end.

UPDATED: OCT 27, 2009 Aroma is very fruity, hawaii tropical fruits, coconut, mango, papaya, peach. Taste is sweet and juicy hops. Fruity and smooth. Very nice, no lingering bad flavors and nice too drink. Re-rate. gotta up this a bit. From 4 to 4.2 Just awesome, especially fresh!
22 oz bomber. Pours a light amber with small off white head.  nice floral aroma grapefruit , peach. Mouthful is citrus, oily .This is a medium bodied solid ipa. very drinkable.

Draught at Najas Place.  Pours clear yellow with an average, white head, mostly lasting with good lacing.  Aroma is heavy malt (grain, meal, cereal), heavy hop (perfume, pine, spruce, citrus), average yeast (sweat) with notes of pear, apple, and peach.  Medium bodied, sticky texture, lively carbonation, and a bitter finish.  Long duration, light sweetness, heavy acidity and bitterness.

Thanks a ton smokepot23. Pours a very pale translucent honey gold with a thin offwhite head. Looks great. The nose is very citrusy and tropical, lemon peel, mango, some piny/spicy hops, resinous. Flavor is very fruity and citrusy, sweet resinous hops, mango, mandarin orange, nice dry bitterness. Dry bitter palate. Very tasty.
Pours out a clear orangeish gold with lots of head. Taste is creamy and hoppy. Lots of spicy hops. Great IPA with, some sweetness and lots of pine. Had last year, best IPA.

I have had this many times this year and again last night. Aromas of pine, citrus, apricots and hops. Flavors of the same including a little pepper and spice. Very nice for a IPA and I look forward to future releases.

22 oz bomber from padrefan98, thanks Jon. Wow this is simply an IPA and not a double, very impressive. Pours a golden orange with an average size bright white foamy head. Aroma is cat piss, grassy hops, citrus and call me nutts but my first impression was also some peanut butter. Body is prefect, medium bodied, medium to slightly strong carbonation with a bitter finish. Flavor is citrus, fresh cut grass, slight pine, biscuit. This one is a big hop bomb for a straight up IPA, not for the nonhop hearted.

Bottle thanks to WeeHeavySD . Thanks man!  Clear, clean golden pour with thick, sticky white head. Nice, strong hoppy aroma. Hops absolutely dominate this ones flavor. Mouthfeel is nice and makes the beer extremely drinkable. Absolutely loved it.

Bottle. Aroma of bitter and grassy hops . Flavor nearly entirely straight bitter hops for me, just a touch of grass, and if I press myself really hard, a slight hint of mango. Certainly highly drinkable, up there with Pliny in that regard, which I¬íd bet is why it¬ís rated so high, but I¬íd like more character from the hops.

UPDATED: APR 22, 2009 Bottle thanks to WeeHeavySD.  Pours a clear yellow with a small white head.  Aroma of grassy and garlicky hops.  Flavor of bitter grapefruit and garlicky hops with a touch of citrusy sweetness and fruity hops in the finish.  Certainly hop dominated.  The hop profile is not my favorite, but this is a damn good IPA and extremely drinkable too.  
8/4/8/5/15 (4.0/5)

Bottle thanks to WeeHeavySD.  Pours a hazy amber with a white head.  Citrus and pine hops dominate the aroma and flavor.  Some nice malt balance, some resin in the flavor.  Good stuff, glad to finally try it.

L: Barely off white frothy thick head. Crystal clear bright light amber color. Tight tiny bubbles dance up the glass.
S:The glass is over a foot away from my nose and I can still smell those stinky delicious hops. Freshly cut spicey gass is the first thing. A slight sweet candied apricot floats in.
T: That fresh cut spicy grass is the first sip. A weedy grassyness even. It continues to bombard you with those hops. A caramle sweetness meshes with a grainy bredyness. A touch of pepper.
M:Tiny little bubbles flick the tongue. Yes it still feels fat and round.
D:Frickin great. The balance of this beer is amazing, yet the grassy hops are so pungent. Everything just gives way to each other for a beautiful beer.

22 ounce bottle shared by cdumler. Thanks! Pours a clear medium amber color with a thin head. Good head retention and lacing. Big resiny hop aroma with some mild tropical and citrus fruit notes. Taste is very heavy hops.... pine, earth, vegetal and a little metal. Slight citrusy fruit and caramel notes. Medium bodied.

bottle via trade w/ snojerk321, great golden glow with medium loose foam, aromas of musky hops, grapefruit, some spice, flavors of resin, corn syrup, citrus and really nice bitter finish, thanks Torry

Bomber thanks to Doubleo. Pours clear golden orange with foamy white head. Aroma is real nice with tons of citrus, mangos, orange, grapefruit, tons of hops and some malt. Flavor is bitter hops, citrus, some pine and malt. Nice thick mouthfeel. Finsihes bitter but has nice malt backbone that brings balance to brew.  Great IPA.

Excellent IPA. Pours a deep orange/red with a thin, bone white head. Aroma is amazing, wet and juicy oranges, pineapples, mangoes, grapefruit, cream, and Bubble-Yum. Flavor is a nice mix of the juicy oranges and pinecones, with a hint of floral hops as well. Some acidic grapefruit as well, and just a touch of lemon. A bit thin on the palate, which is the only real knock. Otherwise, a great IPA.

Bomber, thanks to WeeHeavySD for this one.  Pours a light orange color with a nice foamy head, I could smell the citrusy hops the moment I cracked the cap, but it smells like a grapefruit in the glass.  The taste is a little bit more subtle than I expected, not as much bitterness, just a LOT of hop flavor and aroma.  A tasty brew.  Thanks Jon!

Thanks to toncatcher!

A solid IPA but really doesn¬ít quite warrant its reputation.  Great, not excellent.

Pours a crystal clear light orange with a thin white head.  The nose is an all out assault of juicy tangerine and bubble gum.  The flavor doesn¬ít live up to the expectations set my the aroma, but still its very good with some piny and citrus hops.  Medium body and super easy to drink.  Thanks for sharing Josh.

Thanks to snojerk321 for the bottle!Peach-orange color, large fluffy yellowish-white head gone quickly. Nose is quite bitter but contains a lot of fruit sweetness, great stuff in orange, citrus, and cantaloupe. Flavor is downright bitter, just really hardcore stuff There¬ís a little sweet malt to ease it off and some hints of peach and orange, but the bitterness is direct and bold, through the long finish. Well carbonated and zesty, also a little salty. Very nice IPA, would session with pleasure.

Bomber via trade with stefanje. Pours a very pretty coppery-gold with dissipating head. Crystal clear. Nose is apricots, catty, pine resin and some citrus, quite lovely and bright. I¬íd guess amarillo and simcoe, but you never know anymore. Taste is pretty similar, quenching bitterness and not nearly as overpowering as most have made it seem. Distinct catty flavor and resiny, mostly pine with a little bit of fruit character as well. To finish, there¬ís a big bready backbone to hold it all together. Damn well structured. Tasty.

Poured a clear effervescent amber with a fizzy/frothy white head.  Aroma of grapefruit and orange, some pine, some soap, a slight touch of candy sweetness.  Flavor is quite bitter with strong notes of grapefruit rind, earthy and bitter pine, a slight touch of soapiness, leading to a very dry bitter finish.  No metallic tinge to the bitterness, which is nice.  Overall a very bitter IPA witih sufficient complexity and almost no sweetness which maintains a pleasant refreshing character.  A major notch in the column of those who do not care for sweet or more ¬ìbalanced ¬ì  IPA¬ís.

Colour... pours a medium amber. The nose... OH MY! WHAT A NOSE!! Take the me down the hop-a-dise city, where the hops are green and ale is pretty!!  
The palate... Indian River grapefruit, impetuously hoppy bite runs amuck over the entire palate, piney, resinous, dangerously quaffable, quite a fetching IPA!
22oz bottle. Golden pour with a pretty nice white head. Nice piney aroma. A bit of sweetness up front, with a good light hop bite in the end. Pretty decent brew.
user_location: Redlands, by way of Wisconsin,, California, USA

text: Bottle shared by some of the excellent people at the Rosso release at Captain Lawrence. Pours a hazy brown amber with a soft off white head.  Aroma is piled high with pineapple.  Reminds me of the Green Flash imperial in that regard.  Lots of citrus and pine notes as well.  Body is light and a little bit thin, and not as complex as the aromas lead me to believe.  Finishes well with a deep grapefruit bitter.  If the middle of this was a little fuller I¬íd probably be in love.

Poured from a 22oz bomber (thanks Torry) and served in a shaker.  This poured a lightly hazed amber with a foamy, beige cap that left some decent lace.  The aroma consisted of strong apricot, peach, and orange.  Also some pine needles.  The flavor had a big hop profile, but there was also a nice toffee element.  Piney and citrusy with a stiff bitterness.  The mouthfeel was medium-bodied and slightly sticky.  This was an insanely quaffable brew.  The alcohol was well hidden but packed a good punch.  A really nice IPA.

Bomber in trade with Stefanje.  Nose is rich and has peaches, passionfruit, and heaps of pine sap.  Body is on the light side of medium.  Floral rounded hop infused malt balances easily on ones tounge.  Hops are not omnipresent but certainly not wallflowers. A sweet even bosy and finish that blend into one another s well that the finish is nearly undetectable other than the lack of beer in your mouth.  Very nice.

Maybe the best IPA iv¬íe ever had, although it feels more like a double.   All the citrus you could possibly want, almost as Hopslam and Nugget Nectar had a baby.  

A truly fantastic beer.

UPDATED: MAY 8, 2009 bomber from south bay drugs poured into a pint glass. pours a very clean and clear golden color with a very thin white head and slight lacing. aroma was extremely fresh and clean. the nose drifted out of the glass immidiately with huge, gorgeous fruit notes of apricot, pear, peach, and grapefruit along with a fresh, floral, piney hoppiness and a touch of sweetness. flavor was outstanding and very unique. started off with a slightly spicy hop kick followed by big citrus notes of grapefruit and orange and some sweeter tropical fruit notes of pineapple and apricot. the finish had a wonderful piney and almost minty/herbal quality that i¬íve not tasted in an IPA before. great bitterness but also very well balanced with light, roasted malt flavors. palate was medium bodied and extremely clean and smooth. amazing drinkability with a great long lasting, bitter finish. one of the best IPAs i¬íve tasted and damn am i glad i had the chance to have this one.

Big for a straight IPA. Thanks to snojerk for sending another fine CA brew. Clear dark yellow color. Grassy citrus hop aroma. Mostly grapefruit hop flavor with a bit of green apple hiding in the back ground. Finish is a bitter metallic but pleasant. Running the gamut of hoppy goodness here.

UPDATED: JAN 4, 2014 Bomber shared by Eric, thanks again man. Pours a clear golden color with a small white head. The aroma is full of citrus hops, some lemon and grapefruit. The taste was also full of hoppy goodness; citrus flavors, some herbal goodness. This bottle was a few years old and had lost some of the aggressive hops perhaps, but is was very nice and insanely quaffable.  Re-rate: fresh. Super citrus and resiny flavors. Low bitterness. Very drinkable. Awesome IPA. Ahead of its time.

Scored this via trade and drank is almost side by side with Pliny the Elder.  This beat out Pliny overall.  Bomber pours a clear orange with a white, creamy head.  Nose wasn¬ít nearly as nice as Pliny but still very appealing with tropical fruits, mango, citrus fruits, a touch of grapefruit and a sprinkling of sweet malt.  Flavor is where Sculpin separated from Pliny, tons of sweet, sticky fruits of all shapes and sizes, sweet malts, but mostly a fruit explosion.  Finish is bitter, but also clean and crisp.  Really well crafted and a beer you could drink every day.

22oz. bomber, with a big thank you to stefanje!  Pours a clear golden orange with a creamy one finger white head, good retention and lacing.  Aroma is very nice, with island fruits, floral, citrus, pine, and light caramel.  Flavor is more of the same, with a milder but enjoyable hops bite that lingers a bit.  I have been looking forward to trying this one for a long time, and it lived up to expectations quite nicely.  It¬ís right up there with some of the best IPA¬ís the West Coast has to offer.  Thanks again Stefan!

Orange colored with little white head. Rich aroma, WOA. Flowers, apricot, peach, pine, excellent hoppy note. Medium bodied. Flavor is more bitterly hopped with still flowers dominating in start, same apricot here too. Aftertaste lasts with this piney palate. Well, what can you say, definitely US brew, which we never get too much here in North Europe.
22oz. thanks to Dunk. I think I actually drank this one right out of the bottle. Flavor was citrus, piney, and sweet malt. Nice body and easily one of the best drinking IPA¬ís out there.
user_location: back in NJ!, New Jersey, USA

text:
Thanks to SWolf3 for this one!
Pours with a clear gold body under a tall, long-lasting white head.
This has a marvelous grapefruit and pine aroma.  The malts are there too.
Sweet grapefruit that quickly moves into a smooth hop bitterness that lasts into the long finish.
Great IPA!

Thanks to Shane (I think)! Pours a crystal clear gold/orange with spacious head. Citrus hop aroma is heavenly. Taste is wonderful hops with thin malt backing. Absolutely screams hop flavor without being overly bitter. Could possibly use a bit more malt presence, but I shouldn¬ít press my luck. This is up there w/ the best of the best for me.

APPEARANCE: 
Pours a clear gold color with a medium white head that dissipates at an average rate. Very long lasting lacing.
SMELL: 
Sweet citrus (grapefruit) and pine. Hint of apricot.
TASTE: 
Caramel with pine and citrus. Finish is hoppy but not overpowering.
MOUTHFEEL:
Medium to full bodied beer with a sticky texture. Fizzy carbonation.
DRINKABILITY: 
This is a great tasting beer. Nice balance of sweet and bitter.

Excellent IPA.  Pours a golden amber with sticky off-white head.  Clean and floral with herbal notes.  Grapefruit, pine, and some bready malt and caramel to balance it out.  Really well done and easy to drink.

22 oz. bottle.  Pours a slightly hazy dark golden color with a smaller off white head.  The aroma is fresh, clean citrus, pine, floral, and herbal with enough malt to add depth.  The flavor has a base of bread with maple syrup surrounded by a bounty of citrus, pine, grapefruit, and herbal hops.  There is a nice balance to this.  The bitterness lasts for some time.  Very drinkable, medium bodied.

1/7/09 notes: bomber, shared with Derek.  Pours yellow-orange with a medium white head.  Aroma features prominent notes of apricot, tart grapefruit, lime.  Flavor is bold, emphasizing herbs and tangy citrus (especially grapefruit).  Palate stays buttery throughout, with a smooth finish. Reminiscent of eating delicate lotus flowers.  This is an amazing IPA.

Bottle.  Thanks to alexanderj.  Nice light orange pour, clear, some white head.  Aroma is very citrusy, pinecones, orange rind.  The flavor is similar, good bitterness, lots of citrus rind, and full malty sweetness present as well.

Pours a translucent golden amber with a medium frothy off white head that left lacing. Aroma of fresh citrusy hops, tons of orange, pine, grapefruit, pineapple, dough and light caramel.  Love the orange coming across...so fresh and hoppy!  Flavor of grapefruit, pine needles, loads of hop bitterness and flavor.  Just a touch of some malt to balance.

Bottle from South Bay Drug. Sort of a bright copper color with a decent off-white head. Mixed aromas of grapefruit and tropical fruits. Near medium body with medium carbonation. Flavor is sort of grapefruit mango over lightly roasted caramel. Bit of a bitter hop burn in the finish. Astringent too. This is a really super drink.

Reviewed 12/28/2008 (bottle):

Pours a clear golden amber colored body. Big foamy white head, rocky with good lacing. Bubbly. Very piney citrusy aroma, grapefruit. Dry smelling. Watery body, malty taste, some nuttiness. Dry grapefruit aftertaste. Carbonated and drying aftertaste. More hoppy and bitter with only some balancing nutty sweetness. More balanced as it warms up.

Bottle. Pours light golden color with one finger white head.  There is an immediate nose of pine needles and lemon rinds.  The mouthfeel is light but compliments the hoppy characters very well.  The malts form the perfect canvas for the palate to fully appreciate the hop complexity.  There is a light sugary-sweetness that finishes this drink off.  Great IPA

Pours with a frothy, two finger thick, pale, tan tinged, off-white colored head.  The beer is a clear amber color that shows a brilliantly clear, bright copper hue when held up to the light.  The aroma certainly hits the spot for any hop lover with a melange of herbaceous, spicy, fruity, citrusy and yes even dank hop character.  Malt, I don‚Äôt know much about that, though I am sure there might be a hint in the aroma some where, right now I am focusing on the hop aromatics that the malt character is supporting.  Vibrant lychee, ripe tangelo peal and bitter grapefruit oil round out the fruity hop aromatics, but in the deep draughts of the aroma it is the herbal hop components that reign.  There are turpene rich hop notes, a slight grassy edge, perhaps a hint of chive, but what really jumps out is the essential "hemp" oil components; sticky, dank, resinous, slightly rosemary like, touches of pine tar and a spiciness that almost make my nose itch.  Definitely a hop heads beer by the nose.

Lightly sweet up front and then a bracing, richly herbal, bitterness grabs hold of the tongue; this never recedes either as the bitterness lingers on in the palate after the beer has left my mouth.  The hop flavors have a fruity, almost oily character that is sensed as a backdrop to the other flavors; tropical fruit, lychee and bitter orange peel.  The flavor profile is dominated though by the herbal hop components.  Pepper, amply spicy, a touch of sharp rosemary, green turpenes and of course it has a biting, dank, "hemp" oil green flavor to it that lingers on with the bitterness in the finish.  This is definitely an aggressively hoppy beer, this can be nice, but somehow this beer seems a bit too one-dimensional, even for a overly hoppy IPA.  There is a soft supporting malt character that brings a hint of sweetness as well as a touch of cracker light malt to the flavor, it also supplies a medium‚Äôish body to this brew.

A bit too herbal focused to be great for me; I prefer a nice balance of tropical fruit notes as well as the sticky herbal hop character (the aroma is a bit more balanced than the flavor, though still not quite enough).  Still this certainly has appeased my hop fix for the evening.

Purchased: South Bay Drugs, Imperial Beach CA

Bottle. Pours a clear golden hue with a thin white head. Fair amount of lacing.  Nose is full of intense floral hops. Fruits of apricot, lemon peel, and mango. Wonderful smell. Great flavors. Tons of hops. Starts sweet and turns more bitter. Pine resins strong, lemon peel, apricot, grapefruit, peach, and a slight vanilla note.  Medium bodied, spicy bitter aftertaste. Excellent IPA, one of the best I‚Äôve had!

On Draft @ Barley & Hops Tavern. Pours golden with  creamy white head. Strong aroma of hops and tropical fruits. Flavor is mainly C hops with nice malt balance. Combination of hop flavor w/ hop/fruity aroma is amazing. Very drinkable. Love this beer!

UPDATED: AUG 18, 2009 22 oz. bottle shared with DuffmanSW while brewing a Centennial single-hop IPA.  Pours a clear bronze/copper with low carbonation and a small off-white head with decent lacing.  Light bready malt aroma with an abundance of citrusy/pine hops typical of the west coast style.  Initial flavor mimics the aroma, light maltiness with lingering bitter/dry hop finish.  Light to medium palate with a smooth texture and soft carbonation.  From beginning to end, it¬ís really all about the hops.
tasty excellent IPA. Orange appearance with white head. Grapefruit aroma, very nice.Very smooth, very drinkable. Great resiny hop. One of the best IPAs I ever had, and the bottle picture is cute too.

UPDATED: MAY 30, 2009 Style; glass: IPA; tulip
22 fl oz x 7% ABV = 154 / 60 = 2.56 beers * 150 C = 384 calories (est.)
Purchased at: Craft Beer Outlet, Phila, PA for $11.99

Aroma: nice, calming, beach, field, grassy, salty, citrus.

Visuals: brand focused packaging, a bright engaged yellow, brilliantly clear, bright white tight bubbled head, sticky lace.

Taste: expertly balanced, honey, citrus, rind, peppers.

Palate: Bright, crisp, and layered, drying, increasingly bitter long finish.

Overall: Fantastic. In my top 3 IPAs, certainly. A favorite. 

From a firkin. Oh boy. This knocked me over at the Bella Vista Grand reopening in October in Philadelphia. Those 2 oz samples were like little tiny bricks sealing me in to a personal twiddly state. It was amazing, memorable, and significant. After about the third small sample, the world was a blur. Use with caution, and enjoy. If you can get it, suckas.

Cask at Bella Vista Grand Opening: pours a golden amber with a thin white head, aroma is full of citrus and hops (amazing aroma), taste is hoppy with some citrus, very easy to drink.  This is a very nice IPA, I had assumed it was a DIPA,

Pours a very clear gold in color with only a ring of froth. Smell is very piney hops. Taste is very green, brutally bitter hops. This is very fresh and very green. Very bittering and tongue ripping. This is a aggressive and brutal onslaught on your palate. The bottle is incredible, I could only imagine how this is on draft. Wow.
Bottle Shared with GMCC2181, thanks Gabe. Aroma was pine, citrus and hops. Color was a nice bright light orange with nice head. Taste was pine, floral, and grassy. A nice easy to drink smooth IPA.

UPDATED: SEP 21, 2010 Bottle from spark-dog! Thanks E! Nice aroma, very piney, plus mango and citrus hops. Color was a light orange, decent head. Taste was different from most IPA¬ís. Light in texture. Nice mango bitter hop balance. Not over bitter at all... More like a strong pale ale....????  Overall pretty sweet taste, but holds the classic IPA characteristics. Very easy to drink, for sure one of the better IPA¬ís out there. I like the light texture and drinking it on the warmer side ~55 degrees. Thanks Eric!***Update*** Just purchased a "fresh 2010" bottle from pinochios in PA... Great west coast IPA... Fruity...juicy....hoppy....but well balanced...  Great beer!

Bottle thanks to doubleo.  Pours fairly clear copper with frothy white.  Huge pine/citrus nose.  Flavor is all pine with back notes of grapefruit.  Nice bit of sweetness that tries to round it out, but who cares, this a well made hopped up IPA!

Bottle shared by alexsdad06. Poured hazy copper color with an average frothy white head that lasted with good lacing. Medium body with a slick texture. Moderate to heavy sour citrus hoppy aroma. Moderate to heavy bittersweet flavor with a moderate to heavy  bittersweet finish of moderate to long duration.   Standout brew.

Pours a crystal clear, light orange gold hue, moderate layer of dense white foam sustains, light lacing.

Aroma is piney resin, citrus zest, light fruits, bubblegum, a touch of underlying malt crispness, touch of alcohol.

Taste is pine resin hops with a touch of florals and grass, sweet fruits and lemon/grapefruit acidity soon jump into the profile, some toasty malt enters midway, finishes dry and bitter.

Palate is medium, thick and chewy texture doesn‚Äôt stay too long, moderate high carbonation.

Overall a well-built IPA, the fruit and citrus provide a unique taste and the clean malt sweetness balances out the hop bitterness, a nice refreshing treat with subdued alcohol flavor.

UPDATED: OCT 5, 2008 Bomber courtesy of DarkElf.  Pours a crystal clear gold with one finger white head and spotty lacing.  Nose is very fruity with ripe oranges and pink grapefruit.  Taste is caramel, apricots, orange peel and a resiny pine finish.  Medium mouth feel.  This is a full flavor IPA and I¬ím glad I got a chance to try it this fresh.  Thanks Stephen again for the hook-up!

Bottle; picked up yesterday.  Poured a rich gold; carbonation streams; lacing; compact, medium sized white head.  Huge, pungent aroma; grapefruit, melonand citrus, with some pine,, toffee and buttered bread.  Great aroma.  Had a sample on cask yesterday, but I definitely like it from the bottle today better.  Powerful hop presence, as expected.  Sweet caramel beginning that gives way to grapefruit and pine.  Some buttery, biscuit in the middle.  Very nice balance and just an overall really good beer.  Up there with the best of the style.
Hazy golden with tiny white head. Sweet and hoppy aroma with caramel notes. Sweet flavor with loads of hops, grapefruit, pine and caramel notes.
Hazy golden colour with a white head. Hoppy, piney and light fruity aroma with malty sweet notes. Very hoppy, piney bitter flavor with fruity notes.

Bottle 66cl. @ Amerikaner blindsmagning @ Papsoe, Bottle #27.]Light unclear medium orange color with a average, frothy, good lancing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate to light heavy malty, caramel, moderate to heavy hoppy, pine, orange, fruity - tropic ala peach - mango - lemon. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a long to average duration. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. (190608)

UPDATED: MAR 2, 2011 Bottle on 12/11/2010 courtesy of BrewEngineer. Clear golden amber body with a small frothy white head. Big citrus and resiny hop aroma. Big citrus and resiny hop flavor on a light malt background. Medium body with moderate carbonation.
8/3/8/4/16 - 3.9

Bottle at Ballast Point during the RBSG Pub Crawl Tour on 08/01/2008. Clear golden body with a large frothy off-white head. Big spicy hop aroma. Huge spicy hop flavor with light caramel. Medium body with medium carbonation.
7/3/8/3/15 - 3.6

Bottle: (Thanks puzzl!) Nice cloudy glowing orange pour with a tight off white head. Sweet aroma- citrusy resins with some butterscotch sweetness and a cookie-like-malt note. Light feel with a fairly sweet flavor. Some subtle butterscotch gives way to later piny citruses and a late dry/resiny finish. Decent IPA, could be better with less sweetness.

RBSG 2008, from the bottle at the brewery. Pours gold with a smooth white head and thick lacing down the glass. Floral pine hop nose, soft citrus notes, but the pine took over. Very nice balance with a fruity caramel malt base and the earthy pine hop finish, soft tropical fruit notes find their way into the finish.

Big fresh hop aroma with nice minty notes. Rich buttery hop in the flavor with basil and carroway. The hops are bright but very bitter, not highlighting enough citrus or resin for me. Pretty tough to drink with a bitter finish.

UPDATED: AUG 29, 2009 Pours with a large, rocky, yellow tinged head covering a hazy yellow body. Aroma of apricot, pine, mango and some caramel. Taste is pine bitterness with some exotic fruit. Syrupy with lively bubbles...have since had on cask...this stuff is awesome!

Bottle sampled at the brewery for RBSG 08. Pours a clear gold, with a light white head. Citrus hops aroma, both sweet and bitter, with nice fruit notes. Taste is clean, bitter, and hoppy. Lingering clean bitterness. Very refreshing and tasty IPA.

Bottle poured at the brewery during RBSG 08.  Golden color, tightly packed white head, good lacing.  Caramel malt aroma with accents of tropical citrus and stone fruit.  Flavor is cakey malt, orange, grapefruit, and pineapple, with a solid bitterness.  Long dry finish, extremely drinkable.

Bottled at Ballast Point.  Poured a nice shade of medium golden with a creamy cap of white head.  The aroma was juicy with pears, grapefruit, and pineapple represented.. just enough malt to balance, but the hops definitely steal the show.  Soft bread and toffee wash over the tongue with building bitterness toward the edges (juicy grapefruit and pine primarily).. excellent balance.  Juicy and well-presented on the palate with bitterness riding the finish for a good couple minutes.  Fantastic!

UPDATED: SEP 21, 2009 Bottle from Stan at Lone Hill.  A good recommendation - not as citrus juicy as I like them, but I was intrigued with the mango notes.  If the bottle you get is off, however, gets malty fast and starts to taste English.  Beware!

UPDATED: JUL 11, 2014 In short: An amazingly drinkable well-malted and ultra hoppy IPA.  Complex, never aggressive, extra-refreshing.  Fantastic
How: Bottles, tap, many times, many places.
The look: Partly cloudy glowing orange topped by a small white head
In long: Ultra-hoppy orangy nose.  Pillowy well-malted body.  Malt sweetness has sponge cake flavour and mouthfeel.  Enormous amount of hops.  Next to the sponge-cake maltiness I had orange peels dipped in caramel, cedar, dried bananas, honey, some pineapples and some sponge cake.  Pillowy body with a soft-medium carbonation.  That dry cedar flavour fit so well in there.  This is not a simple hop-juice IPA, this is rich, complex yet highly refreshing.  Simply put this is one of the best ¬ìsmall¬î IPA I¬íve ever had.  I can¬ít believe people in San-Diego can drink that on a daily basis.  I hate you guys, I hate everyone from San-Diego, may you all drown in your San-Diego beer.  But before you do, one more trade please.

Ordered this beer from South Bay Drugs and Liquor. Thanks Joey!

This is probably my favorite IPA and I‚Äôve only had it twice. It poured a nice thick off white head and it has a beautiful golden color. The smell is just exceptional, above and beyond any other IPA I have ever had. Smells floral, grassy, piney, grapefruit, pineapple, and mango. Just all sorts of things going on in the smell and this translates directly into the taste. It tastes nice and hoppy, similar to the smell, and it also has a nice malty sweetness then a lingering, pleasant bitterness at the end. The mouthfeel is pretty good and the drinkability is amazing. This is really the best IPA I have had to date and I will definitely try to get some more in the future. Highly recommended!

22oz Bottle: Pours a clear bright orange with a thin white head. Big aromas of citrus! Hops dominate the taste with pine and orange coming through the best. It¬ís such an in your face experience that also delivers bits of tropical fruit. The body seemed medium to lighter but it could be the carbonation. This has become one of my favorites IPAs. Too bad we won¬ít see it for a while.

Bottled at Papsoes Blind tasting 19th. June 2008 no 27: Pine, herbs, flowers and citrus in the aroma. Flavour is sweet, herbal, has light caramel, flowers and pine. Meidum to full bodied. Dry. Medium to strong bitterness in the end. Is quite balanced. High drinkability.

Medium statured light tan head, retention is good with a thin clingy lace. Hazy gold/orange appearence. Nose is fine with notes of pine,  fruit, melon, some tropical aromas maybe some mango and a hint of pencil shavings, large and lucious. Body is medium with a prickly carbonation and some gentle resiny notes, lightly acidic and somewhat oily. Big piney hop flavors, grapefruit, grass and some earthy notes as well. Big hoppy flavors abound with maybe a touch of caramel malts shining through. Finish is big and bold, hoppy, dry with a magnificent bite. A really massive IPA, right up my alley! Many thanks to SDbruboy for the bomber. Thanks Cliff! Mucho grassyass bro !!

UPDATED: JUL 6, 2008 Overall an exceptional beer. Very unassuming given the competition out there in CA and this style. Really seaking out more and more of the Ballast Point seasonal / rare beers has become an addiction. This was widely available, but very very quickly dissapeared, though lost forever. Very lucky that a friend had some extra bottles that got "lost" for me to have the opportunity to purchase again. Will drink 1 more soon, and keep the other 2 for the next several years.

Has more oil and orange flavors than other IPA¬ís. Complexity of hops thru the finish is what makes this stand out. I can now see why you would ever want to buy a case of a craft beer after this experience. Usually you want to move onto the next one, here you want to come back again and again.

Re-tasted again last night...
This beer continues to WOW me. The smell is mesmorizing. The hops perfume are very complex and creamy on the nose. Intense and balanced. Great mid and finish also but the star is the nose. Glad I was able to buy more again this week from a hidden stache, which is now no more. Maybe rating this too low.

(Bottle 65 cl) Courtesy of WeeHeavySD. Slightly hazy golden with a small off-white head. Distinct aroma of peach and pine. Medium body with a rather sweet fruitiness. Aromatic and fruity hop bitterness. Lovely. 190608

Botte #27 at Papsoes blindtasting.
Cloudy amber coloured with a medium sized white head.
Sweet aroma of fruits, grass, pine needles and hops with notes of grape fruits.
Fruity flavour of hops, grape fruits and pine needles with notes of cardemomme.
Dry hoppy finish.

Bottle. Papsoes MadsBerg homecoming blindtasting, bottle #27. Pours hazy orange with a lacing white head. Solid hoppy aroma with a mild spice note. Flavour is solid dry hoppy. Subdued malt base. Light spice note following. Solid hoppy fruity note briefly appearing too. Ends dry and hoppy, nice one.

Poured from a 22 oz. bottle; vibrant orange lightly hazed.  Furiously bright mandarin and sweet garlic clove nose; sunspots of brilliant tropical flourishes and a dank bed of florals, needles, and cannabis.  Sunny and smooth, with balanced bittersweetness; a really ebullient and unrestrained hop presentation.  Flavor is big and citrusy, almost so bright and tangy as to be sweet with orange and pineapple sugary acidity.  Lemongrass and caramelly dough bring it back.  Pine-like and grassy aromatic bitterness coats the mouth slowly; commanding and firm, but never aggressive and always careful.  Honey sesame seeds, sweet pine wood, and pastry crusts lend dryness and chewiness; full, almost heavy palate is very resinous and rich, which is my only issue with the beer, really.  I¬íd really love it to retain this punchy, perfectly balanced bittersweetness and dry texture while weighing a little less.  Finishes with caramel, tropical fruit, and floral sweetness, lightly dry.  Not as fun as it could have been, but it¬ís hardly a dissapointment; another stellar offering from this fine brewery.  Thanks Larry!

(bottle, thanks Stine!) Pours gold with a white head.  Aromas of pine, orange, slight lemon zest, caramel, lilac, and pepper that¬ís really complex and enjoyable.  Taste is caramel, with some mandarin orange, grapefruit, and an initial burst of pineapple tartness that appears when the beer warms.  Although the flavor improved upon warming, I thought there would be more based on the aroma.  Mouthfeel was medium, with a lightly bitter finish.

22oz bottle.  Upon initial nosing, you would think this were an IIPA. Heavy resiny aroma. Honey glazed candied ginger. Tangerine and tropical  fruit essences with a heavy, sweet malt base. Fresh and spritzy. Spruce. Wet grass and tree bark. Plenty of wet, juicy hops. Pours a mostly clear copper with a decent white head. Flavor  has plenty of wet hoppiness. Spruce tips. Fairly resinous. Lots of residual sugar mid-palate but finishes quite dry and doughy. There¬ís also a good tropical fruit flavor as well. Fairly creamy on the tongue  with bright carbonation and a lengthy, dry, bitter  finish. Thanks Eben!

22oz bottle. Poured a slightly hazy medium orange color. The head was foamy and white with pretty good retention. Some tattered lace was left behind on the glass at the end. Very attractive, fruity aroma with citrus and pineapple elements. There was also some distinct, but less prominent spruce. Dry up front with moderate hop bitterness of about 5-6 out of 10. Some sweetness emerged toward the end and balanced out the bitterness to some degree. Body was on the lighter end of the spectrum without being thin/watery. Hop flavors including the likes of citrus (grapefruit and orange rind) and pine were present throughout. Some malty caramel and graham cracker flavors were also there (mostly at the end) and lingered with the citrus after the finish. In general, the flavors and aromas improved as the beer warmed up a bit. I really liked this one.

22 oz Bottle from Churchill¬ís in San Marcos. Pours cloudy amber orange with a fluffy white head. Sweet aroma of hops and citrus. Flavor begins with sweet hops and ends with hints of lemon and orange. A very very good IPA!

22 oz bottle.  Clearish orange with a whitish head.  Nose is mango, pineapple and musk.  Crisp, with a tingle; substantial but light enough to refresh.  Taste is orange pith, mango and toffee.  Finish is dry grapefruit zest with herbal hints.
Light gold colour. Massive aroma - explosive orange and melon.  Superbright.  Bitter body, so much it¬ís sweet with lots of melon, fresh fruits.  Not the most balanced but what a great aroma.
Clear orange color with a big white head. Knock-out nose of fresh hops...pine and hibiscus. Flavor is awesome with hops, honey and tasty malts. Easy to drink and very approachable. Loved it.

Bottle via trade with mikesgroove.  Pours amber orange with 2 finger creamy white head.  pine, honey, peach, apricot, and flro hops.  Starts witha slight malty backbone and quickly becomes floral honey hopped drying your mouth with hop bitterness.  A really good ipa, but i wouldn¬ít trade for another.

UPDATED: JUL 26, 2009 bottle shared thanks to zinister.  Pours a clear orange with a thin white head.  Nose was of floral and citrus hops.  Oranges.  The taste was of orange and lemon citrus with hops just blowing you away!  Mouthfeel was very hoppy up front.  Super harsh and super bitter.  Wow!

Bottle at toncatcher¬ís. Pours a clear yellow with an off-white head. Quite bitter. and very hoppy of grapefruits. Light alcohol notes. Medium bodied. Soft carbonation. Bitter finish with metallic notes.

Strong citrus bitter hop nose. Gold amber, with a small head and great lacing. A little syrupy. Tart acidity undertones. Citrus hops dominate the palate, lemon, grapefruit. Bitter hop carbonation, and slight lingering bitterness aftertaste.

UPDATED: JUN 17, 2016 Updated rate. nose is fairly strong with the tropical fruit and pine resin. The taste has sweet with tropical fruit and some pine. Dough and walnuts are also present nice. Thanks for sharing a bottle, iowaherkeye. The body was opaque medium gold with a white head. The aroma was strogn grapefruit with some toast. There was also some almonds and caramel. The taste was some mild grapefruit and bread crust. After the initial in your face hops aroma, I was expecting a stronger flavor. This was mild and fairly well balanced.

I can see what the fuss is about! This is a wonderfully fresh, fruity and incredibly well-done bitter beer. Lots of lemon and grapefruit, but also just a huge sticky tropical thing -- thankfully. though, this beer is not sweet, not at all. It is hugely aromatic; incredibly bright grassy, herbal and fruity aromas just leap out of the glass. Great color and heft, leaves you salivating after a long bitter, drying-out finish full of lemon and tangy breadiness. Just fantastic. From stefanje - thanks a million!

Pours orange-yellow with a white lace head. Aroma of grapefruit and another sweet underlying fruity aroma. Tatses like pink grapefruit, with a good inital tart acidity which is moderated by a sweet floral sugar taste. I really liked this beer.

UPDATED: JUN 3, 2008 Bottle courtesy of seaoflament, who¬ís mainly a beeradvocate guy, but I¬íll forgive him for that! Met today at the LA Cuvee de Tomme release and drank some great beers together, including this one. Incredible IPA with wonderful floral hop aroma bursting out of the glass. Outstanding balance of caramel malt and floral and pine hops. Smooth finish and an all around awesome beer.

UPDATED: JUL 14, 2008 4-6-08 bottle shared at tasting and 6-22-08 bottle 
Nice glowing orange with a great creamy head.  Great smell if fresh flowers, grass, and heaven.  Flavor is perfectly hoppy, fresh, fruity, crisp and ideal.  Very nice palate.  Overall, SUPERB!

UPDATED: MAY 16, 2008 Pours a bright golden amber with a dense head that shows very good retention and excellent lacing.  Hops, hops, and more hops. Initial blast of resiny hops with major citrus aromas of grapefruit and lemon. This is what an IPA should smell like.  Resiny, piny hop bitterness is the dominant taste with a definite lemony, grapefruit flavor. I get only the slightest bready malt flavor but enough to balance the massive hoppiness.  Medium mouthfeel with a nice carbonation that shows up prickly on the tongue with the hop bitterness. Goes down smooth with the right balance of bitterness.  For me, this is what all West Coast IPAs should aspire to be and is one of the most drinkable IPAs I¬íve tasted. I would go well out of my way to get a hold of this one.

Thanks to Larry for the hookup!  Clear golden with an average to thinner head.  Light fresh piney hops.  Crisp, unmuddied.  Very light malt.  Hops might be a bit past prime perhaps?  Still crisp!  Average sort of body, on the refreshing side of the viscous/thin divide.  Sharp hops in the flavor.  Very light malt again.  Dry for the style!  Straw.  Pine.  Not as fruity as the nose suggested.  Some slightly garlic past prime hop flavors.  A long lingering bitterness.  I¬íd like to try this a bit fresher... maybe I should have left this in the fridge, oh well!

Dark orange beer with a yellowish-tinted head. Very fruity grapey, some "bittered" malts. Very dry-hoppy, again grapey, grapefruit, warm malts underneath all the hops. Well-bodied, rather fiery MF. Nice, if a bit clich√© W.C. IPA.
Pours copper with a rocky white head.  Smells of perfume, citrus, pine.  Tastes of sweet malt with lots of brilliant pine elements.  Mouthfeel is full with a sage like finish.  Excellent!

Pour is clear orangey amber with a thin off white head...smell is super piney....super piney....taste is not nearly such a hop bomb...a sweet toasty caramel flavor with a solid hoppy backbone....not bitter, but definitely flavorful...resin...

22oz Bomber

Recieved this in a great box courtesy of errantnight, thanks again Derek! Oh, wow! As soon as I cracked this open I took whiff and I can tell I¬ím going to be in for a treat but before I get to the nose let me explain the pour. Sculpin empties the bomber a moderately hazed golden with bursts of carbonation screaming to the surface. The clean white head grew to two + fingers on the pour and eventually fell to one finger¬ís worth of dense creaminess. 

Now, What first caught my attention and has been on my mind ever since popping the top, the wonderful nose. There¬ís a small pale maltiness coming through way, way in back. The good stuff? Huge notes of apricot, tangerine, and a big freshly broken pine neddle hoppiness throughout. Ballast Point did an unbelievable job with the hop additions. It¬ís reminiscent of the hopping I find in Dreadnaught and blows my mind that a brewer can get such vivid, delicious aromas from the little cones.

The flavor doesn¬ít quite live up to the nose but that would be near impossible. The taste is softer than expected with a dominant apricot hoppiness upfront followed by the pinyness on the finish. A little sweet in the middle but damn, that apricot is vivid and delicious. This really is a great IPA. 

The mouthfeel is spot on. Solid carbonation awakens the tongue for the moderate bitterness present from mid-palate to the finish. The body is medium but the carbonation helps it glide through without a problem. 

I wouldn¬ít have a problem drinking this beer all night. If Sculpin was available in my area it would be purchased by the forklift and drank just as quickly.

Ballast Point hit a homerun with Sculpin. A really great IPA with a hop profile that is very rarely found except in the most delicious of the style. Ballast Point makes some great beers and this may be the best I¬íve tried from them yet. A new favorite!

4/19

UPDATED: APR 28, 2009 Bomber bottle and served in my GI IPA tulip, THANKS JON for the bottle:  Pours a clean coppery golden hue with a small but lasting frothy head which left very nice clinging lace upon the glassware. The aroma has a bountiful amount of tropical and piney hops along with some sweey bready malts and a hint of hop spice. The taste is nicely balanced between crisp citric hops and mild pale and caramel malting. The finish displays a light spicy note and some metallic tones. The mouth feel is sprite and crisp, very refreshing and drinkable. Yet another winning IPA from the SoCal area. Mikey Likey, get ya some before they are all gone.

22. Thanks, Foolish_Mortal! BP¬ís usual cool label happening, that¬ís for sure. Pours a crystal clear, coppery medium amber with a towering, sudsy white head and plenty of lace down the side. Rich orange and mango nose...soooo citric and hop-oily. Creamy medium body with soft carb. Piney bitterness starts to emerge out of the mid-palate, under a lovely soft and sweet wash of peach, mango, apricot, and orange. Mild, crackery, piney finish. Delicious, sweet, and refreshing. Awesome IPA.

Thanks to Crosling for sharing this beer.  Poured a clear golden color with a fluffy white head.  Aroma of sweet, piny hops with some tart citrus and leafiness.  Light malt upon entry leads directly into a piny, resiny hop hit with some nice citrus character and fresh, green hops on the finish.  Smooth on the palate, but a hint thin.  Overall, nice, basic IPA that has to be fresh to enjoy.

Bottle thanks to miketd - Nice looking golden color with a larger than average white head.  Aroma has an abundance of citrus and tropical fruits with some floral hoppiness in there too.  Flavor is a smooth and sweet mix of citra-floral-summer fruit flavored hops with some sugar and light malt.  Good mouthfeel with a light sting - really nice work from these guys.  This was really good - the best Ballast Point I¬íve had yet.

Pure west coast hops in the nose.  Authentic and just how an IPA should be.  Very vibrant.  Color is a very light gold, with ample foam.  Flavor, however, is a bit of a letdown.  Doesn¬ít have a lot of malt depth.  The hops arn¬ít as vibrant as I¬íd like.  Needs more bitterness.  Still high quality, but just not as hoppy as I¬íd like.

UPDATED: APR 21, 2008 A hoppy light floral aroma that¬ís not that strong. First sip - whew! That¬ís a double IPA! The meat of the beer isn¬ít as agressive as the head or the first sip but it has a nice finish and when you want something with a kick this is it.

UPDATED: JUL 19, 2012 22oz from South Bay. Wow, this is yet another killer IPA from San Diego. Is there any doubt remaining that this area owns this style? I love the pale orange pour, slightly cloudy, with a big foamberg of a head. Big aroma of juicy hops, heavy on the tropical fruit for sure. I was skeptical reading about notes of mango, but nope, they¬íre in there. Not as sticky and resinous as the Dorado, but as rich and satisfying in its way - more quaffable, the fruit and hops practically sing. If there¬ís a breakfast stout, can we call this a breakfast IPA?

UPDATED: FEB 6, 2010 bottle thanks to hapjydeuce..... pours a transparent apple cider brown with a thin soapy whitish head.... delicious aroma of strong tropical fruit hops (mangos and other citrus fruits).... this was amped up on the tropical fruits and very hop-forward overall.  the finish leaves just a trace of bitterness in the end.... def a nice IPA.

UPDATED: NOV 12, 2009 awesome dark yellow body with a foamy white head that leaves nice webbing.the aroma is a huge burst of citrus hops,and fruits.flavor is pine/citurs hops,mangoes,with a tiny caramel finish.easy drinking but still full of flavor.awesome beer.
clear amber with a thin white head.  Strong citrus hop aroma.  Up front hop flavor with peach,  mango,  and orange citrus in the background.  Finishes bitter,  kind of on the thin side.

It¬ís upsetting they discontinued the Dorado.  This is essentially the single version of that...Damn hop shortage.  I¬íd say pretty good nose of pineapple grapefruit, as usual.  Very fruity taste, somewhat mango, not like the Dorado.  Thanks Pepsican, for serious this time, except that I wish it was Dorado.

Bottle from naven.  Oh no.  I knew I was in for it when I popped the top.  Pure, huge, fresh grapefruit and peach aroma.  Perfect aroma.  Beautiful pour with great lacing.  Add this to my list of beers I¬íd have to have if deserted on an island.  This is perfection in a glass.  Flavor is pure hops without being overpowering.  Possibly the best iipa or IPA I¬íve tried.  The best use of hops for bittering and flavoring that I¬íve ever witnessed.  I think I might cry.

22oz bottle, no date from Holiday Wine Cellar.  Clear medium orange with a 1 1/2 finger slightly yellowish white head with good retention.  Wow, the tropical fruit aromas that I get from this beer are nothing short of awesome.  So much pineapple and mango notes, tangerines, and then some nicely bitter grapefruit and pine needles in the background with some cotton candy and caramel.  The flavor has a bit of an added grassy hoppiness, and the tropical flavors don¬ít quite jump out at me as much as they had in the aroma.  The cotton candy and caramel malts meld with the hops very well in that I get "sweet hops"--I don¬ít get this very often in beers and I think it¬ís great.  Semi-dry finish with bitterness peaking around a 3.  Light to medium body with the same for carbonation.  An excellent IPA--hopefully they start bottling this year round--especially since they halted production on their Dorado.  Also, I may like this one more than Two Hearted, though my rating doesn¬ít reflect it.
user_location: Ocean Beach, San Diego, California, USA

text:
UPDATED: APR 7, 2013 Bottle shared by MiguelMandingo. Thanks

Pours a clear honey amber color with a nice strong citrusy smell of grapefruit and perhaps pine.  Tropical fruitiness.
Taste is fruity, crisp, clean, lightly bitter and citrus rind like with a dry finish.  Bursting with lots of tropical fruits and citrusy grapefruit in the flavor.  Medium bodied with prickly carbonation.  Refreshing and very drinkable.  One of the Best IPA¬ís I¬íve ever had.

Bottle. Hugely sweet citrus nose, orange, mango, pineapple, and other tropical fruit. Clear gold with a thin white head. Balanced bitterness, aggressive but not harsh. Thick and sweet mouthfeel. Top notch.

a damn good ipa....lighter in color and body then alot of the other examples of the style....
but......darn good nose of grapefruity hops....and also the lighter body helps to showcase the hops more....good stuff

(22oz bottle, thanks kmweaver) Clear golden body topped by minimal white head.  Aroma is medium sweet, pine, catty, light caramel.  Taste is medium sweet, catty, some grapefruit, pine.  Medium body, faint acidity.
Golden in color with some haziness and some head.  Nice bitterness in the taset and particularily the aftertaste.  Grapefruit in the aroma, floral as well.  Stone fruits in the taste.

(22oz. bottle)  Pours a clear orange body with a medium-sized off-white head.  Fruity aroma of apricot, pineapple, peaches, and grapefruit. Flavor of apricot/floral/citrusy hops, toastiness, and caramel malt with a lightly syrupy mouthfeel.

UPDATED: NOV 27, 2012 (Resampled and upper numbers since the following rating.) 22oz bottle, courtesy of WeeHeavySD.  Thanks, Jon!  Pours a bright, yellow-orange color; off-white head with solid retention and medium-bubbled lacing.  Cat pee, citrus, and resiny overall hoppiness in the aroma; slightly watery on the edges; lemon rind and clean hop expression.  Medium carbonation.  Medium mouthfeel: resiny, clean citrus and catty hop bitterness; some cheese and sugar.  Medium finish (lots of mediums), showing resiny citrus and grass and sugar.

Courtesy hopscotch.  Pours a crystal clear gold, with a small white head.  Smells of big juicy citrus hops, some weed, grass, and grapefruit.  Big and bold nose.  The flavor is pretty big on the hops as expected, with a decent malt presence for some balance.  Definitely a little more piney than fruity, although there was some grapefruit in there as well.  Very good IPA, almost felt like a double to me.

Bottle thanks to Ken!  Huge nose of sharp mandarin oranges - fruity, juicy, full, wow... has a definite fruit juice sugar character to the nose - while the body is thick and syrupy and frothy while still pretty crisp and sharp... resinous pine and catty simcoe hops round out a big IPA that¬ís not too big.  Very good stuff.

This is a really really nice beer.  Aroma is strong simco and almost cat urine (I just love cheesing!)  Flavor is strong citrus with almost canabis flavor and potency.  This is one fantastic beer.  Finish is smooth and a bit drying but not dry.  Very nice.

Courtesy of kmweaver. Clear light amber body with a tiny white head. Big simcoe nose with lots of cattiness, pine needles, some tangerine, caramel and cotton candy. The flavor is moderately sweet, moderate to highly bitter with caramel, tangerine, some garlic, tangerine and cotton candy. Medium/full  body is sticky/chewy with moderate carbonation.

UPDATED: OCT 23, 2015 Pours a clear golden with a good sized head. Very nice aroma of citrus hops, some caramel as well. Light sweetness, slightly strong bitterness, clean finish. copyright grimreeser.  Thanks for the taste!
Pours a clear golden with a good sized head. Very nice aroma of citrus hops, some caramel as well. Light sweetness, slightly strong bitterness, clean finish.

22oz bottle, recently released 2008 vintage. thanks doubleo for this one! pours hazy golden with white head. a huge grapefruit and mango hop aroma bursting out. wonderful grapefruit and mango hop flavors. pretty straight forward, extremely tasty, and PNW hoppy bliss. I could drink tons of this.

Courtesy TheCheeseMan.  Clear orange color with a thin, persistent billowy head.  Great spicy, peppery floral hop aroma.  Taste is aggressive, but the floral characters balance everything out.  The finish is subdued but tingles from the hops.  Palate nearly perfect for an IPA.  Well put together.

UPDATED: JUL 4, 2011 650 bottle from Bev4less in Santee. Pours a copper-gold color with a big sudsy white head that leaves plenty of lacing. The aroma is rich and pungent with big citrus notes, mandarin oranges in particular, this nose had a Pavlovian effect on me in which I broke out into a drool. A perfect ten in aroma! The taste is centered on the various fruits listed in the description with a big focus on sweetened pink grapefruit flavor and a bit of pine. The mouthfeel is silky smooth and the carbonation is light. The finish is long and lightly biter with lingering pineapple. Overall: this is a great IPA, one that elevates the art of brewing. Highly recommended.

UPDATED: APR 1, 2010 Bottle courtesy of hopscotch by way of WeeheavySD. 

Pours clear straw colored gold with a small white head and intricate lacing. Incredibe aroma, one of the best smelling beers I¬íve had the pleasure of drinking. This thing is packed with mango, pineapple and grapefruit smells with a piney note. The taste is strong on the citrus with grapefruit and pineapple coming through the strongest on the finish. Not overly bitter but its definitely an IPA. Again not my style but this is a very impressive IPA.

UPDATED: SEP 29, 2009 Very dank and aromatic IPA. First thing after popping the bottle is the aroma - it just comes at you. You could smell this beer across a room - and that¬ís a good thing. Full of rich hop character, very piney and resinous as well as citrusey. Reminds me of Blind Pig. Flavor is sweetness that slowly recedes, with a bitter note that sticks around. Not much aftertaste, but that¬ís OK. Once again, BP makes another great beer!

SECOND REFLECTION: This is one amazing beer. Right now, I will change it to be above Blind Pig.

My 100th IPA rating!  WooHoo!  22 oz bottle, via trade.  Pours a clear dark straw gold body with a nice big foamy white head that left lots of intricate lacing.  Wow!  The nose on this is just killer.  So bright and fresh smelling, the hops are bursting with fruit aromas of tangerine, apricots, and peach.  Minimal malt in the nose, but that¬ís just fine by me.  It just smells so simple and yet so complex at the same time.  The flavor is really interesting as well, there¬ís so much hoppiness, but the bitterness is really minimal, making it incredibly easy to drink.  So much mango and dried apricot on the finish, yet the low bitterness makes it fade fairly quickly that you want another sip right away.  The malt is so subtle and secondary that it really showcases the hops well.   Mouthfeel is lighter bodied with a bit of doughy stickiness on the finish.  The carbonation really brings out the hops as well, firm and fizzy, but it¬ís really fine.  Overall, this was one of the best IPAs that I¬íve had in a long time!  I¬ím glad that I tried this so fresh though, cause I think that this will lose alot of it¬ís beauty pretty quick.  Fantastic stuff!

UPDATED: NOV 25, 2009 Bomber. This is a fantastic IPA. Pours very clear and has the citrus aroma in spades. White peach, grapefruit, lemon, honey. I think these beers go from the far "pine" spectrum to the far "citrus" spectrum. This is far on the citrus side. Fantastic and easy to drink, I could have this all day long. 

Rerated 11/25/09: from 4.1 to 4.5 this is amazing beer, Huge aroma of fresh citrus hops and absolutely delicious on my tongue. wow, killer beer.

Courtesy TheCheeseMan. Gold. Modest white head. Huge resiny, grassy, lightly fruity and citrusy hops. Subtle malt background. Nicely bitter. Medium body, balanced, easy to drink. Excellent west coast hop bomb.
Pours a warm copper color.  Aroma is spectacular, pine, sweet peaches, I am really liking this.  The flavor is almost elegant, with some citrus notes coming through.   I really like this.

Bottle... Clear golden ale with a small, creamy, white head. Great retention. Earthy, fruity aroma offers tropical and citrus fruit with additional notes of cannabis, crystal malt and toffee. Medium-bodied with a lightly creamy mouthfeel and modest carbonation. Toffee malt alongside bitter, citrusy, earthy hops. Bittersweet, grassy finish. Bottle courtesy of WeeHeavySD!

Wow!! Thanks to Bu11zeye for this bottle. Poured a clear deep golded color with slight off white head. Aroma had alot of hoppy citrus notes. This beer had a very nice heavy taste of very fresh hops, as if you just popped a hop in your mouth....medium body....VERY nice!

UPDATED: JAN 9, 2009 22oz bottle acquired in trade with WeeHeavySD (thanks!). Poured a medium to deeper and clear golden color with an larger sized off white head. Aromas of pine, citrus (grapefruits and lemons), and grassy. Nice and hoppy aroma. Tastes of citrus, light caramel, pine, some melons, and a little fruity. Nicely bitter with a light sweetness. 
8 3 8 4 16

Retasted and I¬ím upping the numbers on this one.

Thanks to Linus_Stick for sharing. Pour was a nice golden color with a thin white head. Aroma was filled with hops and just a hint of fruit. The taste was just excellent, clean, bitter, and filled with hops that lead you right to a crisp finish that left you wanting more. Definitely a beer I would drink on the regular were it readily available here in PA.
Light amber with a thin white head.  Aroma is a nice floral, and piney hoppiness, very lovely aroma hops.  Taste is a sharp pine, light bubblegum note, and a very subtle maltiness.

Shared by Eyedrinkale.  Lightly hazy orange in color with a medium off white head.  Aroma: very fresh, very hoppy aroma- citrus, passion fruit, orange, mango, light pine, earthy resin.  Taste is alot of citrus, mango, over a sweet pale malt base, piney bitterness is moderate throughout, the hop character is moderately sticky and resinous.  Some honey and light caramel sweetness poke through here and there.  Finishes moderately bitter and lingers nicely.  Excellent west coast IPA. Thanks Mike!

Trade via Stefanje. Thanks! A deliciously bitter IPA. I¬íve had their IIPA and this may be better. Aroma of all hops and not much else. Pour was a medium to light gold with a thin white ring for a head. Taste was just how I like IPAs. All hops with just a hint of malt. Nice carbonation to carry the bitterness to the back of the mouth and bite the throat. Very nice.
user_location: Moon Twp, suburb of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Aroma is off the charts - hello super pine and resin bomb!  Nice golden in color with a little white head.  Flavor subsists of pine, citrus and melons with the Ballast Point dryness at the swallow.  This is easily one ofthe freshest IPAs I have ever had and my favorite beer of 2008.

Another San Diego IPA home run.  Poured from an ultra-fresh bomber. This one pours a clear orange-gold.  A small, foamy, off-white head leaves random spots and snakes of lacing on the glass.  Aromas are fresh and well balanced.  Big notes of freshly sliced oranges, tangerines, peaches, and apricots rendezvous with bitter pine resin and hints of green grass, all over lightly sweet toffee malts and dry grains.  The flavors just pop with bright citrus and stinging, bitter resin.  The grass component is very green, helping to wipe the palate clean of sharp hop residue.  Finishing bittersweet, with hints of butterscotch, this is a very satisfying brew.  Medium-full bodied, the palate gets just a bit sticky after a few glasses.  Awesome stuff from a great IPA master!

22oz bomber from SBD. Pours a brilliant light orange color with a crisp white head with decent retention. Smells of light citrusy hops, a bit of orangy sweetness, faintly grassy. Tastes light and citrusy, malty and hoppy sweet up front, crisply bitter on the finish. Very well balanced and 7% to boot. Light/medium body, very thin and smooth, but a little hop syrupiness as well. Crisp carbonation.

At BPB. Golden yellow with creamy white goey lace. Almost the cat piss aroma that indicates excellent nose. Light citrus flavor of hops that he malt compliments well. Very good bitter finish that doesn¬ít kill you. Solid bodied full and rich palate with just a hint of foaminess. A very good IPA. Fine.
